review_body: We enjoyed our 10 nights at the Waikiki Resort. It is centrally located in Waikiki and only a half block walk from the beach. The room was clean, we had a partial view of the beach, the breakfast was good and the staff all very friendly and helpful. In addition it was well priced and for us offered excellent value for money.

This was our second stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. We booked the 1 Bedroom Penthouse Suite. 3 adults and one teenager. The one bedroom was occupied by 2 adults and the open plan living room was occupied by one adult and one teenager. The living room was big enough to have 2 single roll-in beds (with comfy mattresses) a sofa, sitting chair and dining table for 4. This room also has a kitchenette, stove top, fridge, microwave and pod coffee machine. Our room had ocean views, and a 10 metre balcony which was awesome. This hotel is literally a minutes walk to the beach. We love the service and the staff are always smiling and friendly. Highly recommend for anyone and families. Down stairs you can have an American style buffet breakfast, which we enjoyed on quite a few occasions.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the hotel, the Lady who checked us in was soo lovely she was a pleasure to talk to. Room was big a bit old but clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was just next level,a lot of choices and beautifully cooked, it was the best thing about this hotel that and the location. Location was awesome you are 50 meters from beach and almost in the middle of everything. Can not wait to come back!

Thank you very much for staying open during these hard times. Your employee's do such a great job in being very clean. Even tho my stay was for overnight, the staff made me feel welcomed to stay longer. Thanks.

The hotel was value for money and a stones throw from the beach and the main drag. The rooms were kept clean and there were plenty of hand sanitisers available due to the coronavirus. The breakfast could have varied a bit more but is was still value for money but they never got my wide gluten free bread despite being asked on day 1 of our visit.

This is our second stay here and once again our stay was awesome. From starting our booking with Sherry and always a pleasure to deal with Suzette. To dealing with Brandon when we arrive at the counter our experience here is wonderful. Having the rental car in the lobby is a very convenient addition. The Seoul Jung restaurant has a great barbecue. And the ilima cafe for their buffet breakfast and the Ramen for lunch. I can’t say enough good things about the Waikiki resort. Can’t wait for our next stay.

Stayed here with our tour group, arriving a day early on our own. Price seemed reasonable for 2nd row from the ocean and we booked a high floor with partial view. Even on the higher floor there is a lot of street noise but it is a city and that is what you often get. (single pane glass seems to be the norm in Hawaii) Room had a balcony with 2 chairs and we could watch the surfers all day! Bed and pillows were acceptable and there was coffee and teabags. Bathroom was typical motel set-up with sink outside of shower/toilet area. Main suggestion is they need to do a deep cleaning asap in the rooms and some of the public areas. With so many choices you might find something a bit better for similar price.

Good location Room large & comfortable with balconyOur room was serviced every day Friendly staffNice swimming poolSelf laundry reasonably pricedHowever, our room being on street side was noisy through the night, we were on the 6th floor and 2 of the nights we had people screaming & swearing on the street below, another night a laundry truck idling for half an hour at midnight as he noisily put laundry into his truck. Also one of the lifts was constantly breaking down.Otherwise a good stay.

We have stayed at this Hotel 3 times in the past and it has always been an enjoyable stay. Room prices are reasonable, hotel is in close proximity to Waikiki Beach (<100 yds), shopping is all around, parking is available, restaurants are everywhere, as are shuttles to and from the airport. During our last stay we encountered some medical issues on our last day, which required an extended stay. Staff member Connor and manager Vicki were very helpful, allowing us to extend our stay and keep our same room on a day by day basis. We have always found this hotel to be very helpful, everyone from desk staff, housekeeping and bellhop. I would highly recommend this hotel if planning a stay in Waikiki.

I have stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel several times now. The service is always great, the staff is very friendly. I have noticed over time, the room furnishings are looking a little tired, a little sanding and refinishing would go a long way. Also, you have a day spa and it is not promoted, it should be, I was wanting to see what they had to offer, when I went to check mid-day, they were closed and I didn't go back.

I got this hotel by booking directly through their website promotion 50% off and free breakfast. In future if I got a similar promotion I would absolutely stay there again as it’s good value, the room was decent, very clean and easy walk to most attractions. However paying full price I think there are better options out there.My room wasn’t ready when I arrived and that was fine, I was early. The front desk staff was very pleasant as he gave me options. He directed me to the bellhop who was very surly taking my bags. On return the female front desk staff member checking me in was plain rude. I requested my luggage be taken to my room and this bellhop was a lot nicer and offered some great tips on local things to see and do in the area. The other standout was your housekeepers. They were always friendly and did a great job servicing the room. The breakfast was worthwhile if included. The pool was freezing and not usable. I overall had a good stay, but like I said, at full price I absolutely feel there are similarly priced hotels with better amenities.

Very Impressed with this hotel, it was actually our second hotel we stayed at on our trip and it made our vacation much better! The staff at the front desk was very great and understanding with us! I will stay again!

I thought I scored a great deal on Hotwire at Waikiki Resort for 5 days. At first I was super excited- had booked a king size bed with what seem like a whole other room with a pull out bed. Two decent size TVs in each room. And the free dvd service is an interesting touch. I even had 2 lanais.What they absolutely lost me was their bathroom. It does not match up with the feel of the “resort”. The sink is the cheapest and smallest sink you can buy that is only meant for washing your hands. The mirrors are awkward and faces each other but not you. There is virtually no counter space! What kind of bathroom is this? They could have easily taken some space from the extra room to make a bigger bathroom.Oh and so the hotel room also has a kitchenette with a sink. Brilliant me thought to myself, let me use the sink there instead (because I felt like I was going to bash my head on the sink whenever I wash my face or brush my teeth). The kitchenette’s sink doesn’t even turn on the correct way! I took a video to demonstrate the awkward way to turn the faucet on.After 3 days I couldn’t stand the sink situations and asked the front desk on a Thursday if I could change my room. The woman responded that they are fully booked (ok I can understand that) but also “all the bathrooms are the same. I can try to get you another room but the sink is the same”. I told her I saw the website, that is not true. But she insisted and said she will look into it but I highly doubt it. I can’t wait to get the hell out of here. All the amazing reviews here may be true but was not my experience. There are pros and cons but the bathroom is too big of a con for me. Stay away from room 901 and possibly from Waikiki resort.

The location was a block from the beach. The breakfast buffet was better than average. The staff was nice and accommodating if there were any problems with check in. Check out was also very quick even if you ask for a final print out. I thought the amenities and quality of amenities were more than average. The fridge was quiet. The television was of high quality and had an HD DVD player. Ice and vending machines were on the second floor and there was a filtered water station, mini mart and car rental place on the first floor. I thought it was more than adequate for a solo traveler.

Our visit was unimpressive. We were not advised as to how to deal with our vehicle. And once we were given "validation" instructions and that did not work, we were advised (after coming to the front desk 3 times) to park in the lot next door. When our coffee maker did not work, we went downstairs to get coffee. The restaurant said they were going to charge us for the coffee or would send up a new coffee maker. That coffee maker never arrived.We stay in HNL frequently and this is one of the worse customer service hotels we've ever stayed in. I was confounded that you had such a high rating in reviews!

We found your hotel clean and all your staff were very courteous and help full. Your concierge was very helpful and informative.The major problem was how noisy the streets surrounding the hotel especially at late at night.Another problem was we felt the hotel was a bit dated. It needed renovating to bring it up to the present date.The breakfast menu also needs upgrading.Apart from that we would stay there again.

I went to Waikiki for a conference and couldn't be happier with my oceanview room. I was surprised that I was upgraded to the nicer corner room with an amazing view of the ocean. I realized that other oceanview rooms may not have as nice of view as mine because of the high rises blocking some of the rooms. I was high enough to see above and peak between 2 buildings. The hotel was situation about a block from the beach which made it nicer than the hotel where the conference was held. The room came with a free DVD rental from downstairs (DVD Now). I didn't frequent the restaurants in the hotel, but I also got discounts for those as well as for in-hotel car rental. I was really close to so many nice restaurants that I hit Morimoto on my first night and concluded my trip with Momosan (should've tried here more!). These were few minutes walking distance. I was near everything! I was close enough to Queen's beach for morning yoga sessions. The room was so spacious that I was able to do morning yoga in my room while looking at the ocean from the balcony. I wish I could've heard the waves, but I think that's impossible in Waikiki with so much traffic and people. The staff was pleasant, and I had daily housekeeping. The room had a fridge and microwave which made my life super easy. I checked out the pool, but I really loved hitting the beach.

Hotel was in a good location and closed to a lot of shops and restaurants.Customer service was good. Hotel was very clean and would definitely go back. While we were there, they were shampooing the hallway carpet.Hotel room was maintain well and had no issues walking barefoot on the carpet.

An excellent value in Waikiki! Superb location steps from the beach, restaurants, shops, and activities. Great room (flat screen TV, comfortable bed, refrigerator, microwave, clean bathroom), great staff, concierge, mini-market; two excellent restaurants and a cozy bar on site. Sparkling pool with nice chaise lounges; free dvds, ice and beach towels provided. “Book it, Dano”

My family had a great time at the Waikiki resort Hotel. I was moved by the kind staff and the clean hotel. I would like to come to this hotel again if I have a chance to visit Hawaii next time. Thank you very much!

Very good serviceSee you againGood location, excellent service.I really want to stay in Hawaii next time.Thank you for making this a pleasant trip.It made me keep good memories. I'll come back next time.Mahalo

Waikiki Resort hotel is ideally located within a block of Waikiki beach. Close to bars, restaurants and fast food outlets, you wont find a better bargain hotel, particularly if traveling on a budget. Book directly through the hotel for 2 x adult breakfast thrown in which is a big saver. 20% on kids breakfast. Bedding was ok but could invest in better mattresses. Dont expect to check in early as they are very busy. City view is opposing buildings. Water views are likely glimpses. We'd stay again.

Very friendly staff at breakfast and good hours. Room temp never got below 68 despite setting thermostat to 66. Parking garage was extremely tight and challenging to fit car. Location is great. Concierge was very friendly and helpful.

This hotel does give you value for your money. Complimentary breakfast was a great addition. Staff are very friendly and provide great customer service. Only negative, the room was very small and the outlook was residential units, not very private.

Great central location, hotel a bit outdated but very clean. Had some AC issues and plumbing. No bathtub only shower. overall would return to this location. Easy access for Uber and plenty of food places to eat! Would definitely return

Just a block from the beach, and a few minutes’ walk to plenty of great eats. Had the King Suite which had the king bed and ‘kitchen’ in one section and pull-out couch with a TV in the other, both with a balcony that have nearly black-out curtains. One surprising perk was free 1-at-a-time DVD rentals. Since we were traveling with our one-year-old, our days ended fairly early. The DVDs allowed us to watch some new movies we’ve been wanting to see.Issues:Bathroom - small sink with nearly no counter space to put your things down on.Bugs - bottom drawer of the dresser has a pillow in it. Upon taking it out, there were three small bugs in it, similar to ants but three times the length. Got Ross of the pillow Ang’s didn’t have any additional issues related to bugs. Was an os’s place for pillow so don’t know if staff was even aware.

The hotel's location is its number one asset. 100 metres from Waikiki Beach. Its close to Kuhio Ave, where all local buses stop. The hotel is clean but a little dated. The staff were friendly and helpful when needed. Hotel Parking is expensive, as is the case for all hotels in Waikiki. The hotel rate could be considered as mid level for Waikiki but is still expensive. Breakfast was included in my room rate. The breakfast was a decent full buffet. Overall the hotel is good and my family enjoyed staying there.

Went on the Valentines/President's Day weekend - hotels down in Waikiki were expensive and sold out. Found this lil' hotel and it worked perfect. Checked in late (around 9pm) and it was quick and easy. Room was decent, a/c was a little slow to cool the room but when it cooled it was nice, staff was friendly and having the morning breakfast available made it super convenient for our schedule. Close to the beach and walking the Waikiki strip. Will definitely stay again.

Having been in Waikiki numerous times before and staying at other hotels, this stay was a pleasant surprise. A short 5 minute walk from the beach, it is a great choice over those $$$$ priced hotels We had a 1-BR unit ... terrific.

Not bad but not worth the price at all. The hotel is outdated and the rooms are small. Also, booking through Expedia you don't get the free breakfast buffets that you would get if the room was booked direct and at the same price. Overall, a solid pretty ok.

Loved our 17th floor ocean view room. Well worth the upgrade. Housekeeping very attentive to our requests and the breakfast buffet had lots of options. First time I had fried rice before 8am and it was delicious. The only downside was the NOISE. Banging dumpsters, jackhammers, backup warning beeps, etc. Starting well before dawn. But it was downtown so we just laughed because we were in paradise.

Very Close TO GO TO THE BEACHPartially get the BEACH VIEW IN your roomVery convenient to go any wherethere are many good restaurant near here .I LOVE THIS PLACE, SO I want to visit again soon. thank you VERY MUCH.

I was there for 8 days. Great views and easy 2 minute walk to the beach. Rooms were large and comfy bed and pillows. Staff was friendly. The breakfast buffet was good but the scrambled eggs were runny every morning.

We stayed one night after being on North Shore for a few days. Waikiki Resort Hotel exceeded are expectaions. To start off with check in and check out June at the front desk is amazing, great personality and service. Let us check in early so my daughter could get her nap in for the day. Gentleman at bell desk and towel room were also really friendly and eager to help.Hotel room was large corner king (Room 1113) A little older but really clean and comfortable with great ocean view. The beach and shops are out your door. Didnt try out the restaurants or pool.Would stay here again, great value and service in amazing location.

Over all I was satisfied with the room. There was construction going on outside throughout the night, that was annoying. But the quality of the room was good. Ilima restaurant was nice especially with the 20% DISCOUNT.

Waikiki Resort made our great vacation even better by providing OUTSTANDING customer service starting from check-out all the way to the check-out after out 8-night stay last month.I especially wanted to thank Brandon, who checked us in, for being so nice and welcoming, providing us with all the information about all the hotel facilities and places nearby. He really took his time and made sure the reservation is all right, that we got the room we wanted and we were satisfied. Also, thank you Susie for helping us out during the check-out process and huge thanks to Leo, the bellman, for helping us with our luggage. Seriously, the hotel is amazing, clean and quiet, the location is also perfect, but THE STAFF, including housekeeping, restaurant staff and, of course, the front desk, IS JUST OUTSANDING. The hotel is located literally a minute walk from the beach. Its very clean since housekeeping doing a great job, it also has a very nice Korean restaurant on site, the food made me feel like im at my grandmas house. The elevators are fast, which is very important, so it doesn't take you long to get to your room. There's also a nice pool on the 2nd floor if you don't feel like going to the beach lol. Thank you guys for this pleasant experience and we'll definitely come back!

The location was fantastic being close to Waikiki beach as well as the general restaurant, bar and shopping precinct. The service was excellent and the rooms were very clean. The balcony room overlooking the beach offered a beautiful view particularly at sunset. On a minor note there was a bit of street noise during the night.

We have stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel for six trips so far. Our room was the "Corner Deluxe Studio Suite". Clean, comfortable and spacious rooms with a flair of Aloha. Very friendly staff, always very efficient and prompt answer to our requests. Great location, super convenient!The double-layer window curtains in the room blocked the morning sun that really helped us sleep well every night ;-)And surprisingly, we were able to enjoy Waikiki New Year’s Fireworks from our hotel balcony on New Year's eve... so nice!We really enjoyed our stay every time! And we recommended this hotel to a few friends who were pleasantly impressed upon their stay too. A very special Mahalo to Vicki for her relentless effort to make our stay always so enjoyable ^_^

Our stay at your hotel was very good. The reason it wasn't a notch higher is the fact that 1- the shower doesn't have hold bars in it and 2- you only had two elevators working which caused several long back-ups. Number 2, we hope, could be fixed easily, but it was during our stay. Number 1 is major and we feel should be a major item for future work and improvement.

Great view from our room across Waikiki beach. Excellent location to travel around Waikiki and other tourist sites across Oahu. Staff are very friendly and helpful from check in to check out.Good pool and access to a laundry.

Location location location plus the helpful & friendly staffWe stayed at this Resort for 2 weeks everything was great...clean room, helpful and friendly staff ...perfect location at a great priceWe highly recommend this hotel

7 days in january. Perfect weather but the Pool was cold for swimming. Cleaning was good. Breakfast good but everyday its the same. 4/5 overall. Definitively recomend and would stay again. Thanks for a pleasant stay and an unforgettable vacation trip

The room was by the elevator and you could image the noise. what’s more, the bathroom is horrible designed with a shabby tiny sink. No quality living here and will for sure not stay again or recommend it to anyone.

Staff were very helpful, friendly and always professional. Rooms were comfortable, neat and kept clean by the lovely house staff. Terrific location next to the beach and plenty of great eating spots and high end shops mixed with bargain and convenience stores.

Very nice hotel right near the beach,with lovely terrace to watch the surfers etc.terrific shops, restaurants etc. Service was wonderful and the hotel Lobby is beautiful and open. Nancy at the desk was wonderful and very helpful. They have 2 places to eat in the hotel one is a basic breakfast lunch and a Koren place that was very good, and bar that serves small plates. They also have Massage Spa too! We did the Pearl Harbor Tour of the Arizona and it was great! We loved the tour guide as he was fun and very knowledgeable. I learned a lot about the history of Hawaii which was cool! However, there are a few things that need to be addressed, There towel system is the pits! You must go down to the basement to get and return towels which is a pain especially if have with knee injuries, as i do. I suggested they put a hamper near the stairs to return towels so you are not going up & down. I forgot to get our towels a few times because it out of sight and had to go all the way back to the hotel to get them. On our last day I took the towel from the room so I did not have to go back and forth. Worked great! The other issue we endured as my husband has back pain now and cannot walk very well. They are not well equipped to cater to the unimpaired or handicapped. There was not one holding bar anywhere in the bathroom and my husband feel in the tub because there was nothing to hold to & he broke a few of the plastic shower curtain hooks and the towel rack because there was nothing to grab. They were very good about as I did report the issue and they fixed those items right away with any hassle. Another thing is the toilet was too low and hard to stand especially with anyone with a disability, & the door was so close to the toilet you could not open the door inward, you can only close it all the way unless you are using it. Poor designing there. The pool are is nice & they have nice loungers, but the water is SO cold you cannot stay in too long and they have no spa tub. The sun does not hit the pool til like noon as the building block it until it comes up. Also beware you must pay to use the chairs & umbrellas on the beach. 2 lounge chairs and umbrella will set you back back $60 bucks! Way too expensive if you ask me. We did it the first day but when I went by myself I asked for one chair only they charged me $25.00. They next time I went it was $20.00......then $15.00 as I only stated 1/2 day only. But they guys there are very professional and nice. Other than that a Lovey place to stay!

I would not have wanted to pay full price as the facilities are limited. At half price including breakfast it was a great value. It was clean and comfortable and only a short block to the beach. For full price I would have expected a warmer pool and a hot tub and a different bar. The room was a little tired but was clean and had all the amenities we needed.

The pros- great location, excellent free breakfast, clean hotel/rooms, excellent maid service.The cons-Having an adjoining room next to you and being able to hear the people's conversations and coughing.Being on the 16th floor & The whistling wind was unbearable. It shook the whole sliding door which made a loud banging noise 24/7. I asked to move & was denied, told all rooms would be the same! A worker came & stopped the banging but the wind still whistled as the sliding door wasn't properly sealed. I slept with ear plugs and a pillow over my head. Not enjoyable at all.

Literally two minutes from the beach, so many places nearby. Yummy on site restaurant, closed at 1:30pm. 24hr restaurants really close by. Unfortunately did not have a heated pool, towels only in the basement, ice machine only on 2nd floor.

View from the room was spectacular. That's because we had clear, unobstructed view of the new years fireworks. The hotel is dated, but worth cost I paid for the room. There was a sofa in the room that didn't look right given its placement and the size of the room. Other than that, the room was great. I would stay here again.

I chose this hotel as a base because it was near my niece’s apartment. The hotel is located in great location- 1 block away from the beach. The room was clean and comfortable. Housekeeping did a great job with daily cleaning. Also, hotel staff friendly. I didn’t have a car but I inquired about parking which is definitely much less than other hotels nearby. Also, resort fee was reasonable and much less than other hotels. There is a swimming pool but I didn’t use. I borrowed beach towels which were big, thick, and good quality. I asked for late check out which they accommodated me - only wanted to check out 1 hour later. I had Expedia package bundle with flights. Overall, it was an excellent hotel and deal I got from Expedia. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

The hotel is old and needs an update, yet it makes up for a great location, cleanliness, helpful and friendly staff from housekeeping, front desk, laundry to restaurant. Enjoy the free dvd movies, water refill, breakfast, and 20% off dining. Suzie at the front desk did a great job of upgrading us to a different room since our booked room was not available when we checked in due to another guest overstaying their check out time. We would definitely stay again when we return to Waikiki. Still waiting for an email (instruction on obtaining) our cash rewards.

The place was better than good for us - more value than those right next to the beach, but still in good location and shape. The only downside was that the windows were shaking when windy, bothering a bit while sleeping.

This was our 6th time to Waikiki beach but our 1st time staying at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. It was great . Clean rooms and lobby, excellent and friendly stay . June was beautiful and helpful at concierge . The buffet breakfast included was very good as well. We would easily stay there again.

The reservation officer was kind and the room was spacious, so it was good to stay. The location was also convenient to travel. However, it was disappointing that the bathroom smelled like a hoarse bath and the water in the bathtub didn't drain well, but I am satisfied overall.

Nice size rooms. I was on the 10th floor. No view of the beach, but not bad on the balcony. Hotel restaurant was very good for breakfast. Not the usual rubber scrambled eggs. Nice buffet line and a good selection of items for the international traveler. Close to the main road action and shops. I'm here for a week, so hopefully all will be fine for the remainder of the trip.

We stayed here for 10 nights, mainly because they had free wifi in the room (had to have it with a pre-teen boy!). It was very close to the beach and they gave us beach towels that we traded in every day for new ones. We used the free movies every day. We also used the laundry facility midweek. The front desk staff was very courteous and helpful (especially when my husband dropped my cell phone from the 14th floor!). I appreciated the water bottle fill station in the lobby. The only downsides were: the pool was ice cold and the nonstop crying toddler next door (every day from 6-9 am AND pm).

Good location - average hotel experience. We had trouble with a hair dryer that barely worked. It was close to Waikiki beach and many stores, but it was a bit noisy. The breakfast buffet at 16.95 minus 20 percent was my favorite and the service and waitress was excellent.

This is clearly a well maintained and well staffed hotel. The room was nice (the mini-fridge is hiding in a cabinet under the sink). The balcony was great. Everyone was courteous and willing to go above and beyond, from the front desk staff to the bell desk staff. The housekeeping staff, especially, anticipated needs before I knew I had them (like extra towels - when we arrived at my room, a woman in the hall looked at my family and said "Mom, how many are staying with you? I'll bring you 3 more towels."), and they took care of my requests (such as for a single fork) in decent time and always with a smile. And being 2 blocks from Waikiki beach was GREAT! If I had to say something negative, I guess it would be that the beds are too tall. I moved one against the wall so I didn't have to worry about my 4 year old falling out of bed 3 feet to the floor.

This hotel is in a good location, not right on Kalakuau didnt' matter. It was always nicely cleaned and restocked. It is an older style, (can imagine what a renovation would look like). huge room, good view of part of the ocean

My husband and I visited Hawaii for the first time and chose to party in Honolulu for New Years Eve. The Waikiki Resort Hotel location was amazing. It’s walking distance to everything you’ll need. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Dean in reception. The little details that make you feel appreciated and he had gone above and beyond to help us out. Great job!

Very nice location, close to everything. Staff was super and made things very easy. Simple check-in and check out. Nice room, comfy bed. Would most certainly stay here again. Only negative is the parking garage was very tight/small and a bit challenging to park. If there is room in the outdoor hotel lot than not an issue. Great hotel!

Terrible mattresses, way way way over priced. For the price I had to pay I could have bought new mattresses each night I stayed but the old worn out mattresses I had to sleep on were horrible. My back is hurting still days after leaving. The staff was excellent and very kind and helpful. The location was also excellent.

Being a repeat return guest, We always enjoyed our stay.I want to thank Derek Quinata, Sr. Reservations Agent who always handles our Reservations. Also want to say Mahalo to Sherrie Smith, and to Ho Shin Shin who I met on this last trip.

Staff was very helpful and kind. Room was clean and well preserved. If the facility can be renovated, more customers can visit the place because the location is perfect.Thank you for giving great memory.

We could not fault the staff. Parc and Moon in the breakfast buffet were fantastic. They both were very accommodating! We were disappointed to find out that there was no microwave or lounge in our room, nor was there a tub in the downstairs laundry where items could be hand washed. The ocean view from our room fantastic. The lighting in the room was appalling - it was extremely dim. Our room didn’t have a vanity, just a plank of wood stretching from one side to the other, which was highly inadequate. There was plenty of room for a marble vanity to be fitted around the basin (like the other rooms), however, for some reason this wasn’t the case in ours?? Overall an average hotel, although the location to the beach was very good....a 4 minute walk!! Location to the main shopping was a bit of a walk though.

We were staying at the hotel for 6 nights in December. Very convienient location, close to the beach. We bought a flight and hotel package through a travel agancy and it turned out that there was a hotel reservation problem. The manager of the Waikiki Resort Hotel, Vicky was fantastic! She worked with the agency and solved the problem right away. In the meantime, she accomadated us and made us feel comfortable. All staff were very friendly. Hotel was cozy and clean, provided beach towels. Overall great experience. Would stay again there.

My wife & I are currently staying here for 8 days.It’s our first time here and there’s a reasonable chance it won’t be our last.With the AUD particularly low against the USD it’s hard to find value for money accommodation.We picked here because it was $1200AUD cheaper than anything else.With Jetstar arriving at 0530 which is absolutely ridiculous given most hotels don’t have check in until 1400, this means you can be wandering the streets waiting for a room.We arrived at the hotel at 0615 and the young man pulled a rabbit out of the hat and got us our room and we were tucked up by 0630.That is a HUGH advantage.The rooms are a little old but ok given the price.There is a small kitchenette with a microwave oven for those whom may want to cook a little.The bed is only queen size compared to most other hotels in Waikiki offering king.No big deal for us because that’s what we sleep in at home.The hotel is well positioned and literally 5 minutes to the beach.I’d seriously think about giving this a go because it represents excellent value for money.

Clean, central, great value and fantastic staff. We will be back.Nothing is too much trouble for the staff, and they are always willing to help. The hotel is in a great spot near the beach, and close to pick ups for the tours.Clean rooms and bathrooms, and book directly to get the buffet breakfast which is great.My only neutral feedback would be the pool area needs some love, maybe a wall to block out the units looking in from over the other side of the carpark, and some cabanas, music, kiosk, bar, tiki lanterns, spa... It is the only aspect the place is lacking in... However I do keep an open mind and this place is still great value, and is priced accordingly! Ill happily come back to this hotel at anytime, but would be very enthusiastic to see an over haul of that pool space, so it can compete with some of its competitors pool spaces.,

Dean at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. Parking and location is very convenient. Park in the Ilima restaurant is always great. He remembers everyone in our group and knows exactly what our wants and needs are. He exemplifies the Aloha Spirit and the reason why we keep coming back every year.

Staff upon checking were lovely and knowledgeable. We enquired about adding an additional night as my Nephew was going to stay an additional night, he gave us the rate and we advised we could come down later to book. We came down just after 7pm there was one gentleman on the desk, he was very inconvenienced that we had bothered him and was very rude. He advised we could not extend it as it was through a third party, I said I understand we want to make a back to back room booking, can you not do a walk in book and make notes on our reservations so my nephew wont need to change rooms - He advised no and that he would not make the booking and we would have to come down in the morning?!! I explained the person that checked us in said we could come down. He asked me what the front desk agent was, I said I didn't remember but if he brings up our reservation he will be able to see who checked us in. He said he couldn't do that and how was he meant to know what we were told. What customer service is this!! When my partner and I left at 5am, we spoke to the desk once again about making the booking to which she informed us she could not make the booking we had to come down at 8:30, I requested if she could make a note on current reservation to which the answer was no?! Having worked in hotels around the world this seems absolutely ridiculous and extremely poor customer service.The rooms, are dark and dingy- however comfortable enough for one nights sleep. Bathtub - is half size, if you are under 5ft you would be able to sit cross legged in it - otherwise don't count on having a bath during your stay.The pool - don't even bother with, its extremely outdated and pool towels you need to rent from the garage. It even closes at 7pm.I am happy paying a resort tax when the amenities are adequate - but this is not the case. The location of the hotel is convenient, however there are better places to stay in Waikiki.

I stayed at the hotel for 5 days as I was doing the 2019 Honolulu Marathon. The staff was wonderful and incredibly friendly, professional and funny! Branden was so helpful with advice on the Honolulu Marathon as this was my first visit. The hotel even added a third bed for my 13-year-old son, something we didn't expect. The rooms were meticulously cleaned, which is a feat seeing we were at the beach quite a lot and there were three of us in the room. We got some great advice on tours and helped with the coordination of activities, while Kenneth at concierge was very helpful in storing our luggage.The only thing I didn't like was the pool was very cold and not heated so we could not use it, however, the beach towel service was very handy for our beach time. The location of the hotel is perfect! Off the main street but a 1-minute walk to the beach.Thank you to the staff at the Waikiki Resort Hotel - you made our trip worthwhile and special.

We booked this hotel due to its proximity to the beach (near the Duke statue) and it wasn't as expensive as many of the hotels in Waikiki. Whilst it isn't flashy and could do with a decor update, it suited our needs. Only 1 block back from the main strip, the room was large and the bed super comfortable. The room has a fridge, safe, hairdryer and DVD machine, and you can use movies for free. The hotel also has a buffet (at e extra cost), a restaurant, mini mart, pool, concierge for tours and parking lot. Keep in mind the extra fees for a resort charge and parking. The absolute best staff member was June. She was so kind and helpful and made our check in very easy. We were lucky enough to get an upgrade for our anniversary, a card and a box of cookies which we appreciated.

Free breakfast buffet, friendly staff, easy check in, and only one block from the beach! Special accommodations were requested and granted. I loved the free filtered water refill station in the lobby!

This was our third year staying at the Waikiki Resort for the Honolulu Marathon. We've have always enjoyed ourselves; the hotel is comfortable with a gracious and professional staff. We especially like the complimentary buffet breakfast (especially after running the Marathon the day before). Veronica, our housekeeper, was very friendly, courteous and helpful.

It was clean, cozy, comfortable. The staffs are very kind. no tooth paste and tooth brush so you need to bring them yourselves, but there are a iron, coffee machine and so on. Also, you can charge your digital device by using USB cable without adapter. It was very convenient. you don't have to prepare a plug transformer.

I always enjoy staying at the Waikiki Resort it's like home away from home. I was disappointed that the Christmas tree and decorations didn't go up on December 1st. Also, the breakfast was disappointing because it was very basic and it was the same menu every day. Otherwise on the whole our stay was excellent

Very happy with our stay, convenient location, decent size rooms, nice pool, good customer service, free movies, our breakfast was included. Nice view to diamond head and partial beach. Very happy, would definitely recommend to anyone.

I believe I received a little more than what I had expected. My room athough on the 17th Floor (and I hate heights) was excellent, my views better than expected as I was expecting Partial views. This was a bonus for me.... Always like NANCY, always well dressed and polite, always nice exchanging pleasantries with her... Unable to use the safe in 1718, could not RESET and the fridge had a foot missing making it unstable

overall was not bad, but i think room needs to be renovated as soon as possible.. room size was quite small and as same as other hotels, room was very old. renovation required. locationwise was good and beds were also cozy and nice.

The hotel has a nice, almost bird's eye view of the ocean from it's upper floors, but only partially. The view is a bit obstructed by the other tower hotels in the area. It isn't beach front but still offers a nice view, given the right room. The room istelf had a decnt amount of space, but it was evident the room photos on the hotel's main website are somewhat dated and the rooms have aged to some degree. They are, however, kept clean. The beds were smaller than they looked on the website also. Not much comfort or room if sleeping two to a bed. The shower/bathing area is also quite small. Nonetheless, the hotel does have its charms. Its proximity to the beach, nearby restaurants and shops; as well as being along all the major buslines, certainly helps its case. It does have a nice library of movies to rent at no charge to guests, as well as offering to lend boogie boards, beach towels, accessories, etc. at no charge. The staff are friendly and helpful, and even accomodated a late check out. Not too shabby a place to spend a few nights.

We recent stayed in the penthouse suite at the Waikiki Resort Hotel and it was very, very ordinary. We were hoping for something special, especially given what we paid. Instead, we got an old, dark apartment with dirty dishes, a mouldy sponge and hardly any kitchen utensils. The pool needed serious updating and looks across at a less than appealing apartment block. We also requested a high chair for our 9 month old son but were told it was a 'safety hazard' so they were unable to help us which was a complete inconvenience.The hotel was in a good location and the staff were lovely (other than the waitress at breakfast. She was very unpleasant). The hotel was close to the beach, and very noisy at night as it overlooks the pool areas of other hotels, so you get the music and street noise all night. If you're looking for somewhere to stay to make your Hawaii trip memorable for good reasons, I wouldn't stay here. We were quite disappointed unfortunately.

This hotel is very nice! While not directly on the beach, it is only 1 block away. Staff was AMAZING especially Ken (bell service) and Connor and Dave at the front desk. Not the newest hotel in the area, but great prices and great services! Thank you!

We really enjoyed our stay the rooms were very well serviced and clean and comfortable. We love that you supply beach towels for the beach and pool. Amazing location so close to everything. We especially loved the water bottle refill in the lobby and also the little shop which really sold a lot of much needed items before we left on day excursions. Staff are all very helpful. Breakfast supplied was fantastic value and the whole family was happy with the great range.

This s the second time we have stayed in this hotel ,we stayed in the deluxe corner with ocean view.The room is spacious with a kitchenette which meant we could make breakfast and pack snacks for our day adventures .The staff are friendly and helpful ,the cleaners are very obliging.My daughter had the studio with a seperate bedroom for her two boys,This hotel is one street from the beach close to the bus stops and main shopping strip..We will definitely stay here again .Many Thanks Chris and Rick

Nice Hotel, our room was nice and clean, well kept, hotel staff very friendly and accomodating,  very good location centralized to beach areas,, shopping and restaurants , morning early breakfast was fantastic with a variety of buffet choices

I love love love this resort, every time we go back it’s like going home. I go to Hawaii to relax and unwind. Staying at this resort you are guaranteed a relaxing break. I have fallen asleep many times by the pool. Staff are beautiful and friendly. We are going back and will be staying here again and again. The picture I have attached is a partial ocean view room and as you can see it’s a great view, one I will remember on my busiest days until I return.

My friend and I just spent 5 excellent nights in this superb hotel. Although booked into a standard room, we were upgraded at no additional cost to a 1 bedroom suite, with two balconies. Although surely this cannot be expected, it was an example of the outstanding service and consideration we received throughout our stay. The staff members are exceptionally helpful, the views first class (even in the 'mountain view' rooms, at least on the upper floors) and the location leaves nothing to be desired. The hotel is situated only a half-block off a lovely park portion of Waikiki Beach, allowing easy access for swimming or simply watching the waves and the dozens of surfers active from dawn until dusk. May I suggest that you check the hotel website to get the best prices, and rooms that can be cancelled, rather than pre-paid as is the case with the third-party booking services? All in all, we were delighted with this hotel in every way.

Only 1 block from beach. Good accomodation. Friendly staff. Handy Expedia rep on lobby floor. Close to shopping precinct. Enjoyed our stay. Kai Cofee around the corner was the best coffee we tasted outside of Aus

I am so impressed with the staff and the rooms. I go to Oahu every year and this is the first time I stayed at Waikiki Resort but it will definitely be the hotel I stay at in the future. The rooms are very clean and the front desk staff is extremely helpful and friendly. They provide transportation to the airport for only $12.00 per person.

Great location, 1 block from the beach, easy to walk in any direction to shops and restaurants Would gladly stay here againClean spacious room and bathroom Friendly helpful staffGreat view from ocean view room, even though the beach view was between hotels Highly recommend it

The hotel although a little dated was in a very central location which made it easy to walk to the beach and the many bars and restaurants in the area . On arrival we were met by Dennis from the concierge desk there was 4 adults and two babies and we had just been to the North shore for 4 days so everyone was a little tired Dennis was amazing he help unload a very packed car and got us to reception quickly we did not wait too long for our rooms but had s little mix up which again Dennis sorted out .The breakfast was a buffet style and was adequate for us staff were very good and efficient. the room was clean and the house maids were always courteous and helpful . When I come back to Oahu I would definitely consider this hotel we were on the 18th floor and had a great view of the beach and a partial view of Diamond Head .The only thing the hotel lacked was a bar the pool area although we did not use it was also well laid out .Great Stay

I had an issue with a multinational retailer, Brendon at the reception was able to assist me in dealing with the retailer and resolved the matter for me for quickly. Brendon is always very helpful and will always try to exceed expectations. All other staff go out of their way to make your stay pleasant.

Fabulous oceanview room on high floor. The room was clean and the staff was wonderful and very helpful. It's an older hotel but well maintained. I ate a few meals at the hotel restaurant but there are plenty of dining options in the area if you choose to venture out. I definitely will be back.

Rooms were outdated and quite old in decor. The view of the ocean for our room was a very limited view. The balcony was too small to really enjoy sitting out there. The lobby was modern but the room was very outdated.

I stayed here for one night after a cruise. It was around $28 in an Uber from the cruise port.The reception staff are great, there is a nice pool area with luxury loungers. I booked a small suite with two balconies for less than the price of a normal room at the Hyatt,The room was large and clean.It is very handy having a shop and restaurant onsite.

Rooms were clean and comfortable and the cleaner did a fantastic job. Coco checked us in at 7am which was very much appreciated after 14 hours in transit. We had 3 rooms booked and were going to be grateful if only one of the rooms were available but Coco got all 3 of us checked in way before check in time.

It was great service, facility and amenities, especially coffee and cookies and ice on the second floorBut there's some noise outside of the windows when we slept in.I think your resort have to be replaced double or triple window,Anyway overall it was nice , for your resort.

Stayed here three nights before a cruise. The location is perfect, staff was friendly and helpful. Morning buffet breakfast had a good selection and at 16.95 for two in Waikiki, it was a good deal. The pool was a bit chilly due more to the time of year but a nice alternative to sand and salt if you want it. Free rental of DVDs was a nice perk for the down time not at beach.

I started my Aloha experience when I got on board of Hawaiian Airlines. Then when I arrived at my hotel. The parking is a little expensive The hotel front desk employees were awsome and kind. The pool was nice but the water was freezing.The breackfast at the hotel was little better than denny's but less than the hotel nxt to you. Well situated and located. The room was nice not exceptionnal but confortable. However, the room is very poorly soundproofed. The view from the balcony amazing! I want to thank particulary the housekeeper who did an excellent job and made my room with special attentions. Mahalo Nui Loa!

Leo is the best. From taking our luggage to our room and many other things that were way above and beyond expectations. He is a great point staff person. He has the personality and hospitality for greeting the guest. Leo, thanks for doing a great job. Your a hard commodity to find these days.

Walking distance to beach and shops. Good breakfast.Little outdated room. Please check smell of women restromom next swimming pool. The smell was terrible. You should change cleaning solution. Overall it was nice stay.

Great location, clean, good facilities. We were completely happy with our stay at this hotel. The hotel was only a short stroll from the famous Waikiki beach and close to restaurants, transport and everything else that we needed.

If you are after a comfortable, clean, hotel in a great location at a reasonable price than you can't go past the Waikiki Resort Hotel. We there a Family of five adults and stayed nine nights and thought the Waikiki Resort was prefect for our needs. Staff were friendly and welcoming, rooms where a great size and cleaned beautiful every day, and most importantly the location was spot on. Just one street back from the beach so easy to walk to for a quick cool off after a day shopping or sightseeing. The only let down was the decor, a little dated and tired but then again if they did too much renovating it may increase their rates. So in inclusion the Waikiki Resort would be a hotel that I would recommend to my friends or stay again.

We had a very good time at Waikiki Resort Hotel. All was clean and the hospitality was excellent. A place to recommend and come back.The location to the Waikiki beach is perfect and close and you will find all the Waikiki attractions close by.

Great location friendly and helpful staff and would certainly stay here again. The breakfast was really good and the location of the hotel could not have been better both for the beach, main shopping area and public transport

This hotel is in a great location and the staff are really friendly and helpful. We had an issue with our air conditioning and they came up to fix it right away. They even brought in a temporary fan to help cool down the unit faster. The restaurant has a nice breakfast buffet, however the staff is not very attentative as relates to bringing you hot drinks or refills. The hotel is older, however the rooms are clean, comfortable beds and has everything that you need, including large safes. Only a block from the beach

The front desk employee Nancy was wonderful! Very friendly and helpful! Cameron at the excursion desk was also fantastic. The concierge guys were also very good. About the hotel - the lobby is nice and clean however the rooms are old and in desperate need of upgrading! The rooms are dark and dingy. It was clean just old and tired looking! Quite the let down from the lobby entrance.

Location so close to beach and all places we wanted to go.Staff very friendly and helpful.Free Breakfast was excellent .Only problem need new soda vending machine. Ate my money twice. Bighly recommended

We have stayed at Waikiki Resort many times and arrive around 8am. Although we do not expect out room to be ready then, we were advised that our room "was not ready yet", (I took this to mean that it may be ready within a few hours. We were asked for a contact number to advise us when it was ready. Our friends were advised that it would be "close to 3pm". We suggested they should leave their contact number. Around 11.20am they got a text to say their room is ready. We asked them to let us know if ours was ready. Around 1pm we went back to the desk, to we told the same, "not ready yet". We then went to the beach and as no message received came back after 3pm, went to the desk and told the room is ready.

Hi I have been visiting Oahu for over ten years, and always look forward to staying at your great hotel. When I check in it's almost like being at my second home! My room is always lovely and clean, you have a great housekeeping team, I am already planning another trip, and look forward to staying with you once again during September 2020.Mr M Dyer.

Instead of changing tables in th lobby ,room should be renovated ,toilet bowl leaking, old carpetAir conditionner not cleaned and water drippingGreat location considering near beach and stores ,should have better patio doors,

Your hotel is the best . We appreciate the hospitality and the whole crew are so nice and they always take very good care of us. i would recommend this hotel to everyone.perfect location for everything.

The service was good. Our room was standard size and the bath tab was a half of the regular size; so that, we were unable to take a both in our room. They don't have a hot tab or a pool. We had to wait for 20 minutes in line to get in to have a breakfast as the restaurant was small and they seemed to be short in hands at that time. Breakfast was good though. Convenient location to go around the town.

The hotel staff was amazing!Vicki,Dave Brandon & Dennis. Love the restaurant staff too . We didnt want to leave. We will surely miss the staff along with Michelle, park and moon at the restaurant Aloha

We stayed here for 6 nights in one of the corner rooms with a partial ocean view. The room was spacious and in a perfect location for our stay. Great start to our trip was being able to check in at 8am after an overnight international flight (got lucky!) Walking distance to beach & a lot of shops, bars, restaurants we visited. Great service from everyone we dealt with. The free DVD rental came in handy too. Comfy bed! Would consider staying again if we head back to Hawaii

All amenities made my stay comfortable.:) would stay here again just for the bed...so comfy! Breakfast was ok, but a bit more fruit would have been nice. Bellboy was so helpful and pleasant, went out of his way To accomodate

This is our second stay at this hotel. We love the location (a block from Kaulakaua Ave and the beach. The parking was easy and the staff was very friendly. The service I couldn’t ask for more. I’ll stay there again and again!

I wouldn't call it a resort. Its more like a big motel. It wasn't too bad but it located at a wonderful location with so much to do close by and lively stuff. Parking is 28$ per day mind you. One block from the beach and shopping centers.

This was our first time to visit in Oahu Hawaii. I read many reviews about The Waikiki Resort Hotel before I arranged our hotel accommodations. Then we chose it. When we arrived at the hotel, though many interiors of the room were old, I enjoyed it. The hotel reception services were excellent and friendly. Overall, the location close to the Waikiki beach is one of benefit.

The Waikiki Resort Hotel enjoys everything at affordable rates despite its fantastic location.We had a hard time changing our reservations this time.However, we did provide the best service through the mail contact with the Waikiki Resort Hotel at no additional charge.Thanks to the Waikiki Resort Hotel, we were able to have a fantastic time with our families in Hawaii.If I travel to Hawaii Oahu again, I will surely make a reservation at Waikiki Resort Hotel.Again, thank you for your consideration for Waikiki Resort Hotel.

Clean, old style comfort. Good breakfast and convenient location for a short stopover in Honolulu. Easy access by public transport to and from the airport. Quite and close to an early morning beach walk.

Great location, close to the beach, restaurants, storesThe breakfast was good and heartyThe fillling station in the lobby for our water bottles was a great help especially with the Hawaii heat.I booked directly at their website and it was 50% off with free breakfast which was a huge bonus.

My wife and I had a wonderful time celebrating our 35 year anniversary in Honolulu. I checked over 12 hotels and decided on the Waikiki resort Hotel. The key was the outstanding service by a gentlemen name Derek whom arranged our reservation. The front desk staff of Nancy and Connor was wonderful. We were treated very well. One block from the beach and restaurants.

The house cleaning staff was very good room always well-maintained one thing that was a little disappointing was the front desk everybody was very kind and helpful when you went to talk to them but felt neglected when I walk through the lobby I stayed at the queen kapiolani a few years ago and every time we walk thru they acknowledged us with a wave or a Aloha but here I felt like when I walk past I didn't feel acknowledged. Which I understand they may want to not bother ppl. I guess from being acknowledged at my last hotel I kind of expected it. Again they were very kind and helpful when you asked them a question or for help. And the concierge was very helpful. I would stay here again and would recommend the hotel to people.

Clean,tidy room.Close to the beach.Great surf.Was noisy in the mornings because of rubbish trucks.Wifi not great.Very nice Restuarants close to Hotel.All transport and shops close to Hotel.Have been here twice now, hotel is tired but enjoyed my stay.Thanks.

My husband and myself have just returned from a 6 night stay here, Check in staff were very helpful and friendly - even Nancy at reception who wasn’t too well when we arrived was warm and friendly whilst checking us in. Yes this hotel isn’t as modern and flashy as some of the hotels, would say it need a freshen up with light colours on the room walls rather than the yellows they tend to use. Couldn’t fault the cleanliness at any time of the rooms they were spotlessly clean daily. Pool area was excellent but maybe they could do with some music playing for atmosphere. The location you couldn’t fault everything easily accessible and close to the trolley and bus stops. Only one drawback we found on the 12th floor was when the wind blew the patio doors rattled and banged ended up putting a leaflet in the door to stop it. The wi-fi well yes it is frustrating at times when you can’t get on it and it is slow at times. But hey was only holiday so only needed it to check what was what in the world so no great issues for me. Would stay there again as the resort fees were quite low for the area and parking was easily accessed too.

This has been a long time since had I lost the card the team the left with us and found it again yesterday.From the night I swallowed a chicken bone at a local eatery off kalakaua when we we there a year ago, my family and I were blown away by the support and assistance Branden and Dave gave us back in August 2018. I promised I would post a review and mention the incredible hospitality and warmth we felt from the guys when we needed to rush to ER to have the bone removed. A huge thank-you to the team their and your dedication, you're a huge asset to the resort and made our stay truly feel like home.Cheers,John and Family.

Spent one week in this Hotel giving better value one block back from beach. The positives are great location, friendly staff and clean rooms. Being on 15th floor a great view.The negatives are this Hotel is a bit tired. There is no gym, nor can you get a decent barista coffee. We went over the road to Alonilana Hotel for coffee and found out this awesome place was the same price as our Hotel!I’d give a five out of 10 for breakfast. Same limited fruit selection and cooked breakfast each day.If you rely on wifi , it is rubbish, being constantly kicked off. Used the Alonilana wifi when by the pool which is fairly basic compared to their neighbours.Finally the independent travel office run by Expedia in the lobby are a rip off . Don’t use them. Go into the Main Street and find a small excursion shop. Much better deals.We would not stay here again.

We loved our stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful and accommodating Room had a nice view and housekeeping was friendly and efficient. Breakfast buffet is amazing and the staff at restaurant very nice . Location is very central close to all shops and bus stop just around corner . Very nice part of the beach is half a block away . Can’t fault the location or the price . Would definitely return and do not hesitate to recommend

2nd visit this year. Staff are always welcoming, and keep this hotel really clean and well maintained. Location for Waikiki beach is great - about half a block. Have tried condominiums, but keep coming back to this hotel!

The building itself was a little old, although you can't beat the location. Very close to the beach and restaurants. The first room i stayed was old and need some renovation, the second room was better. The staff was friendly and helpful.

This was my third time staying at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. The staff is always so friendly and the location is unbeatable for Waikiki. I love it because it basically sits mid-strip and only a block off the beach. Each end of Waikiki is just a short walk away. The value that you get with this hotel is outstanding. I also love that they offer self parking. I'm not much of a valet person because I am in and out so much. I love to explore the island and I am constantly on the move. Having self parking where I don't have to wait on valet is so much better to me. If you are looking for a great value hotel in Waikiki, then look no further than the Waikiki Resort Hotel.

This hotel had everything we needed at a good price. We had a deal that gave us buy one get one free on breakfast which was really good value, and what a fantastic choice. The room was a good size with a good en-suite and hot showers. The swimming pool was clean and at the time we stayed we could always get a lounger. The hotel also supplied large towels to use around the pool and the beach. They had a DVD vending machine that we could get up to date movies,(free of charge). To cap it all the staff in every sector were friendly and helpful.

Stayed for about a week on our honeymoon and it was great. Close to beach and plenty of food options. Would recommend and absolutely would stay again! Be sure to get breakfast at the restaurant on first floor, great value and awesome staff.

Brandon was very helpful and friendly when we checked in for our final two nights for our Honeymoon. He upgraded us to a nicer room on a higher floor, which had a beautiful ocean view. Thank you for making our stay special!

Lovely warm welcome at front desk, we got a lovely pineapple cookie gift as we were celebrating our honeymoon and were able to check in a little earlier, lovely buffet breakfast with a great variety. Our room was spotless and cleaned with no effort every day, the pool was nice very relaxing, the location was great very close to the beach and the main street where the shops are, the pink bus take you to the Alamoana shops from the dukes statue.

Hotel was good although being older hotel getting a little tired. Location is good, staff friendly and efficient. Hotel caters for Asian mostly South Korean, KAL flight crew stop there. hence Korean restauraunt on site. 20% discount for both onsite restaurants.Shop on site at hotel a little expensive no prices displayed

What a nice hotel to stay at. The rooms were clean. Staff very friendly. The hotel itself very immaculate. You're a few steps away from the beach, shopping and restaurants. I would recommend it to others and stay again.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Marie B
New York, New York, United States

review_body: Stayed here for 8 nights. The resort itself is in a good location. It is in need for an update as it’s very old. The Wifi in this hotel is really really BAD. A big shout out to Branden for the professional help you provided throughout our stay and also to June for helping sort out our check in debacle. A big thank you though goes to LEO on the bell desk. Your help you gave us whilst we stayed in Waikiki was 5 star. Thank you thank you thank you!!!!!

We spent a week here for our holidays and while generally it was clean, it is showing it’s age. It was an accumulation of little things that we experienced that will not encourage us to return or to recommend it for the money we paid. Firstly, the bathroom had a half size bathtub with the shower, normally a deal breaker right there as I will often struggle to get in and out of it because I’m not tall. To add to that the grout was mostly brown and needed a good scrub. The safe was too high for me to see what was in it. The quality of the food for breakfast offered was ordinary. Lastly, and this is something trivial I know but we had read that kettles were available for tea and coffee which we hadn’t had at American hotels before. A new kettle arrived which was great but they only supply 1 bag of green tea and earl grey tea. So I asked for black tea and was told no that’s it. We are very spoilt in Australian hotels where we have a selection of teas, instant coffee, sugar etc even real cups and spoons. I would love to see American hotels learn to accommodate more than one type of traveller. At $250 per night it was not value for money.

Overall the service was very good however, Nancy was exceptional! Genuine, accommodating our many requests, friendly and tenacious. Nancy is truly one of a kind when it comes to demonstrating exceptional guest servicing. Thank you Nancy so much from George and I, we really appreciate your time and efforts. We will be back and all because of you! Best wishes, Kos

It was very good time in the waikiki resort hotel. Especially every employees are so kind. However the view of hotel room a little bit sorry. If I get a chance to visit Hawaii, I am willing to stay in the waikiki resort hotel.

I like this hotel, good location, easy in and out, clean, people is nice, but only issue is no WiFi when you in the room, I try to get in, it’s alway can’t, you only can have WiFi in the lobby, when I go back to the room, no more, if they can fix this problem, I will definitely stay again, if no, I’m no going stay.

All American accommodation is higher priced then our Australian ones but this hotel was reasonable with and excellent location. They offer beach towels and maintain a good housekeeping standard. The wall paper is from the 70’s but once your eyes are closed it doesn’t matter! Nice room features tho.

We stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel in April which is also listed as a 3 star hotel. For this trip in August we chose the Waikiki Resort Hotel to be closer to the beach & for better views; We assumed that accommodations would be similar. There is NO comparison. The Waikiki Resort rooms pictured are EXTREMELY enhanced and this place is maybe a 1 Star at best and very misrepresented in its advertising. The curb appeal of the property says “vintage” but at a closer look vintage begins to look more like significantly aged and in desperate need of an update & repair. The hallways are dingy, poorly lit, excessively humid, noisy, and brimming with various pungent odors. Yes, the halls are open-air exposed at the ends but the air within them is not circulating at all.  As for the guest rooms. the door exteriors are scuffed with black marks and dirty. The interior carpet is vacuumed and the bed neatly made but the carpet, headboards, bedspreads, wallpaper & most of the other decor is circa 1970’s, extremely “weathered” & very well worn in appearance while screaming I contain 50 years of dust mite debris. Our room view was even better than we expected but unfortunately the hotel ventilation and extreme humidity problems go beyond the hallways and are a significant concern throughout the building; especially in the guest rooms. The air handling system does not appear to be able to keep up with/control the demands of the island humidity and when viewing the room vents for the air handler (which are also broken & bent) extremely dirty & lack of maintenance to the system is easily visible to the naked eye. Upon entering the bathroom We were surprised (shocked) to see that the original scratched and worn shower basins were in place with the old-time rubber mats to stick in the bottom of the shower (gross) but we were even more appalled to discover black mold on the ceiling. Due to chronic illness black mold exposure will hospitalize 1 of us (me) & completely ruin our trip. Fortunately the staff was EXTREMELY kind and understanding. They attempted to show us another room but the same black mold problem was still there. The staff SINCERELY apologized and asked if there was anyway they could rectify the situation to accommodate us; when we explained that once it is airborne it’s just to big of a risk, especially for a 9 day stay they fully understood & gave us a full refund. As 20% of the population suffers from a genetic weakness causing severe mold toxin illness, anyone who has been through cancer treatment, has other illnesses that has left them with a compromised immune system, or a sufferer of airborne allergies the air quality and age of the living decor absolutely matters! This hotel really needs to update the air handling system, replace room carpeting & eliminate the “grass-textured” wallpaper as these can all readily hold mold spores to regenerate & the age of them also significantly increases allergen issues as a whole.... The property is in a great location but “buyer beware” the Waikiki Resort Hotel is completely unfit to accommodate anyone with a compromised immune system or airborne allergies! Lastly, this week is extremely busy on the island of Oahu, there were literally no rooms the 1st night til I’ll called around and found a cancellation at 7:30pm at night... we almost ended up sleeping in our car! Beyond that they’re were 2 hotel options for the rest of the week at 3 or 4xs the $$$... our budget is blown but our accommodations look like what we expected at the Waikiki Resort Hotel... however it’s called: the MARRIOT!!!

My partner and I arrived a couple of hours before check-in time, but our room was ready and we were shown to our room right away. The front desk staff were so lovely and welcoming, and we received a room upgrade from a city view to an ocean view, which was a wonderful surprise! Great value for money, we will definitely stay again when we visit Hawaii next.

Close to the beach for classes and swimming and close to two major shopping areas with with many eating options was a big plus. Food was good and staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was quiet and comfortable. Shower only and it was a bit challenging.

This is our 12th year in the row coming back to the Waikiki Resort for vacation. We like the convenience and location of the hotel to the beach, Waikiki locations and the park. We always enjoy the swimming pool on the second floor.

Excellent location, steps from the beach. Breakfast had lots of choices. Service was very good. Rooms and pool could use an update but overall a comfortable and good experience. Housekeeping staff was excellent and friendly. I would not hesitate to recommend for value and location.
user_name:
Julie A
Simi Valley, United States

review_body: Excellent place to stay accessible to everything. Staff are friendly, always renders excellent service to us. We will come back and stay here again. Hawaii is real paradise island. I like the place very much!!!

We ordered the room and breakfast buffet. When we checked in, we were not given our breakfast buffet tickets. The next morning we went to ask the front desk for the breakfast buffet tickets and the lady at the front desk insisted they gave the tickets and that we lost them. We had to argue for 10 minutes to get what we payed for because the lady at the front desk said "we wouldn't forget to give those out". This is exactly what we needed on our honeymoon, thanks. The rooms are small but we'll maintained. When we finally did get our breakfast it was a good buffet. There isn't a lot of parking and the under ground parking smells like a sewer. Everything considered it was just the customer service that slipped on this trip.

The front desk and bell hop staff were extremely nice and helpful. Flying into hawaii our airline lost our luggage and we were extremely upset and the staff were very empathetic. It appeared she actually cared unlike the airport staff who seemed to careless our bags were lost. Breakfast was delicious at the restaurant at the front of the hotel. And bonus it was only 1 block from the beach! Would definitely recommend this hotel. We will stay again next time we come.

We had several issues with our stay but Branden always knew how to help! He pointed us in the right direction every time. The last day June was a big help as I had to find a way to get my breast milk back home to my baby boy. As far as the hotel it was nice and clean. Bathroom was very small though. Homeless people everywhere as well as construction. All of that aside the hotel was fantastic!

This is our second stay at the Waikiki Resort hotel. It’s close to the Main Street, the beach and it has a great restaurant for a full breakfast to start each day if choose ! We had a parking space and a place to do our laundry too!! A huge thank you to Connor for checking us in promptly, answering all our questions and for his friendly chats!!!

Great location, friendly and helpful staff, a little dated but a good price . Clean and comfortable. Great selection of programmes on tv. Korean restaurant good , pool and DVD selection available. One of our regular stays

Comfortable, convenient accommodations in the heart of Waikiki. Front desk staff are excellent, very quick and responsive to every need and question. Included breakfast was terrific, I enjoyed it every day!

been staying at the Resort for over 30 years! members of my family and I have stayed there for that many years...always pleasant hotel staff - both front of the house and back of the house.- especially like the location as well as the staff. Dennis Bell Desk, Sherrie, Res. Derek, Res. June, Front Desk, Susie Front Desk, Denise Front Desk- too many to name - excellent Aloha spirit!

Great location with only a short walk to the beach -the pool was private and we didnt have to fight for a sun lounge -the staff were friendly and helpful - a great place to stay .would definately come back again .

Would have appreciated wine/champagne glasses and drink tumblers. All in all we enjoyed our stay close to all amenities and beach.Staff in the breakfast restaurant were helpful and friendly.Front desk staff were friendly and efficient.

We had a good time at the waikiji beach cause of tour location. And my little ladies really liked that. We satyed three hotels in Hawaii including waikiki resort hotel, all of families choiced you the best^^

We really enjoyed our stay. We booked a corner room and could see the ocean through some buildings, even though we were one street back from the beach front. This is listed as a 3 star hotel, very clean and so well maintained, for the price paid we were extremely happy. The room was quite large, the bed and pillows were comfy. The room had a bar fridge, microwave, coffee machine and crockery and cutlery for two.The room also had a two seater couch, small table and chairs, a small balcony with two chairs and small table. We requested an electric kettle from reception and it was delivered immediately. Very easy room to live in for the 10 nights we stayed. It has a pool, but we didn’t use it, the beach is a 2 minute walk. What a great place to swim, perfect for families also. Great location plenty of eating places around, bars, restaurants, coffee and casual. It’s only a 9 minute walk to some of the more popular eating places like Dukes and the Cheesecake Factory. Very helpful and friendly reception staff and room attendants, our room was cleaned and refreshed everyday.

Clean, friendly hotel with a lovely breakfast buffet.Only drawback, no patio umbrellas poolside or courtesy room for those who would like to clean up prior to a late night flight. I would recommend this hotel to future guests.

Service was first class. We had a room with ocean views that was serviced daily. Very little street noise other than occasional police sirens. Police station was nearby. Walking distance to just about everything in Waikiki including bus stops to get you to Diamond Head ( bus number 23 and bus 22 to Hanauma bay for the snorkling but leave early.) I've have stayed at a few places there over the years and for your money this is the one for you.

Had a one night stay in Honolulu to catch an early flight home. The hotel was perfect. Very clean, room was perfect size and location was exactly what I would have chosen. A block off the main drag but close to the beach and all necessities. Would definitely stay here again. Great value for sure.

Hotel closed to everything, transport, beach, shop and restaurant. Staff are very nice and helpful. Specially receptionist Kevin helped me to correct my booking fault. Appreciate! We will come back again.

Hotel location was convenient to the beach and offered a great value. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout the hotel and cheerfully answered any questions we had. The room we had was small and really was in need of an update as it was clearly dated. There were however enough available plugins and USB outlets.

This hotel was everything we needed! The beds were very comfortable. They have a water dispenser in the lobby. This hotel is only a short block to the beach and 1 block from lots of shopping and restaurants. The only complaints were the shower was very small and I bumped my head trying to shave my legs and the air conditioning seemed like it wasn't cooling as much as we wanted especially at night. There are DVDs to watch which were free. The concierge was very helpful and the people at the desk were nice. We had gotten free breakfast since we had called direct to hotel for reservations.
