The location was wonderful and I really enjoyed this hotel. Quick trip to MacDonald's on the corner for coffee because the time change I was up very early and they are open all night. I would stay here again if I ever get back to Honolulu!

We stayed at this hotel last month for 1 week. It isn't the fanciest hotel, but it had everything we needed. We booked a Partial Ocean View, and it had a good view. We were able to see fireworks from our room and it was pretty amazing to see. We also saw fireworks when we stayed at Outrigger Waikiki Resort last year, but you could see pretty well from where we were too. I liked the fact that they have a water bottle machine, so we could fill up our bottles instead of buying so many. I don't know how many other hotels have these, but they are very useful. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants. The location is great because it's just a short walk away from the beach. I would consider staying here again.

Thank you for your good service, especially housekeeper provided good service (care foe children) Especially location was very good, and procedure front was friendly and was quick.One inconvenience is that DVD did not have Korean support. I would like to improve it and have DVD Korean support next time.I like your hotel very much as a customer who has already used your hotel three times. I pray for the development of your hotel in the future

we liked each of our 4 stays, the people are friendly, its a medium size hotel so the staff treat you as a person not a room number.the staff that clean the room is flexible and adjusts their schedule to meet our needs. i find them very trustworthy. the bell captain, Dennis Arimoto is helpful, knows the area, and goes out of his way too make our trip enjoyable.

Great location! Brought my children and their families and they had a great time at the beach and a couple took surfing lessons. The hotel was very clean and the personnel helpful. The buffet breakfast was excellent in taste, quality and variety.

Very nice partial view of Waikiki beach as requested. Clean & great complimentary breakfast with hard working manager. Well organized. Great location. Just a few blocks to the beach. Would stay there again.

Excellent hotel great location walked nearly everywhere would highly recommend. We had 17th floor and a very spacious clean room with good views of beach and diamond head. Had breakfast included each morning to kick start the day and found it adequate for what we required.

Great location,1min walk to the beach and main strip. Hotels very clean and staff were lovely. Only downfall is the pool area, very small and out dated. Otherwise couldn’t fault it, we had a lovely stay.

We had a spectacular view of the mountains & watched sunrise on our balcony every morning. Also the night lights were enchanting. The resort was clean and the staff were very friendly & knowledgeable. We could walk to the beach from our room which was updated. Also swam in the pool every morning & dined in breakfast room. We had Easter brunch & it was well worth the price. Thank you for lovely memories & would definitely stay here again.

We spent 4 nights here and enjoyed our stay. Staff are friendly and helpful, but it’s very much 3 star accommodation. We are a family of four and found the rooms a little on the small side for 2 adults, a 14 year old and an 11 year old. The pool area is basic with a not so appealing view. In saying that though, the location is great, so close to the beach and restaurants. This is the first time we’ve stayed in this part of Waikiki and much prefer the Lewers Street end. Found it less family friendly with constant sirens and more homeless people around the area. The hotel is very clean and tidy and has lots to offer.

Our first visit to Hawaii, we wanted to be close to Waikiki beach and this hotel offered just that. Just one block back it was quiet and very convenient to the pick up drop off points for so many of the tours. The hotel might not be the most modern, but the room was a really good size, very clean, bed very comfy, service from all staff was amazing. We loved Waikiki and we loved Waikiki Resort Hotel - we'll definitely be back.

We stayed here for a week in May. Price is fair and location is great. When you are budgeting, you got to look at the resort fee and parking fee if you are renting a car. This is the best one we found for the location. We found this to be the best. The hotel is a little old but it is well kept. The location is close to the beach. You can access shopping and dining easily from this location.We will go back here when we come again.

Just returned from 4 days at The Waikiki Resort Hotel with my husband.I booked direct with the hotel.I asked for a corner delux ocean view room on a high floor and got exactly that.We had room 1618.We werent near the lifts.I think numbers ending in 12-18 are across the front.Because we booked direct we recieved breakfast each morning.It consisted of 2 cereal choices fruits yogurts and your usual bacon eggs sausages french toast and pancakes.Basic but a good start to the day.The service at breakfast was very good.Arriving from Australia at 7am we didnt expect our room to be ready but they stored our bags and said they would call us when it was ready.They called at 2pm which was an hour earlier than the 3pm check in time.Check in from June was quick pleasant and efficient.The internet pictures are correct.The room was quite spacious and very clean.It was always made up each day when we had returned form the beach to a high standard.The king bed and pillows were very comfy.There was a mini kitchen with utensils for 2 and the bathroom had really nice toiletries provided each day.Plenty of storage.The view was what I would consider ocean.The hotel looks between 2 others but it was nice a nice view on the verandah.Obviously the higher the better.I had no problem with noise from neighbours.I didnt use the pool as the beach was so close. A great location 1 street from the beach and a great price.I would rate it 3.5 stars and would recommend it.Thanks for having us.

Stayed on the 18th floor Room 1810 which was quiet and from balcony you got a bit of an ocean view . Room was very clean and always well serviced throughout our 10 night stay. Staff were excellent and helpful . Breakfast buffet was very good restaurant staff just needs to sort out getting waiting customers seated quicker when they get busy . Handy to everything .Very happy with our stay and very good value for money.

From the moment I walked to the open air lobby of the hotel I was greeted by friendly people and faces. The room size was more than adequate and very clean. The views from the patio were amazing break from the day and night. This hotel is in a great location just off the beach and its traffic. Will definitely come back!

The hotel is in a superb location, one street back from the beach. Our room on the 6th floor was good, although the shower was more than a little tired. The room itself was spacious, king size bed, big tv with too many adverts, coffee making facility and already wired to attach mobiles/iPads without having to use an adaptor. Buffet breakfast was ok, on a two for one it was reasonably priced but limited choice. Pool area was good, although it lost the sun late afternoon. Staff were great, apart from the Expedia Rep, who was rude and unhelpful when we were trying to get a refund for a cancelled trip. She was the exception, as previous reps were much more helpful. The resort charge covered unlimited beach towels, wifi and other sundries. Would not hesitate to return, as on the whole, we were made most welcome.

My wife and I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel for our honeymoon and could not have been more pleased. The facility is not the newest in Waikiki but is very nice and clean, great attentive staff, perfect location close to the beach, shopping, Diamond Head. The included breakfast buffet was a huge plus, great variety of quality food and saved us a ton of money. I would highly recommend this hotel, and the next time we go to Hawaii we will stay here again!

Great location. Very good free breakfast. have stayed there 2 trips now, 2017 and 2019. Close to the beach, many great restaurants, Starbucks. McDonald's on the corner. Local bus services for the area. Very helpful people.

Our room was large, room service maids were professional, check in was easy and clear. All staff were pleasant and kept the lobby spotless. Loved the water fountain in the lobby, I filled my drink bottle every morning from it.

Great size room and wonderful view from the balcony. The staff were friendly and provide a worth of knowledge of places to see. The housemaids did a wonderful job in cleaning the room and making the bed and changing the sheets. Will stay there again.

This hotel is situated one block from beach with many stores, cafes and restaurants. The hotel was always clean and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly! Would definitely recommend to friends and family!

We stayed for a week at the Waikiki resort hotel which is steps away from the beach. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. The WiFi was spotty. Our rooms on the 20th floor had very nice views of the Waikiki skyline. The rooms were cleaned every day, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Of special mention are Connor and Dave who answered our numerous questions and helped us whenever needed. Definitely recommend for families who want a clean, comfortable and family friendly stay steps away from the beach.

The locations was great. The beach was right down the street. The breakfast buffet was wonderful- we were given 2 for 1 coupons for the buffet. They provided towels to take to the beach or pool. they provided free DVD rentals.

Great location, one street back from the beach, central to all the shops. Even though the resort was one of the older buildings they have kept it well maintained, all the amenities were clean and the service was great.

A well located property close to beach and transport. Room was clean and functional, the bed was very comfortable. Staff were courteous and no question was too hard to answer. Beach was a 3 minute walk from hotel.

My gf and I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel last week and had a wonderful time. The front desk staff were friendly, and check in was easy. The hotel is located very close to the beach and to the Waikiki strip. However, I would say that more than anything, the cleaning/service staff were amazing. Our room was immaculately kept, and the staff were friendly and helpful to meet any additional service needs. I would strongly recommend staying with Waikiki Resort.

The staff is wonderful and so helpful (Derrick & Dave). I’ve stayed here numerous times in the past years. It is my first choice to stay in Waikiki. Great value. Good breakfast! Location is great! See y’all in the fall.

The room is great! They provided enough beds for all of us. Amenities were replaced. Rooms which is spacious get cleaned everyday. Gave us a portable kettle without additional cost. DVD for rent was free and unlimited. Front desk and employees in the lobby were very kind and helpful. They provided service with a smile! The location is a block away from the beach that has access, it’s near convenient stores, shopping malls and different kinds of restaurants!

Amazing location which is just a skip and hop away from Waikiki Beach and shops. Awesome price. Hotel provides water fountain where you can refill your water bottle which is a huge saving instead of buying bottled water every time, provides beach towels and toiletries smells amazing.But the real gem of this hotel is the staff. Special shout out to front desk supervisor Scott who is super amazing and made our trip extra memorable and wonderful. And front desk Dave as well who helped us with everything and made life easier for us. Mahalo Waikiki Resort. We will definitely come back.

This hotel is in a fantastic location; 1 block from Waikiki Beach. It is within walking distance of all of the beach attractions such as Duke’s statue, surf lessons and Duke’s Canoe Club. We had an ocean view room on the 17th floor. The room was clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly.

Stayed 2 nights - beautiful room with an awesome view. Great location and reasonably priced thru Priceline. The staff were very nice and helpful but the concierge didn’t know much about the trolleys or tours. Would definitely stay there again. Aloha

Just got back last night from staying 5 nights at Waikiki Resort hotel with family of 4 (2 teens). We got to check in early and with a pleasant surprise was upgraded to a corner PentHouse room... SWEETNESS!!! Room had 2 balconies and 1 was a wrap around due to corner room. Bathroom is big, room has mini fridge, microwave, utensils, sink, coffee maker. Living room has pull out couch and tv, other room was big with tv too. Awesome views of mountain and ocean. Perfect location... 1 block from main strip, beach and restaurants/bars and 1 block from Kuhio and bus stops. Great walking distance to many things, even Diamond Head (yes, we walked there). Lobby has a free water filling station. Staff was very friendly. Would stay here again in a heart beat. Highly recommend. Thank you for a great time

We stayed here for 9 nights. We had an amazing time at the hotel, all of the staff we interacted with were so helpful & friendly. The location is so close to everything, food, buses, beach, shopping.The breakfast & the staff in that restaurant were nothing short of amazing as well, nothing here could be faulted. Great variety of food which changed slightly each day.The hotel's interior is dated however we found everything to be perfectly clean & tidy and felt more than comfortable with the rooms & public areas.I had no issues with the WiFi, but did have to log on each day, no bother though.Used the pool twice, both times no issues, perfect to cool off & chill out after shopping.Our room was serviced daily & in a flash. Our room maid was very friendly & always made a time that suited us. (usually while we were at breakfast)I have also thanked the hotel for having the room ready when we arrived, that & the upgrade was just magic. The best place to spend my birthday! After a long flight with no sleep we weren't looking forward to wandering around until we could check in.

I will never again stay at this hotel for how I was treated by the front desk personnel! I expressed multiple times I was having an ‘emergency’ (and quite frankly, it’s non of their business why) and needed to get another key (that I had forgotten to bring with me for the day) and needed to get into my room ASAP. I am not going to go in to all of the details, but I was clearly in distress! Caring humans would have noticed this and have helped me instantly, without making things difficult. They made me feel embarrassed, and I am appalled. Not how one should feel on weeks stay of vacation!

Stayed here for 12 days in May.2019 and loved it. So close to the beach and local restaurants as well as pick up locations for tours. The hotel is a little dated but for the price and location it can't be beat. the WIFI was well below standards and was hard to log it to and it would drop all the time. Breakfast down stairs was great and always stocked. Would stay there again. Only problem we had was having out car blocked in the parkade by an employee. Also loved the beach towels to can get from the hotel to use.

Fresh flowers in rooms were a lovely surprise. Rooms however are very tired with less than efficient air conditioning. Customer service staff was a hit and miss affair. Some fantastic and couldn't do enough for you while others made you feel you were inconveniencing them. Restaurant on site was seldom open. On one occasion when it was the service was poor.

Their website beat Expedia by $100 and Hotels.com by $200, plus they included a full hot breakfast buffet for 4 for the entire stay.Clean room, but the beds are doubles. With 4 adults, they added a portable twin without asking.One block from Waikiki beach and lots of shopping. If renting a car, go for a small one to park under the hotel ($29/night after fees).

I dont think the breakfast was very good. Not enough choice of fruit . Eggs were ordinary and nott enough choice. Cereals were not a good variety. Not supplying milk in the rooms was also not good.The position of the hotel was great. Rooms were nice. Wifi was very hit and miss. We had to log in again when we returned,

Pool was closed for an event so couldn't use 2 days. No ice machines on the floors. Front desk check in was not helpful. Room was nice and clean . Towels in the basement was not conducive for a handicapped person!!

One block back from Main Beach in Waikiki, parking available for small extra charge really worth it, great breakfast. Easy to find, walking distance to shops for anything you might need. Could easily base yourself here and use public transport. Room really quiet. Great stay all around

My mother and I were guests at this resort from May 17 - 20th, and during that weekend we had a dramatizing experience using the elevators. The second elevator did not work properly, it couldn’t go to the 5th floor, which is our floor. So we had to use the 3rd elevator, which stopped working midway so both of us got stuck inside the elevator. We rang the emergency bell but no one came!

We enjoyed our stay at this resort. Our ocean view room was perfect! We had an incident at the airport but as soon as we arrived to check in, we immediately felt so much before after being greeted. We recommend this resort and will book again in the future.

We enjoyed everything about the hotel. My only complaint would be how out-dated everything is. It is like walking back into the late 80's. Even some of the things done at check-in are out dated. the best thing that we like was the breakfast. But over all it was a nice stay.

We had a lovely stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. The staff were fantastic! Each one of them was very helpful and kind, they really wanted you to have a great time on their island. Waikiki beach was only 200 meters from the hotel, which is a plus! My daughter celebrated her 17:th birthday there and the staff came up with cookies and wished her a happy birthday, this meant a lot to all of us. The rooms were very clean and nice. One thing that we really enjoyed was that they had a machine in the lobby, you could fill up your water bottle for free. A great idea, especially for the nature, since you save a lot of plastic doing that. The water was ice cold which was nice on a hot day! We will definitely be back on the island in a couple of years, and the hotel is not a difficult choice, we will of course choose Waikiki Resort Hotel once again. They will help you make your stay on the island unforgettable!

We stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel for eight nights and were very happy. The room (CNR K/suite) was spacious and comfortable, and we had everything we needed. We had views of the beach even though we were back one street, but the location was very convenient and close to anything we needed. All restaurants and any shopping was a short walk through Waikiki.Our bed was comfortable and the bathroom was a good size, even though it contained a shower/bath.We found the service at the hotel was excellent and all staff were great at each contact. Check in was later than normal (3pm) so we had to wait, but this was known before we arrived, so it wasn't a surprise. Check out was very quick and easy. Would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Hotel was nice; breakfast was great. Location is close to everything. Check-out was not the best. Young man that checked me out was condescending. I explained how my and my friends card should be charged for the rooms since I had originally reserved all the rooms, but didn't want it all to go on my card. He assured me he understood (in a sarcastic/condescending tone). Obviously he didn't.....A few days later, I see that all the charges went to my card! Not an issue that my friend and I can't work out....but his customer service needs a check!

I really loved staying in this hotel. The beds and pillows are really comfortable and all the staff is super friendly and accomodating. We loved their korean restaurant and enjoyed our ocean view. We were lucky to stay in the 17th floor and had a wonderful view of all the ocean area and surrounding mountain. I really recommend this hotel since it is close to everything and in front of Oahu´s most important beach (Waikiki). If we ever return to Hawaii, we would for sure book here again

This hotel is located one minute walk to the main beach shops & restaurant strip. Hotel rooms very very clean & spacious & contained safe coffee making facilities fridge etc. All rooms have a balcony. We booked directly thru hotel which was cheaper than websites I looked at and included breakfast. The staff were extremely helpful (Nancy at reception is a gem) and there is a nice pool (we didn’t use) & Korean restaurant in house. A self use laundry in the basement was also very convenient. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Pros: *Front desk staff lovely *Provided connecting room on request *Nice buffet breakfast *Plenty of (paid) parking - even through rates were pricey they would be one of the cheapest parking lots in Waikiki Cons: *Had prescription pain medication vanish from our room on the second last day. Had to chase up with hotel staff myself during these 2 days only to be emailed a conclusion after our return home of "not located". No sorry, no nothing. Really not good enough. *Wi-Fi was terrible - slow and always dropped out and that was if we could even get connected (could get connection in one room and none at all in the 2nd room). *I have no issue paying a resort fee but for the first 2 days of our stay the pool was closed due to a private function - which we were only made aware of when we checked in. After a long flight and hot weather all my kids wanted to do was have a swim in the pool' *3rd day another function so no parking between 5-9pm (another extra i had paid for) With small children we were home from exploring each afternoon to enjoy dinner in Waikiki. Really was a sad ending to what was a great holiday

friendly staffs and very helpful, very well located near to Waikiki beach and few activities, the rooms are very good however it is very noisy, it starts around 4/5 am so not very good for long sleep but overall it was a good stay.

My fiance and I got married in Hawaii and stayed at this resort for 7 days. We had another couple who stayed here with us as well. We enjoyed it, very clean and very nice staff. I did have a friend, whom stayed in another hotel in Waikiki, that needed in our room while we were gone. She told the front desk her card wasn't working. Without checking to see who they were or asking for an ID the front desk worker gave them a new card. Luckily they were trusted friends of ours but what if they weren't and they just got a key to our room without being identified?

My bf and I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel, however that’s not what we want to brag on. What we want to brag on is our concierge! We came to Hawaii with a couple ideas in mind of what we wanted to do, however after going to the concierge to ask a question about a car rental we ended up getting a car and a full schedule that included what we wanted and more! Our concierges name was Gaby, she travels around to multiple hotels but if you see her, GO TO HER! She’s so helpful and after talking to her, you’ll be surprised to find out she wasn’t born here because her knowledge of the island. She made our lives and trip just that much better! Very thankful for her!

This hotel was in a great location only 1 block from the beach and an easy walk to the centre of town. We had a corner suite which had plenty of room for the 4 of us 2 Adults and 2 kids. The bathroom was private with a walk through storage/wardrobe area which included the vanity, which was great for getting ready in a hurry when 4 of you need to use the bathroom.

almost perfect，except a little noisy outside. I think Hawaii is a ideal place to live, especially for children. They feel very very happy there. Waikiki is beautiful, friendly and lively. I feel free, relax, and comfortable. Hope visit again!

We enjoyed our one night stay at Waikiki resort hotel. We arrived before check in time but were able to store our bags and were given a key that gave us access to the bathrooms and the pool. The staff were really friendly and helpful at check in. Our room was a good size with a partial view of Waikiki beach.

Hotel is at a great location. Very close to beach ,stores & restaurants. Many tour buses stop for pick up close to hotel so it's only a short walk away. Beds were comfortable, rooms were very clean. Shower was small but does the trick. All & all, it was a pleasant stay & would stay again. Hopefully this coming Oct.

Overall the size of the room was not bad. The only thing that was poor was the wash basin in the bathroom was very small that you could not wash your face or shave in it. Although we were happy of the location where the hotel was situated.

Very nice stay! Hotel was only steps from the beach and everything you need within walking distance. Due to a miscalculation we arrived a day earlier than our reservation. The front desk went over and above to find us a room.

Came for a personal vacation booked through orbitz was a good stay, the staff was excellent, the breakfast vouchers need some work like if a family comes in give them the buy one get one. If solo give them a better voucher and check out time is too early, personally should be correlated to pick up time of shuttle to airport that way guests aren’t hanging out in the lobby until who knows when, check in times should go the same route as check out that way clean staff has time to clean room etc.

The room we had had a beautiful view of Wakiki beach. We had breakfast included in our package and it was very good also. The room was clean and service was great. The only complaint we had was the sliding door did not block the noise from the street and buses constantly stopped on the street below us and backed up with the beeping sound early in the mornings. We put on our fan in the bathroom to help block out some of the noise. Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly

Great Hotel... near the beach.. clean and well maintained. very friendly staff!!! Will be back in September, 2019. Buffet breakfast was great as well. Definitely will refer this hotel to other friends and family.

Wonderful stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. The room was perfect for our needs. My only complaint about the room was that the bathroom was a little on the small side with no shelves/storage. Location was very convenient for the beach. Staff were always helpful and friendly. Will definitely stay again.

2 blocks from the beach, ocean view as promissed. Lots fo great restaurants close by. Breakfast had a nice selection but was a little too busy some mornings and had to wait in line for a seat. Shuttle from the airport had a little difficulty to find it using Google maps. Noisy from street traffic, trash truck at 5:30 am and ambulances...but we were told they are renovating and changing the windows.

Perfect location, clean hotel and very friendly staff! Will defiantly stay again. Pool is terrible , but Waikiki beach is 1 block away! Hotel offers free WiFi and movie rental as well as breakfast in the lobby every morning. Thanks for a lovely stay!

Resort was well kept, clean, and staff was incredibly friendly. Location is perfect, 2-3 minutes walk from beautiful beach and various restaurants and convenience stores. The only down side was the amount of traffic noise on Koa Ave. in the early am hours (2-5am).

This is definitely not a 3 1/2 star hotel. It is overpriced, drab, tired and in urgent need of an upgrade.We stayed here for 5 nights. The first night we didn’t get a wink of sleep due to the noise not just within the hotel, but outside as well. We booked an ocean view room which you could only just see. After not sleeping for the night, we approached reception to ask for a quieter room and were supposedly ‘upgraded’. This meant a higher floor. It was a little quieter, and better views but still very drab, and the same layout and decor as our previous room. Again disturbed sleep due to loud music playing all night long, other noise and inconsiderate guests. The only redeeming factor is that it is close too the beach.

The wifi sucks here, didn’t clean our room either. It was supposed to be a fun family vacation, but this hotel ruined it. My family was so stressed because of many reasons. I’ve travelled a lot, and this place was the worst hotel I’ve ever been to.

We love staying at the Waikiki Resort! Everyone is so pleasant and courteous. It’s hard to leave when we’re having so much fun. We always wish we could stay longer! Mahalo and Aloha! A Hui hou! The Caberto family

One block walk to beach, easy walk to shops, driveway perfect for pickup and dropoff. Corner deluxe room with sink, microwave, crockery and cutlery for 2 people allows takeaway meals-salads from ABC shop, pizza from food truck. Breakfast cafe is good quality food and run very efficiently. Try for a deal that includes breakfast.

The wife and I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights in April 2019.We knew the location was very good and found it to be the best thing about the hotel.The front desk staff are not that helpful, and not all, but some of the newer trainee people, one in particular had an attitude.We asked about the breakfast at the hotel, and were given 2 for one vouchers. We inquired how much it would cost to get the breakfast for free without using the vouchers. We were willing to pay extra. They didn't understand what we were requesting. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and helpful.The front desk people could learn a thing or two from them.The room was a standard room with a view of the back alley. The room itself was okay and the television was a nice size with good channel selection and free dvds.We though of trying to switch rooms because of the view and noise from the back road we looked out on, but decided not to since the staff were not that helpful to begin with.Again, the location is great, the room okay, but other areas leave much to be desired.

Nice clean room with such accommodating staff. Fantastic location. Breakfast was great with a large variety. Pool was very nice although the water was a little cool. Would certainly recommend to anyone

Stayed one night, over nighting from disembarking from cruise ship to flight to New York. We dropped our bags at 8am due to check-in being at 3pm. We returned to the Hotel at 1pm but our rooms were not ready, and the staff did what they could to get our rooms ready by 2pm which was appreciated. Staff friendly and every question answered. Room was cosy and well presented. Being Australians we prefer fresh milk rather then powdered milk so went downtown for coffee and teas rather then using facilities in room. Great location, beach is less the 2 mins walk. The hotel pool is cosy, lots of rules! But great for a quick dip. Great having laundry on site for washing holiday clothing and very easy to get taxi or Uber from hotel. Would stay again.

Very friendly and efficient staff at check in and was able to check in early. Housekeeping staff responded immediately with extra coffee etc. Only there for 1 night but would return and recommend to other travellers.

Good location , short walk to the beach. We had a great view of the beach and a lovely room.We had breakfast at the cafe on site had a very good selection of hot & cold foods. Would have a coffee there after we had a day out exploring. Shuttle bus picked you up outside to go to Factory outlets. Staff were all helpful.

Nancy on the front desk was more than helpful at our recent stay. We had a beautiful big room with view of Waikiki beach and only a short stroll to the water. Highly recommend.Would definitely stay again. Perfect location

The food was great the place was clean And the main guy at the Buffett was very nice n hard working.always on his toes his name was Park. Would definitely come back for the great variety of food n just to see park again. Thank you ParkAnthony n Erma from Fresno california

Great location right in front of Waikiki Beach! So easy to walk around to all the popular places in Waikiki. Staff was very helpful and hospitable. Good size rooms. Would like to note that the water didn't go down the drain too well, but not terrible. Internet is supposedly fast speed, but is not. They kind of make up for it a bit with having free DVD rentals in the lobby with current movies. The free breakfast is very good--fried rice, salad, spam/sausage, tater tots, fruits, juice, coffee!

Great room: very spacious with good amenities. Great view from the balcony.Convenient location: close to beach, shops and restaurants.Friendly staff, great value for money. Check in and check out was efficient. Would highly recommend!

From the staff at guest services, to the maintenance team to the lovely bell man, we were always treated fairly and with respect. The hotel itself was very clean with an awesome location. We loved our view of the ocean!

The hotel is nice, staff was nice. It is just so big and so many people everywhere that it is not relaxing. The room, condo was very nice and had everything we needed. We asked for a ocean view or partial and was told it was a partial view. But it overlooked the street and you basically had to go to the end of patio and look over buildings to see the ocan.

This hotel had everything we needed for a 3-night stop in Honolulu. Good rooms with enough space to move in. A bathroom with separate space for mirror and sink. Our 10th floor room could see the ocean between neighboring buildings so we could sip our in-room coffee out on the balcony while watching the early morning surfers catch their waves. They had a nice towel service for beach use. It is convenient to the Kuhio beach area and free hula show.

Great location, close to beach, shops, buses and restaurants. Very friendly staff. Clean, comfortable rooms. This may not be the flashiest or biggest hotel in Waikiki, and may seem a little outdated, but has everything you need for a great stay. Would definitely recommend and will be staying again if we come back...which we hope to do.

This hotel is right on the beach front, close to shops, quiet, the grounds are very well maintained with a great pool. Staff helpful with tour bookings, reception on arrival very friendly and helpful.

I loved staying here! The staff were so friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean and quiet. The balcony to our room looked at the ocean. I checked several sites and couldn’t find a better value on a hotel anywhere. I will definitely stay here again!

Was a great location. So easy to walk toeverything! Beach is one block! Everyoneon the staff was so friendly and helpful. Localtransportation of trolley/bus was just down the block as well. Having the cafe in the lobby areafor a wonderful breakfast each day was fabulous!

Enjoyed our stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel. It was reccomended by our friends Ashley amd Glenys Bahnisch. They stayed here on their visit to Honoluli.it is handy to the beach, shopping and public transport. Housekeeping was good and room satisfactory. We enjoyed the included brelakfast and also enjoyed our meal in your restaurant. Is

Rooms were clean and room service was great. Convenient location, decent views in the ocean view room. The cons of this place were that it was very loud outside early mornings, small bathtub, no jacuzzi

The hotel lobby was beautiful, the room was dated but very clean and the staff was friendly. The hotel was about a block from the beach and walking distance from the zoo, aquarium and international market place. Plenty of places to eat and shop in walking distance of the hotel as well.

My third stay here so that speaks for itself. One block from beach and close to shopping, restaurants and all the excitement. Everything was very good from the food to the friendly, helpful staff. Will come again.

We had great experience staying in this hotel. All staffs are friendly and kind. Breakfast include was really nice and make our trip easier with 2 toddlers. Food was fresh and tasty. Only one things need to be improve this place is WiFi connection.We are not happy about this service. We will come back when we have chance to go back to Waikiki. In last, hotel location was really good and very convenient.

My husband & I stayed at the Waikiki resort hotel over the last week. The location is amazing! You’re within walking distance to literally everything, the beach, shopping, restaurants, tour pick ups, and public transportation. We did not rent a vehicle as it was not needed with this location! The room itself was great! Our room was quite a bit bigger than we were expecting. It had a nice lanai, the room was very clean and the maid service was fantastic. The hotel staff is very friendly and kind. They have free DVD rentals, which is nice after a busy day out in the sun. They also have a water bottle filling station in the lobby which we found was very handy to have especially on hot days. It is really nice to have beach towels & they were always available. We will absolutely be returning to this hotel in the future!

This was our second time staying at this hotel. The rooms are clean and nicely furnished, the staff are lovely, and the breakfast buffet is fantastic. We really love the location of the hotel as it is pretty much in the center of Waikiki. We also love the feel of the hotel.. like old time Hawai’i. We will definitely stay again.

I returned from a recent stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel with my two children. This hotel is very family friendly and the staff are wonderful. The room we had was simply furnished but had everything that we needed for a relaxing holiday. Although it is not situated on the beach, it is only one street back and a quick walk to the safe lagoon area of Waikiki Beach. I would highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again. They have a water filter machine in the lobby where you can fill your water bottles for free every day which is very convenient. There are a couple of shops in the lobby also. It is steps away from everything you need, a quick walk to the Zoo and the sunsets can be seen every evening if you are on a higher ocean view floor.

Ive been 20 times to Waikiki and first time at this hotel .Should have gone earlier as it was very good as we love this little area , its away from the busy area but still has enough around including beach, transport , restaurants and stores.

This was our first trip to Hawaii. The hotel was a 5 minute walk to restaurants and food trucks. We were one block from the beach. Our room faced the ocean. Breakfast buffet was very good. Lots of selection. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We only stayed 2 days but we packed in lots. Also thanks to the hotel staff for the cute gift and card. So thoughtful! We would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone coming to Waikiki beach!

Good budget hotel for the location. Check in was quick and easy- however I had called and requested a crib and “quieter” room a few days before. I also confirmed my requests during check in. Neither of my requests were made. We were right next to the elevator and could hear people coming and going through out the night. Regarding the crib, I at first thought maybe they were all out, but I saw a bunch in their storage area so I think they just forgot. Room also did not have a tub, we made do and bathed our son sitting up in the handicap chair. Room was adequate and clean- 2 full size beds, flat screen tv, fridge, safe. Fridge settings did not work, we couldn’t make it colder. Big patio that faced Alohilani hotel and their beautiful infinity pool. Hotel is surrounded by other high rise hotels so I don’t imagine you’ll get much of a view unless you’re at the very top. My biggest gripe about the room- no fan in bathroom, I could see mold growing in various places. There is also a large vent right above you, that I couldn’t help but stare at every time I brushed my teeth, hoping no bugs would come out of it. AC worked fine for us, kept our room cool. Didn’t check out their restaurants but they give you discount coupons for them. Parking was easy. $28 + tax daily. There are 2 lots- one indoor, one outdoor. I can’t recall the exact amount of the resort fee- maybe $21+ tax? Both parking and resort fees combined for a 6 night stay cost us an additional $300. My advice- look into renting a condo if you’re renting a car. Or skip the car rental and just get it for a few days during your stay. You don’t need a car in Waikiki but we like to drive around the island. Location was great and the only reason I’d come back here again, if the price was right. It was less than 5 min walk to the beach, which was perfect for our 14 month old. Walk a short distance to the right and the waves were perfect for our 11 year old. Plenty of food and shopping nearby. The employees we did encounter were all nice, front desk staff were friendly. When I called about our tub and room situation, they informed me they had no available rooms but I could call back in the morning to see what would be available. It was just too much of a hassle however so we just made do with the room we had.

location was good the resort provided us with what we needed, amenities were made easily avaiable for what we needed. the resort was close to the beach, the staff were very friendly and helpful in fixing anything that we needed

Great location, very friendly and helpful staff. We were on a family vacation and needed one more night to stay somewhere so I picked this place. The staff let us use washrooms etc. While we waited for our room and called as soon as it was ready(early). Very impressed.

Great location, very close to the beach (1min walk), close to McDonalds and the many ABS stores in Waikiki.The staff were friendly.The rooms were fine for the price, the rooms are a bit old and tired, could do with a make over.

We had a pleasant stay at the Waikiki Resort. We are returning customers. Family enjoyed the breakfast buffet. Staff was wonderful. Kids loved the movie rentals. Glad you have a water dispenser now. Many perks!! Thank you for another pleasant stay.

This was a great hotel. The location to the beach, bus and shops was fantastic. Dave on the front desk was a great ambassador for the hotel. The view from our corner suit of the beach was lovely. Breakfast was good for buy one get one free.

Great location central to beach and shops. Accommodation was clean and comfortable and staff very pleasant. Although the decor may be slightly dated the property has that traditional Hawaiian feel about it. Would recommend.

First I would like to note that my first day in Hawaii was rough. Traffic, rental car check engine light came on, my husband getting sick, but I do want to say that amongst checking in; Branden was so amazing and helpful! He definitely turned my frown upside down. He was completely helpful in all ways. Gave us great information to make our stay here at the Waikiki resort hotel much more enjoyable. The hotel was beautiful, clean, close to the beach, shops, and short walking distances to everything! We didn’t even need a rental. Thank you waikiki for having us, and a special thanks to Branden for being a wonderful host! If we return to visit again, I totally recommend booking here! You won’t regret it. It’s such a lovely place, it work out so well with my husband not feeling well. DVD rentals were complimentary, down stairs was a lobby to purchase drinks, medicines & all sorts of goodies. Even a little boutique for us ladies to splurge on a cute bathing suit!

I loved the staff they were very informative of all my questions and needs, I really love the vouchers for the breakfast buffet everyday, the pool was great, didn't have a good view from my room but that's not a deal breaker, the wifi gave me issues and wasn't able to stay connected I really wish that would've worked better, but I loved my trip regardless.

1st off this was my first time staying at the Waikiki resort hotel In Waikiki. I would highly recommend staying here to anyone looking for a hotel in Waikiki. The service at the front desk was wonderful and everyone was friendly even the guy who checked us in at 11:30 PM. My first morning we were able to speak to June at the front desk and she helped us with all our plans for the week and any questions we had about our room such a joy to talk too! The room was very clean and had everything we needed we did not have a view of the ocean but we had a beautiful Mountain View but in all honesty we were not here for the room we were here for the location and the great price point. I’m looking forward to staying at this hotel again soon!

Great place great location great customer service... super close to all kinds of food. Easy access to anything you want to do. Seconds walk from Waikiki. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Beds were super comfy.

Staff are friendly and rooms are clean and comfortable. A bit of noise early in the mornings with garabage trucks picking up in Koa Ave. The building is old and the sliding doors do not slide easily and tend to rattle in strong wind. All in all, a great location and affordable.

The WiFi was next to useless and the Aircon was very noisy at times. Otherwise very convenient and comfortable. We had the less expensive 'town view' room but could still look out at the beach thru between other high rise hotels.Good value for money. Will recommend to friends and family.

Beautiful entry, very professional staff, great location, food at restaurant was very good, shower needs to be upgraded it’s showing it’s age. Rug has worn through its life span and should have been replaced a year ago! Over all I would recommend and stay at this hotel again definitely. Parking is lacking effort need to work on that . It was definitely the worst part of the visit.

The staff went out of their way to make our stay perfect! Front desk and housekeeping are amazing. The breakfast (included in our rate) was yummy. Would recommend to those who plan to explore the city. Close to shopping, the beach and excursion pick up locations.

This hotel is one block off the beach with great restaurants and all the action of Waikiki.The front desk staff are excellent. June, Brandon and especially Dave are very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. A well oiled machine for sure.We had a partial ocean view so we could watch the surfers right out front from our bed and deck.I would definitely stay here again.

A stones throw to the beach, and a stones throw to the bus stop, Comfy beds large 60 inch tv with lots of channels and great toiletries Our room was facing the infinity pool and hot tub across the street so we hopped over to check it out nice. They have a purified water dispenser in the lobby and a bell desk to leave your bags if you have a late check out Breakfast was good at the Lima cafe only gripe is the resort fee they gave us a list of things included and apart from newspaper they were all things that should be included with the room anyways no newspaper in sight.There is a surf board rental right next to the hotel less than half the price of the beach. We had a great time and would go back in an instant.

We had a lovely time at your hotel. Staff was friendly, restaurant was nice, everything was clean. The location was excellent. Parking sometimes was an issue and the parking rate was ridiculous, especially for what you got.

Love this hotel! Staff are incredibly friendly! Great location close to the beach and the Main Street. The hotel had a great vibe! WiFi works great in the lobby but not good in the rooms but apparently this is going to be upgraded soon. Staff are so incredibly nice! Every single staff member went well-beyond expectations to make sure we had a great trip! From the lobby staff, to maintenance and cleaning staff! I like that it’s a smaller hotel so staff get to know you and greet you when they see you. This hotel does the little things right- like the water filtration station. If I could change one thing- I would heat the pool- but most of the summer that probably isn’t necessary.

Dee, Branden, Leo, and the Full Time concierge Ava are absolutely excellent employees. They got to know me then suggested places that I would want to go. Park, Edna, and Moon great No Full Length Mirror

We have stayed here many times as have members of our family and friends ( at our recommendation) we love the location and the reasonable rates, the rooms are large, clean and the corner rooms are great with the small kitchen We would like to make a special compliment to Sherrie Smith in reservations who always looks after us and is wonderful to deal with, she is one of the main reasons we keep coming back. Don’t ever let her leave

We found this hotel to be very well located only one street back from the beach. For its location it is well priced compared to other hotels so we expected to have to compromise. The welcome by the bell person was nice and the check in at reception by the male trainee was very warm and welcoming. The letter from the GM in the room was also a nice touch. The room was nice and the partial ocean view was good, albeit the bathroom could do with an update. Our only criticism was the buffet breakfast and the breakfast staff. Seeing as we had a voucher 2 for 1 costing $15.95 I don't suppose we can complain about the breakfast but it is very basic. More disappointing though was the surly attitude of the breakfast wait staff.

The hotel was fantastically situated, with the beach about 2 minutes walk away. Rooms are a bit dated but functional, clean and in good condition. Staff were helpful and friendly. Free DVD rentals was great for a night in. Pool is quite small but the photos show that so it wasn’t a surprise. Wifi in the rooms can be a bit bit and miss but otherwise is great in the lobby.

We have stayed with you for many years running. We love the location. The hotel is a great compromise between price and prime Waikiki location. We also like the non-smoking cleanliness. Staff is very efficient and helpful. The downside is, rates and fees continue to go up and at some point you will price yourself out of our price range. I would only suggest you improve your registration process. It’s always a challenge getting a simple e-mail reservation confirmation. Sleep is also a challenge because Waikiki is just very noisy. Not your fault.

Steps away from Kalakaua Ave and Kuhio Beach is this comfortable, clean and welcoming hidden gem. Great location, close to everything in Waikiki, and because it's a block off the main drag it's nice and quiet.

Three night stay in March 2019 was a great way to end our 2 weeks in Hawaii. The staff at the front desk (sorry, I don't remember their names) were extremely helpful each time we needed them. The location ( a block from the beach) couldn't be beat, and the free (included) breakfast buffet was all fresh and well prepared. We will certainly stay there again on our next Oahu trip. Parking was expensive, but it is Waikiki!

I was not pleased at all with the hotel. 1. Only two large towels in the bathrooms. Most hotels have four.Only one ice machine located on the second floor.Pool was very cold. Paid for parking for two nights and the first night was a fiasco trying to get a spot.

Stayed 12 nights, location to everything was fantastic-literally 30 seconds from the beach!! Very impressed with Moon from ILIMA restaurant-great service & professional manner! Me and my three sisters throughly enjoyed our stay!

Hotel has a nice entrance and lobby area but the rooms and hallway to our room are old and maybe should look into updating. The staff were friendly enough and helpful. The maccas that was 2min walk was a lifesaver for the kids. It was our first time staying in Waikiki and I guess if you like the hustle and bustle then Waikiki is for you. The beach is just across the rd from maccas so that was convenient as well. So location wise this hotel trumps it especially with the good cheap rates we paid. Has washing machines and dryers in the basement carpark

Many thanks to Connor and Branden who helped with a important issue that a fax for business had to be sent helped us so much very appreciated , we liked the loction also very much not far from beach and shops

We were pleased with our stay here. It was very clean and the rooms were always looked after each day. It is only a short block to the main beaches of Waikiki or another block to the Bus on Kuhio. While the traffic noise in the morning woke us a few times it is to be expected in the downtown hotels anywhere. The staff were friendly and quick to accommodate our needs especially when our flight left just before midnight. Would stay here again.

Great location in the central Waikiki but it won't necessarily break a bank to stay there. We had a double-bed room at 14th floor. The room is clean and the size is fine for my family (2 adults, 2 kids). It's nice to have a balcony with partial mountain view. The only thing to complain is lacking of mirrors in the room. There's only one mirror over the bathroom vanity. It would be great if they have a dressing mirror because women need that. We didn't try their restaurant because there're plenty of good, local eateries down there. Btw, they charge $28 for overnight parking.

Excellent location and service! Better of what was expected. Beds was so comfortable and cleaning was also really good. Was so close to Waikiki Beach and stores I would come again with no doubt. Thank you so much!

Super cool place going to stay there again next time better than the Hilton for sure !!! The fact that it was literally one block from the beach beat any deal around. They have a breakfast buffet on site that is super good and the people were really polite . The people who worked at Waikiki resort really friendly and super accommodating.... I did lotta reviews and we got in one day early and stayed at the Hilton and I’m telling you for the money you spend for one Hilton room you can get a two bedroom suite !!!! I can’t think of any place else I would’ve stayed!!! We were pleasantly surprised.....I would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Excellent location, great staff and a great buffet breakfast. Our only complaint was the noise from the street. We had a 7th floor city view room. You could hear the garbage truck for 2 hours before daylight each day. Did not make for a restful experience

We had an excellent stay at the hotel. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The room had perfect view of the ocean on the 16th floor. The beach was just a minute walk from the door. Really the only complaint we had was the Wi-Fi. It was very spotty.

Very pleased with Hotel. Staff very pleasant and very quick to tackle any small issues. The staff are also very helpful in planning various excursions. For the price we highly recommend this Hotel. We will not stay anywhere else.

Loved the location,very short walk to Waikiki beach and city centre and good breakfast at the Illia cafe in lobby .bed was very uncomfortable.mattress had sunk on the side and caused bad back pain after a few nights.time to upgrade them i think

Location of hotel was excellent! Close to beach, restaurants and shops. Parking was convenient.Staff were very friendly and hotel was very clean. Only downside was the garbage trucks that were in the parking lot every morning at 6:30am.

From the start of our stay we were made to feel welcomed , we were checked in by Conner, and our bags were taken to the room by Leo. There was gift for my husband and I for our anniversary.The room was nice and clean, but small, but the ocean view I requested and paid for , was more of a partial ocean view. The door to the cabinet that held the compact fridge inside was broken off one of the hinges,no microwave wish I had one, and the tub was tiny. This hotel is located a half of a block from Waikiki Beach. We did have a small walk out balcony , which I loved. There was parking available by the hotel for an additional fee, not to pricey considering it is Hawaii. We later needed an extra blanket, and that was immediately brought to by housekeeping.The staff was so accommodating Also around the block is a McDonald's and many other restaurants , and shops . We were in walking distance of the Honolulu Zoo, Waikiki Aquarium , and Denny's restaurant., which was a plus. The many pros , outweighed the few cons, I would recommend this hotel to anyone , and I will stay here again ,

AlohaJust got home 03/08/2019 from another fantastic stay at the WAIKIKI RESORT HOTEL in Hawaii.This will be the 10-14th years in a row (Maui one year) that we have stayed at this wonderful hotel. Still my wife and mine favorite hotel in Paradise. My wife actually stayed here back in early 70s when it was a year old.Clean,friendly staff right from Sherry in reservations,Nancy at front desk and my good friend Dennis the bell captain. One block from the Waikiki beach, literally only 3 minute walk. All the amenities that you require, restaurants, shopping,pubs,medical emergency, transportation that you could possibly want.Very good value for your money,grest views as we stay on the higher floors.Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.ALOHA and MAHALO.TOMMY J.

Wonderful room, great location, great service and great view. Enjoyed stay. The hotel was located half block from beach, lots of restaurants and shopping around the area. Would stay here again and would recommend to friends.

Our family have spent the Christmas holiday season in Hawaii 3 times in the past 5 years. This was our first time staying at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. We were happily surprised when we arrived. There was a nice open air feeling to the hotel entry and lobby. The greeting staff were very helpful. We had booked a suite for this 6 day stay. It was very roomy and nicely decorated. The living room and bedroom each had balconies with views of Waikiki Beach. Two of the best things about the hotel are the housekeeping staff and the generous yet economical breakfast buffet off the hotel lobby. While eating, we could see beach goers at Waikiki Beach. Slightly disappointing was the pool area, which could use some attention. The parking garage is relatively small for a hotel of it's size. Overall, it's a great value for the money.

My husband and I stayed over the holiday season. The location was perfect, it takes just 2 minutes to walk to the beach! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was excellent and they change the menu everyday. Plus they will make you a special order omelet at no extra charge. It is within walking distance of everything. This is an affordable bit of paradise! We won't hesitate to return to Waikiki Resort.

Waikiki resort is the place to be if you are a young couple looking to save a buck but still stay somewhere nice, central and affordable. The hotel was very central on Waikiki beach within walking distance to everything! Weather you want to shop? Laze by the beach or walk off the breakfast buffet to the nearby diamond head it’s all there a short stroll away.The hotel package we go included a buffet breakfast which was quite extensive in what it provided and was also nice! The hotel also provided a movie rental station with a vast range of new and classic movies.Hotel staff were very helpful, upon request they were more than happy to help us with our room confusion of having two double beds instead of a king. The front desk were quick to swap our rooms and make amends to our problem.

The good: The location of this hotel could not have been better for us. We were a block off of Waikiki beach. They have an in hotel restaurant that serves buffet breakfast which was WONDERFUL. The pineapple was the BEST I had ever tasted. They had eggs, bacon, and all of the trimmings. It was one of the best breakfast buffets I have ever had. I had paid for a partial ocean view with 2 beds as I was traveling with my brother. We were late in arriving to the hotel due to delayed flights, and they did not have our room. They offered to upgrade us to a full ocean view. The room we received had a wooden took pick (not ours) and other dirt in the floor so the cleaning is not the best. The balcony was nice, There were 2 chairs on it and not room for much else but it was a balcony. The beds were adequate and the linens were clean. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Overall this was worth the money for the location and the breakfast.

I stayed with a girlfriend for 10 nights in February. The view was amazing as was the sunset from our balcony. We had breakfast included although I didn’t enjoy the food on offer. I feel it was directed more at the Asian guests & also one of the male staff was quite unfriendly to the point of being “rude”. The housekeeping staff are excellent as was “June” on reception. The guests in the room next door were smoking marijuana on their balcony & we needed to close our door to not smell the odour. I did complain to reception, although nothing was done to rectify the situation unfortunately. Apart from these issues we did have an enjoyable stay.

Very comfortable room, with a partial ocean view and a ""look around the corner" view of Diamond Head. Much noise came in the evenings from the nightclub at a neighboring hotel and quite a bit of noise early in the mornings came from trucks in the street unloading things at the hotel's facility across the street.

The hotel is close to the beach and all the shops, markets, and restaurants everything is within walking distance. The entrance foyer is very nice and inviting. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms are a little small and dated but are very clean and comfortable. The only negative was no microwave. The Hotel restaurant had great food and a decent breakfast deal. The hotel store was reasonable for a hotel store. We felt secure comfortable and had a great time here.
1.Wi-fi often does not connect to the Internet, 2.The elevator did not arrive at the parking lot3.Swimming pool without warm water4.No drinking water in the room.5.Bath products, no soap available.

Great location-close to everything and less than a block to Waikiki Beach. Walking distance to mall and restaurants. Room had a great view of the ocean. Loved relaxing on balcony watching the sunset. We would definitely stay there again.

What an amazing hotel to stay at. From the minute you walk in the foyer the staff are so welcoming. Dave, Brandon, Connor or Dee are always waiting to assist you with any questions or tips. Also Leo & Trent were always waiting to assist you with your luggage or transport

We arrived very late due to a 6 hr delay of our flight, but staff was very friendly and helpful at 4 am! The facilities are good, although the rooms are a little bit outdated, but still very clean and comfortable. It is only a very short stroll to Waikiki Beach, and our room had a partial ocean view which was great.

The hotel needs to update each room to make them accommodating for their quest. I found the room had a musty odor and the shower was so small my husband and I tried using the bathroom space at the same time to get dressed and it was incredibly cramped. We asked for a later check out time just an hour the desk clerk said yes. On the day of checkout we housekeeping and bellhop came to our room and we had two calls from the front desk it was so unnecessary just fior 1 hour.

Stayed here as a couple. We LOVE this hotel. It's not the newest hotel but that's normal for the area and the place is spotless. It's in a great location, super close to the beach and Duke statue in the centre of Waikiki (and you can catch the $2 tourist trolley bus from there). Walking distance to everything and super good value for what we paid, we stayed at another big-name hotel in Waikiki at the start of our trip - it was more expensive and not as good as this one! Perfect for our needs. We'd hired a car - there's a big carpark next door where you pay at reception and we could see the car from our balcony. There's a convenience store just next to the lobby that sells LOTS - alcohol, souvenirs, food, medicine... and it's run by the nicest lady. All the staff from start to finish were superb and helpful, laundry facilities were good (there's a laundry downstairs). We would 100% stay here again. Fabulous hotel, super clean and very well run. 5 stars easy.

Very nice hotel, very good location between beach and tourist attractions. Very friendly and helpful staff. I had some belongings stolen from me on the beach and Connor at the front desk was extreamly helpful in assisting me in contacting the police and making the rest of my holiday enjoyable. He also suggested a number of great and affordable restaurants around Waikiki. Thank you so much.

This hotel is conveniently located about half a block from Waikiki beach. Many restaurants, convenience stores and bars near by. The room was not how it was presented when we booked online. The furnishing were too large for such a small space. I was extremely disappointed by the literal, baby tub, sized shower. Decor was out dated. The pool space was dull and uninviting. I would stay again having the expectation that this is an affordable motel type stay.

Overall the stay was good. Rooms were clean. For the price I paid I Was a bit disappointed with the amenities at this hotel. Pool needs work. Area is bland and uninviting. WiFi in the rooms was hit and miss. We had a 4 share room and often cleaners would only leave 2 towels. In high wind the sliding door to the balcony would rattle creating a lot of noise. I had to jam pieces of paper between the door and the jam to stop this from rattling and keeping us awake all night. On the plus side, hotel was clean and service from staff at front desk was very good. Location was excellent.

Very nice hotel. Clean and neat. It is convenient, very close to Waikiki beach and shopping centers. Front desk staff was very polite and helpful. One can reach to different areas by public bus only a block away. On the other hand, hotel charges $28/day for parking with unlimited in and out. My family stayed 4 nights with very pleasant time.

I have stayed for 6 nights in Waikiki Resort Hotel with my wife, son & daughter. The room size is a little small but hotel location is execellent. I have spent a happy time with my family. My 1st stay in Waikiki Resort Hotel was 24 years ago as a honeymoon tour.

We stayed here for 2 nights before heading to the North Shore. This hotel was a good surprise. We booked as the rates were lower than many other hotels in the area, but the hotel was very clean and comfortable.Our room was large, had comfortable beds, had a fridge and microwave, and a great location. We were only half a block to the beach, and also had a lot of restaurants and shops nearby, being right in the middle of Waikiki. The staff was all very nice, and responded right away to all our questions and one request we had. We would definitely not hesitate to return next time!

Travelled to Honolulu as two family groups comprising 3 adults and two children. We stayed five nights and were given rooms on the same floor which was most welcomed. The rooms were very clean and the beds provided good sleep. The receptionist was excellent when checking us in. Now the highlight has to be the location, 40 odd metres to the main beach and ready access to all the shopping and attractions on offer. There are so many bars, restaurants and sightseeing within pleasant walking distance that this Hotel offers everything you need but at a lesser cost.

Location the biggest factor as its literally one block away from the beach. The hotel seem quite 1970's esque and the carpet could be replaced as it still has that hawaii five-o taste. The staff were great, the concierge was better as she managed to plan most our our days with the best of the best trips around Honolulu and the big island. A must if you havent organised anything, go see her. Sorry cant remember her name but she was great. A good stay had but not sure if we will be back.

I was celebrating my Bday with my gf and the stay was amazing. The room was clean and so does the whole hotel. The employees were so friendly and accommodating. The location was close to everything. We didnt have to drive at all. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who visit Waikiki.

We stayed 4 nights here & enjoyed our stay. Nancy was fantastic! Twin rooms are small in particular the bathroom. Deluxe corner suite more spacious for little extra $Breakfast was good & included as we booked direct.Wifi was good, the pool only gets afternoon sun & is freezing. It was all relevant to the price p/n. We had ocean view on 10th floor.

Stayed a week for a vacation. Nice place with slightly outdated but clean rooms. Price was affordable compared to other nearby overpriced hotels. The beach is one minute walk. We only rented one day as there was no need for cars when you stay around Waikiki. Great place.

City-view rooms at higher floors are good enough. Best location if you want to swim at the beach. Close to all kind of activities. Breakfast buffet is awesome. Swimming pool is clean and in decent size.

We had a great time at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. I'd recommend it to anyone! Only one block from the beach and all the shops. We walked one block to catch a bus one evening. Very convenient for a first-time Waikiki Beach traveler!

Very tidy and friendly. Staff were top class and nothing was too much trouble. Pool area was exceptional and well situated for the sun. The foyer-entry area was particularly impressive. The whole hotel was quiet and beautifully presented.

Reservations were responsive to my need for adjoining rooms so that my sister and I could hear my 84 yr old aunt in the next room,should she need assistance. Reservations alerted me that the accessible rooms were on lower floors. I appreciate that they responded quickly to my inquiries. Location a half block to the beach was wonderful. All staff were very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel. Sunday nite there was a bit of noise in the hall from other hotel guests. After that, it was quiet in the evening.

Had an upper floor with a view of the beach and songs around the night fires. Quiet hotel near everything. Liked that the airline magazine had an article about my Boston school and pictures of Lapland. Enjoyed the Korean cuisine and Korean beer.

This was our first time to Hawaii and this hotel was great! The location is in the center of Waikiki and yet conveniently located a block away from the beach, McDonald's and great Poke restaurant. The staff was went above and beyond but Branden and Trent always made sure we had everything we needed. We are definitely going back.Although this is not a five star hotel, the location and staff made it exceptional! After all, you don't go to Hawaii to stay in your hotel room all day.

This hotel is in a great location close to shops, the beach and downtown. However, while the location is very positive, the hotel itself is an older property and both the rooms and common areas really need updating. Rooms are adequate but the air conditioning is weak, beds are very soft and the decor definitely needs updating.There is a restaurant on site but we did not get a chance to eat in it.An OK, basic property in a very good location.

I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, location is great, staff are very friendly, a special shout out to Nancy on the front desk and Ken the concierge they can’t do enough for you! Breakfast staff were fabulous and very efficient.Rooms are clean, housekeeping helpful! Towels are a little old and thin and rooms can sometimes be a bit noisy but overall a great place to stay!

Only one block off the main strip and the beach in Waikiki. Hotel is well maintained, and housekeeping staff does a good job with the rooms. Very good buffet breakfast available in the lobby restaurant but note it’s not included in the room rate. Beach Towels available at the housekeeping desk in the basement. Parking in the basement is tight for a minivan or SUV but doable. We did not try the Korean BBQ restaurant in the 2nd floor because it was considerably more expensive than we were looking to pay for one meal for a family of five. There are at least 3 ABC stores within one block which we went to for bottled water, snacks, etc. There is a gift shop on site at the hotel which has a variety of items like snacks, laundry supplies, sunscreen, etc but you’ll pay a little less at an ABC store.

We stayed in hotel for a few nites right before Christmas, staff at check in counter was friendly, room was spacious with a balcony that we could see the flights took off (pretty far away though). Another good thing was they had a DVD player in room, which is very convenient to us Hotel location is awesome, just a small block away from the beach, lots of shops around and pretty close to the zooOne thing that can be improved in my view is breakfast, not a lot of choices and always need to line up in morningIn short, was happy with the hotel during our stay and will definitely go back

Very nice staff, very nice and clean. Close and convenient to the beach . Concierge messed up the pick up time for my Luau so I had to change everything around . The breakfast buffet at the restaurant was good . I would stay here again .

Stunning experience to stay here!It is really well located and offers great quality for all facilities such as swimming pool, Korean restaurant, cafe, DVD rentals and rental cars, etc. with super cool prices.

The hotel is good. The room was clea all days. the customer service is very good and the staff is always there to help you.The hotel's location is excellent.I would only add one more facility to the hotel; it needs a gym.

Our stay was very pleasant. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Sending a hello and Merry Christmas to Nancy at reception who helped me on my holiday. Nancy also gave great recommendations for our stay. The rooms were great, comfy beds, spacious and tidy. Awesome location, so close to the beach. Was great value for money. We'd definitely recommend this hotel to friends and loved ones. Thanks for the memories.

My flight arrived early and I was at the hotel well before check-in time,but the front desk staff were helpful and I was able to get into my room a couple of hours ahead of the official time which was very good considering I had arrived after a long flight. I don't seek luxury accommodation and its not offered here-but I think this hotel is good value.

Everything was overall satisfactory and rather fantastic.The staffs were very kind, especially guys on a graveyard shift, and also helpful.The facility itself is of fantastic beauty, including the nice pool and restaurants around, not to mention the scenic view from the balcony.Just one tiny drawback, was small stains and particle in the bath..

The Hotel is in a well positioned location one street back from Waikiki Bach. We stayed in a Corner Deluxe Ocean View Room. This was our second stay at the Waikiki Resort. It is an easy walk to most areas in central Waikiki. The Hotel offers great service and is kept very clean. The rooms are staring to get a little dated, however well worth the stay and good value for money.

I applied for a free trip with my family for 6 days through Hanjin Tour.I was stayed at Waikiki Resort for 4days(21-25). and I leaved Resort on the 25th. and when I left, l booked to check in again on the 28th and checked my credit card at the front desk.after that, I came back on the 28th and checked out on the morning of the 29th, and later checked out that $160 was paid. when I checked out on the 25th, the front desk confirmed that it was $130.00 a day. I couldn't confirm it because I had to return to Korea on the morning of the 29th.I was so offended and offended. please let me the extra payment back.

We had an awesome stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The breakfast had great variety and the rooms always clean and comfortable. The location was perfect for our holiday

We were greeted and serviced by Nelly at the front desk when checking in. She was most friendly, courteous and helpful. We enjoyed our stay, and were most thankful for the breakfast at the Ilima restaurant - plenty of fresh food, including fruits, which was most appreciated after recoering from the Marathon.

I ran in the Honolulu Marathon and this location was key for my stay. It was close to a diamond head and kapiolani park which is my route for my morning run. The shops and restaurants were also not too far away.

Very good location, very close bus stop, and a very kind housekeeper but buffet restaurant staff needs to improve customer service attitude and the noise from the elevator, especially, during the night is so great that it interferes with sleeping. I stayed for 11 nights and they offered me upgraded room with ocean view.

Pros. Fantastic Location close to quieter Waikiki beaches, shopping, main streets with public trans, and most touristy shuttle pickups. Hotel provides beach towels. Interesting convenience store in lobby with many unconventional, asian medicines. There is a pool and a spa parlor. Rooms have small coffee machine, safe, and tiny fridge. Rooms are clean and well tended. Comfortable beds. Lobby cafe is good for value buffet breakfast, but so many great breakfast options nearby.Cons. Don't try to leave before 9am, the elevators and lobby are swamped with Korean Air flight staff and massive tour groups trying to catch all of their shuttles and buses. Spa website has expired so no info unless you walk up. Korean restaurant in-house is overpriced. Wifi is located "in various rooms on each floor so just connect to the nearest one"; doesn't allow you to connect most of the time since there is no password (meaning too many people probably using the free wifi so don't count on it). Bathroom is tiny and "tub" is practically nonexistent (approx 3' wide, 4' long, and 1.5' deep), you might be able to bathe your feet or a small dog in there. No true closet, just a hanging rack in the tiny bathroom area. When the wind picks up, the sliding door to balcony rattles quite a bit. Curtains don't block out the light completely since they can't be closed completely on one side.

I gave 4 stars because the Hotel needs to improve vegetarian options on Breakfast menu. The facility has close proximity to Waikiki Beach but lags in the complimentary services that other adjacent Hotels offer.

Our group of 12 were there for 3 nights and 2 of the twelve tripped and fell going up the step into the open air lobby. It is an extremely high step and both ladies fell. Fortunately, they were not hurt other than being a bit stiff and sore the next day. As we were a senior group - we were very fortunate that no bones were broken.The hotel was clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The on site restaurant was very nice and the location was wonderful. I would recommend this hotel, but it would be wise for them to consider redoing the step into the lobby or installing railings for safety purposes.
