Everyone here at this hotel was very,very pleasant and accommodating. Cleaning ladies were also very helpful. June was awesome at check in and out! Desk Staff also helped with printing boarding passes. Will definitely stay here again.

The location is perfect, just a street away from the beach and at the end of the shopping strip. Accomodation is average, bathroom is rather small, view from the room is nice, thin walls (when we stayed the hotel next door was being renovated so was very noisy). Only issue we had was the check in time is 3pm and they don't allow you in any earlier. Our flight landed at 7am and we got to the hotel by 8:30am and got told to do something otherwise i'll be a very long wait.Other then that we enjoyed our 1 week stay here.

I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel at the start of March 2018. Upon arrival I was informed that there had been an issue with my room and that I was unable to check-in at the time. I had just arrived from mainland US and it was about 11pm. The staff were very apologetic and I was gifted two vouchers for the breakfast buffet. I was also given a room in the hotel next door. So the inconvenience was minimal. The staff did a great job facilitating my check-in of the new hotel and offered their assistance with anything I needed.Upon checking into my the following day, I found the room to be spacious and open with a view of Waikiki Beach. I had booked a corner suite. The room had a king size bed, fold out lounge and kitchenette. The bathroom was old and in need of renovations, everything was outdated. The lighting was poor and there was no curtain on the bathroom window. I was on the 9th floor and it was pretty quiet, the major noise I noticed was from other rooms on my floor, this could not be helped and it didn't bother me. When I checked in I was advised to try and attend the breakfast buffet around 9:30am as this is when most of the guests had already eaten and it would be quieter. As I had a lunchtime flight on the day I left I went to the buffet from breakfast around 7:30am, expecting it to busy. It was, however what was disappointing was that fact there were empty tables for the people waiting, just not enough staff to clear the tables and seat people. If the hotel knows it will be busy why not have extra staff assigned to the dining room. This would have made a 40min wait around 20mins. While this did not have a major impact on me as I was expecting it, it is easily solvable by the hotel.The pool was not much, very simple but the Hotel is a very short walk to the beach and in my opinion one of the better places to stay off the beach in Waikiki. It was value for money and the staff were very friendly. There is a coin laundry downstairs for hotel guest use also. My room also had multiple USB chargers which came in handy.All in all a nice place to stay.

Very pleasant surprise. Great location.staff friendly helpful. Beds comfy. One block from beach. Only concern we had was while i like flavoured coffee my hubby does not and the wolfgang puck coffee was very weak no matter how little water we used.

We stayed in this hotel for an one week,nice and close to the beach,room service every day,room nice and clean.very good breakfast buffet,and Korean restaurant on the second floor parking and swimming pool. Some people complain? I think they should stay in five star hotels. Very nice staff easy check in and check out,if come back we will definitely stay there. Special thanks to David at the counter.

Only yards from the famous beach and at a fraction of the cost of many hotels this is a good choice. We had a small kitchen area and living room with soffa and tv with a balconey and Lovely comfortable kingsize bed. Bathroom was filled with shampoo etc and three large good quality towels each. Shops on site open until 11.30 pm friendly and helpful staff and two restaurants. Only problem we had was with the weather.

We stayed here for 4 nights. The breakfast buffet was included when we booked direct online. Our room and bathroom was clean and our balcony had partial ocean views in front as well as partial Diamond Head views to the left. I booked this hotel for its location and because it was cheaper than most of the other hotels nearby. I was very happy with our stay.

Our experience from the start to the end of our stay was magnificent. We were greeted at check in by the hotel supervisor June her friendly professional manner was exceptional. As we were early we were given a key to the restrooms to freshen up and our bags were stored away,all our paperwork was completed and we were advised that we would be called when our room was ready,true to her words June phoned us.What a smooth process with a smile. Our room was large exceptionally clean and a with a great view ,The hotel has its own DVD library a mini market,it also provides beach towels. Can not fault this hotel is in a excellent location and all the staff are friendly knowledgeable and will go out of their way to help you.

Hotel looked a lot better from the outside and in the lobby, than the actual room did. My cousin and I originally booked a room with two full beds. Upon check-in, we were told that they "upgraded" us to a king bed which didn't really work well, (two senior females)but we were too tired to argue. Price didn't change, so we dealt with it for two nights before traveling to another island. Hotel was very busy with American and foreign tourists. Beach and restaurants were conveniently located. We were able to walk to many places. Gave it a 3 rating because room needed a facelift. Just looks worn and tired, so do the hallways.

One of the best things about this hotel is the location. It is only one block from the beach and a short walk to shops and restaurants. It's not a luxury hotel, but it is adequate, and good value for the price. Our room was fairly basic, but comfortable. After all, it was only a place to sleep at night, since we were out and about during the day.Breakfast at Ilima restaurant was good and had a good choice at the buffet. It's included if you book directly with the hotel.Despite several requests for a room on the upper floors, including at the time of booking (numerous months in advance), we were given a room in the lower half of the building. When I book a seat on an airline, I have the opportunity to choose my seat at the time of booking. Obviously, the earlier I book, the better choice of seats I have. I can't wait until hotels start doing the same thing - allowing me to choose the room I want to stay in at the time of booking. As it stands now, it doesn't matter how early you book, you are at the mercy of check-in staff as to which room you are allocated, regardless of how early you book.Overall, this is a reasonable place to stay. If you don't want to spend a fortune, but still be in a good location, this could be the hotel for you.

We’ve stayed for many years now and we love the hotel, but this trip was tainted by loud noises coming from the street—particularly from the pool deck of the hotel across the street. It prevented us from leaving the sliding glass door open during sleep. They closed the pool at 10 pm but there was music and loudspeaker chatter that went on beyond 10 pm. One night, the music track played on the loudspeakers all night long. It’s a minor point, but we also noted that some of the DVD’s available for checkout from the lobby are damaged and won’t play. We turned in two such DVD’s to the front desk.

This hotel has friendly staff and a perfect location. Hotel has an amazing lobby with a nice breakfast café on site. A short walk to the beach. The pool is also very nice and peaceful for some quiet time.

Had such a great time with my children. Within walking distance from the beach, good eats and several shops. Everyone was extremely friendly. Rooms were clean. Free DVD rentals came in handy for rainy days. Small store, pharmacy, and atm all inside hotel for convenience. Definitely willing to stay again!

My partner and I enjoyed a 9 day stay (5 + 4). The hotel is extremely well located and offered very good value for money with an ocean view. The service of the room each day was first class and the the Expedia desk in the lobby is friendly and offers good advice for local travel connections. We ate each morning at the buffet where the staff are very welcoming and friendly. The only thing we would suggest is more variation in the morning buffet and an espresso machine for a quality (non-American) style coffee.

Stayed here while in Waikiki. Nice hotel, resort is in the name but just the basic amenities are included (WiFi, cable, coffee in room), however there is a daily resort fee. Also, Parking is $25 a day which is normal, unlimited in and out of the parking structure. Only a block from the Beach and a McDonald's which is nice for a quick breakfast. Had a balcony view of the city, which is just a road and looking at another resort. Lots of construct going on, no fault to the hotel but kind of noisy for those staying in the near future. Also, only one ice machine on the 2nd floor. Fast elevators. Housekeeping was extremely friendly!! Every morning when we would be heading out of our room, we were greeted with big smiles and Good Mornings. Did not use the actual housekeeping services while we were there however. Clean, reasonably priced hotel for close walking distance to stores and beach.

We were able to get a good deal when I booked. We didn’t realize how close to Waikiki beach we were. The front desk was very accommodating! Great service from everyone! To top it off free DVD rentals!! Wish we could have stayed longer.

Staff was very helpful,held our bags when needed and made our stay very pleasant. It was just right, not too fancy, yet comfortable and affordable. It was also conviently located and easily assessible to many shopping areas nearby and tour agent within the lobby.

Great hotel! Close to beach! Excellent customer service from front desk staff! Beds are super comfy!! Coco from front desk was exceptionalmy helpful and very friendly! Accomedated us when we are ed early and gave us an upgrade!!

飯店離威基基海灘和卡拉卡瓦大道(Kalakaua Ave) (shopping天堂→國王大道) 很近。飯店內有藥局、超商(有點小貴)，不過ABC store很近! 這次預定海景房，感謝飯店提供最高樓層的海景房，雖然還是有很多建築物擋住，只能看到部分海景，但還是很滿意! 房內空間不算大，有沐浴用品、熱水壺、吹風機、陽台、熨斗‧‧‧等，浴室乾濕分離，晚上坐在陽台還蠻舒服的。蠻特別的是有提供免費租借DVD服務(會提供卡片)，但沒使用到，另外也可免費提供租借浴巾。有地下停車場，車位有限(旁邊還有一個室外的)，每晚停車費要 US25，很貴!!!!!! 但附近沒有太多的停車格~~也謝謝飯店贈送的蜜月小禮物，飯店人員都很熱情，願意幫忙寄明信片!! Location is very convenient for shopping and going to the Waikiki beach. But room is too small and crowded, and the part of ocean view was hidden by other building! The the parking fee is also expensive (US25) But very thanks for the employee, they helped us to send postcards and gave us a special honeymoon gift! That's so sweet! Thank you for giving us a great memory of honeymoon.

Wakiki is a great place to visit to just relax or do lots. The Mariott I was really impressed with the staff were excellent and so helpful. The rooms were really big and always clean. It is a really good position where it is and you can either go to the pool or walk across the road to the beach.

Outstanding facility & meals. I had an issue with the hairdryer as it kept blowing the circuit in the bathroom & the plug on top of the alarm clock (2 separate incidences - I reported both). The meeting room used on the 2nd floor was comfortable but a bit noisy from the neighboring room. Your breakfast was very enjoyable. Conveniently located - close to the beach. Poor bus driver had some challenges maneuvering the construction when picking up our group of 34 people. All in all, I would love to stay there again & would definitely recommend it.

Very clean, well-maintained hotel with excellent staff. Happy with all aspects of this hotel except for early am noise (which they cannot control). Woke up on 2 different mornings by loud construction crashes at 4:30 am.

This property has a great location for the price. It is older, but well maintained. The shower was a little small, but otherwise the amenities were fine. We had a minor maintenance issue, but it was resolved very quickly. We'd stay there again.

internet was very slow & on & off while i am using my computer.the bed sheet is kind of old. not fresh. the location is good, convenient.the restaurant seoul jung was good.the people at the lobby & room services was kind.

Stayed at Waikiki Resort for 10 days in mid January 2018. Enjoyed our stay immensely. The While the resort is by no means lavish it does represent excellent value for money for those on a budget. The positives include the follow:• excellent value for money.• location is great.• staff ( particularly those cleaning the rooms) are lovely.• efficient staff in all areas.• a very clean hotel.• extras like free video hire & included breakfast.The only negative on our part was the pool area which was a little small and no spa or hot tub. Not a great area for children. Otherwise, a great hotel.

I chiose this hotel due to price.When I stayed was the last of yeay so price was very very expensive. So i choose this to save a little bit comparig to others. Retal chair was very useful and goo point.

Room on the end was way to noisy from all the outside and interior noises. Doors slammed too loudly. You could hear people in the hall too much. Would not stay there again. Other people may have different opinions. Also freight elevator often would not go down to parking. Parking was too expensive for 15 nights, so we found off street parking most nights.

Nice Hotel. The staff was extremely pleasant and the breakfast restaurant was very convenient with good food. The room was small but it had everything I needed. Free tv & wifi, coffee maker, fridge and free dvds for the night. There was also a pool but I never got to take a dip. Was this a lavishly furnished hotel?.. no... but it was a very good deal in a pleasant environment.

This is located right near the beach, So the location is good. It is an older hotel if you don't want luxury prices. The breakfast was great for a cheaper hotel. The service was great. The pool is very cold. The fact that you have to take/pick up your pool towels at the lower level is not ideal. They should be delivered to Reception or on the pool level. We stayed as we had early flights to the airport so it was more of a stopover for us. For a couple of nights this is great. Probably would not stay for a family holiday for an extended period. But it was perfect for what we needed. Maybe overally priced for the actual standard though .

It was me and my wife's first Hawaii. The guy called Branden, he is the man you should ask for anything! From my experience, Branden can make your vacation way better than you expect! So helpful, friendly, and professional. Thank you very much Branden, we will see you again in few years!

Stayed at the Waikiki resort hotel for 2 nights. Check in staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was decent, pretty much your average hotel room. Everything was clean. The beach towels are a nice amenity to have. My girlfriend and I enjoyed our stay there.

Reasonably priced if all you want is a clean room close to the beach, shopping areas and tourist attractions. We enjoyed all of our meals for breakfast and lunch that we had at the lobby restaurant(Llima). There wasn't a huge selection but it was adequate and reasonably priced and using the 20% off coupon the hotel gives their guests is a bonus. If they had been open for supper we would have used that option as well because of the prices and convenience. Having never been to Waikiki before we found the restaurant prices and just about everything else very expensive compared to home. Also being there over Christmas made it hard to find a place to eat in Waikiki at night that didn't require a half hour wait or more. The only thing we didn't like is the constant street noise in the room day and night and screaming guests using the pool at the hotel across the street. We are used to double pane windows at home so I imagine most of the problem is from the single pane glass door and window. There is also a metal panel on the other side of the street that bangs twice every time a vehicle goes over it and echoes up into the rooms. From our balcony we could see diamond head through two buildings and could also see the beach area looking down the street. The hotel is set in among other buildings so I wouldn't say there is a true ocean front view. We had a king bed on the 11th floor and was very happy with the size of the room and bathroom. Would have given it an excellent if it hadn't been for the street noise that affected our sleep-never thought of taking ear plugs as we also found this an issue at the hotel we stayed at before our cruise in Waikiki. We found all employees that we interacted with very pleasant and helpful. They also have a shuttle service to the airport that works out cheaper than getting the expensive taxis.

Rooms were small, but served the purpose of what we needed. Microwave would have been nice, but at least there was a minifridge. The location is great as it is an easy walk to Waikiki Beach and many restaurants. Parking is a nightmare if you have a rental car and costs $25 per day so that is definitely a consideration.

The hotel is amazing and the staff is very polite and helpful. They offered help and suggestions! The view of the ocean was amazing from our room, except the crane, don’t waste your money at the restaurant though! There are too many excellent ones in walking distance to settle for sub par Korean. Otherwise, we loved the place!

This hotel is clean and convenient to Waikiki. Walking distance to all the beach activities retaurants and shopping. There is a parking lot outside and inside, but beware of the inside lot if you have an SUV. The vehicle I rented was an Ford Expedition, and I got stuck in the parking garage!! The rooms were clean, but the beds were very small. I double bed is barely adequate for a couple. However, at the front desk, BRENDAN was the most helpful and friendly person I have encountered at a hotel. He was completely accommodating and professional, he was THE BEST!!! I would like to suggest to the restaurant to add more fresh fruit in the mornings... after all there is an abundance on a tropical island like O'ahu. I would like to see papaya, pineapple, banana, and any other fruits. NO green salad at breakfast, please. Great stay especially because of Brendan!!

We stayed here in Nov 17 for 5 nights. Each Staff member was friendly and helpful. The hotel was under renovation however this didn't impact on our stay. My in-laws ate at the restaurant downstairs and enjoyed their meals. I feel it was great value for money.

I've been to Oahu about 8 times now...For my 50th birthday, I decided to go back to my favourite island in the Pacific.. Upon arriving at the hotel after a long day of travel, I was greeted by Brendan at the front desk for check in. Upon hearing about my birthday after asking me the purpose of my trip, Brendan upgraded me to a full ocean view for my stay..The next day a complimentary bottle of champagne and goodies was dropped off at my room. My whole stay the staff was helpful, courteous and friendly. Thank you Brendan and staff for one of the best memories of my life. bless you....kind regards , Paul Laine

would of liked to have been able to get access to at least one of our rooms earlier as we had arrived in Hawaii at 6.30am and to have to wait till 3pm was not appreciated and front line staff were not in a hurry to serve you, Breakfasts were yummy and the lady working in llima is one fantastic employee you want to keep her.

Staffs are not kind (esp, female old age staffs). Location is good. Breakfast was not good. Room clean is okay. Resort was not bad and not good. You need change and add the menu in the restaurant. ---

Great Location and very friendly stuff. Rooms are clean and big. Little refreshment needed but overall nice. Only pillows was too hard to sleep, some softer pillows needed. Great viuw and nice movie collection

I wanted a modest place with an ocean view for me and my partner, this hotel provided just that.It's a reasonably priced hotel given Hawaii's standards. The hotel is old but we have a comfortable bed and can open our eyes to the ocean in the mornings. It's not a place to be pampered but a modest place with a view of the ocean. Please budget additional $25 for Parking and $16 for resort. Happy so far given our budget.

I was only in town for a short while, but the location was just perfect enough for me to get around to the beach, grab some delicious food, and a great nights rest before having to hop back on a plane.

After 2 flight transfers we finally reached the property at 1230 am. We were greeted by the desk staff upon checkin. We were informed that since it was our 40th anniversary we were upgraded. To our surprise the upgrade was to a one bed room penthouse suite. We couldn't ave been more delighted. When we reached the room we were even more in awe of the spacious room. There was a kitchenette , living room and bedroom. While at the desk we had asked what our view would be , the clerk answered you are at the top so you will have a view of everything. We went out onto the balcony to discover that we could see the ocean in one direction and mountains in another . Just spectacular ! The property has 2 restaurants , a pool , gift shop and concierge desk . Al staff were friendly and happy to answer all our questions. This was our first time flying internationally anywhere. We were in complete awe of the beautiful Hotel and surroundings. We couldn't have asked for more. We ate in the restaurant in the lobby for our breakfasts which were buffet style and delicious ! We booked a few tours though the concierge desk per Allison who was very helpful and informative. The desk staff helped us with learning the local bus schedule to help us explore the Island on our own. All desk staff were knowledgable and helpful with any questions we had. Dean helped on more than a few times on what to see and where to go.I would definitely recommend this property to anyone . We would stay here a gain if given the opportunity. We hope to one day return to see and do more. This was a trip of a lifetime !!

The hotel is old and needs updating, but the location is 2 blocks from Waikiki beach and is a cheap price for the area. There are lots of restaurants you can easily walk to, or 2 onsite. Check in was easy. Not many amenities but it served its purpose. I would stay here again as it was clean.

The swimming pool was too cold and sun never shined on it. Lady in apartment building to the west kept yelling at us and being very vulgar using the "F" word a lot. I realize that neither of these are controllable but a heated pool and hot tub would have been wonderful after a day on the beach. We were never able to eat at the hotel restaurants as they were not kid friendly. The website said nearby construction noise, and they were not kidding. It starts early in the morning and is on three sides of the hotel. Incredibly noisy! Don't expect to hear the ocean from the balcony. Staff is wonderful and very helpful. Location to beach is great, about a 10 minute walk to a place to plop it for the day. Hotel provides beach towels. A funny chicken on the front lawn that my kids named Pickin the Chicken.

Hotel is in great location. Close to the beach, shopping centers. Staffs are very courteous,very happy and helpful. Rooms are very clean and the service is excellent. Housekeeping staffs are very respectfull and very honest.

Definitely had more than I expected. Loved the Open to the outdoors, main entrance. Had it's own convenience store and vitamin store, which I was not expecting at all. Very short walk to the beach, which was nice. And the staff was very accommodating

Good and decent room. Weren't told there was some renovation been done above us in level 9. Rang front desk to complain about the noise, got moved to level 18, with King size bed and an awesome view of the sea! THANK YOU!!!

Good standard hotel for a good price and in a great location. Rooms were large and comfortable. Didn't use the restaurant as there was a lot of choice in the area. The bar was not inviting. Nice pool.

We booked the Waikiki Resort last minute and we were pleasantly surprised. The staff at check-in were very friendly, whilst the room was clean and comfortable. We did request and paid a little extra for a mountain view which was a little disappointing as we only saw a minuscule piece of the mountain nestled between two high raise hotels. Apart from that the location is perfect.

We had been very disappointed in our stay upon arrival the staff did not acknowledge that we had been waiting for awhile at the desk, yes it was during the Christmas break so we just let it go, no one to help with our luggage. This hotel is definitely not worth the price. It is outdated and could use some cleaning up, the desk staff could not help or could not be bothered to help when we asked about restaurants in the area or even how to get around via public transport. I have stayed inn 3rd world countries that give better service than in the US.

Staff was very friendly and Accommodating. House Kepping Staff was Excellent as they were at our room with in minutes of any requests we may have had...the Convenientwo store in the Hotel had any and everything we needed last minute...room was extremely comfortable and relaxing.

In Brief my ratings of a 2 day stay out of 101: Customer service 10/102: Breakfast buffet 9.5/10 3: Room of Comfort and size 9/10 ( with microwave oven) and sink4: Quietness of night sleeping with air/conditioner (On) ahhhhh 10/105: Location 9/106: Self service for laundry approx. $1.75 wash per load / $1.75 Drying per load7: Walk time to Beach 2.5 min

We planned a trip to Waikiki for the annual Halloween celebration. The Waikiki Resort offered the best value and location for our carriage less visit. Our front desk attendant, Dean was courteous and extremely helpful checking us in and suggesting great sites to visit that were within walking distance of the hotel. He did a great job and took time to listen to our wishes and made great suggestions. The room was excellent, clean and offered all the necessary amenities. The battery in the bedroom smoke alarm began "chirping" and the cleaning staff was responsive in its replacement upon notification. We dined in the Korean restaurant on site and loved the in table BBQ dinner we ordered. Overall this was a great week of R&R and of course the culmination was participating in the Halloween festivities. Awesome job and thanks to all.

The staff was friendly and helpful, the hotel is clean but older as with many of the hotels it is in state of renovation there is a lot of construction work and not the fault of the hotel that the city is so loud at night perhaps new windows will be more sound proof

We needed one night in Waikiki before our flight and we chose the Waikiki Resort Hotel after noticing that a lot of airline staff stay here. While beach views may be limited because you are 1 block back from the beach we didn't get all the noise generated by traffic, emergency vehicles and the building works progressing at nearby hotels and on the main road. Reception and luggage staff were extremely friendly and helpful allowing us to leave our luggage in the foyer at 10:30am and even got us room entry before 2pm. Rooms are clean and well equipped with plenty of usb outlets. We will be back and we will stay here again.

Staff were very helpful from check-in to pointing out directions. We had a room near the elevator so it was a bit noisy at night and the cleanliness/tidying up could be more standardised. Other guests staying at the hotel were very polite so it's good for friends and family.

The staff were very nice ans specially Leslie this guy helped us a lot.The location is excellent ,is only one block from the beach and many god restaurants around there and the price that we paid was very good.I would like to recommend this hotel to all my friends.

During our recent 7 night visit we received exceptional service. Everyone from housekeeping, concierge and front desk were brilliant in providing assistance.The unfortunate issue was the local and internal construction.There was renovations happening on a level or two above. As a result all we could hear through the whole building was drilling and banging with construction workers blocking out lifts at busy times.To add to this, the building sites over the road had works starting at 6am with skip bins being emptied as early as 4:00-4:30am.This was quite frustrating as the noice was unbearable at times.I understand this is just a timing issue as renovation and building cannot be helped. I would just recommend checking if works are happening throughout your stay.Apart from that, I would most definitely revisit and recommend Waikiki Beach Resort to friends and family. I would like to thank staff members Branden, Dean and Leo who made our stay as pleasant as possible.Mahalo!!

We found our room to be clean & comfortable. I was disappointed that you don’t provide tea (English type) or liquid milk in your rooms, only herbal teas despite the fact that it is provided in your cafe where we had breakfast.

While not the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in, this place was certainly clean, tidy, and comfortable. The bathroom was rather interesting, in that it had possibly the worlds smallest bathtub (may as well have not been there at all), but the rest of the room was more than adequate. The added bonus is that there is an on-site laundry downstairs, which is rather handy on a lengthy work trip! I'd stay here again if given the chance.

The staff were super friendly and helpful and made sure we made the most out of our visit to Hawaii. They were helpful in organising cabs, tours and just making sure we felt really welcomed as part of our holiday.The only thing I would suggest is that some of the staff on the tours desk in the reception area weren't as helpful as others. There was one lady and as soon as she realised I was after general information rather than book a tour, she actually sent me to the hotel next door. So I wasn't impressed about that.

nice, comfortable room; excellent restaurant for breakfast and/or lunch; good pool; friendly staff; very convenient to everything i.e. great location!; an ice machine on level 2; electric jug and coffee machine included...an added bonus!

Short walk to beach, near everything and bus stop. Breakfast was great. This was our second time to stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel. Ask for a room facing beach and get one of the higher floors. Ours was 12 with a beautiful view of the beach.

This place is not our idea of a "resort", basically just a hotel room. It is close walking distance to several restaurants, beaches, and shopping. The front desk people are very friendly and helpful, which was a plus.

The hotel was literally 2 minutes away from Waikiki Beach! The staff were friendly - loved Trent and Leo (the bellhops)!It was a little noisy as there was renovations happening in the hotel (loud banging) and also beside the hotel.

Great hotel if you aren’t looking for anything up market. Clean, reasonably priced and in great proximity to Waikiki beach. I’d definitely stay there again. The staff are also very polite and helpful.

The Waikiki Resort Hotel is in a great location, one block from the beach in the heart of Waikiki. For us it was also incredibly well situated to the places we picked up tours -- never more than a five minute walk away!Among the best features of the hotel are the roomy king beds, excellent A/C, and the split bathroom with the toilet and shower separated from where the sink was. We also found the staff to be friendly and helpful. What we didn't like were: the lack of a full length mirror in the room and for one of us, who happens to be short, there was no way to put the shower head down lower making it impossible to get a full blast of water. But what we hated the most was being surprised with a resort/amenity fee of $47 after we had already paid our hotel in full. At no time were we told there was an extra fee, which the woman at the reception desk had the gall to tell us covered things like the HAIR DRYER in our room. No, that is included in the fare. As was the mini-fridge. We were forced to pay the fee, which we will be disputing with our credit card. What might have been a pleasant stay ended up leaving a very bitter taste in our mouths. Would we stay here again? If they got rid of the resort/amenity fee, then yes. Otherwise, no, never again.
user_name:
Dori S
Scotch Plains, New Jersey

review_body: Clean, quiet, comfortable, convenient location, good value. While it appeared to be a slightly older building, it was clean and well maintained and undergoing some renovation/ upgrades to some rooms or floors. Bed comfy. close to beach. Restaurant for breakfast buffet had friendly staff as did the Korean restaurant we went for dinner.

Very friendly service. Great location. Rooms are basic, clean and tidy. Only fault is being able to hear people coming and going down the hallway to access the lifts and rooms. But all in all I would stay here again.

Selected this hotel for a combination of price and location. Very pleased overall. Not luxurious accommodations, but comfortable and clean. Short block to the beach. Complimentary breakfast buffet was good, even if not extensive. Free dvd rentals was a nice extra. Staff we dealt with were all friendly and helpful.WiFi in our room worked, but was weak. Better signal in the lobby.We'd definitely stay here again if in Honolulu.

Location is not bad but the dated interior has a desperate need for refurbishment. Souvenir shop needs a more friendly worker. Pool, also needs to be cleaned up, as well. Staff were very friendly, and helpful.

We can't rate this Hotel highly enough. Have just spent 2 weeks there, the staff were first class, the ladies who looked after our room were so helpful and did a fantastic job. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. Never had to wait longer than a few seconds for the lift - we were on the 15th floor. Location was wonderful, about 2 minutes to the beach, bus stop again about 2 minutes away. We would thoroughly recommend this Hotel and will be back .

To me the kiss of death for a hotel is bad wifi. When I'm on vacation, it is especially important to me to be able to take care of things I need to do online quickly and efficiently so that I can move on to other activities. The wifi in my room at the Waikiki Resort Hotel sometimes worked, often didn't work. I would have to take my computer down to the lobby to get anything done. Otherwise the hotel was ok -- not my idea of a "resort" but ok. A light sleeper would have problems with the thin walls (and ceiling) if people were talking next door or walking around upstairs. The pros were that the room was clean and that the breakfast buffet was good.

nice holiday hotel close to the water shops,restaurants and good breakfastour stay was excelent good service by the front desk especially by reps.Branden and Dean. hotel is clean and tidy staff very friendly room get cleaned dailythere is Korean restaurant and they have a cafe you could have a coffee and some hawaiian dishes if you staying at the hotel you get 20% discount at the restuarants and they got buffet breakfast close to public transport and shops quite area I would stay here again. you get wifi in the hotel

We arrived early September 17 about 21.30 & the hotel was easy to find. Checked in without any hassle & I must say the staff were always very helpful with any questions we had. The rooms were always cleaned to a high standard each day with fresh towels every day. The view wasn't great facing other hotels but we could've paid extra for sea view etc but you don't go to Hawaii to sit & addmire the view from the hotel. Only thing we didn't like was the hotel bar but we didn't have any issues with it as we were out quite late each night. Overall we would not hesitate to stay again.
user_name:
Anthony C
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: This hotel is probably best described by the word quaint. The lobby decor and furnishing and decor in the room seem like they are straight out 1970. it's not that the hotel is worn out out or dirty. In fact it is clean and well maintained and consistently seems to have rates which are well below similar hotels in the area, making it a good value. Also, it is located in a quite street , just a block away from the beach, shops and restaurants on Kalakua ave. Check in was smooth, and the room were a good size (about 350 square feet) and clean. There is a decent Korean restaurant, on the second floor as well as a cafe where they have good coffee and omlettes and other local Hawaiian dishes . if you are staying at the hotel, you get a 20% discount at either of the two places. this makes for a compelling value proposition since eating in even the cheaper places in the neighborhood costs more. I would definitely choose to stay here if they had the same rates

We usually stay in Waikiki for the Labor Day weekend for the Okinawan Festival. We've stayed at other hotels in the same area but chose Waikiki Resort because of the price. Glad we did! Service was great, rooms were just enough for the 4 of us (wish there was a microwave though), & location was perfect. Short distance to Kapiolani Park & to the prime areas of Waikiki. We will definitely stay again! Mahalo!!!

My stay was extremely pleasant and just what I needed. It was made better by the service that Front Desk Rep Dave provided me. He is a gem! Meaning a 3%er. 97% of people currently are either average or below average. Then there are the 3% who from the grace of God, are so unique and special and kind. They will be successful in life no matter what. Now as far as your business, you can benefit from the successes of Dave if you are able to keep him. He deserves recognition and a promotion. Thank you Heather Cheyney

The Hotel was clean and well maintained. The service was also good but I have to keep asking for more towels because we are 4 and they only put two.I like the movie rentals included in the stay and the help from the traveler agent available st the lobby was the key to our trip planning around Honolulu. The restaurants in the Hotel where good but for a family of 4 an everyday meal there was too expensive. The only really big complaint is that there was a construction going on across the street from the Hotel and our room was literally facing the construction and woke us up very early every day.

Perfect location, just a few minutes walk to Waikiki beach, restaurants and shops. Clean room and great service. The breakfast at the hotel is expensive, but ok. Will stay here again next time I visit Honolulu :)

This hotel is fantastic. Great service, clean rooms and amazing breakfast buffet. Short walk to Waikiki beach and ABC store right around the corner. Very convenient. I would Definitely would stay again!

(+) : Good location(2 mins to waikiki beach, 1 min to McDonald cafe, 1 min to surfing board shop for rent and lessons), Hotel restaurant's food is so good, internet cafe(1F) (-): I didn't know about the extra fee(resort fee), the tissue case inside was too dirty!!

Great location, very clean and super friendly staff. The hotel is central to everything and one block from the beautiful beach. The pool is nice, but we spent most of our time at the beach. We couldn't ask for more and can't wait to return.

Nothing special about this hotel. Room was not ready at check in. Had to wait 15-20 mins. Water took forever to get hot in our room. Construction began the day after we checked in. Breakfast that was included in our package was horrible. I understand continental breakfast, however nothing was hot.

stayed here for 5 days while dropping off my daughter for school. Was not disappointed in anyway, close to beach, close to restaurants(good breakfast buffet on site), room was clean and comfortable, easy walk to anywhere in Waikiki beach area, pool was relaxing with afternoon sun, lots of parking on site. Price was right considering location and the inflated price you will pay for other hotels on the beach, Waikiki resort is only 1 block from beach. Thank You I would definitely return.

Only one block away to Waikiki beach. Trolley stops, fast food (MacDonald's, Burger King), ABC stores, restaurants and bars are near by, very convenient. Need to do your laundry during the vacation? Worry not!! A self-service laundromat located at the B1 level.

Location of this hotel was perfect and only a block from the beach. Also easy walking distance to shops, bars and restaurants.Accommodations were better than expected and staff were friendly and helpful.Would definitely recommend this hotel.

We used the hotel for its convenient location as a short stopover on our way home. We found the room nice and clean, the staff very friendly. The breakfast room does not cope all that well with the numbers of guests, involves queuing.

As the saying goes "location, location, location"! Found this little gem on Travelocity and were not disappointed. It is a 3 minute walk to the beach, shopping, restaurants, bars, etc. Beach towels are provided daily. The staff were friendly and helpful, which made our trip that much better ... special koodos to Brandon!! The only downside was the size of the shower stall! I am not a big person and found it difficult to manuever in the shower. We will, however, book the Waikiki Resort Hotel on our next visit.

Everyone was so nice and helpful. Less than 2 blocks from the beach. At check in our room wasn't ready yet so they held our bags for us, and helped us locate a place for lunch a Hppy Hour. Fresh towles were always available! Loved it!!

The hotel is Perfect Location to shopping, Beach, Restaurant.Even though the old hotel, room is so clean, enough towel, good reception. parking lot is easy to in and out from hotel. there is favorite Musubi House and rental shop for Surfing board.

If you are looking to spend your time on Waikiki beach and exploring Honolulu this hotel is a prime location to base your outings. Friendly staff, a bit dated in decor but rooms are clean and comfortable with balconies. FYI room 543 has a view of construction, though the noise was not bothersome.Free DVD rental which is nice. There is an amenity fee...approx $15 that will be added to your bill for things like wifi etc, non-negotiable. Parking at the hotel is $25/day with come and go.Air conditioners don't get the rooms very chilly so plan on about 75+ being the chilliest you can get.Overall we were pleased and would recommend this hotel as a great value.

Really enjoyed our stay at WaikikiResort Hotel. ALL staff were approachable, friendly and helpful.We even received a free upgraded room which allowed us to view the city.I checked in with Dee- who was very pleasant to deal with and Ilima restaurant staff a delight. Really liked the food ad price of this restaurant!

This was booked through a package deal. The front desk and bell staff were very pleasant and inviting. Beds weren't very comfortable and walls must be really thin Because all we could hear all night was room doors opening and closing:( restaurant staff was also nice

Loved out stay here. Great value for so close to the beach. We had a great view. Central to everything in Waikiki. Rooms clean neat and all you could need. Lobby is beautiful and staff friendly and helpful. Would stay again and absolutely recommend.

The first Hawaiian trip was so enjoyable with Waikiki ResortThe staff were friendly and clean and everything was perfectI don't know when I will be, but if I go to Hawaii, I would like to stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel again and then look again

Very comfortable stayRestaurant in 2nd floor was also very good.Hohsekeeping was nice.Shops in the lobby was very helpful.I took several tour form the tour desk in the lobby, which was very convenient.

The rooms are dated and there is only one mirror in the room. The rugs are dirty looking and the beds seem old and sag to one side. A full length mirror would fit perfectly on the wall just outside the sink area before you go into the bed area. My wife and daughter would often go to the lobby to use the mirrors around the elevators. Parking is very tight underneath and the residents in the apartments next to the outside parking are rude and come out and yell at you if your horn honks when you lock your vehicle. Makes me worry about leaving my car outside. Also you have to pay $25 a day to park here and the extra "Resort Fee's" are a unpleasant shock as well. The extra $700 we had to pay for the two weeks we stayed cut into our travel money and prevented us from doing some of the things we had planned. Be sure to get that info before you check in so your're not surprised by the extras. This is temporary but as of July 2017 there are major renevations going on at the resort across the street and the workers start there day at 6am. So if your placed on that side of the building don't expect to sleep in unless you wear earplugs.

This hotel was in a great location, one block from the beach and surrounded by a fantastic choice of restaurants and take away food outlets as well as plenty of ABC stores close by. The air conditioning in the room was great and the ice machine and ice bucket were well used by us! Overall, I would choose to stay here again. Thank you!

I am an assistant guide for Road Scholar Program/Pacific Island Institute. We had a great three nights including the breakfast buffet, Porter Services, and rooms for our evening programs. The short walk to shops, restaurants, and Waikiki Beach is excellent.

While I am not sure of the reason, we got upgraded room to veiw an ocean. The hotel would have some guideline to offer. In any case, we are happy for 5 stays.And all of sstaff we talked are so friendly and kind to teach anything we asked/requested.Only some concern is that someof facilities in the room is old / not comfortable. However, due to the upgraded room we enjoyed to stay.

Our family was treated special by your staff. When we first checked in, Branden made us feel welcomed and was very helpful for the duration of our stay. We will recommend your hotel to others and will return. Thank you!

The hotel is in a great location, just a block walk to Waikiki beach. It is walking distance to a lot of shops, shopping centers and restaurants. Staff is friendly and helpful. It has a fridge, ironing board, etc. The property is old though and you can see that the rooms have not been updated. Bathroom is small with a teeny shower and fixtures are old. Price is not too bad given that it is summer. Doors are not build to block out noise. We had a room that was close to the elevators and you can hear people talking in the corridors and banging their doors. So it's an ok hotel if you are looking at a basic place to stay with great location, othewise you may have to upgrade to some of the premier rooms if you are expecting a more lush experience.

This hotel is nice . The room was very small and the bathroom was tiny. But the hotel is 1 block from the beach and close to shopping and restaurants. It's also close to the zoo and aquarium ( a 10 to 15 minute walk , but it's not bad ) if you have a flight going out really late like 8pm I would look at paying for 1 more night when you book because they don't like late check out, the latest you can, after you ask them is noon , and they willl watch your bags which is nice. But you have to pay them , it's 2.00 a bag after 2 hour, and if you are going to try to enjoy the town or the beach and want to get cleaned up it is hard too. If you have a big party I would just pay for 1 extra night in 1 room. It might be worth it. The hotel has a nice small pool on the second floor ,it was clean and had chairs to sit at :)

Thermostat was not working right. We wanted the room to be cooler but it stayed at 70 degrees. We had issues with the DVD rental card at first. The room was ok except the construction outside woke us up in the morning. Location is great. Wish our room had a microwave to heat up food.

The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Clean rooms, breakfast buffet was excellent! The view from my room was not the greatest....apartment building across the way. Next time will try to get a room on the front side of the hotel.

Great location! closed to the beach, shopping yet away from the traffic! Friendly staffs, our rooms (we have 2 rooms) were clean and comfortable, Housekeeping service were nice & clean yet promptly. Front office staffs always cheerful and friendly greeting us each time. George & Brandon in Front office were very helpful!

It's a great location and the price is not bad if you shop wisely. That's about it. Unless you get a suite or high end room and a very high floor, you are stuck with a mediocre room with thrifty style. Very basic double beds with one bedside table. The only phone is nowhere near the bed but across the room. Airplane style toilet, door hits it when you open. 30" x 30" shower stall. Really compact refrigerator, under the small sink with a small mirror on top and that is the only one. Scary part is, unless you remember to put the sign on the bed every day, they won't change linens for 4 days! That shifts the responsibility from the Housekeeping on to you. I wouldn't call it a "Resort" but a Budget hotel with pool and spa.

ok.........we have to change room due to water leaked. And the bathroom was very small.... There were additional fee after we booked through Hawaii airline with the combine of hotel booking. This was not say during the book, it was after i book the hotel and which i have no choice but accepted.

Location is just a block away from the beach close to many shops and restaurants. We stayed in a double room, which felt smaller than other rooms but for the price and location it was a great Hotel. $$

Great Hotel with great employees.All very helpful and friendly. Hotel is near to Waikiki beach, 2 minutes walking!Clean and very nice rooms.Breakfast is very good and Erna is very friendly and nice.June in FO is very helpful.

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on my way back to Australia to break the journey. We had stayed at another hotel on the way over and called in here to enquire about airport transfers and a few other things. I found the staff to be very helpful even though I had to arrange my own transfer. The room that I booked was a city view but I did have a glimpse of the ocean. There was construction going on next door but to be honest it didn't have any impact on my stay at all. The hotel is 1 block from the beach to it's not too far to walk. The room that I stayed in was 1611. First of all I must say the bed was one of the most comfortable I had slept in, much appreciated. The room had plenty of storage which I didn't make use of as I couldn't be bothered to unpack for a 2 night stay. Yes the fridge is small but it works and all I had to put in there was water and milk. There is a safe in the room, it's on a shelf in the bathroom. For me being quite short I had to get someone else to get something out of the back of the safe as I couldn't reach the object that was the only issue I had. The bathroom was clean with the bath/shower and toilet separated by a door from the wash basin which is quite a good idea.Check out was quick with no issues. Would I stay here again, the answer is yes. It's not too expensive and there are some nice restaurants nearby and as always there is an ABC shop just round the corner/

Staying here was alright and everything went smooth. Downside side was the tub was too small to even take a cold or hot bath. Another was someone's card almost got charged for the amenity fee instead of my card which I corrected right away. All n All.....it was a good experience stay.

Wonderful location! Only 2 blocks away from the waikiki beach. They provide beach towel. Great staff to work with! They understand my needs to switch rooms. Clean room and okay decorations. Only con: additional resort fee was charged.

Stayed here for 6 nights in July. The hotel is located only one block from the beach. There are an abundance of retail shops, convenient stores, cafes and restaurants all within walking distance. My room was very clean and spacious with a very comfortable bed. There is a bit of construction happening next to this hotel and i have noticed that some other reviews said that this bothered them. For me personally, it had no affect on me at all. The staff at this hotel were pleasant and very helpful. The buffet breakfast was small but very nice and catered for all tastes. I have no complaints there at all. Breakfast filled me up every morning. There is a nice pool on level 2 that gets heaps of sun. The place is a little dated but I believe that added to the charm of the hotel. i highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return

We stayed here 5 nights. Staff was friendly and helpful when we needed anything. There is construction going on in the hotel next to us so the backing up of the truck beep woke me before 8 am. No microwave and very small fridge. The bathroom light and sink area light are connected, so if you have to potty or shower your roommates will have to sleep thru the light. Maybe not an issue for some but it was for me. Our shower made this strange vibration when the water got too hot or the pressure was too hight. Not exactly sure what caused that. I don't think I would stay here again.

We stayed in the Waikiki Resort Hotel for 6 Nights. Its a good place to stay in Waikiki. Just a few steps away from the beach.All employers where very helpful and friedly. Special Thanks to June from the reception desk for checking us in when we arrived very early in the morning and also to Erna for her good service and always smiling.Rooms are good,clean and have everything you need.Mahalo and Aloha.

I can't imagine a better hotel in the Waikiki area; delightful location and amenities, very helpful staff, tasteful rooms with balconies, and great beds, I draw special attention to every staff member from the desk clerks and manager to the helpful room service staff. They made a huge difference. Many thanks.

This was my second visit to this hotel. The price was reasonable.They made a call when the room was ready so that we can do early check-in. Room was clean, had enough parking spaces. Location was good too. Really close from Waikiki beach. If I get to visit Oahu again, I would stay in this hotel again :)

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Even though we had a bit of a problem after checking in ( a wet carpet) if seemed to dry by next morning. Pool was great for the kids, location was excellent.

The location and support from staff is excellent. Property needs upgrade as too much noise of lift movement. Better outcome can be obtained should there be modern facilities available. Rooms are smelling may need to change the carpet.

We came to Waikiki a day before we set out on our cruise. We booked the hotel through travelocity and we were upgraded to an ocean view suite! It was so nice to sit on the balcony to watch the water. Great location - lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. Would definitely come back again!

We were welcomed on arrival and the service continued to great throughout our stay. The location of the hotel was perfect, views of the beach, close to shops, transport and entertainment. Great value for money. We would definitely stay here again.

The menu of the meal is identical every day and there is no change.I wish I had kimchi.I'd like to prepare a pair of slippers to wear in the room.It was inconvenient to clean the room too early.and It's too late to check in at 3:00 p.m.

Upon arrival at 7am we were told by Nancy, the receptionist, that our room wouldn't be available until 3pm! She gave us a key for the communal bathroom and told us to get beach towels from the basement. A few hours later I asked a male receptionist if it would be possible to get our room a little earlier, having arrived at 7am. He said that w should have asked when we arrived. Nancy did not mention that this was possible. She was also quite abrupt in her demeanour. She is not someone I would employ on the front desk of a hotel!Room cleanliness was average - one day only two of the three beds in our room were made. The bathroom wasn't clean to a very high standard.

reception was excellentroom was clean, wideLocation was very good, easy access to the beach and bus-stops, trolley-stops to shopping centers and tour places.But, Had to try 2~3 times with key to open the door and Water tab made noise when turned to cold

I stayed with my family at this Hotel for my sister's Wedding. A great experience at check-in, George Mahalo was amazing, he was able to accommodate our group on the same floor. A very good Breakfast included, extra discount vouchers for movies and other meals. Walking distance to restaurants & beach. Rooms average size, showers small.

Great location with Waikiki beach but the amenity was a poor. We have seven people divided by two rooms, but the bed were just five for seven people. When we came into those rooms, we were shocked very much. But I think overall rate should be 3/5. Thanks,

Close to Waikiki beach and short walk to food and shopping areas. Staff very helpful and friendly. Excellent American breakfast. Easy access to bus routes for sightseeing. Room had balcony (good for drying swim stuff) but view was really of other hotels/apartments. Higher floor was quieter though so worth the extra

The hotel is great overall. Location worked for us however next trip we will stay closer to wharf end as more convenient. The hotel is very clean and the staff certainly accommodated very request we made. Wifi was not great.

I didn't stay here, just ate the breakfast Buffet for $12.95, I stayed across the street so it was very convenient. If you are in the area then it's a good option for the area. You don't have to stay there to eat there, Holiday Inn across the street only allows their customers to use their restaurant.

Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. It's in a great location, 1 block to the beach, all kinds of fast food restaurants close by. Bus stop 2 blocks.The staff were very nice and helpful. A shout out to the nice lady who cleaned our room! She should be employee of the month!I would stay here again, hopefully next year!

Room was clean and tastefully furnished. Breakfast buffet was very nice. One short block to beach. Desk clerks were very friendly and helpful. Small shop in lobby in case something was forgotten. McDonald's is one block away.

We enjoyed our stay at Waikiki resorts. It's less busier being on the street back from the beach. Good location. It would've been nice to have a spa in the pool area and a bit more shade. Service was good

i stayed really nicelyand the location was wonderfulnear from the waikiki beach,trollye stop, and the shopping mallsit would have been better if you give some of bottles wateronce again the location is the best

Booked this trip through an online 3rd party vendor. The name of the resort wasn't revealed until after the booking. Read the reviews from others which were "mixed". We arrived and were very pleasantly surprised. Waikiki Resort is very nice. The location was beyond great. The lobby impressive, the employees genuinely nice and the room had an ocean view. The facility was CLEAN, quiet and comfortable. I will definitely return,.

My friend and I stayed in the mini suite on the 16th floor, containing one bedroom and a sofa bed in the living area. The hotel had mentioned that as the mini suite was located next to the elevators, noise may be a problem, however we were not troubled with any noise at all. The bedroom had a small view of the ocean between buildings and the living room a stunning view at night of the city lights.Hotel was perfectly adequate for our needs, the beds and especially the pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom was rather small though and the tiny basin was ill positioned. I am only 5'1" and still had to bend over to use it. No shelf space other than a small triangle above the basin which was filled with the hotel's toiletries.All of the reception staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. I would especially like to mention Susan, our housekeeper and Erna, our server at breakfast in the Ilima Restaurant who were two of the most accomodating women you could meet. Both made our stay even better. We will miss you both.We enjoyed our stay at the WIkiki Resort Hotel and would recommend it as a mid price, well located hotel.

This was my second time staying at this hotel. I love the location and the service. All the employees were extremely nice. I couldn't ask for anything more. I will be staying here again in the future.

Loved the location! One block away from the beach! Service was great! Enjoyed the slight view from our window of the beach. Service was accommodating and readily available to help. Very clean. Easy access.

Waikiki Resort was quite pleasant to stay Stafff were pleasant Resort was sort walk to beach close to all ships & restaurants The rooms were good & very clean We did have an issue in the bathroom & reported it to stafff it was addressed staight away which was very good Would gladly stay there again

The location is super convenient to the beach and shopping. The hotel staff with Branden and George are the BEST! Top notch customer service that Branden provided can't be beat. The open air lobby is beautiful. The rooms are clean and spacious. Nice balcony area too. The cleaning staff and the ladies downstairs are all awesome. I have stayed here before and will definitely be back. I tell all of my friends and customers about your hotel!

Prerequested for early check in due to traveling with small baby but got the keys at 3:15pm. Had to wait from 8:30am. Receptions only care about group check in. Individuals are treated as 2nd class citizens. First and last time staying there.

The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. They had just begun some renovations while we were there with the front lobby. The hotel is outdated in terms of decor and style but not a game changer for us since we only needed a place to sleep. Definitely a bargain being a block from the beach and a couple blocks from 236 Grocery ( way cheaper than ABC stores). We would stay again but perhaps something with bigger rooms if this hotel offered it. Felt crowded with two adults and two children. There aren't any microwaves but there is a small dorm fridge in each room.

This hotel gave me the satisfaction of customer service and service to my stay in O'ahu as a whole. While it's super close to the beach, it's also relevant to the city life in general, I.E. night clubs, restaurants, shopping and tourist attractions. I was welcomed and guided by a friendly staff who was super accommodating. In fact, Brandon at the front desk was my best help of all. Not only was he knowledgable about everything I wanted to do and see, but he ensured that it was easy for me to accomplish everything on both of those lists.

This hotel is very nice. The service was great. The only problem we had was the shower chair in our accessible room was not stable. My husband ended up using the balcony chair in the shower. They need to buy new shower chairs.

The hotel is within walking distance of many attractions in Waikiki. The room that I was staying in was kept clean. The extra services offered by the hotel was a bonus to the quality of the service offered. Even with the construction across the street, the room was quiet and I was near the elevator also.

I requested a later checkout due to the fact that my husband had a heart attack in Hawaii and we had a 7:30 departure from the airport. The management was very understanding and said that we could checkout whenever we wanted.

My partner and I arrived well before our check in time after a long flight and were met by the lovely Dee at the front desk. She went above and beyond, ensuring we had a room to check in too early, upgrading us on the spot! Facilities are everything you require! The hotel is in a fantastic location, so close to the beach but 1 street back from the hustle and bustle off the main street. All staff are friendly and happy to help. Free wifi was also a plus.Highly recommend and would return again :)

We had a great stay at this hotel. All of the staff were friendly and accommodating. Upon arriving to the hotel, Branden greeted us with a warm welcome and a smile. He quickly checked us in and answered any questions my family and I had. He offered us a crib for our baby to be sent up to our room. I didn't even know hotels offered baby cribs. Our room had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. The hotel location is perfectly next to the beach and shopping but just off the main strip so you don't hear the busy streets. Thank you Waikiki Resort Hotel for a wonderful stay and especially thank you to Branden for your awesome customer service and making us feel welcome. We will definitely use this hotel again in the future.

Very happy with the location, room and staff. The Expedia Desk in the lobby to set up adventures was helpful. Would recommend and return to this hotel. Great value. It was nice having a room on the higher floors, with an ocean view. Could see at the activities on Waikiki beach.

We had a great experience at the hotel. We have a toddler and our first room had a small stand up shower. I was debating whether to see if we could change rooms or not and before I called, the assistant manager called me to see if everything was okay. I told him the issue and the same day was able to change rooms for us. The all of the staff was friendly and helpful. The only thing that was a "negative" would be that the hotel is a little outdated. The location is great! A 2 min walk to the beach and all of the Waikiki restaurants and shopping centers are very close. We will definitely stay here again due to the courteous staff and location.

Arrived on time for check in and the room was ready to go. We had just spent a week on Kauai so were only in Waikiki for one night which would be spent dining and shopping so booked purely on price.The room was a little dated (but which ones aren't in Waikiki...) although clean and tidy. Bathroom could do with a bit of an upgrade with new vanity tops etc but overall a nice room for an overnight. A little on the small side, and we booked a city view room which was exactly that, but for people who complain about the view of other buildings there are always oceanfront hotels to be stayed in for 2-3 times the price.Booked online and received breakfast included in the price which was a decent typical American breakfast selection.Front desk guys were very helpful and polite though possibly a little too casual for some people in terms of chatting amongst themselves, but I've been in the industry and if it breaks up the boredom of a long shift and complaining guests, go for it.literally a 30 second walk from hotel to beach with good shopping and restaurants within strolling distance.Would I stay here again, definitely, as I probably wouldn't be inclined to stay in Waikiki for more than a couple of nights tops. If spending more than a few nights, I would probably consider one of the larger resorts.

They need a patio area for smokers. They have a lovely drop off area. Very close to the beach. Our friend was disabled and had difficulty getting a proper shower chair. The shower itself was great. Breakfast buffet was great.

We were very happy with our hotel stay. Price included a big buffet breakfast, free internet, a block from Waikiki Beach, clean rooms, underground hotel parking ($). We were able to take beach towels to Waikiki and able to leave our luggage with the bell check after checkout waiting for our flight.

Firstly, this hotel was a toss up between this one and another nearby. At the last minute, my gut told me to select Waikiki Resort Hotel, and I am glad I did. I had called reservations after I confirmed to request a special room. My wife has been going through recent challenges, and I wanted her to have a great experience, it being her first time in Oahu. They told me they would work to honor the request, but couldn't gaurantee. Understood. It was just a request.Lo and behold, when we checked in, they were able to accommodate my request! David was fantastic. He checked us in, was not only efficient, but worked to build a relationship. He was not only a great ambassador for the hotel, but for Hawaii in general. He also recommended two great places to eat and made adjustments to our reservation seamlessly, as we were able to extend our stay for a day. We didn't have to change our room, and got a better value than we would have changing hotels. He is a true hospitality professional.The hotel is in a great location, central to all things by the beach and is accessible to everything you'd want to do within a short walking distance. This hotel, in essence, is a renovated motel, but the service is well worth it when you combine the price. It is a great, great value.It would have received 5 stars but the concierge was a touch rude (supposedly set up a dinner reservation for us that was non-existent when we arrived. It was suspicious mainly because she unnecessarily cautioned us about not honoring the reservation we requested) and the young lady running breakfast was very efficient, but not super friendly (side note...if you have breakfast vouchers, tell her ahead of time or you will get scolded). These small instances were not enough derail our positive feelings regarding the hotel, David, and the team. I am a 15 year veteran of the hospitality field and was a corporate trainer for luxury hotels. I currently run my own hospitality and service consulting firm. Genuine hospitality is not easy to come by, and I am pretty adept and knowing the difference. You will find it here at Waikiki Resort Hotel. They care whether you really are enjoying your experience. Kudos!
user_name:
Kingleo61
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed 4 nights inthis hotel.This hotel very old. And very very noisy.Every day AM5:00, the noise wake up.Parking pass were not recognized after a day.The keys did not open at once.More than seven times had to be tried.Than open the door.I don't never never never visit again.This hotel ruined my trip.

Only stayed 1 night. Reception staff very helpful, organised early check in. Room was classed as standard - had 2 queen beds, all necessary amenities, ample space & balcony with a good view to beach. Location is great, close to beach, restaurants, bus service, shopping. Free DVD rental service & Wifi all available.Would not hesitate to stay again.

room was really good and comfortable, breakfast was really good, service was really good, you can rent a DVD for free, location was really good, easy to access to the beach, store, restaurant, shopping, bus stop

First of all, the room was too noisy. I could not sleep because I was noisy at night. The refrigerator was too small and I could not get a coat hanger. I could not dry my wet bathing suit because there was no laundry line.

This place was great it was a great experience staying here. We had a couple of problems but they were quick to fix them. I would definitely stay at this place again with my family when we return next year.

Bathrooms need a shower hanger or something to hold soap and shampoo very difficult to take a shower in. Hair dryer cord is too short to hang where it is and still be able to use it easily in front of mirror. Nice location, good view.

We stayed here for a family vacation with 2 smaller kids. PERFECT location to beach, shops and great service from the staff. Would definitely return in the future. The rooms are a little dated but the location and friendly staff made up for all of that!

The hotel is very clean and the staffs are very nice. The location is very convenient too. The breakfast is very tasty as well. It's only about 3 minutes walking to the beach. I will for sure to go back next time.

$15 accommodation fee was unfair. Would prefer to have used that money towards other activities on island. Those accommodations should be included in upfront price when initially paying for hotel. But location was nice

The Front Desk staff was great. One tip however, that we could take a bus toPearl Harbor and get there in 40 minutes. NOT!!!!! Not including waiting for 20 minutesfor the bus itself, the ride took 1 hour 20 minutes. We missed our scheduled tourbut fortunately the nice Park workers allowed us into the last group. And then a 1 hrand 25 minute ride back to resort area. Call Uber next time.

The staff were friendly & helpful. The rooms are old but the bed was comfy. We had a partial ocean view which was nice. Room was clean & therefore can't complain. The rooms were noisy as I don't think they're insulated well. I could hear the lift bell & the neighbours tv & doors slam.

Not a 4 or 5 star location to be sure, but a 3-3.5 at a price below nearly any competition in the area can't be ignored. We were looking for a solid place at a good price in a perfect location. Fit the bill to a T. Directly in the center of Waikiki, and only a block from the ocean. Rooms were nice, stores downstairs helpful for needed items, and bar did its job when we needed it to.

overall nice location...only minus is 25$ charge for parking...clean location...nice and friendly Staff...good for families ...very close to waikiki beach and food locations....most of visitors are from Korea and Japan..

I stayed here during my trip to Honolulu. Every aspect of this hotel met or exceeded my expectations. The room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was great. I was a day late arriving due to problems with the airlines. When I finally made it to the hotel, the nice lady at the front desk could see that I was miserable and upgraded me to a suite. A very kind gesture to help reset the tone of my trip. The hotel is a two minute walk to the beach, and there is plenty of food and beverage options within walking distance. I'm sure that there are more upscale hotels in Waikiki, but for the price this place can't be beat.

I went on a cruise of the Hawaiian islands. I stayed at this hotel for two nights - pre and post cruise. After the cruise we arrived at the hotel relatively early. Our room as ready and we were able to arrange extra time in the room with minimum charge due to late flight. Our flight was delayed 5.5 hours and the hotel gladly extended our time in the room without additional charge. Staff Dee Hoo, Connor and Branden were very accommodating pleasant and friendly.I must also mention Dennis who repeatedly took time to map out routes for us to find our way around the city. A special thanks to you Dennis. One downfall of this hotel is that is charges a $15.71 amenity fee. We had to pay this fee for each stay.

My husband and I, including our grandchildren enjoyed our stay!! Great breakfast buffet and great location!!Kids enjoyed the swimming pool and the DVD choice! Room worked well for all four of us! Thanks!!

We were looking for a hotel that was close to Waikiki Beach, restaurants, and shopping that was reasonably priced. Given the low price compared with hotels on the beach, we did not know what to expect. Aside from its fantastic location, the hotel was lovely. The reception area is large and well-decorated.Off to the side are both a gift shop and a small market. The rooms, while not particularly large, were adequate; since we spent so little time in them, the size was irrelevant. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean. Our grandson loved the balcony, and made us wish we had upgraded to an ocean-view room. However, even the city view, looking out toward the mountains, was very nice. The hotel provided beach towels (apparently standard in Hawaii), but we did not expect that service.The only downside was that evening hotel restaurant was Korean, which did not appeal to our grandchildren. However, there were numerous restaurants within walking distance.We considered this hotel to be a great bargain and highly recommend it.

Excellent service, excellent location, staff friendly, room clean and comfortable. Parking service available.Would love to see more food selection available in the restaurant.Highly recommend to my friends.

Our room was clean and nicely decorated. It was small but we had no trouble with the space for the 2 of us. Staff at the hotel were always friendly and helpful. We were only 1 block from the beach and very close to lots of shops and restaurants. It was convenient and I highly recommend it.

Location was great...2-3 minute walk to the beach and to the main street. McD/Burger King/ABC Stores all conveniently located. A bit noisy in the morning even with windows closed...can hear garbage trucks clearing the bins and street noise.

This hotel is in a great location and our room had a really nice view of Waikiki Beach. All of the staff were really friendly and helpful. The only down side was that the soundproofing of the room was not good enough to shut out external noises and being in a city there were quite a lot of loud noises throughout the night.

So close to everything! My only small comment would be to have the pool/beach towels more accessible. I had to bring my daughter in the stroller down to the basement, and only the one elevator went down that far. Minor detail to a great week.

As a guest at the hotel for nearly 10 days my fellow traveller and i were welcomed by some less than friendly, arrogant and rude staff members at front desk on numerous occassions, particularly a young blonde man. The man at bell desk that assisted us on arrival and departure was delightful and accommodating. Rooms looked aged and nothing special but housekeeping were amazing and meticulous. Location is handy and close to beach and main street but lots of work was happening at opposite hotel so some construction noise on that side of hotel.

Our room on Level 6. Noisy garbage trucks with banging and reversing noises from 3am til dawn. When I mentioned to the staff on Reception they just laughed at me. Not impressed. Higher levels might be ok. No bell service whatsoever - had to lug our own luggage up and down stairs as the front entrance was being renovated.

Overall good hotel. The beds were very soft. He elevator was very fast (no floor 13) (photo 1) covering 1 floor per second. My 3 problems : 1: bathtub is VERY small. Hard to move when your taking a shower. (Photo 2)2: I was told the balcony view was of the ocean. Instead, it was of a construction site. (Photo 3)3: the bathroom door had air vents, but they pointed in an upward direction, which made it feel weird. (Photo 4)Overall, I would come back here if I ever visit Oahu again. Thank you Waikiki Resort Hotel for having this good hotel.

A good value. Close to the beach. Near great shopping. Nicely decorated with comfortable room. Good food in the restaurant. Comfortable bed. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The staff is friendly in keeping our luggage for us to take tour.

It was good to me..Someday I would like to stay again.My wife and my children also satisfied with everything..room breakfast even parking..Price also was perfect..Thank you for your free upgrade..Korean manager thanks a lot..

Very good value, great location, good stay. OUTSTANDING SERVICE...
