We stayed for 9 days and were having some issues unrelated to the hotel, George (from the front desk), helped us above and beyond his job description, solving our issue entirely. Thank you so so much George and we are so grateful. Truly dedicated customer service is hard to find these days. So thankful and would absolutely recommend.

Dave, the afternoon front desk agent checked us in, he was very pleasant, helpful and knowledgeable. We are very very satisfied to stay here, and why worry for a pool when the beach is a block away?? This hotel has met our spectation

We stayed for 4 nights at the Waikiki resort in April. The location was excellent and we had a sea view of the beach (would recommend this type of room). Rooms were basic, but very clean. The breakfast buffet was nice and the pool was a nice change from the beach in the late afternoon. Pool was very clean. Would stay again.

We have been return visitors to this hotel for a number of years. Very quiet, safe and while the furnishings are not "5 star" they are just fine and would be above what many similar priced rentals would be. Things have been well maintained. The staff are very helpful, when we have needed someone to help us with our room safe, it took less than 5 minutes. The pool area is quiet and clean. The restaurant on the main floor has a great breakfast buffet and separate menu. Very highly recommended.

Waikiki Resort Hotel is close to the beach, and is a good value, with clean, nicely decorated, comfortable rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially George at the front desk, who told us about the local restaurant where we ended up eating.

Not a complete ocean view but I was lucky enough to get a partial ocean view. The hotel is very clean, and has friendly staff. My only complaint was the pool was kinda cold and a out small. Two family of kids took the whole pool up. Other then that, I enjoyed my stay. I love the easy access to street vendors, stores and the beach is only 1 block away. One thing to definitely mention, at check in they give you a card for free DVD rentals, I have never seen that before and thought it was cool. I would definitely recommend this hotel! Our room was on the 15th floor.
user_name:
Christina C
Staten Island, New York

review_body: I stayed at this hotel long ago with success, and now I stayed there again just for one night with my Road Scholar group. It was the same hotel: good service, clean rooms, fast elevator, many amnenities, and fair prices. And so close (1 block) to Waikiki Beach!I would most definitely stay there again, hoping that when I do, the current construction in front of the hotel will have been completed.

Although the staff was very welcoming and provided excellent service, the rooms did not meet the description provided in your advertisements. We were very happy with the location, but had hoped for better accomodations.

Hotel was quite nice. Respectful staff helped at every opportunity. Hotel emanated Hawaiian nostalgic feel from the furniture, stained glass paintings, plants and lovely artwork. Airy room on 15th floor, 3 elevators. Pool towels were nice. Mini balcony overlooking city, noisy during day with construction.Limited lighting for bath.

This hotel is not the fanciest hotel, but it is nice and very clean. Very good location only 1 block to the beach. Great restaurants and shopping within walking distance. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. Nice restaurant to catch breakfast and lunch, very reasonably priced also. Nice pool area, but sadly no hot tub. Very quiet at night and could not hear noise from anyone next to us. This would be a great place for a family to stay.

The Waikiki Resort Hotel is a great hotel located on Waikiki Beach near the Honolulu Zoo. From the hotel you can walk straight to the shopping strip 50m away which then stretches for about 1.5km. An ideal location to the beach 70m and a key pick up point by most of the tour companies.

Close to the beach and to the park. Short walk to great shopping and restaurants. Large attractive lobby with friendly help. No wait for elevators. Very quiet rooms. We were on the top floor with an ocean view...worth the little extra money. This is a great value in Waikiki. Special shout out to Branden at Reception...I had a lot of requests and he was very patient and helpful.

We went on a family trip and all 15 of us loved the Waikiki Resort. The location is great. The price is unbeatable. The service, staff, cleanliness, convenience.....honestly everything about the Waikiki resort was outstanding. The only complaint I heard from anyone while we were there was that the pool was only open until 7:00. I will never look for a different place to stay when we go to Oahu. The breakfast buffet was very well priced and the food was good. It's also open for lunch with good prices and good food. Do yourself a favor and stay here!Since we went as a group we needed several rooms. Robin and Sherrie was awesome to deal with over the phone and made the booking and accommodations so easy for me. I mentioned it was my 16th wedding anniversary and they remembered that as well. With as many people as they deal with that was very impressive to me. Great customer service is hard to find now days but they nailed it.

The Waikiki Resort Hotel is located in Waikiki, about a block from some beautiful Waikiki beaches. It hosts a Korean BBQ restaurant as well as another restaurant. The hotel pool closes early, but with the ocean so close I suppose it doesn't matter. The view from our room was mostly of other high rises, with a small sliver of ocean visible between buildings. No major standouts, but it is a clean place to sleep.

Breakfast Buffett was excellent! Parking was underground & wifi worked perfectly.Free movie dvd's was a surprising bonus.Our room had a view from the balcony of Waikiki beach also. Like the fact of being close to Waikiki beach but away from the hustle and bustle of it

Great location! Very clean hotel, friendly staff, outstanding customer service and amazing Kamaa'ina discounts. The breakfast buffet was great, huge variety of food and breakfast meats. I also can't wait to try their Korean restaurant.

The staff was very helpful & friendly. Ron, the concierge was particularly helpful in planning our various tours. We also enjoyed our balcony & refrigerator. A microwave would be nice. We also liked being close to the beach and various tour buses.

Great location! Although rooms need some renovation the lobby is pretty and staff is helpful. Breakfast was fine--not included in . Loved being so close to the action on Waikiki Beach without the noise. Rooms need a makeover.

Great location just off the waikiki beach and walking distance from all areas on the beach. room nice and clean and the cleaning staff does a great job. nice shops and free videos on the first floor. our room had a refrigerator that was great for breakfast. one problem was the parking. they charged me for 2 days of parking when I only parked one day at the hotel. so that was not cool.

House keeping threw away refrigerator contents that we accidentally forgot less than an hour after checkout. They could have called us prior. We called soon after and was told what happened. Those items were purchased on Kauai and were intended to be taken back to Florida.

. Did not like the noise of nearby demolition, nor the busses standing outside with motors running. The garbage trucks with the peeping at 3am was annoying. Breakfast was boring...would suggest a change of menu for those who are not fond of lettuce greens and soup in the morning. Having to long into wifi every day was a bit of a challenge.Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would likely return if the occasion arose. Would recommend to others.

The room was nice, and the staff was always accommodating! location was perfect walking distance to all of the popular things to do in the area. The only issue was there was no fitness center, you had to pay to use the 24 Hr Fitness nearby....Check in is at 3PM - I arrived at 1130AM, so I sat around for a good three plus hours - which wasn't a fun time, try to arrange for an early check in if possible! if you plan on arriving early!Otherwise everything was great! totally recommend this hotel/resort to anyone visiting this island!Front desk staff member Nancy - was truly an amazing lady! wanted to give her a shout out for all of her hard work, and above superior customer service!!

It was my first time to Hawaii, where I met a client. I booked via a travel site where you are given a "discount" (that maybe everyone gets!)Even though the hotel must have been one of the first high-rise hotels around Waikiki, maybe in the 60s or 70s, there is a friendly atmosphere, and the staff go out of their way to make your stay pleasant. My flight from Japan came in early, and staff managed to get me the room before ordinary check-in.The building has some mid 20th century charm, but everything is well maintained, and there are the contemporary electronics and an OK wifi set up. Basically, everything you need for staying short term. The location is great; however, you should know that later developments built up around the hotel, which obstruct what must have outstanding views at one time. (I didn't mind, since I don't stay in a place to be sitting all the time in a hotel room.) I know a downstairs restaurant is sometimes important, but the one available was a little too crowded for me with tourists who seemed to be on a package. Also, Waikiki, like many southern Japanese cities, are magnets for Far East Asian tourists, and sometimes I feel there can be cultural misunderstandings when they are staying with someone who is not also on whatever group they are with.Location is really good, it's just one block north of the main avenue, and three beaches are within close walking distance. There is also a supermarket about 8 minutes away on foot, if you are gluten-free or don't eat restaurant food.Sequels are never quite the original, but I would definitely stay at Waikiki Resort, just for the great service and atmosphere.(P.S. the hotel across the way had some construction going on, which may be noticeable depending on what side of the hotel you are on. I noticed it, but it was not a nuisance.)

Don't bother coming here as it is in referb. If you want noise with your breakfast this is the place. Constantly noisy 5 days a week. The beaches are the best I have seen but and a big but is the construction work.

Very nice place to stay and I had a nice time with very pleasant service.But thr room was not really modern style.If they changed some equipment changed it would bea very nice hotel.Location is really good

The staff were amazing and so friendly. Travelling with young kids is hard and having to wait around for check in at 3pm would of been tough but the staff managed to organise us to check in at 10am. They had the laundromat downstairs in the basement which was very handy too. The location is very close to the beach.

Although our room looked a little tired [ rotting wood around the bottom of the bathroom door jamb and crazed hand basin with the crazing stained black and dirty looking] we found the hotel very convenient to beach, restaurants, shops, etc. Very obliging staff: front desk, cleaners , restaurant workers. Too bad the noisy work was going on at the building over the road but only bothered us when we were trying to rest a few times during workday hours. To avoid this ask not to have a city view room. All in all, satisfied with our choice.

My wife and I have been staying with you for the past few years. We like to come in February and then again in October. We love the room, especially the really comfortable bed. Everyone is terrific, from the people who clean the rooms to the restaurant employees to the hotel managers. Everyone is very nice, and very responsive to any requests. The location is terrific, just a hundred feet or so from the beach, and we plan to continue staying at the Waikiki Resort Hotel.

Best thing about this hotel is that it's so close to beach, ABC's stores, and tons of restaurants everywhere cheap and expensive. Hotel rooms were perfect, showers were a little small but otherwise had everything you could possibly need. Hotel has a DVD machine in the lobby and DVD players in the room which came in handy for those days you just want to chill. Fridge and safe in the room. Towels also available in the Basement floor. Would be good to have chairs that you can take to the beach.

I think that the Waikiki resort was a great location but my one concern was the incredibly small bathroom. Shower was a small square and a tiny toilet was there also. They also have a counter outside the bathroom were the sink is located. They have very comfortable 2 double beds and the size was perfect for my family. We were in room 717 and it had a beach front view with an average size terrace. There was a building in front of us but you could still see water. Over all I think that except for the location and the beds it was ok.

Honolulu hotels are expensive and this was a cheaper one. Well worth the money. Just as good as Hyatt place and is cheaper. We did a Priceline bid and requested a high floor. Well we ended up getting a ocean view on the 17th floor! It was great. A little older but so is everything in Hawaii.

Nice clean rooms. Always welcoming and friendly staff. If you're looking for a reasonably priced stay in a prime location just a block black from the boulevard this is ideal. I like the retro feel of the hotel decor - some may call it dated but I think it adds character. Room was always clean and when I asked to be moved room as we were in a twin Scott at the front desk was very accommodating and sorted it out straight away. I wouldn't pay extra for an ocean view as the hotel is dwarfed by larger structures on every side. Beds are great and rooms have all major amenities. Our room this time didn't have a bath but some of them do. Worth noting if this is important to you. Liked the addition of the DVD rental. Perfect if it's raining! All brand new releases. Nice touch. There's a convenience store in the hotel with everything you need and of course an ABC store in every corner. We've never dined at the restaurant but there's so much more in close vicinity you don't need the hotel to provide you with this. Some investment could be made at the pool area. It's always been empty every time we've stayed. Yes the ocean is just a stones throw away but it would be great to have a place to grab a cocktail in the veranda. The general area looks quite run down. Even something as simple as upgrading the sun loungers would make a big difference so as it's not wasted space. Not a big issue for us though - just an idea!We are repeat visitors so it would be nice if breakfast was offered as an incentive to book again. Buffet on offer was a perfect mix of Asian and Western cuisine. I think this hotel is owned by Korean airlines so you'll see lots of their staff staying. Would book again. Always a pleasant stay and location is a winner. Also worthwhile to note that MacDonalds is right on the block in front - Waikiki is expensive so it's nice to be able to pop in before a bus trip for something reasonably priced.

We have visited Oahu 3 times now & stayed here all 3 as the location is perfect! The staff are so friendly & the rooms are always very clean. The hotel sits a block back from the boulevard so your minutes away from Waikiki Beach & is right in the heart of Waikiki so your never far from a restaurant or convenience store. If touring there is a pick up point which most tour operators pick up from behind the Hyatt hotel which is just opposite Waikiki Resort on the same street so no long walks. We only ate at "Ilima" for our buffet breakfast but they have a Korean restaurant called "Seoul Jung" which I'm told is very popular & if certainly seemed that way at night:) We will stay here again in 2018:)!

Another great trip to the Waikiki Resort. From the time we made a booking for our room Sherri and Ho Jin in reservations took care of us. The familiar faces at the front desk Branden, Nancy, Dave, George and Suzi were great just like every other time we have gone.The Staff in the Ilima cafe are the best without a doubt. Erna, Park Gil and Jin are just a treat to see every morning when we went for breakfast And thanks to Dennis Trent and Leo at the bell desk. Housekeeping always does a great job.. And the general Manager Glenn for remembering us from past visits. It's a great hotel in a great location for a great price.

The location is great -- just a couple of short blocks to Waikiki beach and near a lot of restaurants. The hotel itself is OK -- nothing exceptional but it's fine. There is no view of the ocean. The beds are comfortable. The rooms are on the small size but big enough. Rooms have free wi-fi which works about the same as most hotel room wi-fi (i.e., not great). There is a nice breakfast buffet, but it isn't free. The pool is not heated and can be extremely cold.

The hotel is in an excellent location, one block back from the beach. All services were provided to a very high standard and staff were very friendly and obliging. The buffet breakfast was extensive and of excellent quality.

The room was in average condition but for the price (an online special) that's to be expected. I appreciated the free DVD service, cordial maid service. The view from this room was of other hotels. Again, for the price, that is understandable.
user_name:
Michael S
San Francisco, United States

review_body: Nice Hotel. Nice location. Kind front desk. Everything was good except 1st floor restaurant. The waitress didn't excuse for her mistakes. The bill was strange that they bill me tip twice at first. I don' t know why.

We stayed in this hotel 2 nights prior to our NCL Hawaiian cruise and 5 nights after the cruise. Lobby area is nice, small outdoor pool we didn't use. We preferred to go to Waikiki beach only one block away. Great location, walking distance to everywhere in the heart of Waikiki, nearby restaurants, beach, shopping mall, public transportation. Most hotel in Waikiki are getting old, the room is very spacious, shower only, two double beds, it could use some updating. We are on the 7th floor high enough not to hear street noise with private balcony. Breakfast was good nothing special. Overall we have a vey nice stay in this hotel especially for the location.

We stayed here for one week while on a Road Scholar program. Staff were very helpful. They came immediately to fix an air conditioner that was leaking. Our rooms were kept clean and comfortable. Beds were comfortable; not old and saggy. Good service if we had questions about restaurants, shopping, etc.

The guy that checked us in was cool and it's a short walk to the beach and if you get the right room you can see the beach parking is expensive but there is no where else to park overall a good clean place to stay

I expected more. The room was small and cramped for myself, husband, and two daughters. The description says that it sleeps 4 however one of my kids chose to sleep on the floor because the beds were too small. (floor space was also very cramped). My Daughter also was hoping to have popcorn and watch a movie however there was not a microwave! I do not know if this was stated in the description, but every hotel i have ever been in has had one. She was very disappointed. also, some of the staff was nice and helpful while some seemed annoyed that we had a question.

service was good.location was very good.room is good enough, want to have bath tub.small refrigerator needed.explain how to control alarm clock. it has been set up already. did have to struggle to stop it.

I posted a stellar review in Expedia and thought it was the hotel's but here it is again..... FANTASTIC TIME @ Waikiki Resort Hotel and ALL started with wonderful George at front desk!!!!! Give that man a raise or promotion, he exuded the true spirit of Aloha, very warm and genuine. Lobby was very nice, very "welcoming" open and spacious with pleasant breeze. So many things to do, free dvd rentals, 2 restaurants with discount price with use, our 7th flr corner room had beautiful view of ocean. Loved the cozy kitchenette, extremely efficient! (Only setback was clogged "lua", but maintenance fixed immediately.) Wished we had more days there, everything about WRH was great!!! We stayed at another major hotel chain, several streets over, for same price..... no comparison... Waikiki Resort gave us more for our money!
user_name:
Sina S
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: We loved our stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel. The hotel is located in a great spot with the beach being only a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The concierge staff were particularly helpful and friendly. Even though we only stayed here for 2 nights, Ray and Leo remembered our names and greeted us warmly upon each return to the hotel. They had the true aloha spirit!!

The location of this hotel is incredible, just steps from the beach and attractions with great views from the ocean side. The room was comfortable, if a bit dated. But do NOT stay here in the next few months if you are a light sleeper. The hotel next door is under massive construction, and I was shocked to be woken up at 4:30am with a constant stream of noise. The front desk did not mention this when I checked in, and was completely unconcerned when I brought it up at checkout. I got a really good deal for the room on Orbitz that seemed too good to be true, and now I think I know why. Offering a few cheap earplugs and an apologetic note in the rooms on arrival would go a long way, even if there is nothing that can done about the construction schedule. It seems a city code violation to start so early in the morning. If they were concerned about their guests' experience, they should complain on their behalf to the city.

Me and my wife visited Waikiki on last May 2015, actually this was my second visit to Waikiki, but this was very special because i celebrated my birthday at Wakiki. The hotel is cleaned, helpful staffs and within walking distance to stores, resto and Waikiki Beach

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 days and we had a really great experience. It had been our 2nd time staying in this hotel. The rooms are clean and you get a really Hawaiian feeling while in the hotels. The staff are really friendly and resourceful. You can get beach towels and the room is always clean and organized. Also, the location of the hotel is really convenient since is just a little less than a block away from the beach so you can just walk straight to the white sand. Also, all the stores are really near by so you can just walk. There are plenty of ABCs stores near by so if you need anything you can just walk by.

Stayed here back in September 2015 with my husband. Our second time in Honolulu. The hotel was in a good location, not far back from Waikiki beach. Our room was clean and comfortable. Slightly dated, but I believe most hotels in Waikiki are. Would happily stay here again.

Loved the location! I wish there could've been a hot tub at the pool! Also, there could've been another breakfast buffet option that was free for hotel guests. The ilema breakfast buffet was not worth $30 for two people.

My family and I had a wonderful stay here. All of the people their were extremely helpful and friendly. How can you beat being less then a block from the beach. Awesome place to stay. this was my second stay here and I look forward to coming back.

Location is the key to Waikiki Resort, great staff. Received an upgrade after notifying we were on our honeymoon. Great big room, king size bed. Breakfast in the morning was awesome and helped start the day. Recommend this place highly

The comfort of this hotel was great. Beds were soft and linen top notch. The towels were high quality and very absorbent. Even the quality of the toilet paper was great. My family was appreciative of the soaps and shampoos because they were very high quality. We travel frequently and found the Breakfast put together by the chefs was excellent having a variety of American dishes and Asian inspired Polynesian dishes also. Parking was easy and Open air lobby very comfortable with unique furniture that followed the theme of Wakiki. The only thing thing I found wrong was the business center was out of order so printing services and computers were unavailable. Great Staff, Great food, Great price!!

Check in staff was very friendly & helpful with suggestions for the area. Bathrooms a little small but nice. Beds were comfortable. Location was convenient to everything I needed. Parking was close by. No unexpected surprises at checkout.

I spent a week here in Dec 16/Jan 17 and had a lovely time. The hotel is set back one block from the beach but my ocean view was very good (they also have city view rooms). I arrived at 830 in the monring and checkin wasn't until 3, but they were able to get me in by about 11 and in the meantime got me a pass to use the pool. I was a bit too tired from the flight to use it but I appreciated the gesture. The room wifi is included in the resort fee, I found that a bit confusing on the website as it kept mentioning a fee but didn't mention what it was. The breakfast buffet was good and the staff were attentive. This is at the DIamond Head/Honolulu Zoo end of Waikiki and very near bus stops, Waikiki trolley and lots of amenities. I'd happily come back again. This isn't the fanciest place in town but it is very nice and good value for money.

Good hotel very close to Waikiki Beach. Small room, narrow double beds. Make sure to bok room with oceanview so you don't get a room on the lower floors where noisy tour buses might be disturbing. Very many korean guests

We booked this hotel through the Jetstar website. Hotels in Waikiki at Christmas are very expensive and this hotel was good value for money . The pool is very clean and is a lovely escape from the busy beach which is a few steps away.

Chose this hotel primarily for the reasonable balance between location (close to shops and entertainment) and price. One only has to walk out the front entrance and two or three minutes later you will hit the beach!Stayed for two weeks with family.From this end of the Waikiki beach strip you have to swim out a bit before you see the beautiful Diamond Head. Alternatively, it's about five or ten minutes walk along the beach (towards the Royal Hawaiian Hotel) before you can see Diamond Head from the shore. At this end there were some cute schools of fishes in ankle-deep to waist-deep water (I saw about four different kinds). No waves at this end, so good for the kiddies, oldies, or just the super relaxed. The less good: there's not a lot of restaurant variety in close proximity, other than Eggs N Things, McDonalds, Burger King and takeaway places. It was difficult to find half-way healthy food without having to walk at least twenty minutes or more along the main strip. However, the Korean restaurant at the hotel was great. Hotel breakfast buffet was pretty standard - no complaints. Overall we were happy with our city view floor on level 17. Alas, at this stage of my life I cannot yet afford an ocean view hotel in Hawai'i. Next time!! Special mention to the Filipino maintenance man (I wish I could remember his name). He was super friendly and hospitable (he helped us with setting up internet and fixed a faulty light). He would always greet us kindly - his bubbly personality is an asset to the hotel. P.s. Wifi was generally fine. We were instructed to use the wifi from neighbouring rooms because ours "didn't have a modem". Had to reconnect everyday, but no big deal.

Had a great stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel, we ended up coming back and staying again after a few nights at Maui. George checked us in both times and was exceptional - he was quick to get us into our rooms and provided us with some great advice on what to do and where to go locally, if we ran a hotel, we would hire him! Thanks George and Waikiki Resort Hotel, we will be back.

Reading the other reviews I was nervous to stay here, but it's such a nice hotel, maintenance always there when you need it (not that we did, we just had a drip from our sink that they fixed). Not tacky like other reviews say. Lovely location, a 5 minute walk from the beach with an open breezy entrance. Luggage storage while waiting for your pickup, and it's free for 2 hours. Only thing is the restaurants are expensive in the hotel but there's plenty around to choose from.

Comfortable, convenient, and exactly what we wanted during our stay in Waikiki. Our stay represented the first part of our honeymoon, and though my husband was referred to as "Mrs" in the welcome card left in the room, it's the thought that counts.

Everyone involved in this hotel was extremely helpful and sincere. The experience with them could not have been better. Housekeepers worked hard, front desk always smiled, bell desk was friendly, food was excellent, the gift shop had many great buys at reasonable prices. Highly recommended.

The hotel overall has a very poor conditions. We had to change our room 3 times for 3 nights stay at the hotel. First room was too smelly. second room was upgraded to a suite behind the elevator, terrible bed, bathroom and too noisy. Third room was upgraded to even a better suite, but bed was still terrible. Location however was great. Breakfast at the hotel was not good.

Location, the staff, the view, the room wouldve been great for the price but there was a small roach outside our door when we arrived and another in our bathroom on our last day. Not sure I'd stay here again because of that.

This hotel was every reasonable for the location. I was looking for some place to stay, where I could shop and do some excursions before the Pride of the Americas Norwegian cruise. This worked for my pre cruise days in Honolulu.

So, the location is great. A block off the beach and sandwiched between 9 ABC stores. The lobby is pretty nice, airy, open and comfortable. Then you get to your room.I'm pretty sure KAL owns and operates this hotel and it shows. Let me ask you- when was the last time you were on a commercial airliner and the bathroom was clean and roomy? Your seat had more than enough room? The staff was friendly, accommodating and actually accomplished what you asked them to do? That my friend is the WRH. Safe, but just enough to meet requirements. Clean, but just enough to pass inspection. Roomy depending on your definition.I had good experiences from Dave and Brendon at the front desk and Leo at bell. Housekeeping did a fine job of taking care of us. I got the impression from all staff that they would like to do more for you but they knew it was pointless to ask or to try.There are a lot of other choices in this part of town. Choose a hotel that operates like a hotel and not a 15 story airplane.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Good service with beach towels and access to laundromat in the basement. Nice breakfast buffet. The rooms were very quiet, but a bit worn down. Overall a very nice stay.

Great location close to shops and the beach. The rooms are in dire need of a remodel. The bathroom is small and cramped. No drawers for toiletries. Does not have a bathtub just a small shower stall like an RV. No shelves in shower just had to keep shampoo on the floor. Wi-Fi did not work.

The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were well equipped and clean. The views were limited by high rise hotels and apartments around the site but we could see the sea. Traffic and construction noise was disturbing from 4:30 am but that's Waikiki for you.

I had 40,000 Korean airlines miles to use before they expired. Stayed her with my wife for a couple nites. Overall blah. Had miles enough for breakfast one day too. Buffet was junk kine food. Staff at desk acted like I was a thief using my miles instead of money for room. Get this I wouldn't stay here at half your room price. Careful leaving the door on you lanai open, da pigeons come in!

The manager and check in desk made every effort to make our stay a pleasant one.The manager went out of his way to help us when we had some internet issues and in fact gave us his tablet to use.The service and location to the beach exceeded all expectations.

Every single staff member was incredible! You felt welcome and had a lot of truly helpful advice about how to get to places or what to see. The bellhops were kind and helpful most of all. The two rooms we stayed in were very different! The first was very small, the door hit the toilet and wouldn't even shut all the way for privacy and the shower was very small! The second was slightly bigger, but we had to call for toilet paper in the middle of the night when we realized they didn't leave the typical second role (talk about an embarrassing issue). The free movie rental was nice. I would not choose to stay at this hotel again, but want to say again how kind and helpful the staff were!

Hotel was one block from Waikiki beach, although we only spent one day actually on the beach. Tourist shopping and restaurants were nearby too. For what we paid for our room it was worth the price. We had an upgraded room with a partial view of the ocean and Diamond Head too. The room was clean and relatively up to date. The staff was friendly and professional. Since our room faced west there was an issue of noise at 5:30 a.m. from the garbage truck and tour buses on the street below. The hotel can't control this but it was rather annoying. For the most part the stay was enjoyable at this hotel and would recommend it for the price.

We stayed here from 11/25/16 until 12/3/16. We enjoyed the hotel a lot. The room was nice but right next to the elevator and for 2 nights that is all we heard at night. We told them about it and they moved our room which was a partial view of the ocean and a way from the elevator. They were very accommodating to us as soon as we brought that to their attention. The room was clean and the balcony lovely. The hotel was close to the beach a short 1 1/2 blocks walking distance and very safe. It's location was the biggest plus. There was even a Mcdonald's on the next block by the beach. The beach was close and we loved just sitting there watching the surfers, swimmers, blue waters and beautiful sunsets. You can't go wrong with this hotel. We had the breakfast buffet included in our reservations and it was great.The food was good and a lot of variety. We even ate things we never would have eaten at home. We also liked Mr Park in the Ilima Restaurant. He was so kind and always remembered us each morning with a smile. He really made us feel welcomed. After staying for a week at the hotel we came back after our cruise for one night before we left for our flight home. We felt like we were coming back home. You can't go wrong with this hotel. Also the buses for transportation were right down the street. You can take a certain bus for $2 and they take you all the way to the flea market at the stadium or the Mall. The last night we got a room on the 18th floor corner room it was great. Thanks for the wonderful 45th anniversary vacation in Hawaii!

Everyone super nice and helpful. My husband needed and doctor and the staff was very supportive. The restaurant has an excellent breakfast with friendly service. The hotel lobby is modern. The hallways are a little out-dated. The rooms are fine. We did not have an ocean view but we still had fun sitting on the balcony and watching people. It's very convenient to the beach and good restaurants and shopping. The tour buses come right to the hotel. We would certainly stay here again.

Korean is a good hotel to visit and have a chance next time, to visit again.The best point was able to communicate, my poor English.I want to highly recommend to a friend of the hotel. Hope to develop even more in the future over other hotel.

Stay with families during 6nights with high quality of service. Especially, Ilima resturant, MR.Park is really kind and nice who served in high quality and would like to deliver big appreciation his service. Distance is really good to Waikiki and so clean and safe. Want to back again in near future with you!

We went to Hawaii for vacation and to visit family. We chose the hotel because it's close to the beach and my father-in-law. The hotel was clean and the service was great. We had a partial ocean view and loved sitting on the balcony watching the water. We would recommend this hotel and definitely stay there again.

We stayed overnight, but enjoyed our brief stay. Our room was on the 16th floor and we enjoyed our balcony with a skyscraper and ocean view. The check in was smooth and the staff was friendly. We would recommend this hotel.

Stayed 2 nights with family of 5. The family room adjacent to the lift so it was a bit noisy but we got used to it. I believe all the family rooms are adjacent to the lift so keep this inmond if you are booking. We also had a standard double room on the same floor. It was cheaper for our family than other hotels in the vicinity. It was good to be able to go to the beach and come back for lunch then go out again. Lots of restuarants around. We didnt try the restaurant and cafe on site but the menu in the cafe looked reasonably priced and would be good if you didnt want to go hunting for food with hungry children. The cafe is only open for breakfast and lunch. The other restuatant is korean -I like korean food but it seemed quite expensive compared to other korean restaurants. Overall great location and price but avoid the family room if you are sensitive to noise.

Staff was not friendly- especially front staff at night shift. Rest room was so tiny. However this hotel is in very good location close to waikiki beach, famouse local dinings, bus stops and ABC stores. Worth to stay with reasonable price.

Very good location, very close to Waikiki, good value, but remodeling needed, dirty carpets etc. recommended for budget travelers, first floor restaurant is great, but the second floor Korean restaurant has horrible service, specialty for Korean group tours,

The Waikiki Resort Hotel is awesome close to the beach and shopping. The staff are all awesome , helpful and friendly . My husband and I keep coming here, year after year it's in a very convenient location. It has a nice swimming pool no hot tub though. We wish it had one, but maybe one day. Thank you Waikiki Resort Hotel and staff and see you next year 2017

Enjoyable stay, nice clean room,one block or less than 1 minute's walk to beech. The reason im only giving this a 3* instead of 4* Is the issue above with poor wifi (only in reception) @ times!!! I went up twice & saw/found out the front desk had pulled (removed the main cable)!!!!! Then they have the sauce to charge $10 USD per day for this limited service!!!! main issue for "us" were had to check out @ 11am OK, thou flight departing was 11.30pm. Asked several times if we could extend room. Requested to enquire on departure day. Again enquired a lovley lady went into the mangers office (closed room) she did try her best, thou I was advised all rooms are fully booked, then "we" have available room's!!!!! Thou can not extend room for a few hours, will have to pay full 24 (day price) $250 USD OMG. What a complete tissue of lies!!!!!! Sorry once they have had ur hard erned monies & then the customer can go. Sorry guys. we flet very let down, had to sneak around hotel & pool area, could not even use the toilets!!!!!!! Poor Service..

The hotel was clean & staff was friendly. The AC in the room ould've been colder... maybe servicing was neeed? Rooms could use a little renovation, and a fresher look. Overall, it was decent and it was costly friendly for the kamaainas (locals), half off of parking was great & discounts for their restaurants were a plus!

no WiFi-contacted office three times and no one was able to connect it- never stayed in a hotel that had such poor WiFi.. and no one knew how to fix the problem.Terrible Problem as we needed it!!!! POOR service.

Location is great a block from Waikiki Beach. The lobby is open air and well appointed. But once you step out of the elevator on the room floors, it's very plain and bland. Room was ok size, bathroom was split (shower/toilet in one room, sink outside of that room). Bed was comfortable enough. Was nice to have the balcony. We did eat lunch at the hotel restaurant on the lobby level using our 20% discount they gave us at check-in, which made it very reasonably priced...less than $9 for a burger and fries. All staff we encountered were friendly. We went outside to check out the pool on the 2nd level. Small, but functional. No great views of anything. Would probably stay here again.

Decent budget range hotel near Waikiki Beach. Rooms and bathrooms are small but clean. Our reservation came with a free breakfast for two which made the price paid for our reservation worth it. Staff were friendly and accommodating. If you can get a pent house room, ask for it - views of waikiki are great!

Very well run hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. There was a Korean breakfast included in price. My partner and I chose not to eat breakfast.The room we opted for was a partial ocean view and the view was pretty O.K. Good piece of Waikiki beach visible.The room was a good size and had two double beds.(bit small and narrow) Good size balcony.The room was very clean and well maintained each day. There are two lifts operating.There is also a rooftop pool (surrounds a bit sterile) but a good size and plenty of sun lounges available. Towels available to take to pool and beach. The hotel is one block back from beach. Would stay here again. As Aussies we like our boutique coffee (hate Starbucks) And I found a little coffee kiosk across the road from the hotel which made not fantastic but certainly quite adequate coffee. (Honolulu Coffee) Also fantastic garlic shrimp in the evening served just out front.

Staff are friendly. Our room was always cleaned early. We were 1 block from the beach, with a good choice shops and restaurants close by. We had a suite on the 16 floor with 2 balconies. Well placed for The Bus and Trolley stops. Nice pool area on the second floor, and laundry room with coin operated machines in the basement/car park. There is also a sundry store in the hotel. We would stay here again.

We were on Vacation for my wife my daughter and my niece there were insects in the rooms and in the showers crawling along the wall small baby roaches. We also experienced noises above us and below us it was as if someone drilling through the walls we were told later that it was pipes the room next to me and the room below me were also complaining. I was at the front desk talking to a receptionist on duty and another person came up and he preferred to take care of the person that came up as I was registering that complaint the service is very poor

On the plus side: USB chargers in the rooms, friendly and accommodating staff and clean environment. Minus? The extremely carelessness with with the staff that handles breakfast handles plates and silverware. The whole banging and moving plates around can be quite unbearable. I found that to be quite unprofessional.
I stayed waikiki resort second timeBut this time I feel so noise at the night The other things are very good. It near location from waikiki beach and other famous placeBreakfirst is normal taste Bye

We stayed only one night here, and will never return and wouldn't recommend it to friends. The room is very dated. shower box is very very small, I'm size samll but barely can turn my body around without touching the shower curtain. Room is not typely clean and the hair dryer is not good at all, I couldn't dry my hair, finally gave up on it. But the worst things are the sliding door to the balcony make big noise when wind blows on it and I can hear next door guests talking very clear in the middle of the night.Not happy at all. If I can give negative rating, I would absolutely do it.

Great location. Walk to zoo, beach, restaurants , shopping, entertainment. Our only complaint was the street noice, buses and garbage trucks every night. We were on the 8th floor. If you have a sound machine, bring it.

This hotel is comfortable & convenient. It's location close to the beach & shops makes for an enjoyable stay in Waikiki. Members of staff are friendly & helpful. There was some difficulty logging in to WiFi.

We loved our stay at this hotel. It is so well located for the beach and shops, and the staff were always friendly, check in and check out we're very smooth. We initially had a problem with the TV and it was fixed straight away, which was great. The room wasn't large but big enough, and it was clean. Overall we couldn't fault it for the price.

Everything was wonderful except the WiFi.  We had trouble logging in and very constantly getting kicked out. That was very frustrating. Room was great, service was wonderful, price was very good and location was amazing.

Service and staff was terrific. Very accommodating and helpful. Location and proximity to beach and stores also cannot be beat. The rooms however were very small and outdated. We found the beds to be unusually small. Also the wi-fi was not usable. We loved being able to use daily beach towels and although we did not get a chance to use it, the movie rental was a nice perk.

We stayed here as part of our cruise tour package. Hotel has a great location a block from Waikiki Beach and close to lots of activities. Nice pool facility on upper floor for quiet relaxing. We would like to see them add a jacuzzi/hot tub in the future.

We booked the Waikiki Resort Hotel as we were attending a wedding and that is where most attending were staying. Overall we were happy with the resort with the only negative being the rooms are a bit dated and needing to be upgraded a bit.

Parking lot entry machine does not work. Maintenance guy dispatched was ill equipped to fix it. Wifi does not work well. Water pressure in small shower os insufficient. The saving over other hotel options is not worth the aggravation. Will not do this place again.

$25- daily parking (if you're renting a car)$10- daily amenities (unlimited DVD rental, wifi access...). A 2 min walk to the beach. Close to restaurants, boutiques, diamond head hike, aquarium and zoo. Daily room service. You can kind of see the mountain but this hotel doesn't have a good view.

Our family had a wonderful stay at this Hotel. It is walking distance to everything and has a great amenity package. Very nice pool area with cushioned seating and tables with umbrellas. The staff was excellent. We had complementary breakfast each morning and the food was great. Would stay here again.

Thank you...I was very happy during their stay at the resort.And, I was impressed with the friendliness of staff.And, I English speaking is awkward, but received a lot of help.And Breakfast was good. And the location was good too.Once again thanks

The staff of the hotel were very helpful. We were welcomed at reception and the room was kept in perfect order, well supplied with towels and soaps. The flowers on the bed were a nice touch. The location was a short walk to the beach and stores. However the view from the room was lacking. Hard to get a good view with all the tall buildings. Air conditioning was a bit noisy. The pool was great. We did not eat in the hotel so I won't rate the restaurants. It was a nice stay.

The hotel itself was good and the reception staff were outstanding, the only person that let the hotel down was our cleaner from tuesdays to saturdays, she did not clean our room at all, she tried to dictate what toiletries we used, and questioned us when and where we were going and how long we were going to be, and told us daily that she cleaned our room and indicated that she wanted tipping for doing so. The cleaner that worked sundays and mondays is a credit to the hotel. Other than that the hotel itself was good couple of issues with the roombut maintainence arrived within minutes to fix. Would recommend this hotel.

The location is a block away from Waikiki Beach and easy to access stores and merchandises.The hotel recently renovated and the room is clean. one night parking fee is $25 and spaces are enough and there are 2 parking lot, basement and outdoor.

Great for the family. Rooms are clean. Breakfast buffet was great - the wait staff were very friendly. The pool was perfect for the kids and usually quiet as the beach is located just one block away and an easy walk. The hotel has a towel service for pool and beach use. Short walk to restaurants and shops. There is also a laundromat just across the road that has same day service found this very handy. Concierge was fantastic in recommending and booking different tours. Found all staff welcoming and friendly. Will stay here again on our next visit.

When we moved into our room, we immediately found a cellophane cigarette wrapper on the floor. During the stay we then found a used Ear Cleaner lying on the floor so we felt the cleanliness was not up to standard and even felt uncomfortable touching anything because of this. The sink had cigarette burns in the porcelain that just looks dirty even though it's not. We had been very impressed with the taste of the water when we first arrived in Waikiki and stayed at another hotel, we then went to Maui for a week and they had great water but the water from your taps tasted bad unless we ran the water for a while before drinking.

My Husband and I stayed there for 2 nights. We had a package that includes buffet breakfast. We had to leave early at 6am to catch our flight on the second morning. I organised with the front desk the day before to be able to get breakfast a little earlier since the breakfast didn't open until 6am. We waited out front of the restaurant from 5.30am 4-5 different people inside the restaurant saw us standing outside not one of them acknowledged us. While my husband waited at the restaurant I went to the front desk and asked to be let into the restaurant. They said they couldn't and gave me an email address to send a complaint to. I explained that I had organised it the day before, they didn't want to help me. All the breakfast was ready and sitting in the bane maree, yet they still would not let us in, not even 5min before.Resort itself is dated.The chain on the inside of our toilet kept coming off so we couldn't flush it.The Korean restaurant on the second floor was the highlight for us. Great food and service.

There is a lot to recommend about the Waikiki Resort Hotel. My room was comfortable with a fridge, a proper desk to work at, very good internet in the room, a balcony and a comfortable bed. I was opposite the lift and yet the room was quiet. Nor were street noises a bother. The location is very good, being only a short distance from the famous beach and the shopping strip.The hotel has a swimming pool and a very convenient general store which was very useful. You can borrow a DVD from a machine in the lobby and play it in your room. There is a coin operated laundry in the basement and you can borrow a towel for the beach.The restaurant serves breakfast and lunch. The buffet breakfast is popular, so get down early if you can. Peak hour seems to be between 7.30 and 8.00.

Breakfast was the worst I ever seen and I couldn't swim in the swimming pool due to a strong smell of disinfectant, too cold water and the slippery floor. The staffs were not friendly but housekeeping was good. The parking lot was old too.

Room nearby elvators can hear loud elevator actuating wire cables noise in the room.Housekeeping staff asked when are we planning to check out in the morning before the official check out time (11 a.m)

Very nice hotel, located in the center of all that is happening in Waikiki. The beach, restaurants, and shopping are all located within a short walk. Staff really showed a genuine concern of the guests satisfaction and was there to help in any way.

Great location. Reception staff were great. On site tour and event people were great. Struggled a little with wifi and had to get help a couple of times. Pool was ok but beach was so close and was lovely.

Very good service. Close to the beach. Great breakfast for the price. Lots of convenience being right in the heart of Waikiki. Hotel is a little out dated, but still good value. Will go back for sure.

We loved the view. The breakfast was excellent. The internet was fast. The hotel was close to the beach, shopping venues and restaurants of interest.Service was courteous and efficient. Rooms were clean

We were extremely pleased with our recent stay at this hotel. The location was extremely convenient to the beach, restaurants and shops. We had an excellent water view from our balcony and the room was very clean and comfortable. We also enjoyed our breakfasts in the downstairs restaurant which featured a hot and cold buffet. The staff were pleasant and very helpful and we highly recommend this hotel.

I don't usually pay this much for a room ($300Aus) but not much left to look at. This was a good fit for us with location and room was clean and functional. One street back from the beach in a central location.

Great location , great views, great access to restuarants, shops . The rooms are very functional with all modern appliances , plenty of rooms for resting, cooking if want and sleeping , highly recommend this beautiful building and resort

The rooms were smaller than they appeared on-line, but we had adjoining rooms that worked great.Staff, both at the desk, the maid service, and the basement towel service was incredible.This hotel is perfectly located for beach access, and all the things you would want to do in Waikiki.

My wife and I spent a week at this hotel. The staff were extremely helpful and polite for our entire stay. The rooms are clean and provide all that is needed. I particularly enjoyed sitting on the balcony in the evenings watching the world go by. The beach is just a short walk away along with the shopping areas.

Although the interior is a little dated, the rooms are very clean and the staff extremely helpful and polite. The location is excellent to all facilities.The time is not too far away when the rooms will need to be upgraded but that no doubt will mean an increase in charges so need to balance one against the other. We found the room facilities quite good and clean. Comfortable bed and pillows which is important. Reception staff excellent.

We spent 4 days, 3 nights in the Waikiki Resort Hotel in the beginning of October 2016. Nice to be right where you can find lots of the interesting things and places, but on a back street away from major traffic. We love the morning breakfast buffet that offered fresh Hawaiian fruits, and juices. I highly recommend including it with your room. Service was very good. I asked for an extra roll away bed at front desk while checking in, and it was already set up when I got to the room. All in all a great place for its class. Will surely go back.

I found the hotel to be clean, with friendly staff and it was a stones throw from the beach and shops. We had breakfast every morning, the selection wasn't great, and one morning the food was a bit cold. I would stay here again.

A wonderful family gathering, fun, fun, fun. Have views of the ocean, bbq grill, clean and huge swimming pool, comfortable bed, great breakfast and friendly service. Convenient to restaurant, shops and grocery stores. It is a great hotel.

We found that the Waikiki Resort Hotel was very convenient to everything in Waikiki, the hotel and rooms were very clean and the staff were very helpful and polite, I would recommend this hotel to my friends, family and anyone looking for a nice place to stay in Waikiki.

Decor a little old but lovely and clean with polite staff. The Philipano woman at breakfast made us feel welcome every day and the buffet had lots to choos from. The Concierge Leimomi Baker who very patient and helpful in assisting us in choosing some events and attractions to attend. She was a pleasure to deal with as we're all the staff.Would stay again and would recommend.

The location is great, so close to beach, Duke Statue ( bus stop for all the lines to take you anywhere). We had a Corner Deluxe room on 10th floor, so we had a view of Waikiki Beach. Buffet breakfast which was included also good. Unfortunately the rooms, although clean are so dated and badly need upgrading. Wifi was dreadful, non existent in our room, so trips down to the lobby were necessary often. McDonalds just down the street was often the go for fast connection. Since it is the base for Korean Air, mostly guests are also Korean and food is aimed more for them. Given so many accommodation choices in Waikiki I probably wouldn't stay here again.

This hotel was perfect, the best location, 2 minutes to beach and MacDonalds for a cheap breakfast, 2 minutes to bus stop as well. It is bright, open and cheerful. The restaurant serves breakfast from 6 AM for all the early risers like us and was very good, despite some negative reviews I read before we booked!!?? Also do not understand any of the negative reviews....so folks don't go by them, some people are just too fussy. For the cost, it is a "wonderful" hotel, we did not stay in the room during the day long enough to expect a view, rather got the view 2 minutes away on the beach. George and other staff members were always pleasant and helpful, the room was clean, the beds comfy, the a/c worked.....the only issue we had was wifi not the best. We would definitely stay here again and definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family. Had a great vacation.

Great hotel of its class. The front desk staff is customer service oriented, friendly and welcoming. Upon our arrival, Branden greeted us with a smile and remembered us from our previous visit seven years ago. We were accommodated with our room request and received a no charge upgrade with a partial ocean view. Room was very cleaned and our daily housekeeping service was outstanding. Housekeeping was very friendly and responsive to our needs.

The hotel it's self is beautiful and very reasonably priced. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Also the hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of shopping, the beach, and lots of tours.

We LOVED this hotel. Just one block from Waikiki Beach it was the perfect location for the beach, shopping, dining, and people watching. Our room, 1818, was fantastic. Very large and since it was an end room (one floor below the penthouse) we had great views from our balcony of Waikiki Beach in front of us, downtown Honolulu on the right (stunning at night) and Diamond Head on the left. The room price was extremely reasonable for the location, very clean, and I repeat - large - with great amenities in the room and even orchids on our bed and laying on the towels in the bathroom.The front desk could not have been nicer in holding our luggage when we arrived early in the morning from our cruise ship so that we could go touring, and in providing us with bus information and helping us to choose a route.When it came time to leave and print our boarding passes, we had trouble with the free WI-Fi terminal (probably us, not the terminal) and George from the front desk took over and printed them all for us at the front desk, despite the time it took to do that for four of us. A great place and we cannot say enough about the wonderful breakfast at Ilima that was included with our hotel room. Better than any breakfast buffet we've ever had at a hotel before. We were impressed.We would definitely stay here again in Honolulu.

We booked a corner deluxe room on the 14th floor. Nice glimpses of the ocean and view to Diamond head. The hotel itself is getting old and in need of an upgrade in places, but a good size room which was clean and had a lounge which was good to relax on. Nice and central to shopping and the beach 2 mins walk away. McDonalds also a 2 minute walk. Pleasant staff. No complaints.
user_name:
Mary-Lou H
Gold Coast Queensland Australia

review_body: This hotel is great for the price and location. It served all our needs, was clean and super friendly. They were great at making recommendations in the area and the locaiton is prime to be in the heart of Waikiki.

Enjoyable would come back. The only thing I did not like was the spiders in the bathroom. But we had a beauitful view of the golf course even doe we do not play golf. The pool was nice & clean & the people who worked there very friendly & helpful.

My wife and I needed a hotel for several days prior to our departure on the Pride of America cruise ship. After a thoroughly extensive internet search, I found this gem close to the beach yet near the city center. Our room was clean, comfortable and had a partial ocean view with a balcony. We found the staff of this hotel very accommodating and eager to please guests. The hotel is perhaps older than other nearby properties but for the money we spent we felt it was a good value. The free in-room wi-fi is included in the $10 daily amenity fee as is free in-room coffee, DVD movies, in-room safe, and daily newspaper. There is also a pool available. I would recommend this hotel over the pricey national chains unless, of course, you have deep pockets.

We stayed four nights at this Hotel before flying to Vancouver and cruising back to Honolulu and staying one more night here before flying back to Australia. Our Travel Agent recommended this Hotel and we were guided by her. We have holidayed in Waikiki twice before and felt we knew the area pretty well. Waikiki Resort Hotel is owned by Korean Air Lines so you will see their crew stopping in and out. We are not big brand name groupies, preferring to spend our money elsewhere but we do like some basic services - clean, comfortable rooms, happy and helpful staff, onsite breakfast and close proximity to local attractions. When we saw just how close we were to the beach - one SMALL block - and how impressive all the staff were, we vowed that this is where we will stay on any future trips. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. Contrary to what others have said, we didn't find the rooms small at all - very comfortable. Not flashy but we weren't paying for that either. Not one staff member from the maintenance staff to the retail staff in the downstairs store failed to greet us with a smile and they went above and beyond in their customer service. Another big plus was the very affordable self serve laundry in the basement - a must in this hot and humid weather. The breakfast buffet was also an absolute treat - we thoroughly enjoyed the opportunity to indulge in the miso soup! Beware....its addictive. We look forward to our next stay and will be recommending this gem of a hotel to our family and friends.

We loved our accommodation, the customer service and facilities where great, happy to recommend this hotel to others considering going to Hawaii.Our room was terriffic with a great view, 5 minutes for the beach and the shopping great also everything very close. Loved it.

We are beyond pleased with this hotel. It is sooo close to the beach and super clean. The staff was so helpful and curtious. We travel a lot and to find a place like this hotel was awesome and we can't say enough about the staff. We have stayed in a variety of hotels but the service we received here was much more than we had expected

Great...we pick this hotel because it was close to the beach but not beach front priced. This place was in the heart of everything...Staff upgraded us and our travel companions. Thanks Nancy and Coco.

It's handy to the beach. It's hand to the aquarium and the zoo and diamondhead park. It's close to a whole lot of stuff. The rooms are clean. The staff is very helpful and friendly. I really like this place!

We had oceanvue it was verry good room and hotel. But a litle dirt in the corners. The beds was also very good. I had wanted a accesible room whith an oceanvue. Verry good poolarea. Difficult too hit the elevater that went too the basement.

Clear, good welcoming, wonderful location, and perfect service. Everything was good. Breakfast is so so..but I am sure that if you are looking for the reasonable accomodation, it could be a right choice:)

They offer so many amenities that it's hard not to like this spot and they across the street from the beach and next to so many shops and they had the most affordable "extra costs and fees" when I did my research for where to stay in Waikiki! I definitely recommend it!

Overall the stay at waikiki resort hotel was good.The only things that we didn't like was that room didn't have a microwave and the room was dark at night because there wasn't any other lights besides the lamps.

People at this hotel was awesome. Beds were so comfortable. Room was very good. No complaints what so ever. Great location. Mahalo Waikiki Resort Hotel for your awesome two weeks. Aloha till we meet again .

The location on this hotel cannot be missed. Only 1 block from the beach ( and little did I know a Hawaiian block is very short), you walk out of the hotel and are literally 30 seconds from Waikiki beach, shopping, and restaurants. The staff was very accommodating and nice. The room is nice, no frills. Where I would mark the hotel down is it is need of a full renovation. It looks like it hasn't been updated since the 80's; however, for the price, it works. If I had to break it down:Location: 5 starsPrice: 4 starsHospitality: 5 starsCleanliness: 4.5

We enjoyed our stay here, the room was clean with a decent ocean view. Free DVD rental and wifi were nice perks. Restaurants on property were convenient. Staff were friendly and helpful. The beach is an easy walk from the hotel. The balcony had a nice view of the ocean.

George made sure my husband and I were very well taken care of from the minute we walk in until we waved good bye! George left us a bottle of champagne, cookies and a very sweet card to celebrate my wedding night with my husband. When people ask us about our trip, we always tell them about George at the Waikiki Resort Hotel :) We even took a photo with him on our wedding day to remember him and our stay.

Just 1 min to waikiki beach and 5 min to central part of waikiki.This hotel has own swimming pool with a cozy size. Swimming towel is also provided. Parking lots in basement is quite narrow path and the view is little bit blocked by other hotels even I staying at 7th floor.

It was my first trip to Hawaii. Stayed here because of the location. Beach is a block and half away. McDonalds on the corner. Stays open 24 hours. Kalaukua Avenue has everything from restaurants, to ABC stores, shopping, etc. Easy breezy check in. Staff very friendly and helpful. The room was great. Air conditioning could have been a lil cooler. Pool was great. Didn't try the restaurant. They have a store in the hotel too.

The hotel was ok a little outdated but we expected this. We were in a room next to the elevator and that's all we heard ALL NIGHT LONG! Then the idiots in the room above us urinated off the balcony while we were outside GROSS... Called the front desk and they didn't nothing, this type of behavior is absolutely unacceptable and these people should have been removed from the hotel. Otherwise the hotel had a good location but needs some work. We only stayed for two nights, I would have not spent any longer here, if we were staying longer I would have paid for the Marriott the next block over.

I was checked in by George who was super friendly and very knowledgeable about the property and area as well. He showed great hospitality and did his utmost to accomodate not just my needs but also my whims. The hotel property is right by the beach, although not on the beach (dont think any are in waikiki) and its a clean well kept hotel although a bit dated but not that much either. overall my experience was great, i would give it 5 stars if the hotel were a bit more contemporary. Staff, especially george exceeded expectations.

Hotel is in a very good Good position close to beach and restaurants , rooms in hotel is a bit dated could do with upgrade. Good breakfast. Friendly staff. Kept being woken up by people slamming doors.

Absolutely the worst check-in experience of my life (I'm 67). In line for 45 minutes. Incompetent and disinterested staff at registration. Room is dinky and crowded, no room to walk around. I now understand why the rate is lower than most other Waikiki hotels - the place is not worth what they charge. Only positive thing was the location - near the beach, and many stores and restaurants within an easy walk.

Easy checkin, helpful concierge. Very comfortable bed, room was spacious enough although the bathroom was oddly configured with the wardrobe and vanity together. Very nice lobby area, plenty of seating. We enjoyed our stay and would return.

Great staff. Housekeeping keeps the rooms very clean. Great location (with parking) for the beach, shops and restaurants. As my edition of "Oahu Revealed" says "Solid Gold Value." Have already booked for 2017.

Adequate in services, location, amenities. Friendly and helpful staff. Discounts for on site restaurants. Easy walk to everything. Good value for the location. Would stay here again. Nice and relaxing and safe.

We are a family of 3 and we stayed at Waikiki Resort for 2 weeks, August 2016. We stayed on the 10th floor, didn’t have a view of the sea but we were happy with the view we had. We had a roll out bed in our room which was surprisingly quite comfy. Amenities DVD rental is great; they have a good variety really handy for those lazy days.Towel rental is really good and convenient. Swimming pool is small, but as we are so close to the beach not maybe people used it so we found it to be quiet most of the time. WIFI, no issues in the room or hotel lobby was able to facetime friends and family in England with no problems. Only downfall is that WIFI is not available by the swimming pool. Fridge, Safe, Iron, Kettle- usual stuff in the room, all very convenient and worked well. Breakfast:We tried this out twice it was ok, I personally don’t think it is worth the price. Maybe a little more fruit and variety of cereals. As hotel guests you get a 20% discount, but as it is attached to the hotel it is a convenient. Didn’t try the other hotel restaurant. Staff:Front desk, maintenance and especially housekeeping were all very helpful, friendly and work really hard. Location:Fabulous, Waikiki beach is a few minutes away literally half a short block. Hotel is based in a popular tourist area and there are lots of the usual shops/restaurants around. Activities: We didn’t book anything through the hotel so I can’t comment on their concierge service. We booked either directly with activity provider or used one of the reps on the beach front. Luah- Paradise Cove was amazing, entertainment, food, activities all were greatWater activities: we did Jet skiing and parasailing with H20 sports, staff were great and made the day enjoyable. Island Tour- nice way to see lots of things Big Island-helicopter tour- unfortunately the helicopter part of the tour was cancelled due to weather conditions but going over to the big Island was a great experience. Hanauma bay- is a must see Getting around:We didn’t hire a car and opted for public transport which was both reasonably priced and very convenient. Local bus stop is half block away serves many useful bus routes. Overall View: We had a very enjoyable 2 week stay at Waikiki Resort and I would defiantly recommend it to others.

We arrived early after a long flight from Australia and having paid for the previous night accommodation found check- in slow at that time of the morning. We had two rooms on 11th floor both with partial ocean views that exceeded our expectations. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony watching the sunset. Room was spacious for two people and bedding was super comfortable. Maintenance were very prompt when having trouble with balcony door and housekeepers were excellent with rooms serviced by midday or sooner. Each morning at breakfast we were greeted with a pleasant smile and shown to a table to which we sat at each day. Plenty to choose from and liked the way the waiter knew when to bring my pot of tea. Taxis were always nearby when we required one. The pool was refreshing and towels were easy to collect and return.We wish the showers were easier to turn on but once figured out was fine to use. The vanity needed more room to store toiletries and it desperately needed a full length mirror.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel and if we are fortunate to return we will stay here again as we found it to be the perfect location close to beach, shops and dining.

My son booked a room for Aug. 26, 2016 not realizing I was checking in on Aug. 25. Upon checking in when the front desk checked our reservation we found out about the mistake. I was very tired having just flown in from the Philippines. I was given a room upgrade where I just had to add over $100.00 something. And it was the Penthouse with 2 rooms and a living room! I was elated and thankful for the accommodation.My only complaint is the Shuttle that took us back to the airport the next day was not very nice. He drove us to the airport with a few other people. This was on the 26th of August. And I was with my grandbaby who is 5 years old. We have 3 big suitcases and few carry ons. And I take the wheelchair because of my knees. The driver dropped us off in between Delta and United. There is a walk to the check in area. The driver said because there were cars at the drop off area. He could have waited a minute to see but he did not. I had to beg people to watch over my luggages while I had to find someone to pick my luggages. This had caused me to get aggravated. All the nice experience I had with Hawaii just disappeared. The driver should have been more helpful. He wasn't.I would like for this driver to know he made our stay very unpleasant. Such unpleasantries experienced by people like me who has mobility restrictions are not acceptable.Thank you for taking the time to read my letter,Tessie S. MatusalemEmail: tmatusalem@gmail.com

My stay here was indescribable. Out of all the fine hotels we have stayed at , this one exceeded expectations in terms of quality and service. The front desk staff and the manager Ms. Vicky were immaculate service members and I highly recommend staying here !! This hotel is very clean , staff is very helpful especially in the event some situations arise , and they are ready to do whatever possible to help you! We ended up extending out stay just due to the at home feeling we received here ! Brandon especially is one of the front desk staff you want to deal with! He will help you in every way possible and he's never shy to crack a joke or two to give you a laugh and to make you feel like Ohana, and not a guest!

This was our first trip to Waikiki. This hotel is in a good location, just steps to the beach, shopping and restaurants. Room was clean but small for 4 people with 2 double beds and twin size cot in between them made space tight. We were offered a larger upgraded room but we declined due to noise of elevators adjacent to room. Price was affordable and staff were more than pleasant, from front desk to housekeeping to maintenance to waitress in Ilima restaurant. All very friendly and accommodating. I would stay here again.

We booked a ocean view studio & we were on the 17th floor with a great view of Waikiki Beach. The room was comfortable however being up this high you get the wind blowing between the buildings & the door doesn't have double glazing so you here it all the time.Another thing that would be nice is to have net curtains as well as the drapes. Every time you get changed you need to close the drapes but if you had nets you wouldn't need to bother having to close the drapes.There is ample space in the room with a dresser, desk, comfortable chair & plenty of plugs to plug in phones etc.You can get breakfast & lunch in the lobby restaurant & they also have a Korean restaurant for dinnerIts only one street back from the beach & there are plenty of places to eat no matter your budget. There are some very high end shops close by like Gucci, Coach just to name a few.All in all we have been very happy here & will be back soon.

Had planned wedding and hotel was in good location from the beach. Was also moved up in room due to there really not a good beach and ocean view until about the 10th floor. We were moved to the 18th. Great ocean view and Dimond Head as well.

This was my second stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel and it has been pleasant. Great service at check in, rooms were clean and room service great. The price was very affordable and talk about the location. Location is awesome for the price... the beach is literally steps away. I love my stay, I rather stay here than any other 5 star snobby hotels.

The room and staff were great, always very helpful, and willing to accommodate however they could. Location was easy to get in and out, with alot of thinks close by. Breakfast area was great, food was fresh and well prepared.

Can't say enough about how enjoyable this hotel is. Great location, great breakfast buffet, large room, comfortable beds, WI-FI, large pool, and a very friendly staff. They include free DVD rental and pool towels as part of their amenities.

Wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon for 6 nights. Our room view overlooked the beach. It was so lovely. The customer service was superb. They gave us so much information and help us find our way around the city. The beach is 1 block away.

Great location in Heart of Waikiki, 1 block from the beach. Staff very helpful especially David at front desk. Rooms are clean, maybe somewhat outdated, nice flat screen TV with DVD but small. Air conditioner is noisy but cools room well. Beds are clean and comfortable. You will pay $25 per day to park car and have a $10 add on per day for beach towels, DVD rental, tea/coffee for in room. Would use this hotel again

The hotel location and customer service was superb. No complaints. Room 916 had a very nice beach view but the only downside to the room, it wasquite small and no microwave! Vanity counter space was quite small too.

Excellent proximity to Waikiki Beach. (1 block). Excellent reception staff. Great housekeeping staff. Comfortable bed. Be careful hanging swimwear on the balcony (we were on the 18th top floor) as it can blow off and never be found again! bathroom basin crazed and needs upgrading.

Our travel agent booked us at Waikiki Beach Resort for 7 nights during our trip to Hawaii and we enjoyed the hotel and the staff that worked there. Few staff stand out over the other because they make effort to greet us and conversate with us,it make strange place feel more welcoming . I like to thank Dee and Dennis for your friendly smiles and helpful advice during our stay there. We really had a great time. Parking is really hard so be prepare to walk or do public transit

Great service, friendly staff special thanx to Scott for the warm welcome to my family. Rooms are clean, very close to the beach(walking distance). My family enjoyed the stay to the fullest, will be back soon.

Can't complain about the staff one bit.
