A stretegically placed hotel, half a block from Waikiki beach; close to shuttle buses, that take you on numerous excursions; as well as cheap breakfast eats! Wonderful staff, and pretty too! Tony DiBenedetto

Our family really enjoyed the Waikiki Resort Hotel over the holidays. The highlight of the stay was our interaction with the front desk personnel, in particular June Tsukayama. Our flight arrived early in the morning before check-in, and one of the elderly mothers in our family was sick. June noticed that our mom had fallen asleep and woke up her to inform her that an early hotel room was available. This was much appreciated!! Thank you for your excellent customer service.
user_name:
MayaBimbimbap5
New York City, New York

review_body: eggs in restaurant were under cooked, need to change food . movies were great idea. pool was to cold to swim in it. location awesome, activity provider's were great at their job. enjoyed all activities planned

We stayed at this hotel as a family member was ill and at Queens Hospital--not your typical Hawaiian getaway. However, the hotel went well beyond expectations for our entire stay. June, at the front desk, was extremely helpful and extended a 6 pm checkout once things went poorly at the hospital. They were all very kind. The pool was small; however, it was very clean and never crowded. The location was fabulous and the price was very, very reasonable compared to others in the area! It is on the 'good' side of Waikiki--just a block to the beach and in the midst of much nicer hotels and resorts.

We only spent one night in Waikiki before heading out to the windward side of the island. This is a great location only a block from the beach. Like other reviewers the hotel is older and the colour scheme makes it look even more dated. But it is clean and well maintained. The bed was comfortable but our room which was on the Diamond Head side of the building did have some road noise. The patio style doors to the balcony are older and not as soundproof as you might like. The breakfast buffet was very good and the small underground parking was convenient. We liked that the extra charges for parking, internet and breakfast buffet all lumped into one small fee. This makes this hotel a very good value compared to some of the others nearby.There are various types of rooms and if you had a nice room on the back or quieter side of the hotel it would be an excellent spot to stay in Waikiki. If you are not expecting luxury but a moderate hotel for a good price this would be good for you.

Excellent location. Close to the beach, shops and eateries. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was sufficient for our purposes. We would have liked Queen sized beds rather than double. Great facilities such as washing machines and towels for the beach.I would stay here again.

We really enjoyed this hotel- excellent housekeeping, friendly front desk and very helpful concierge especially when it came to storing luggage before a late night flight... As others have said, very short walk to e beach, restaurants and shopping.

The room was great, but the outside noise was loud and started at 5:30am. Would suggest replacing the lanai Windows and doors with soundproof ones. The bellboy Leo was awesome, as was George at the desk!

Good middle of the range hotel. Stayed for 2 nights. Arrived at 3am check in was easy. Nice friendly staff. Stayed on 7th floor. Little bit dated but nice tidy room with balcony. One block from the beach which was awesome. Restaurant in hotel but didn't try it. Close to a number of good restaurants.

Just one block from the beach. Lots of eating places within one or two blocks, plus a couple in the hotel. Everything was clean. Staff was friendly. We enjoyed our stay. Be prepared for the high cost of food in Hawaii. That was the only downside to our trip, but we expected it so we still had a great time!

Actually my family stayed Waikiki Resort Hotel on Feb 5 - 8 2016 and it was a wonderful time for my family.We loved the staying in Waikiki resort hotel and would like to come again very soon.And our family deeply appreciate all staff in Waikiki Resort Hotel.Thanks a lot

Friendly staff awesome place to stay cleanrooms awesome view easy access for restaurants and beach easy check in and easy checkout friendly hostess they were even helpful on other stuff to do on the island.

Great Location! Very good breakfast. We Wolf definitely come back. Bus stops dir excursions are near. The waikiki Beach is a dream. Around the hotel there loads of shopping center. The hotel employed are all very helpful.

The staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms are small, but I didn't go to Hawaii to spend all my time in a motel room. The location was convenient walking distance to many places including the famed Waikiki Beach. The lobby was very nice and roomy. I would stay there again.

My family and I had about 6 rooms booked whilst our stay in Hawaii. I highly recommend this place, it was very clean, so close to Waikiki beach and all that Hawaii has to offer. We were staying with our kids and needed laundry room service as well, and they had one in the basement which we found very handy - anyone travelling with kids would know this. Highly recommended.

I had the best stay here and will always stay here going forward! Location is awesome! One block from the beach. The higher rooms have views. I loved the balcony. Rooms clean and beds wonderful. It feels so nice to be treated like family. CoCo, LEO and Nancy all amazing. I go to Hawaii 4-5 x year and this was my favorite place. It's reasonably priced. Very convenient and quiet even though in the heart of all the fun. You can easily walk everywhere ! I'm bringing my hubby back next time!

Our room was maintained clean and amenities were changed everyday. The hotel location is also good and close to the beach and shop and restaurants. We could save time and money by staying at Waikiki Resort Hotel. At last, the bell staff were very helpful to book the airport shuttle too.

I work 7 days a week, so I like to take a relaxing break to just get away from things. This was the first time stay here and I have only good things to say.i will be back. The room was ckean, air con was perfect, the bed was so comfortable.

The location was the best, walking distance to everything in Waikiki. When I booked it I didn't expect luxurious, but was a little taken back with the old dated rooms. The shower was like a little box, dated chairs and carpeting. Really needs a renovation badly. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful on the positive side. Did have problems with the Wifi....kept getting too "hot" and turning off. Advertised 2 or 3 restaurants in the hotel, all but one was shut down, we went into the Korean BBQ one and immediately left, not too clean. Might be a good place for some college kids but not for anyone looking for a "nice hotel". I personally would not return.

Waikiki Resort is very good for us. Sleep condition and service is very good. Location is very good, we went to easy to Waikiiki beach. Thank you very much. I hope to go and stay Waikiki Resort next year.

I just returned from a great week at the Waikiki Resort Hotel with my boyfriend. We were in town for a wedding, but also extended our stay to do some exploring of Oahu on our own. The Waikiki Resort Hotel was perfect for this as it was close to the beach and offered everything we needed in a hotel (free beach towels, awesome concierge services, clean and safe room to sleep at night). The only thing we would've liked is breakfast included, but this doesn't seem to be a common thing among hotels in Waikiki. Also, as others have noted, the hotel decor is a bit dated so if you are looking for luxury you may want to reconsider. All in all, we were extremely satisfied with this hotel!

We stayed here with a group of 10 for 9 nights and we were all very pleased with the hotels central location to Waikiki Beach. Rooms were large, clean and roomy and all staff were very friendly. Would definitely recommend others to stay here.

PH room was fanstastic! Enough spaces, clean and wonderful view!Hotel staff are very kind. Restaurant was also good.My Wife and I was fully satisfied. This Hotel is very close to Waikiki beach and parks. It is very good place for vacation!

We stayed for 3 nights on the 11th floor. The room was quite dated and needed some deep cleaning. We could see footprint stains on the carpet all over our room. Heard the trash trucks clanging & beeping every morning around 4 am. The majority of the guests seemed to be Asians, maybe because Korean Air has an office of of the lobby. The girl checking us in could barely speak English but was fluent talking to the Asian clients. Located about a block from the beach with limited view of the ocean between the surrounding hotels.

100 seconds from the beach. The Waikiki Resort turned out to be a great value for us based on location, amenities, and cost. Before booking, know that they tack on a mandatory $10 per day concierge fee at the end of your stay to cover use of beach towels, DVD movie use via a Red Box-like vending machine, and in house restaurant discount. The room bathroom is small and the bathroom light illuminates the whole room, not just the bathroom. The lanai is cool, if you're a smoker, but not so cool if you're not due to smokers on other room's lanai. The in room complimentary wifi was fast enough and didn't drop us once. The buffet breakfast was very good, fast, convenient, and reasonable versus other choices in Waikiki. Elevators were fast, which made the ice machine on the second floor seem not quite so far away. The tiny in room refrigerator froze everything we put in it overnight regardless of where we set the dial. No microwave. We saw mostly Korean patrons here versus seeing mostly Japanese everywhere else.Don't miss the free activities: shows at the Duke Kuhanamoku Statue, beach volley ball tourneys, surfing, etc, right at the beach. We were able to walk to the zoo and aquarium. We took a shuttle to hike Diamond Head, but walked (quite a ways) back to the hotel from there. The Ala Moana shopping center and Beach Park is about the same distance in the other direction, and I suggest paying the $2 each way for the trolley. It's $2.50 and over an hour one way on the city bus to Pearl Harbor, and $22 rt (+$7.50 entrance fee) to Hanauma Bay including snorkel gear. Alas, we didn't find much good local cuisine in Waikiki. Burgers in Paradise (next door) was an exception. Rainbow Drive Inn is a little far to walk, but very popular with locals. There is always a crowd and a line-up for food at Murakame Udon (noodles.) Otherwise, after a few mundane and overpriced meals at local venues, we took solace at Subway and KFC.So, get ready for a busy, fun vacation complete with beautiful sunny weather, awesome sights and sunsets, beach, shopping, and luaus, in a big, expensive resort town full of crowds, traffic, and foreign tourists.

This resort is close to the beach. The hotel is very clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here again and will share my experience with others. My only complaint is the tight parking area -but we always had a place to park.
user_name:
Shawn H
Provo, Utah, United States

review_body: My wife and I stayed at Waikiki Resort last minute and it was great. One of the best locations as close to the "strip" as you can get. Walked to everything. We would definitely recommend this hotel and we look forward to going back.

This hotel is in a perfect location. You don't need to catch a cab to get to any of the local activities, everything is in walking distance. I must say the best thing about this hotel is the customer service! From the first telephone call to our last evening, each representative from the front desk, to housekeeping and maintenance was wonderful. The room was always keep clean. If we ever had a need it was taken care of immediately. Although everyone was wonderful, I would like to give a special shout out to George, Brenden, Susie and Coco who were really exceptional. They were so patient with us and all of our questions. If you want outstanding customer service, a comfortable and clean room in a convenient location, this is the place!! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!! I LOOK FORWARD TO RETURNING!!

Great location, nice room, no complaints in that respect. Declared party of six when booking made, in two rooms, only four vouchers for breakfast which is frustrating and was then charged for a cup of tea and piece of toast, despite four of the party not drinking tea within their voucher allowance.

The hotel is in need of an upgrade, it is looking a bit old and tired. At night it was difficult to sleep from the noise of trucks and what sounded like construction. The staff were attentive, but I will not return.

This hotel was very good value for Waikiki. All the staff people were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit small, but clean. There is a nice pool and sundeck on the second floor and it's only a short block to Waikiki beach.

Overall the hotel is very good. The hotel location, cleanliness, money for value, amenities, etc. are very good. The Internet access should be included as standard. The coffee and tea should be upgraded.

As we are travel agents that send you lot of people through our tour operator, we expected a better checking out.. We asked for a day use and first it was possibile paying half day rate, then it was fully booked, then it was possible to stay but paying the whole amount of 180 dollars per night (in Maui we had it for 30 dollars); So at the very end, we decided to leave at 12 but had our flight at 9.30 in the evening (and we arrived at 11 pm on the 01st) so for this reason I'm not giving the 5 stars, because for the rest erything was ok, the breakfast, the room, the cleaning, and the position, of course..

The staff and management were fantastic, the property is in sad shape, rooms are minute. 2 bed rooms are comically small and the street noise is deafening even 10 floors up. It is in easy walking distance of the beach.

Very loud room. We heard all hallway activity, doors, elevator, and the rooms around, above his below. Very dated room. The beds were not very comfortable to sleep on. The plus side, The staff was very friendly.

It is very Convienient place to enjoy waikiki! It is Very near to waikiki beach,shopping centers, honolulu zoo, diamond head, etc. This hotel has Clean rooms and a swimming pool and you can enjoy nice meals.

Everything was conveniently located. Bed was super comfortable, absolutely loved the shower head! We only stayed 1 night, so it was good for us. The parking was was convenient & average cost with every other hotel. Overall a great stay for the short time & the price.

We stayed one night at Waikiki Resort before heading back to the Main land. Primarily we need a hotel that would allow for a single night stay during the New Years Eve timeframe, The location is great, short walk to the beach, lots of places to eat and shop. The lobby is nicely appointed but the rooms themselves were old and outdated. Canvas wall paper, old carpet. The room was fine for 2 adults and one child - although I still don't understand why when you have toilet/shower and a separate room for the sink, closet there is only one light. If you use the bathroom in the middle of the night you have to turn on the light and it wakes up everyone. Also the shower was small and short - and the handles for turning on the water where confusing and cheap. Overall it was an average room at an expensive rate.
user_name:
sarahdS4350DE
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is at a great location close to beach at the same time quite. It has all kinds of restaurants and shopping nearby with the Shows within walking distance. All tour buses stop near the hotel. Ilima has good breakfast although there are no vegetarian options for lunch and dinner. Internet is not free.Improvements: should have a vegetarian option at hotel with free internet. All inclusive packages would draw more tourists to this hotel

Our horrible experience started from the moment we stepped foot onto the hotel grounds. There was no one there to help us with our bags. Although I am more than capable of carrying my own bags it would of been nice for at least a staff member to batter their eyelids and offered a helping hand or a greeting.While checking in (there was 4 of us, 2 couples, 2 separate rooms) the staff member gave us keys to a different room as to what he had checked us in on the system. This resulted in our account getting charged for parking.Hotel room is nice but the bathrooms can use a facelift. It is TINY. How tiny is it? It is so tiny that in order for you to take a shower or go to the bathroom you must first open the door, step inside the room, lean against the wall while holding your breath as you close the door! My husband who is 183cm tall struggled with the shower and found it beyond a joke that such small confined bathrooms like this still exists. Even NYC or Japan bathrooms were bigger! Walls are thin which means you can hear everythingAir con is exceptionally loud but if you put it down low then you can't feel anything. If you put it up then you can't sleep due to the noise. When we brought all of these issues up to the staff member they said there is nothing else available except for one other room which was a downgrade to what we had paid for. I found this very hard to believe as our friend had the same issues and later on was upgraded to a better room. Maybe we were not assertive enough? When checking out we got charged with the extra resort fees however, when our friends checked out they were told not to worry about paying for the resort fee. To charge 1 customer resort fees and choose not to charge another within 5 mins of each customer checking out is unjust and I will never be coming back here nor will I be recommending this hotel. Spend a little extra and stay somewhere nice where you are treated with common courtesy and fairness.

Our one night stay was acceptable but the hotel itself is dated and somewhat worn. We found the lobby furniture to be uncomfortable at best. *The Reception Staff was fantastic upgrading our room due to an extended delay in checking in.!

The hotel was right where you want to be, short walk to the beach, close to major shopping and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only issue was although we had an ocean view, the street below is is where all the tour buses go down to pick people up, and the balcony doors were not very sound proof, so we were woken up fairly early some mornings by some traffic below.

The nearby ABC store, McDonald's also was close and convenient.In addition, it was Kokorozuyoka~tsu because there was a person who can speak Japanese to accept.We were able to spend comfortably.Thank you.

Waikiki Resort Hotel was a real treat in a busy city with many options. We enjoyed out anniversary trip over the holidays at the hotel. We found it clean and comfortable with nice amenities. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. Nice friendly staff and great location.

This was a family vacation for us and I have to say the staff here are wonderful and made our stay so much more pleasant. The location of the hotel is only a block away from the beach. We didn't get to enjoy any of the hotel's amenities because everything is close-by. For example, McDonalds Restaurant, Burger King, Subway, etc are all within a block radius. Japanese & Korean restaurants are abundant and all around us. The hotel itself is clean and noise was not a problem because we're facing North-East. The view is that of another hotel (Kuhio at Waikiki). Some things to note: The mini refrigerator is tiny so I would not recommend buying anything in bulk if want them refrigerated. TV was definitely in HD and we had better channel selection than our previous stay at another hotel in Waikiki. There is laundry facility is at the parkade downstairs of the hotel and parking we found was a little tight. If you're driving a mini-van... good luck navigating those tight spots. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would certainly come back here again.

My daughter and i had a enjoyable and relaxing night. I was able to Rest after a long week. I'm looking to return again for New Year's Eve 2016, if I could get Kamaina Rate. Very near to. The beach and the ABC Store.

We spent one night in the hotel. We ate breakfast in the dinning room. The breakfast was buffet style with excellent food and service. Later we walked on the beach enjoying the view of the ocean and warm sand on the beach. This hotel was in a great location for us.

We stayed four night end of December 2015--just checked out yesterday. Booked through a travel agent. Very nice, extremely clean and great view of the ocean--one block from Waikiki Beach. Bed was very comfortable. Staff was very good, very good breakfast buffet. We enjoyed our stay there.

I stayed this resort for 2 nights. most staff are so kind...However, it is not quiet at night....and I could hear the voices of upper roomsomeone slid the door a lot... It made my sleep away Parking fee is a bit expensive

We stayed there for the Christmas break.the price was reasonable for the Christmas holidays.The hotel was clean kind and quiet.It is only a minute walk from the beach. Excellent choice for family and couples.

The room was small, but location was great. Good was average yet quick and easy with two young kids. The pool was not heated and there was no hottub which was disappointing. It was fine for a night or two, but would have been difficult had we stayed longer.

Location is really good. Staffs are really kind. And park fee is cheaper than other hotel.You can park rent car without fee around zoo.Alamo rent car, zoo, beach, teddy's burger etc.. are close. Especially beach access is really good.

We were happy to stay for a night. The hotel was comfortable and close to the beach, shopping and restaurants. We would stay again and recommend it to others. The bell hop, Leo, was extremely helpful.

Nice place to access to beach. Besides so quiet because of back of busy traffiic road. The room was well house kept everyday.The room was locsted to east do sunbeam was in it was nice to get up in morning natually.

A lovely hotel, nice and close to everything you need! Only one street back from the beach and around the corner from the Main Street of Waikiki. Only thing I didn't like was That wifi was not included in the room charge and had to pay $10 per day to get wifi in the room.

Very convinient and close to the central of wikiki, easy to access to various tourist pointsViewing from room is very good at night, specially lights on the hill side is very beautiful.I would like to stay at the sea view side next time,

Branden was great @ check in, June was extremely helpful finding us a box, Dennis- Bellman wonderful with our packing & check out! We totally enjoyed JulieAnn @ Compai & the food was amazing!!! We will be back in January!!!

I like the hotel and the breakfast was good. I would stay there again. Internet service needs improvement, but I have recommended the hotel to my friends already. Convenient located near the beach, which makes it special.

Three years ago my wife and I stayed at Waikiki Resort Hotel as part of a cruise package. We enjoyed the experience so much that we repeated the package this year including my grown children and their families. The room, service, and buffet breakfast were excellent once again. The location about a half block from Waikiki beach and close to restaurants and shopping make for a wonderful stay.

Suited our shopping and beach going needs perfectly. Great room with views of diamond head and over to Waikiki beach itself. Buffet breakfast was extensive. Very handy having convenience shops inside the hotel. Short walk to best Mexican restaurant too!

This room was book as part of a cruise package. Did not really know what to expect. Felt the rooms were great. Loved having a balcony that you could see the water and the amenties they provided. Only negative is they do not provide WiFi in the rooms for FREE. Now a days with everyone needing WiFi it should be FREE to guests.

Before we took our cruise we stayed at the Waikiki Resort. The hotel is in a great location . Walking distance to the zoo and lots of restaurants. It was clean and the staff was helpful. The breakfast was delicious. After the cruise Leo the bellman checked our bags so we could spend the hay in Honolulu before our 9 o'clock flight. He arranged for a shuttle to take us to the airport. Leo was kind and helpful he gave us a wonderful extra day in paradise! Thank you Leo

It was so thoughtful to open the breakfast buffet at 5:30 am so we could go to Pearl Harbor. The pool closed to soon it closed at 7:30. It was centrally located. An extra bed was put in our room as there were 3 single ladies and we didn't even have to ask.

We stayed for a week with an organized group . The hotel was accommodating, efficient and the beds were very comfortable. The rooms were clean and quiet. It was very close to the beach, restaurants and shopping.

This is a lovely place to stay, 2 blocks from beach lovely clean accommodation. Very comfortable. We had buffet breakfst included with our room which was fantastic and delicious. Great service from staff.

We stayed at Waikiki Resort Hotel on Nov 15, 2015 for a stopover for one night then back to the airport the next morning. About a 25 min ride from the airport. Great location 1 block from the beach. Nice and Clean hotel...Front Desk staff were very friendly. We had to be up for 4:30am for at flight at 7am. We had a problem with the neighbours in the next room partying until 2:30 in the morning (not the hotels fault) I called security to have them quiet it down 3 times. They gave us a discount which was very nice of them. Again not the hotels fault that the next room people were inconsiderate of people around them! I would go back to this hotel again!

Upgraded to partial ocean view for no extra charge - I didn't ask for it, it was given upon check-in. Paid the $25/day for parking and there was always parking under the hotel. Mattresses are a bit soft. The shower was really a 1/2 tub, so taking a bath was NOT an option. Housekeeping was very responsive.1 block from Waikiki beach, so worth the cost. Recommend using the hotel's website and AVOIDING hotel.com and their extra fees!

Great service ! Left with good memories here at Waikiki :) comfortable stying helped a lot!It's super close to the beach, we walked in our swim suite to go to the beach and back. Me and my husband are picky when it comes to choosing a hotel. Despite how old the hotel is, We loved it so much here :)

We had a great experience at this hotel. The room we had was excellent. Very clean every day. Wonderfully helpful staff. The location is hard to beat. Just one block from the beach. We had a decent view as well. Totally recommend this hotel especially to AARP members.

It's close to the beach easy to walk to most locations from. Parking is $15/day, resort fee is $10/day to cover amenities most hotels have standard. However you are in honolulu and waikiki, just about everywhere is going to have a nickel and dime operation like that. The area is tough for parking, just about everywhere is on street but it's tough to find. So naturally something in short commodity will come at a price.  One feature i did like at the hotel was the free dvd rental in the lobby. That was a nice touch. Bathroom was on the smaller side, and could use an update. AC was consistent. Wifi had trouble connecting the first night but once you alter your security settings it can be fixed. The hotel has a partnership of some sort with Korean Air since that airline had a desk in the lobby. Rooms weren't terribly remarkable but were comfortable for our liking. You will find similar prices resorts in this area have about the same outdated areas. I can't and wouldn't want to imagine staying at a place a step under this.

What a great place to stay!Our first time in Honolulu/Waikiki and it will not be our last.Great staff and facilities. Convenience of of the e-Mart down stairs for those little snacks or souvenirs.The staff where only to happy to help all the time.Great buffet breakfast.Finally Dennis is the best bell hop ever only to happy to help with anything from what bus goes where to cracking open our bags due to losing the keys.Thanks for being a great place to stay!!

We paid the same amount for this hotel as we did for five star in Vegas but you cant expect the same standards in Hawaii. The check-in went well and George was friendly and professional. We upgraded to a partial seaview room and were pleased we did. The bed was comfy but a couple of things didnt work. A couple of crucial light bulbs were out and the hair dryer was dead. At night with the wind the sliding glass door continually banged against its frame. I had to jam clothes and paper up into the gaps to try to stop it with only partial success. Two highlights - the free DVD's on offer and Leo the concierge/bel-hop - a great guy. One tip: dont expect a smile from the staff in the convenience store attached to the hotel - not on offer.

It was a very pleasant experience. It is just one block away from the beach and centrally located in Waikiki area. My room had a fantastic view of the beach and I highly recommend this place. Book now!

My statist the hotel was a great experience. Mannerisms and professional very great. One of the cleanest hotel I been to. Workers were very polite and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to whoever needed a pace to stay at. Breakfast in the morning was delious and the scenery was great. One of the best hotel I been to.

Room was quiet and clean. Room # 1003 avoid it! The bathtub does not even allow for me (height 6' 1 inch) to sit in it! We really needed a hot bath or hot tub in hotel after climbing Diamondhead! We also had a large high school group slamming doors most of the night.

We booked the hotel for the weekend to get away from the military base for awhile haha. We paid for a 'city view' room, but got lucky and had a partial ocean view (room 918, def recommend it!) Service was quick and nice. The afternoon/evening bellhop was fantastic! I wish I'd had more cash to give him. Room was clean and comfortable. It had a light bulb out and the shower was a bit small, but no big deal. It is a bit of a walk from the 'heart' of Waikiki (about 15-20 min depending on how fast you walk) but there's still plenty right around where you are. And plenty of shops/restaurants to go into on the walk towards the center, if you wish to do that. The hotel is NOT on the beach. And huge hotels surround it, but we did manage to get a view of the ocean.. so my guess is some of the higher rooms also have a view. But I think it def depends on where you are located. The parking and daily fee is a bit excessive, in my opinion.. On top of the room fees we paid an extra $70 in fees and parking, and that was only for two nights! So take that into consideration when looking at costs. That is really the only complain that I have. Everything else was great!

Very nice hotel just a block away from Waikiki Beach. Very friendly and very helpful staff. Free.Wifi in lobby. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Convenience store just off lobby. Beach towels available on request.

The Waikiki Resort is conveniently located one block from Waikiki Beach on the Diamond Head end. Pluses: Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, the housekeeping staff was very gracious (especially our housekeeper Susan), there is a store located in the building, a pool, and a restaurant. It has a very elegant lobby.Cons: Doors close very loudly which can be a problem if you are sleeping, there is a resort fee which we were charged even though we booked before it was added. It was removed from our bill after we inquired about it. We were upgraded to a higher room which had a great view of the Manoa valley.

I was good time my vacation just like my home .I like to thanks to your staffs working on front Lobby(tow men ) I can not remember his name ..........maybe one of them name George an other young men ? Room cleaning young lady she was excellent thanks every one.

Wonderful experience, I was please to be helped by suzie at check in who accommodated our early arrival. She was most generous and a pleasure to speak with. This enables us to be accommodated at 11 am instead of the usual chk in time of 3. This was such a relief as we were extremely tired from the flight. Thanks and well done.

It was great time my vacation I had.I wishing I can come back soon... We had 2 cars in this time, then parking was little bit expensive. I wish you guys have discount system second of car park. Restaurant was close early...

Our stay at waikiki resort was nice.It was close to everything.The rooms were nice and the beds very comfortable.The breakfast was good and I think her name was Erna who worked in the breakfast area was friendly and knew you immediately.She knew when you wanted your coffee and I mean there was quite a few patrons.

We recently spent two nights at the Waikiki Resort. It's a block from Waikiki beach, and convenient to shopping and restaurants. The rooms are clean and average, the bathroom smelled mildewed. We didn't have a view, but other rooms may have them. There's an air-conditioned room off the lobby where you can print boarding passes for free, but otherwise there's a charge for web surfing. The only free WiFi is in the lobby which is open to heat, humidity, and distractions. Although the room felt safe and quiet, we didn't feel that this hotel was a good overall value for us.

Penthouse was very relaxing, staff was very friendly. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends I ask for up grade and I recieved it thank you for allowing me to enjoy my stay could I please be informed when rooms go on special

I am Gold with Both Marriott & Starwood however, The wonderful front desk staff here at Waikiki Resort far exceeds Both of the above mentioned properties. Scott is extraordinary! Very Helpful, informative and knowledgeable. His fellow staff member Nelson was also very kind! For a last minute reservation, both my husband and I are very happy with this hotel. Very clean, quiet and close to everything. A very good value!

Very clean. Affordable. Great sushi bar with decent prices. WI'll definitely stay again. The location is close to all of the clubs and attractions. Nice swimming pool. Friendly staff. There are two restaurants aswell.

I am so happy with my stay here, upon checking in I was helped my coco and she was hands down the most friendliest hotel worker I have ever meet. Outstanding at her job. Clean hotel, very nice interior, and great location!

Would like to submit 2 complaints:1) having late afternoon flight back home on Oct 21, 2015, my luggage was parked with the Bell Desk after 11am check out. The officer on duty asked for $5 charge fee. I questioned why? I said this should be free service why charging me? He then said $3. I said no way. I'm happy to give tips, but not for unreasonable charge.2) I went to the Gift Shop at Hotel Lobby for last minute shopping. I was being "watched" by two sales persons. The male sales stood next to me while I was looking serongs. I asked "Can I have a look?" He said yes, but still standing next to me, stared at me. I said "can I shop freely on my own?" He said "I'm here just to help out when needed." He still kept standing there watching. That's the 1st time I encountered this unpresant shopping. They are so rude making customers so un-welcoming.
user_name:
Wun Hing Y
Vancouver, British Columbia

review_body: I read a lot of the reviews on this hotel and as always decided to see for myself. Top of the positive list is the location it is perfect, a very short walk to the beach, shops and restaurants. My second positive is the hotel staff, I had read in a previous review that there were no full length mirrors in the rooms and to my dismay, there was none in our room, We only had one medium sized mirror in the bathroom which is not great for 2 ladies trying to put on make up etc. I went to the reception to ask if there were any full length mirrors we could have and was told that they had none, I expressed my disappointment and went out for the day. On our return to the hotel low and behold a full length mirror appeared, apparently the receptionist a very nice lady called Nancy had organised someone to buy one and fix it in our room. Nancy I applaud you as you went the extra mile to make sure our holiday was perfect and I hope this review gets back to her. The breakfasts in the morning were reasonable with the 20% discount you get and it an all you can eat buffet, which isn't bad. I agree with some of the other reviews that the rooms could be updated and they charge nearly 10$ a day for wi fi in your room, which is expensive, you can get it free in the lobby but that can be inconvenient. One positive regarding the room was the view from our room, loved waking up to it every morning. So overall a great 6 night stay and I would go there again.

Good lobby and location. Staff were professional and friendly. Room was surprisingly nice except for the tiniest bathroom I have see in a hotel. Had to go outside of it to change my mind. I might do another overnight there, but would never stay longer because of the bathroom size.

Stayed here for two nights/three days as part of cruise/land package and was pleasantly surprised at their great location, helpful front desk clerks and comfortable room. Overall the hotel is slightly tired because it appears to be heavily used, but we would stay again and recommend it to others. Loved the coin laundry in the basement and they upgraded us for free to an oceanview corner suite. Short walk to beach, dining, and in the heart of the tourist area. We enjoyed our stay.

This hotel is a must stay if you are coming to Oahu! The front desk concierge Coco was more then accommodating. After arriving to the island earlier then planned she looked into getting my husband and I into a room right away. The service she gave us was beyond memorable that we will be back and recommend it to anyone who wants an at ease experience. Although Hawaii is all about a laid back attitude, the service here was far from that. She was up to date on all the island had to offer. Coco was so kind, had such a sweet attitude and made our trip to Hawaii unforgettable. The hotel was clean, fresh, and inviting. The free DVD rental was a nice plus since my husband and I wanted a night in to relax. The balcony on each room was a great feature as well. The friendly staff throughout the hotel was a wonderful addition. Also having a fridge in our room was so perfect, we could store our leftovers from the big name restaurants that were so close to our hotel. I cannot say enough good things about this place. If you want to do Waikiki right, stay here!

I enjoyed my stay it was comfortable and relaxing. The rooms were spacious and the location was perfect as it was centrally located in Waikiki. We were able to walk around and enjoy the strip. We shopped and stopped at 3 places before returning to the room.

Stayed two nights not consecutive for the price it was wonderful and centrally located near everything. Needs a fitness center and jacuzzi. Personnel was very friendly and helpful! Parking was easily accessed under the hotel.

The Hotel was clean and nicely located across from the main beach.The pool was fine,not too busy it would be nice to have towels located on that floor as opposed to getting them in the basement but also nice to have them available for beach use too.The attached coffee shop was attractive and handy for breakfast and lunch with great choices nearby for other meals and bus service to everywhere just around the corner so everything was well located,all in all a good stay.

Resort was in great area, staff always helpfull. Breakfast staff and food great. Rooms clean and tidy. Bathrooms small but workable. Lucky to be updgraded to the 18th floor which was a wonderful surprise.Definately will be back .

There were 13 in our family staying at this hotel. They were so considerate and put our rooms next to each other. The rooms were cozy, clean, and very comfortable.The morning breakfast buffet was very good, lots of choices. We lunched there one day and found the food good and the prices reasonable for that area.. We would stay there again. t

Stayed for a couple of nights and found that we were well looked after. Clean and well maintained. Our room was what we booked - City views. Bed was good. overall, not all that bad really. Sound leakage from the door needs to be addressed, as we found that the sounds of the city could be heard when we were trying to sleep. Maybe just get the seals fixed as part of ongoing maintenance! WiFi works well unless you use a Blackberry Z10, which does not like the WIFi in the hotel. Good Air Con which was quiet. A bonus is that you can get beach towels from the hotel to take to the beach which is a nice touch. Get down to breakfast early, or find somewhere else, as the line up can be way too long.

Nice stay and really close to the beach and restaurant.The bathroom was old and tiny but we were most of the time outside so it was not a big big problem. I suggest to be at a highest floor to avoir some street noise.

Location is 1 street back from waikiki beach,close to all shops and restaurants, would recommend anyone to stay there,staff are friendly,beds where extremely comfortable ,rooms are a little dated,but location makes up for that,c lose to the cheesecake factory, which i should a must go to on your vacation to Hawaii

arrived and upgrade to balcony overlooking the beachgreat hotel and location only STEPS to waikiki beach big rooms clean anything you need just ask. korean air office on location in lobbyclose to museum, zoo, and shopping.

Great location, but this old hotel needs to be updated. Rooms, bathrooms, elevator, all feel old.Check in was slow, restaurant buffet was just ok--but a good price with 20% off coupon. Pool was tiny and not very inviting. Parking lot is small.

great pool, rooms are tight. bath rooms needs updating. In general the whole hotel needs a good update. The staff is great. Especially Joe. He was so helpful with lining up transports to cruise port. They need a restaurant that in better suited for travelers. Location is great. Short walk to beach.

I stayed six nights in this hotel while on holiday . Public areas were clean and comfortable. The bell boys were very informative. The reception staff were friendly and helpful . The bedroom was spacious and comfortable. It had the usual amenities, TV, the mini fridge and coffee making facilities were located in the bathroom. I was concerned about this because of how close to the water they were located. The room also had a iron and ironing board.See picsThe bathroom was split in two.The open wardrobe hanging space was located in the bathroom next to the wash basin, I was not happy about this due to the steam from the shower etc on my clothes.The other part of the bathroom consisted of a shower cubical and toilet only and was really small . I had to step in the shower to get around the door for the toilet. The shower head needed to be updated as it was not very effective. The other thing the room lacked was a full length mirror, even though there was plenty of free wall space for one.The pool area was comfortable with plenty of sun loungers. You were able to get towels for the pool and beach from housekeeping located in the basement. The hotel had a Korean restaurant which we tried. The prices were average but the restaurant lacked atmosphere and under used.

staff was nice, lobby is very good, pool was very small and older, rooms are small, bath tub is TINY, carpet was dirty, sheets were old, bed comfort was ok, not the best but not the worst, hotel needs a little tlc and updating, but it's not too bad. location is the best thing going for it. If you're looking to save money, it's a good choice

We stayed here for 5 nights and were pleased with the service. Reception personal were friendly and helpful. Our room on the 16th floor was large and included a safe and refrigerator. (The hair dryer was not very powerful) The room was very clean. We had partial view over the city. Internet and breakfast were included in our deal. Buffet breakfast was sufficiently stocked and fresh. It was not a noisy area to stay in, a block from the main beach street. I would be happy to stay here again.

4 nights in a penthouse sweet $476 but had service fee of 10per night and 25 per night parking fee. If they mentioned it in the website that would have been nice. I liked that they had movies for free.
user_name:
ser george d
Los Angeles, California

review_body: Very close to the beach, shopping, restaurants, etc. Nothing fancy but I would stay here again! The room was a bit small. Bed was comfy and we had a nice view of the ocean.Staff was great! Location is really what makes this hotel great.

The room service was great! Could not sleep as I could hear every sound from the sliding door and the room above mine.Location was fantastic. Could get to beach and Waikiki shopping in steps. Would prefer more elevators though.

Sat with my car idling when I arrived for 15 minutes. Had to go inside to find out their is no valet, no bell captain to take bags and there was no signage of where to park.. Not ideal after traveling half a day to get here on business... Overall, just a no frills place. Nothing special at all and for the amount that you pay ($300), you can certianly find much better values in Honolulu. Very disappointed and will not stay there again.
user_name:
John P
New York City, New York

review_body: Ideal location for Waikiki just 1 block from beach and close to everything you need to be close to without paying the higher cost. Room is clean and acceptable but it is not over the top. Does not have a jacuzzi.

It was a pleasant hotel, nice and central to the main area. Clean a spacious rooms. We stayed two days pre, and two days post cruise and was a tad upset to be charged quite a sum to store some luggage during that time.

The Hotel is acceptable but the rooms needs to be renovated. . The location is really great very close to the beach right in downtown Waikiki. It is an average hotel. Maybe a little bit expensive for the quality.

We loved the view from our room of the beach where all the locals go to surf. We enjoyed the staff as they were all very friendly. The hotel is located very close to a lot of places to eat and shop not to mention just a block away from the beach.

It was a real pleasure to stay to the Waikiki resort Hotel. Located at only one block to the beach, surrounded by nice restaurants and stores. The staff was very friendly and proffessional. Thank you!

For the price, you can't get a better location in Waikiki. Just a 2 minute walk to the beach (1 block) and all the shops and restaurants. Hotel was great except for a small colony of tiny ants in our bathroom. Mentioned it to the front desk on check out. She was friendly but no apology or any offer of some kind of a rebate. She said she'd have someone look into it. While there, we heard through the grapevine that they were preparing to fumigate the place. Hopefully, this will be resolved promptly for new visitors.

very nice hotel, great spot for shopping with plenty of restaurants nearby , very clean and comfortable beds and very nice pillows spent a week here at the start of September 2015 would stay here again

Enjoyed my stay at this hotel with an exceptionally friendly staff especially the Bell Manager! No ocean view in my room but great central location just one block off the beach front. My only wish is a bigger bathroom, more consistent wi-fi and didn't see the reason for an additional resort charge.

Stayed at this hotel for a conference that was hosted on their 2nd floor. This is a nice clean hotel with reasonable rates. The hotel has a nice pool area, restaurants, pharmacy-type shop and a full service gift shop at their lobby level. A nice hot breakfast is served in their restaurant and hotel appears to be a favorite for tourists. The lobby and restaurant staff were very courteous and helpful. Their rooms are spacious with a balcony, and are clean and well-kept. All-in-all, a very good hotel, but what's lacking is something to make it stand out among all the other hotels in the area.

I had never stayed at this facility before and was concerned. However I was pleasantly surprised. It was comfortable, clean and in a great location. The staff was helpful and friendly. I will definitely stay here again.

It was a ok stay overall at this hotel. We found the room's AC wasn't always working, sometimes it was too cold and sometimes, it wasn't working. Also, the bathrooms are a bit run down, especially the shower area. And the hairdryer wasn't working so we had to have a new one installed, which the staff were very quick about. The only thing going for this hotel is its location...just walking distance from everything. There is even a McDonald's right in front of the hotel.

Booking at last minute on Priceline 10pm, there was some confusion about my reservation when I arrived at midnight. They had no record and said they were completely booked. After waiting 30 minutes when tired from traveling they reluctantly put me in a penthouse suite. That was awesome but the disappointment and reluctance of the staff was not. Also.. please add wifi to the price of the room because charging extra is a hassle for the guests and staff.

Every year we visit our Ohana in Kailua, we always stay at your resort. Not only is the rate affordable but we always look forward to spending the rest of the day or night in our room. Our room is modernly furnished and well kept. Our bed sheets were very clean and wrinkle free. I loved the feeling of laying down on my bed. Overall, we enjoyed our stay in your resort and would highly recommend it to our friends and family. We are coming back in May,2016. See you then. Thank you.

Every year, we stay at this hotel for the Waikiki Hoolaulea. We enjoyed how they set up the room and the ocean view. They have the friendliest workers. I would come back to stay here next year again!!!!

We really enjoyed out stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel and would highly recommend it to friends and family. The location was ideal as it was easily accessible to the beach, food outlets and shopping - these were all within walking distance.. We found it quite easy planning day trips from our location also. The in-house breakfast buffet was excellent.

Very nice staff very respectful to my Mother that required special needs ! Lovely area to beach and reception area . Nice flowers and plants. Rooms were well kept clean and quite. I would stay here again .

The hotel was nice and relatively modern. The location is great for being so close to Waikiki beach and local bars/restaurants.The rooms are adequate but perfectly functional. Wifi was a bit unreliable and would disconnect quite often but not a major concern. The staff were friendly and helpful.It was also relatively cheap for its location on the Waikiki strip as hotels can be very expensive in this area.

Whilst this hotel is perfectly located its rooms, decor and facilities date back to the seventies.Dirty carpets , wallpaper old rickety balcony sliding doors which are not really secure, old plastic balcony furniture, balconies dust and dirty not cleaned, dirty curtains drapes. This hotel need to be closed and refurbished from lobby thru to rooms, lifts,pool area. Guest be advised that balconies sliding glass doors are really hard to lock to avoid inter room balcony theft. Whilst we did not experience any theft, we were paranoid as balconies were easily accessible by other balconies.Staff at reception were exceptional and happy to look after every need, however housekeeping was substandard. Rooms that were supposedly clean from previous guest had towels with lipstick on them , aircon not working in one room ,. Again maintenance were efficient to attend to the problem but it seems nothing is attended to , checked or replaced unless guest complain. There need to be further checks of each room and facilities before guest check in. This hotel is ok for a short stay but I would not recommend basing you Waikiki holiday at this hotel.

We had a good stay at this resort however it was overpriced. When we checked in they gave us 2 single bed even though we did not request it. Generally an accommodation will provide 2 beds if it was requested or of it was selected when booking. We then requested to be accommodated in a king size bed. They were a bit difficult and wanted us to pay the upgrade. I refused to pay and have advised them that i wouldnt have booked if it was 2 single bed and would not pay more for kingsize. It took almost an hour as their system was a bit slow. The room was very average and definitely not worth almost AUD$300 includes taxes and other fees. Breakfast was also average. All in all stay was ok but not special. The good thing about this hotel is the location.

Great hotel but you need to know what level to stay on..the levels 7 and below are noisy..we stayed on level 7 and that was noisy.. from bin collectors (every morning), beeping horns to people laughing and speaking loudly on the street...so I would ask for level 10 and above...though the rooms are a good size and we had interconnecting rooms with our children which was great...The cleaner really made her presence known as every day she made a point of seeing us repeatedly any opportunity she could..which I guess was to ensure she got a tip...very draining and irritating and toward the end of our 10 day stay she did not get to our room before 3ish..so if we were in the room after being out it was unsettling wondering when she would come in..other than that it was a good 3star hotel

I wanted to complement the front desk and bell service at Waikiki Resort for their help. Because of my flight arriving at 3 AM, I had an uncomfortable period of time before my check-in time. The bell service took care of my many bags (I was in process of moving from a different country) and was even accommodating when I had to access them to remove items. The front desk gave me a room at the earliest opportunity and even refunded my breakfast since I would not be able to use it the next morning due to another early flight. Everyone was very helpful and I greatly appreciate it.

I definitely will come back this hotel. Never seen breakfast steak and egg only $13 in Hawaii exclude coupon %20 off. Room is big and clean. Staff are so friendly and patience every time I ask a question. Only 5 minutes walking to the beach and trolly station.I have not tried Koren food on 2nd floor yet but I think will be good food too. In short strongly recommend for everyone who does not know where to stay in Waikiki beach area.

We stayed in Sept 2015. The room was on the 6th floor, it was very clean and well maintained. The heavy curtains helped block the morning sun, the air con was great. Overall a very good hotel. Would stay again.

It was clean, but air conditioning leaked all in my luggage running it the night before we left for home. It also created big puddles of water on our bathroom floor, which we both almost slipped in! Other than that it was ok. The food was horrible in the restaurant!

Staff were attentive and polite. Breakfast was good and open at 6am. Room was a little tired but adequate with quiet aircon. Pool was nice and out of direct sun by 5 pm. Also only 150 metres to the beach.

My 17 year old daughter, her friend and I stayed here in July for 4 nights. It was such an awesome location. Walking distance to the beach, shops & restaurants. We had a room with amazing view of the ocean. Parking was well lit and the staff at the hotel was very welcoming. I'll definitely come back and highly recommend this hotel

It was very handy to everything. Excellent value.Two things that they could improve on:- Clean the carpet in 1109 and have some wear to have a shower and change out of beach clothes when you have a late flight home.

Good place clean cool room. Nice staff, close to beach and zoo. We found the area to be super busy with people filling restaurants and lucky the hotel has a good Korean Resturant that have good Asian food.

The Service: Every staff we have encountered is super friendly. They are all very helpful. Especially Susie at front desk. Very personal service.The Location: Two minutes walking distance from Waikiki beach!!! We go to the beach few times a day. It's super close! Also, trolley and public buses are running on the main street all the time. Very convenient!The Hotel: The hotel is a little bit outdated. But it's well maintained. Big lobby with FREE WiFi. Many seating area. Inroom WiFi $10 per day.3 restaurants on site. Swimming pool on second floor. Gift shop and convenient store on ground floor. Internet center on ground floor..... with A/C! Coffee maker in the room and many other amenities.

Overall is good to stay in your resort, a few suggestions:- the room cleaning do not done properly, some of the beddings sheets, pillow and shower bath towel smelly;- the shop keeper in the convenience store of the first floor is bit rude, after he realised we are Chinese, he refuse talk to us.Otherwise, all good.

Simple and easy. Expensive parking but nice customer service. Perfect location. Not the fanciest but great for the price. Would have liked to stay longer but was just on Oahu overnight for a doctors appointment.

I stayed for one night, nice room which fit my needs, the staff was friendly and location was excellent, a short walk to everything I wanted to do, beaches, shopping, Diamond Head etc. Would stay there again.

We were at this resort for 2 days. It is clean place, had decent free breakfast and an excellent location. Ciean hotel with decent free breakfast.it is close to beach and commecial district, plenty of restaurants and shooping close by.

Great location- central to all services-activities-eaterys & attractions-friendly staff and all services top shelf. Provided a great base to explore the island of Oahu. Would recommend to all. Barry Ryan.

Clean, good location, reasonable facilities. Would recommend this hotel to others and would stay again. The staff were friendly and unobtrusive. Our beds were comfortable. Check out is 11 am which is very reasonable. The pool was a nice change from the beach.

Nice hotel.Kids (8 and 9) liked it.Nice poolLittle bit noisy (waikiki surrounding)Missed a bar in the hotel/pool and a good coffee.We will choose Waikiki Resort the next time again. We rented a car and could park it at the hotel what was very relaxed.

very friendly and helpful staff very clean great location good value for money had a great time there.Realy close to beach reception area was quite and relaxing as was the pool area. the bed was very big and comfey our room had a fridge and a microwave as well as a sink and cupbourds to store food.view of beach from balcony were lovely would recommend a stay to anyone.
user_name:
rensemarilynb
Berwick upon Tweed, United Kingdom

review_body: Fantastic location without the hefty price tag. Recommended by a friend who frequents the hotel. Was not disappointed. Very happy with value for money. Great location for the price. Comfortable rooms.

Stayed here for 10 days 5-15th July 2015 & loved the location of the hotel being just about 2 mins from famous Waikiki beach. There are loads of convenience shops very close by & restaurants were also in very close proximity:) @ the hotel I only went to "Ilima" for b/fast so I never tried any of the other ones although I was told they were very good! The room was very clean with an awesome city view & to be honest I never spent that much time @ the hotel but the staff were great & I would highly recommend the hotel for price & location..you will be very pleased when staying here:)!http://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ShowUserReviews-g60982-d4543517-r194457643-Seoul_Jung-Honolulu_Oahu_Hawaii.html#

Very nice hotel, the bathroom could be nicer but i liked the hotel very much. Nice staff close to the beach we all wanna swim in. Close to everything in waikiki. Loved to stay there again! We got alot of help with all we needed, all Tours could be get at the hotel and they can help you good!

Excellent front desk service. Quietest hotel we have ever been in. Beds were extraordinary. Clean and comfortable. Rooms were a good size. Very close to beach. Breakfast was excellent. It loses one star just because the rooms need a bit of updating and the bathroom is very basic. Would definitely stay here again and would have no problem recommending.

They were totally kind. And provided us good services. I will stay their hotel again on my next trip to Hawaii. But there's one thing they can make it nicer. Door closing sounds (of other room) in midnight disturbed my son's sleep. I hope I can rest in more quiet room next time.

Enjoyed staying at this hotel. A little outdated but very clean rooms. Location is excellent and one block away from Waikiki beach. Evening front desk staff needs to be trained to make decisions when Manager is not available.

The hotel is very close to the beach and you can walk there in 5 minutes. Place is a little old but staff is really helpful and friendly... And for the price, it's worth it. If you are going to Hawaii and explore Oahu, this hotel will be really great.

I went out to Hawaii as a solo traveller for 2 weeks from the UK and the hotel did nothing but accommodate my needs. The only issue I initially had was that the wifi wasn't standard in the room but once I had talked to the guys at the desk they sorted me out with access in my room.

All things were convenient, clean and comfy. We had a bit of wi-fi trouble, but other than that, we loved our stay. One block from the beach was really wonderful. The lobby is beautiful and the staff was helpful and friendly. We really liked it. It was family friendly, too.

Great location, very close to the beach. Hotel & room was clean, bed was comfortable. Registration was less than expected, not very warm or friendly. Hotel lobby was hot - could use some overhead fans to move the air.

Everything was nice, hotel staff were helpful. The only complaint I have is that the shower was difficult to use because it was really small. But it had a removable shower head, so i just used that. Other than that, i really enjoyed it. It's about. Block away from the ocean and all the shops. Super great location for walking around!

Great location within walking distance of everything including the ocean. Good price and friendly staff. The rooms are a little on the small side, but we didn't spend much time in there. Quiet inside the rooms. My only complaint would be with the a/c. The room always felt damp and the a/c was never able to cool to the temp that we had it set at. We would stay here again.

Center at the Waikiki beach. Best location ever. One minute to Waikiki beach. Walking distance to shopping center. The facilities are fine. Clean. Not large enough. Ocean view is half hidden by front hotel. But Best location ever. 80% are Korean (Korean resort). I highly recommend if you are planning to chillin at the Waikiki beach.

The hotel wasn't bad and wasn't too old. The decor in the rooms might need an update but it was relatively clean. The best part was that the location is situated a couple blocks from the main Waikiki beach area as well as the bus stops for the main lines to get around Honolulu. The staff was friendly, minus a couple front desk workers who neglected to give us information about the secondary parking lot, so we had trouble finding parking in their garage. Overall, great if you're looking for a place to sleep at but will be spending most of your time at the beach or touring.

It is a great place to stay i am very happy with there service i will definitely stay there again . The views from our room was great and it was a short walk to the beach thanks you Waikiki resort for making our holiday special

It was great that everything was close to the hotel, for all of out activities that we did buses went to the hotel to pick us up. Parking was $25 per day if you have a car. Did not like that wifi was $10 extra. TV does not have a lot of kids channels.

My first time staying in this hotel. As many other reviewers have stated, it is an aging hotel and a bit dated. However it seems like they try their best to keep up with the times and cleanliness of their rooms. It was a hell of a price for the time of the year I was going. All other hotels in the area were price at around $350 and up. I just needed a place for me and my kids to rest our heads, because honestly who goes to Hawaii to hang out in their room? It was the perfect hotel for my scenario. Sleep, wake up, freshin up, out for breakfast, beach bummin, out for lunch, more beach bummin, out for dinner, even more beach bummin, back to hotel, shower, sleep, and repeat.

We are here at the moment. Great location as the hotel is only about 100 metres from the beach. Pros: reasonably priced. Friendly and helpful staff. Close to the beach. Cons: very dated (but clean and spacious) rooms. The outside view from the pool is a really untidy block of apartments and paint peeling on the hotel. I would stay here again though.

It is a very good hotel, very well located near the Waikiki beach, Honolulu as well as all the wonderful ABC and other stores, eating joints etc. The reception area was neat & the check-in staff, courteous. Our bell boy, Leo from Philippines was the best.Our room was on the 18th floor. Though it lacked the view of the Pacific ocean, the Waikiki Beach or the Diamond Head hill, it had a terrific view of the city, the beautiful housing on the sloping hill opposite, the golf course etc. The room was neat; the double beds were extra large with clean linen; the free Wi-Fi worked well; the toilet was clean; the sink was outside the bath area and was sparkling.The breakfast was sumptuous. As vegetarians, we were worried but there were several things on offer for us.

The hotel is ageing however this didn't bother us in the slightest. The staff were fantastic and friendly, the location is just perfect. We enjoyed a room on the 16th floor with wonderful ocean views. The king bed was very comfortable. I would be happy to stay there again.

This is my third time staying at the Waikiki Resort Hotel and next time in Waikiki, I will stay there again. Fantastic location - only 1 block from the beach. The rooms are not 5-Star rooms, but they are clean, well kept and the beds are very comfortable. Our A/C worked quite well and the front desk was very pleasant to deal with. Parking underneath the hotel was tight, but we never had a problem finding a spot.

We stayed here for one night before a cruise. It's within walking distance of the beach and shopping, and is reasonably priced for the area, but is just so-so. Rooms were clean, but in need of a face lift. The bathroom was tiny, especially the shower. The water pressure in the shower was practically non-existent, and the temperature kept fluctuating between hot and cold. We booked a package with free wi-fi and breakfast, which was fine, if not inspired. The concierge was hard to find, and not very helpful once we located him. The ladies in the gift shop were very nice.

This hotel is excellent value and in an equally excellent location. The staff are friendly and courteous, giving help where needed.We were checked in upon arrival by the lovely staff member June who made us most welcome and we received the keys to a lovely room which was quiet and very comfortable, The beach is 3 minute walk and so are restaurants, convenience shops and coffee shops. Walking towards Diamond head (left at the beach) is an amazing walk in the early morning, with a coffee shop 1km away next to the beach for a break.The location was the best attribute with the least being no free wifi in rooms, we had to take our computers, iphones etc to the lobby to check mail etc.

Not a bad resort to stay at, local to everything in Waikiki and extremely central which was great. Rooms were clean, air con was wonderful and we even got a complimentary upgrade. It was lacking a few things that make it really comfortable for me- free wifi in your room, a gym, nice beach towels. I guess it was value for money in terms of a mid range type of accommodation.The concierge wasn't overally helpful with the questions I asked, so I ending up booking things myself.Bell boys and front desk staff were friendly. The cleaning staff didn't speak a lot of English, so it was hard to discuss things with them, but they didn't a good job of cleaning.Has laundromat facilities. Pool was basic but clean.

Very nice place to stay. I have stayed in waikiki 8 times in last 12 months and this is by far best for the money. Rooms were clean beds are soft a/c is best of all hotels in the area, Staff was very nice and easy walk to all that you may need .

Awesome location for the price! It's a very short walk to the beach and next to a ton of shopping. There's free wifi in the rooms! The Korean BBQ restaurant on the 2nd floor was amazing! The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Stayed for 7 nights & would like to especially thank George & Kevin for making our stay enjoyable & nothing ever being a problem for them. They were both very obliging & very courteous. Thoroughly recommend. Chris K

My first room was good except that the tiles in the shower were coming up. I let the front desk know and I was immediately moved. great customer service from Branden and George. They helped me with directions, places to eat, shop and visit while I stayed at the hotel. With everything else being good, I will be back because of the great customer service. Kudos Branden and George!

Love that place. Wonderful employees. The staff was very helpful. Great location. My sons first time to Hawaii he loved it there. We will be back again next year for another family vacation. Love that place thank you

Nice hotel in a perfect location. The hotel upgraded our room to an ocean view room for free. That was a nice surprise! Free wifi in room would have been a nice touch however. Overall a nice place! We

everything was perfect. i liked the fact that there was internet in the rooms and many may many dads to also have for a fixed price per day. would have liked the restaurant to be open all day though or have room service

The hotel was good, the furniture was a little dated, but, the beds were very comfortable. Like sitting out on the balcony during the day and night, wish I had gotten a room with a view of the beach instead of street view. Maid service was excellent.They do need air conditioning in the lobby thought. On the day of check out we couldn't get a late check out and our flight didn't leave until 10:30pm so we had to wait around until our 8pm pick up. Kinda warm. For the most part a really good stay. I would suggest getting the package when booking the hotel with breakfast, the food was good but, pricey.

Waikiki Resort Hotel is in a great location. It's a 200m walk to the beach! It is not a 5 star hotel, but it is clean and comfortable. Close to bus & trolley routes and lots of ABC Stores!! The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely look at staying there again simply because of the ease of getting around from this location without a car.

Nice place always kept clean and great people at the front desk and in the dorms. Location is quite central and is close to everything. There is not much daylight is the only minus, but that did not worry me much.

This was the first time I travelled to Hawaii, and the Waikiki Resort made our trip perfect. All the staff were fabulous, location was great and all of the amenities were very good. Our room was cleaned every day, and we found the staff that worked at concierge and the bell desk super helpful. I was located on the 18th floor, which had an amazing view. I was far away from the lift as well, and the hotel was always quiet. I do not have a single complaint about the hotel at all. It was all perfect!

The lobby area should have door closed to keep the smoke outside and 25 feet away from the entrance and the shower stall small, no free wifi inside the room :( Could not see ocean view from the room :(

Friendly, courteous staff with quick and easy checking in and out. The hotel is situated in an ideal location very close to the beach and shopping. No internet in room, only in foyer was inconvenient.

I was in Waikiki for 2 days of business and book an extra 5 days with hubby after my meetings.The hotel was beautiful - lobby is this stunning indoor /outdoor tropical oasis. Our king suite was much larger than expected. wlthough this property is NOT ocean front, loxated a coule blocks from the water, we had a lovely view of Waikiki beach from our private balcony. Room was quiet, beautiful, well appointed, and very romantic

overall good and friendly service, need accommodations in the rooms for the disabled, bar in bathroom showers, by toilet,etc. my father had a fall due to no bar in shower and the mat was down, broke his wrist made vacation a bit stressful, and a few more handicap parking would be great one isn't enough. Also, bit of an inconvenience to walk down to basement for swimming towels.

I've been coming to Waikiki for many years and this hotel is reasonably priced, right near the main beach and Blvd - but most of all, it's a got a warm personalized feeling with a VERY helpful and accommodating staff. The rooms are always clean and there's a nice breakfast restaurant which services primarily the hotel guests. I don't think you can find a better deal for the value.

Friendly staff and cost effective rooms. Check in to check out very fast and easy!!! Room was clean, a little dated but most importantly clean. Overall a good stay and I will very likely stay there again.

The rooms were pretty spacious, however there was a small bathroom. Very close to the beach, great location. Nice pool and spa Overall the hotel was very good, but my one complaint would be the wifi. There was free wifi in the lobby, but if you wanted to get wifi in your room, you would need to pay 10 dollars a night.

It is a very customer friendly hotel. The room was always clean. It was great that there is a store and a restaurant there. Also planning on things to do was also nice because I was able to do it there. Very helpful and friendly staff.

My partner and I stayed at Waikiki Resort for 7 nights. We had a fabulous time. The room price was reasonable compared to other hotels, the location is perfect, close to the beach and shopping areas, and the rooms were comfortable with air conditioning.We were particularly impressed with the night staff (George and Branden on reception). They were both friendly, polite and gave us really good advice in terms of transport, site seeing and locations, all with a big smile on their faces :) We want to thank them for their excellent service. We would happily return to stay again and wish or stay was longer!!
user_name:
Hamish B
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: This no frill resort was fine for my business trip. Wouldn't recommend if you were spending lots of time in the room. Service was very good, but the shower wouldn't contain the spraying water and soaked the floor.

The bath room is smaller than I expected. Cost-effectiveness is good! The hotel provided guests the best possible care anytime day or night. There was no microwave ovens in the room. but, we used microwave oven in the house keeper's room

Have a good location.The bath room is smaller than I expected.Cost-effectiveness is good!The hotel provided guests the best possible care anytime day or night.There was no microwave ovens in the room.but, we used microwave oven in the house keeper's room.

We were overall happy with our stay. The location was perfect for us. Besides the bad parking and our air condition didn't work properly, we couldn't get it to cool down. The blow dryer didn't work either but they replaced it right away. . Nice restaurants too.

Everything was as expected. Clean and great location. No complaints about the facilities and services. The building is well maintained although aging but for the price in comparison with others in the area it was good. I was charged a facility fee of $10 a day I did not know when I booked the hotel at Hotel.com. This type of b.s. fee (supposedly for use of the pool since there was no jacuzzi or anything else) is now being implemented everywhere to extract more more from guests but make the room charge seem lower than it is. Only thing unsatisfactory was that the concierge service needs improvement. Tried to get help with transportation to Pearl Harbor and was recommended a much more expensive company (only one company they recommended) than I was able to get online and that company recommended by the hotel had terrible reviews on Yelp and TripAdvisor. They should help the guests instead of trying to make money also from outside services.

This was the 1st time staying at Waikiki Resort. Staff was friendly and helpful, room was clean. Breakfast buffet was good. Location was close enough for us to walk to shopping, beaches and Waikiki Shell. We would stay here again.

Our family usually goes to Hawaii about once a year. We try to stay at different hotels each time to see what they all have to offer. The staff here is very helpful and nice, the location is wonderful. It's a block to the beach; you can hear it from your room if you don't have a beach view. But that’s about all I can recommend the place for. Straight off the bat one circle is gone for not having free WiFi throughout the whole hotel. There is only free WiFi in the lobby. Otherwise, it's $10+ each day you use it.The hotel is also in desperate need of a redo. It looks to have been decorated in the Don Ho/Elvis in Hawaii era and not changed since. The wallpaper is peeling, there's mildew on the walls and ceiling of the bathroom.The in-house restaurants all close around 2 (some for the day!) and only open at 4:30 or 5 or have really sporadic hours (I'm talking about you, Kampai) so you miss them completely.We paid upwards of $220+/night to stay here. I feel our money could have been better spent elsewhere and we would have gotten more out of our stay.If location is all you're after, by all means take your chances. If you want a complete package you might want to try somewhere else.

I stayed there few few days after I finished work and I loved this place. Wonderful view and the location just perfect. Walking distance to the beach and the shops are not far with the bus. And better than all, the pick up for all the touristy trips where just from the front of the hotel :)

The hotel is located in an excellent location just a block from the beach. There are plenty of restaurants and shops within minutes of the hotel. The staff are very helpful and the concierge assisted us with all our tours of the available functions\events. The only negative point we found was only having free WIFI in the lobby while having to pay for it in the room.

Service and room were excellent, and the restaurant on the ground floor has a very good breakfast buffet.
