We were told this cannot be changed as we were upgraded to a superior room that has a partial ocean view. The room given was on 4th floor, and was indeed larger than average, but no ocean view at all. Decor was very run down - room looks dirty, carpet was old and there was an exposed wiring for about 3 metres hanging along one side of the wall. The TV was mounted on the wall next to (instead of facing) the bed, which makes viewing difficult. Service is poor - no smiles from receptionists. Impressive hotel foyer, location, and good buffet breakfast aside, we went away vowing we will not return.

The Waikiki Resort Hotel is located one block from the beach, in the heart of Waikiki. It is a short walk to the beach, shops and restaurants.The provided a typical standard room. There was nothing to find fault with. The hotel staff were very helpful. They were even willing to tell us how to catch local buses rather then trying to sell us expensive toursThe rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. There is a nice pool, overchlorinated but otherwise acceptable.We were only looking for a room for two nights between flights and a cruise. So we were not looking for a luxury resort. It perfectly filled the role.The hotel has strong Korean links and most of the customers are Korean as it has Korean Restaurants. We only had breakfast in the hotel. That was an excellent buffet.

The Waikiki Resort is fine for what it is, a no frills hotel in the heart of Waikiki and 1/2 block from the beach. The room is basic and acceptable. I was here on business and it worked out for me fine. If I wanted a vacation resort, I would have gone to the Hilton Village. However, this hotel is exactly as advertised. Staff was very nice and very helpful. Wi-Fi in the hotel rooms should be free in this day and age, as necessary as television and air conditioning. To pay for Wi-Fi is frankly off-putting. I paid for it because frankly, I had some work to complete. However, I would use this hotel again in the future.

the room and location were excellent. staff was great. i have always looked forward to a dip in a pool after being on the beach. the pool water was way to cold to stay in. i was very disappointed about that. i would recommend your hotel except for the pool.

Feb 2015, pool unusable , rooms too small , food below standard, location great , staff amazing ,room was clean , water pressure low ,, not good when you have been at the beach all day , not enough closet space for a room with two beds , view awful in 612

This is a Korean Hotel where all the flight crew from Korean Airlines stay. We had a nice stay there, even better once we moved up to the 12th floor. The 6th floor gets all the Street and traffic noise. We had a small wedge view of the ocean because I near the beach, all the hotels are sky scrapers and block any view. Ask for a room 12th floor or higher! Rooms are clean and ok maintained. There is a 5 star authentic Korean food restaurant on the 2nd floor. We would stay there again because it is so close to the beach. We were with a tour group.

We used this hotel for our first two nights on Oahu as a landing platform. It is not very expensive but ok. Our room was small but clean & sufficient. Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is only block away from Waikiki, perfect walking distance. Many Korean tourists come to this hotel as it has a special deal with Korean Air and apparently a very good Korean restaurant on the first floor (that we did not try out). Two things I did not like: no free internet available (only in the lobby) and the breakfast buffet is pretty simple & overpriced (there are better breakfast options just around the corner at f.ex. Shore Fyre.

Had a noisy room the first night , they changed us to another room that was way quieter on the 16th floor the hotel is a half block from the beach and close to bus stops. we booked with expedia and every thing went smooth

It was our first time in Hawaii with our friends and family. Hotel is nice and close to the beach and restaurants . Room service were great . Friendly staff. Would recommend to family and friends. Mahalo

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 9 nights in January. Overall, we had 0 problems with this hotel. We thorougly enjoyed our stay and it is AMAZINGLY close to the beach and shops and food. We were literally in the best location and I would definitely stay here again just for that. The room was nice, clean and the bed was comfy. We didn't use the pool as the beach is literally a 200 metre walk so I can't comment on that. There is a store in the lobby that is really useful for toiletries, souvenirs and snacks.The only thing I would suggest would be to offer free wifi in the rooms as I thought most hotels did this now anyway. But even though there wasn't, it was no big deal as you just went down to the lobby if you wanted to use it.Overall, the stay was great.

We stayed in October 2014 for 4 days and had a great time. The hotel is a little dated but who spends too much time in their room when in Honolulu. The staff were great - from check in to check out everyone was helpful and pleasant. The guys on the concierge desk couldn't have been more helpful organising transport to the factory outlets. The breakfast was great, plenty of variety. One street back from the beach, no resort fees and reasonably priced who could ask for more!

We stayed here for 2 nights on a stopover from LA to Australia. This was a great location and is a thoroughly comfortable and presentable hotel. Walking distance to the beach, shops and restaurants. The breakfast buffet was fantastic too.

The Staff ~Will, George, Brian, Dave, Joe, Susie, Nancy, Dennis, Kevin & June are fantastic. They answered our questions daily & always with a smile.. No extra Resort fee. Great Location, Beach, etc.!

We stayed here in mid Dec 2014 for my mums birthday. The rooms were decent and clean. Staffs are all helpful and very friendly. One of the staff was very kind and upgraded us to a floor below the penthouse for a night and it was splendid! Partial beach/ocean view and on our last day we got to see a full rainbow out of our balcony. Located at the center of city, close to restaurants and shops. No hassle to walk back after a night out. Our receptionist was Dave, GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE! We had a great time staying there.

If you think you'll be staying at nice motel you won't be disappointed. It's clean, but it's old,especially bathroom. I'm not sure if it was just the room we stayed, but the smell in the bathroom was not nice. The smell from korean restaurant on 2nd floor took care of that bad smell. You can't beat this location though. Parking is $25 and you can go in and out. Yes it's expensive,but normal in waikiki at least it's not a vallet parking. Their pool was nice actually nobody was using it I guess it's because beach is a block from this hotel. Free Internet is only in lobby area,so many people were there to use Internet. Their stuff are very nice. Bacically you get what you pay for.

Loved it!! I picked this hotel in particular as I wanted traditional Hawaiian decor, we got this and more. The staff were very friendly, we had great ocean views and we could not get over how close we were to Waikiki Beach - a 1 minute walk. It was such a wonderful surprise!

Had the best holiday ever here. Staff were always very kind and helpful. It isn't super luxury but the location is ideal and is close to all major amenities. Lovely and friendly hotel. Only a stones throw away from the beach and everything was always very clean.

Abt me: Female - > 35yo I usually stay at Hilton Family hotelsI usually take about 4 trips recreationally each year (within the U.S. and outside the U.S.)Pros: The Waikiki Resort Hotel is in a great location - Very close to the beach and a main shopping & eating street running parallel to the beach. This is the biggest advantage to the hotel for it's price point.The breakfast buffet offered is very good (fresh fruit, salad, eggs, meats (at least 2 options), cereal, miso soup, plain rice porridge/juk/congee, cereal, various baked goods, juice, coffee) - So if it's part of your room rate/plan, then go for it. Most rooms have a small balcony with 2 chairs (called a lanai in Hawaii). The Korean restaurant on-site is good/tasty (moderately priced in my opinion - good portions - don't order too much, Korean dishes come with several small sides and rice - there is a small discount on most dishes if you stay at the hotel (certain deals/specials are already discounted)).Cons: The rooms are dated and need refreshing. Although it seemed clean and well maintained enough. The breakfast location is small - Get there right when they open or wait at least 30 to 45 min after they open for the initial rush to die down. I think there was free wi-fi in the lobby only (I didn't use it). The staff were friendly and helpful.We stayed there a few days just before the anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor (Dec 2014) so there were several American high school bands staying in the hotel at the same time. The students were a bit rowdy and a bit disrespectful of the other hotel guests (at night and in the lobby). Thankfully, the students did not eat breakfast in the breakfast location.This is not really the hotel's "fault" per se but I have the strong feeling that based on the hotel's price point and location, it's popular with for tour groups or other groups. So I wouldn't be surprised to see a lot of guests at the hotel on a regular basis.I did not use the pool or the spa (I think there was a spa on-site...).Other food recommendations close to the hotel: 1) For Spam Musubi fans - Musubi Cafe Iyasume - It's in the Aqua Pacific Monarch Hotel (literally a block or so from the hotel) - Next to Jinroku (Japanese restaurant - I did not eat here) - On Kuhio Avenue - Very tasty spam musubis - Cheap (abt $2.50/musubi) - Good for breakfast or a snack - The musubis are made by little old Japanese ladies - Cute place - I only tried the regular spam musubi and the bacon/egg/spam musubi, both very tasty.2) Sansei - Good and creative/interesting Sushi/Japanese/Asian fusion cuisine - They have a few locations in Hawaii (Maui (Kihei), Waikiki, etc). It's about a 7-10 min walk - To the Left after you reach the main street - On the 2nd or 3rd floor of the Marriot. 3) Cheeseburgers in Paradise - Good comfort food with some Hawaiian twists/ingredients.4) Honolulu Cookie Company - Very tasty cookies!!! - Shortbread cookies shaped liked a pineapple.There are "ABC's" everywhere if you need a quick convenience store. "ABC" stands for "Aloha Brings Customers" but most Hawaiians refer to it as "All Blocks Covered." :-) I am NOT a fan of Honolulu/Waikiki overall. It's too touristy, urban and busy. The traffic is very busy. But if you are looking for an urban location with lots of shopping, restaurants, and nightlife but next to nice beaches, then Honolulu/Waikiki is a good choice. Otherwise, I personally prefer Maui (Southwest Maui/Kihei/Wailea area) or Kauai. Overall, I gave this hotel 4 stars because of the location, friendliness of the staff, and price point. I would be willing to stay here again if I ever returned to Waikiki/Honolulu.

Stayed here over Thanksgiving for 4 nights and the hotel itself is only 1 minute walk from the beach so that was a great plus. Other things were average. I definitely recommend much higher floor (we stayed at the 3rd level which had no views at all) since others seem to be able to have ocean views. Room was basic and mostly clean aside from a leaky shower stall, part of the bathroom door was rotted off and also we managed to kill a small cock-roach crawling around on the desk. Staff were kind and courteous and no complaints there. Just that the room was not as good. They do have a nice delicious Korean restaurant on the 2nd floor that was nice. This was not by choice since we did a tour package so I do not have exact pricing for this place but if you spend all that money and time to fly to Hawaii, I personally would prefer a nicer place for a longer stay. Also no free wifi. Not sure if this is typical of Hawaiian hotels (this was our first time here) so be aware of that as well.

Upon checking in I was greeted by the front desk personnel and they were so friendly and full of aloha spirit. They were helpful and informative. We had a beautiful view of the beach and only one block from the beach. The kids used the swimming pool and enjoyed it very much. We had breakfast coupons and enjoyed the meal which was fresh and plentiful. I will certainly use this accommodations again.

I travelled to Honolulu with my wife and our 14yo daughter. We didn't really pick the Waikiki Resort Hotel, as it came as part of a package tour we bought. Having said that though, we couldn't say we were unhappy with what we got.The Waikiki Resort Hotel is located just one block back from Waikiki beach and, therefore, very well located. It is also within walking distance of all the shopping and restaurants in Waikiki and, is well serviced by the hotel pick-up services used by the local tour organisations.Having not used any other hotels in Waikiki, it might be a little unfair to call it a B-grade hotel. I would say that it is a little older than some of the other hotels we saw; it is a little smaller [maybe that's a 'plus'].The Waikiki Resort Hotel is, though, very comfortable. The staff we dealt with were great. The rooms were very, very clean and the daily house-keeping did a wonderful job. The bell desk guys were friendly and helpful, as was 'Steve' who helped us with booking a tour.There is a very good 'convenience store' on site too.Would we stay there again? Most likely. We're not 'luxury' travellers, and like to get good value for our money. Normally, we treat hotels as just somewhere to lay our heads for the night, so we look for reasonable value.Any negatives ... specifically to our room (#1111), the toilet wailed like a banshee at every flush, right up till the cistern was fully refilled! Only a big issue if used in the middle of the night.Little niggles ... the doors to the rooms closed with a decent slam. Again, only an issue if you or your neighbour came in or went out during the night. And, the rooms could do with another mirror. Maybe a full length one behind the door, or opposite the bathroom door on the wallOh, and totally out of the Waikiki Resort Hotel's control, the Pacific Beach Hotel, which our room faced, played music into it's outdoor reception area late into the night. NOT loud annoying music; kind of at 'background' level, but still able to be heard where we were on level 11. Maybe the music lulled me to sleep, I don't know. I just remember being aware of it every night. Very light sleepers could find this a nuisance. For me, it was just 'there'. Neither really a nuisance, nor a plus.

This hotel is centrally situated a block back from the sea. The rooms are good and the hotel reception staff are very helpful. Free WiFi is available in the room but better reception in the lobby.The hotel has all the usual amnities

We had a beautiful view of the beach and ocean, everything was clean, the staff was very nice/helpful, and it's very convenient to get to the beach, restaurants, etc. We had the romance package that included the breakfast buffet, early check-in, & late check-out. The food was pretty basic, but fresh and plentiful. Wi-fi was easy to access and they stored our luggage at no charge as we were actually transferring to another resort later that day. We would definitely stay there again.

I was there for one night only, but it was a great experience because of the service and the delicious food.Actually i was late for my flight and the people from the hotel took care of me, they woke me up jus in time.

Upon arrival Dennis (bellmen) helped us with our luggages without hesitation. The front desk agents were really friendly and suzie (supervisor) accomdated us very well. We were told that our room was not ready yet and that rooms are guaranteed ready by 3 pm. Therefore we left our luggages with Dennis and headed out to waikiki strip to get something to eat. There is a restaurant near the lobby but they were not open for brunch, A mcdonalds near by, and another restaurant called eggs and things. Not much selection of places to eat near the hotel as the international market place was about a 15/20 minute walk. We got back to the hotel at around 12 pm and our room was ready, I had put in a request for a higher floor and we were located on the highest floor of the building (floor 18) however we were right next to the elevator! At night it was a little hard to sleep as we could hear the elevators going up and down. We decided to stick it out as we were only there for 2 nights. As my Husband and I got to the room our first impressions was that it was small, King sized bed and the bathroom was as small as the lanai. Overall experience it was okay.

My wife and I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel from the 13th - 22nd October 2014. This was our first ever trip away from Australia, and we hit the jackpot by staying here. Not the flashiest hotel,(which, to be honest, made relaxing a lot easier) but for location (one block from the beach, close but not too close), professional and friendly service, and truly outstanding value for money you could not hope for better. We are already arranging our return trip with our whole family. Make sure you book through the hotel website, as they included free buffet breakfast . And what breakfasts. I could hear my Doctor screaming back in Australia as I gave it the full Homer Simpson treatment.The rooms are very quiet (no lift noise), and are very clean, and have everything you want, such as hairdryers, ironing board and iron, coffee and tea facilities. The pool is really nice as well.The staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful, and the super efficient and informative concierge service helped us make our dream holiday a reality.Brian and Nada would like to offer our most sincere thanks to the staff and management of the Waikiki Resort Hotel, as they are great people in a great place.

We stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel for 7 days in October.We were greeted with the best service ever.I will always go back when returning to Hawaii.What made the Resort so different to the rest is the service provided by 3 gentleman at the main desk. They provided us with 5 star service nothing was ever a problem we could ask them anything and they would do it or give advice. Joe Michael, Branden and Dave really made our trip pleasant they made us smile every time we walked through the reception area and really made our trip very part more enjoyable, we will forever return while ever these 3 are working here. We will forever recommend The Waikiki Resort Hotel.

The location is perfect...one short block to Waikiki Beach. The hotel is immaculate, the staff is friendly, the restaurants are excellent, the beds are super comfortable, and the price is right! What else do you really want? The bathroom is small...a minor inconvience. The clientele include many Koreans. A convention of Korean students who were well behaved, quiet, and respectful made us glad we were not with a convention of American students! We had a great view on 16th floor of the beach and watched the surfers arrive at sunrise each morning. This end of Waikiki is less congested, and a shortvwalk to the aquarium and zoo. I will definitely recommend to friends who don't demand 5 star hotels. The Korean restaurant was amazing!

The Waikiki Resort Hotel was a very satisfactory place to make a layover stop. We loved George at the front desk. He was so personable, charming and helpful. He made us feel very welcome after a long day of travel. The rooms had comfortable beds and were very clean. We did not try the onsite restaurants. This hotel is one short block away from the beach! Great location.

The room and bathroom is small and not fancy - pretty basic stuff. Who cares though, you are steps from Waikiki beach, shops restaurants and buses that will take you just about anywhere! If you are lucky enough to get a top floor (I was on the 18th), you should have a great view - I had almost an almost full view of the ocean.The hotel itself has friendly staff who are very accommodating to requests, a nice pool and decent place for breakfast. I did not try the restaurant. It was also great to have a booking agent at the front desk who could pretty much book you on the spot for activities.

Stayed here for our recent holiday, very central to beach, bus & tour pickups. Staff are excellent especially Branden, Kevin and Joe [-]. These guys were the best always pleasant and helpful they made our stay very enjoyable & solved all of our problems. And also a special mentioned for Lahaina - (concierge) who organised all our tours especially the Blue Hawaiian helicopter tour, all were fantastic. The only let down was the lobby wi-fi so bad always had a problem, worth looking into better connection.

I went to Hawaii last April and stayed in this hotel . The place is near the beach front and there are lots of shops and stores within the vicinity. The staff are nice and friendly , breakfast is also a good experience , food is fine .

I stayed in the honeymoon here. I do not speak English well. I'd want you to understand me.The hotel location was very good. was good to swim near the beach. Restaurant in the hotel which was clean, delicious.The McDonald's near a lot of restaurants. Another store was close to downtown. I'm also convenient to shopping T- Galleria Duty Free. The staff was friendly. I tried to solve my inconvenience. Dragonfly also had very side, was clean. This is true all. I have experienced it yourself. It was a happy and fun time for me too. My children and I want to come back here.

The front desk staff Branden, Dave, Joe were simply amazing. We were made to feel like family from the very beginning. The hotel is located conveniently to the beach, shopping, and restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is very clean & housekeeping staff very nice. I would definitely stay here again & highly recommend.

The location is ideal. One short block from the beach front and walking distance to shops and restaurants. Breakfast was not included but MacDonald's was 1 minute from the hotel if that's your choice and there are heaps of ABC shops that sell stuff you could pick up for breakfast. We had breakfast at the hotel on our last day and there were good choices. The wifi is free only in the hotel lobby area. It's US$10 per day if you want it in the room. We had 2 adjoining rooms on the 14th floor with a city view. The rooms are spacious and clean and the beds are really comfortable.

Had a great stay at this hotel! One block from the beach, walking distance to food, shopping, other hotels, ABC stores, Starbucks & entertainment. Didn't have an ocean view.. didn't miss it! Great service from the bellhop, concierge staff, housekeeping.. excellent experience all around. Reasonably priced, clean and friendly. Definitely will stay there again

I loved staying at this hotel! It´s very well located, one block from the beach and very close to the nice stores and restaurantes like cheesecake factory!! It´s clean, nice price and the staff is very friendly! Specially Dave who got us free wifi as a gift for our honeymooon!And also the manager Susie who helped us find a Ford Mustang for Rental! My husband really wanted to drive it!! They were all really nice!

Front desk was very nice and helpful. Branden from from desk was very nice and helpful. Hotel was very clean. The hotel location was walking distance throughout waikiki. The down stairs restaurant was convenient, breakfast was very good buffet style.the city view wasn't the best. Will definitely upgrade to an ocean view next time. Will definitely use this hotel again.

As the title suggest, this place is well priced for what you get. You get a decent sized room in a well located spot of Waikiki. Close to sun, surf, and sundaes. However the name "Waikiki Resort" is a little deceiving. The place is a slightly run down, needs a little rejuvenation and doesn't offer things you would expect at a proper resort. It's more of a classy budget hotel however the staff is friendly and caring.Must stay if you are on a budget and looking for a good spot to stay in Waikiki, wouldn't recommend anymore than 2 nights though.

We give this hotel a top rating because it offers so much for the price. Obviously, you can stay in much more expensive hotels and get more, but at this price point the Waikiki Resort is very hard to beat.A couple of things that were very appealing "extras" are the ability to print out free boarding passes, free in-room safes, a small in-room refrigerator that gets cold enough to make ice, and an exceptional Korean restaurant in the hotel (they gave us a 20% discount and the prices were already reasonable for Waikiki).We arrived very early, and while they could not accommodate us immediately, we were able to get into the room a couple hours ahead of standard check-in. We found all employees in the hotel to be exceptionally friendly and accommodating.The rooms are somewhat dated and small, but quite clean and comfortable. They have exceptional pillows and mattresses and the AC works very well. Included is a desk with an office chair, a nice size chest of drawers, a flat-screen TV, a sitting chair, and a table and two chairs on the balcony. We were lucky enough to have a modest ocean view, but you only have to walk a short block to get the total picture on the beach.This gets mentioned in nearly every review, but the location is really good. The beach is just down the street. There is a McDonalds there which was giving FREE coffee while we were there! We're not huge fans of McD, but with the prices in Waikiki it was nice to get a price break on something. After paying around $20 the first day for our morning coffee and a couple of treats, we became fans of McD in the morning.

My husband and I stayed 2 nights at Waikiki Resort Hotel and after a bumpy start enjoyed our stay. Room was very nice , clean , the price was good and just a walk to the beach. We had breakfast at the buffet restaurant very tasty we a good price for Waikiki. We would stay again

Good location set back one block from the beach. Partial ocean view rooms are good and well priced. We stayed here for 2 nights at the endof our Hawaii trip. Check in was OK - quite a late check out time (12:00) so rooms are unlikely to be ready before checkin time at 3pm. Hotel is dated but clean and comfortable. Customer service as noted by other reviewers is good. From my persepctive thehotel needs to iprove its wifi offering- its free in the lobby but not available in rooms - not ours atleast. In this day and age this is an essential service however there is no resort fee to pay here unlike many other Hawaii and Waikiki Hotels so this just about offsets this. I would stay here again - nice hotel, good price (for Waikiki) and close to the beach.

My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful 2 weeks at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. Upon our arrival we were greeted by Branden who provided excellent customer service this day and every day thereafter. We were also helped by Joe Michael several times, and he too provided exceptional, friendly customer service. Cleaning staff were accommodating and very friendly and thought to leave extra towels without us having to ask for them. The location of the hotel, just 300 feet from the beach, is so convenient. This was our third stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel and will return there on our next visit due to the exceptional customer service we received and the cleanliness of our room.

Stayed at Waikiki Resort for 3 nights before sailing around the islands. It is an older style hotel but clean & well maintained. It is only 1 block away from the beach & close proximity to local restaurants - Hula Grill, Dukes, Cheesecake Factory & California Pizza were my favourites. Webooked this resort through tripadvisor for A$200/night with buffet breakfast. The rooms were large with very comfortable beds & pillows. There was a large outdoor pool but we didn't use this facility as the beach was so invitiing.

The hotel is located 1 small block from Waikiki Beach so its very convenient because it's also one block away from the main street shopping and restaurants.There is a small pool which is great for families with kids. We rented a car and the hotel offers parking for a nominal daily fee. The staff was super nice and helpful. There is also a small cafe in the hotel along with a shop for any last minute items you may have forgotten or just some snacks. The room does have a small fridge, iron, ironing board and blow dryer for your convenience. The rooms are a good size. It looked refreshed especially the tile in the bathroom area although the wallpaper looked like it could use a change in some spots. Nice balcony to sit too. No workout room. Overall great hotel and will definitely stay there again.

The location is great, 2 minute walk from the beach, one block from kalakaua ave with all its shopping and restaurants. The bus that goes to Ala Moana Mall, goes from Kuhio Ave and it's close by also if you want to do some shopping there. On the other hand, if its important for you to go online, the internett connection in the lobby is absolutely horrible. It doesn't work most of the time and the guests where frustrated. Other than that, the hotel where fine :)

Stayed for 4 nights.The beds that we had were terrific, the best pillows I have ever found in a hotel.The Korean Resturant was outstanding and the same applies for the breakfast buffett. The only downside was the convient shop on ground floor, the man in the shop seemed a little unfriendly.

We stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel for nine days in September 2014. The rooms were great, large bed, great view and close to all the action in Waikiki. The staff were fantastic, and we will definitely stay there again, and again.

This was my third time at the Waikiki Resort Hotel, and each time has been great. I have stayed at the partial ocean view and standard rooms. This time we stayed for nine nights on the fourth floor in a standard room with two beds and a balcony. It’s about two blocks away from the beach, and a few blocks from bus stops (including the Waikiki trolley stop) and restaurants. The place is clean and safe. There was good room service everyday. We were able to get extra towels, shower caps, and hot water to make tea. You can get beach towels downstairs. The food at the restaurant was good, and it was great that they had a breakfast buffet. We were given a 20 percent off coupon for the restaurant when we arrived. The hotel staff members who I have talked with are very friendly. William Lee was especially helpful in giving advice on good places to eat, where to get coffee, things to do, and he always answered our questions. We were in a hurry when we left, and William Lee helped me print out our boarding tickets right before our shuttle arrived. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a relaxing stay in Waikiki.

The hotel is looking tired since our last stay 3 years ago. No wi fi in the rooms is a nuisance and the lack of tea bags was surprising. We have never struck that before anywhere. A small thing but annoying. Service was adequate without being as friendly as we have experienced elsewhere in Waikiki. Room quote small Would only consider for a short stay.

We stayed at Waikiki resort for 4 nights. We had a room on the 4th floor and it was quite big, clean and quite, with two queen beds, a small toilet and a big balcony.The overall quality is good and considering the walking distance form Waikiki beach, definitely a good deal. We also used their private parking lot, a valuable choice if you need to park your rental car. Unfortunately there is no internet connection in the room, but you can use a complimentary wi fi connection in the great lobby, a good chance to enjoy its outside-lobby!

Initially looking at the location on the map, i thought it would be somewhat far from Kalakaua road. It is actually a few steps away and located pretty much very close to the beach. It was a surprise as well how it was so conveniently located across the meeting place for most Hawaii tour operators pick-up location.Hotel room is good for the price and clean.Wasn't really looking for a suite type accommodation since i wasn't planning on staying in the room but i would assume it was well worth it.Only one thing that bothered me was the sound proofing of the room was not as good. Was on the 16th floor but could hear all the truck buzzers and road traffic in the morning.

My best friend & I stayed here for 13 nights to celebrate our 50th birthdays. It's a great hotel close to everything. It's a block back from the beach & the main shopping strip.The staff were always friendly & helpful, the room was always clean & the beds really comfy.U also have the bonus of a laundrette in the basement & a little convenience store in the lobby.

I would recommend this hotel, we stayed there 6 of us for 14 nights in may 2014, the rooms were good, the beds (KING) were so comfortable best I have slept in, pillows beaut.....the hotel was clean, entrance area fine, STAFF WERE LOVELY, breakfast was good, laundry down in basement, beach towels no problems, 1 block back from beach,(from macca's) front rooms have a great view of the oceans and surrounding areas, we had a front room was perfect. pool was great nice area maybe a bar would be good there as there is none and u r not allowed any alchol in the pool area, although last night we did sneak some up there and sat around and had a drink and it was great we really enjoyed that....

My wife and I enjoyed our 1 week stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel. It's only a block away from the beach and conveniently situated near the stores and restaurants. The room was always clean every time we come back from our daily activities. The staffs were all courteous and professional. We would definitely stay at Waikiki Resort again next time we go back to Honolulu. Thanks for making our family vacation a memorable one!!!

I stayed at the Waikiki resort hotel for 8 nights, what a great place! The staffs are great, breakfast was awesome with a huge selection and the Concierge was excellent and very helpful. I would definitely without hesitation recommend this hotel to anybody. E. Brookins

We stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel twice on this trip - on the way to the mainland US and again on the way back to our home in New Zealand.On both occasions we had a city view room.First time round the room was great and the beds fantastic, second time round the room was tiny and the beds terrible. I don't mind an older hotel but the comfort of the bed is non-negotiable.Overall a good hotel in an excellent location, offering value for money.Note to owners: please fix you WiFi in the lobby, it is absolutely terrible. Your router needs to support more than 5 simultaneous users!!! All the hotels we stayed at in the US offer complimentary WiFi in the guestrooms apart from yours. Please get with the times.

Such a resort to wind down after 3 busy weeks in USA,mainland.So beautiful to have windows ,doors open and enjoy the breeze and watch the activity on Waikiki Beach ...this is Hawaii! We had great views of the ocean and the mountains.The main pool area was meant for relax,relax and fun the foyer area gave a sense of peace and great to have deli type stores with good coffee

We have stayed at this hotel 6 times and will stay there again in the future! The staff are friendly, helpful and courteous! The rooms are clean and spacious. Although not located on the beach, we loved to get up early and walk the short block to the beach stopping for coffee at the McDonald's on the corner. There is a small laundry room in the basement which was very convenient. The price for the room was very reasonable but we did have to pay for parking.

We have stayed in several different hotels in Waikiki over 26 years and Waikiki Resort has been our best experience so far. We have only eaten in one of the restaurants in the hotel and the breakfast is wonderful. The hotel is very clean, and in a great location close to the beach, shopping as well as being near several popular restaurants. The front desk staff Efren, Branden, Nancy, June and Dave, and our housekeeping staff Rocely and Soon Hee were amazing. Any inquiries were answered in a timely manner and delt with efficiently. The employees treat you like family and that pride is shown throughtout the hotel.

The hotel exceeded my expectations. It was both well appointed and quite, making it ideal for the business traveler. The breakfast was reasonably price and very good and the service was excellent. Dave at the front desk particularly impressed me and went out of his way to make the stay pleasant.

I stayed here for 8 days with my daughter while she transitioned into a apartment. While staying there I needed assistance with one of my rooms and Vicki the manager made sure I was comfortable. She was excellent!! She acted quickly with such professionalism. Branden also assisted me with the change and always had a smile. He also was super professional with excellent customer service!! A definite recommend!! The staff is very helpful and they all act quickly when a problem arises. The rooms were great, pillows firm but soft (perfect) beds comfortable and cleaning staff was also perfect. I would recommend this hotel to all.

Hotel is impressive from entrance . Inside lobby is just as nice! I rate it as a five since it is well maintained, room service was great and room was better than expected. One quick minor complaint though. We arrived around 1:00 p.m., which is early since check-in is 3:00 p.m.. June , the receptionist, informed me that our room wasn't quite ready but would be soon. That was fine with me. I told her that I would wait with my family in the lobby seated since we were tired from the flight and just wanted to relax. Mind you, the seats are in direct view of the registration counter and there are four of us total. About 2:30 p.m., I went to the counter to see how much longer to wait. June was busy with another person, so I asked another employee, an older gentleman without name badge, The gentleman said " oh, it's been ready for some time." Why then could June not inform us earlier? It wasn't busy at any time since. Good question! Anyway, we got our room , which was 1515. The room was awesome! Two double beds with a rollaway placed in between if we wanted it. We were told that if we didn't, just roll it out to the hallway.Two teen girls did not want to share a bed so it worked out even better! That was good planning and thinking on the staffs part in my opinion. Kudos to them !! The view was impressive both for the water as well as Diamond Head. Plenty of room in the wash basin area. Bathroom isn't large but not uncomfortable to facilitate. Shower was more than adequate. Small tub not designed for bathing but that was fine with us! Small refer, closet, coffee maker ( Wolfgang Puck coffee, excellent, ooohhh!) , safe, hair dryer and iron , located in basin area. Plenty of towels, too. Nice t.v. and clock radio are in the room. Pool is on the second floor, not huge but big enough, and is great for kicking back and relaxing after a long day. Plenty of lounge chairs and was never crowded. If you needed towels for the beach, just check them out from the basement and return them afterwards. Real easy!!! Newspaper every morning in the lobby. Overall, I feel as if I got my moneys worth and MORE here at Waikiki Resort. I would definately recommend the upper rooms as there is street noise early in the morning. Not bad where we stayed but I'm sure it would be worse on lower floors. Two blocks from the beach, so its a real short walk. Oh, did I mention room service was great? Worth another mention!!! One odd quirk though. We received a flyer, left by the maid, informing us that there would be a drapery inspection between 9:00-10:00 a.m. the following day. Is that odd or what ??? We were gone at that time, so I do not know if they actually did this but I found that really strange !!! I felt as if they were checking up on us instead. Peranoid I guess. Never had that happen in ANY hotel that I have stayed at in my LIFE ! Why could they not do that in between reservations? Or why not when the maid was in our room? She was there usually mid-afternoon. Oh well, thats life. Otherwise, great place stay, disregarding the two incidences. Book way in advance to get best rates !!

The one bedroom suite was perfect for the 4 of us. It was spacious, very clean and so close to the beach. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was pleasant and accommodating, down to the last minute request of a 6pm late check out. We will definitely be back next year and with more family!

Placed in the middle of waikiki, honolulu, hawaii makes waikiki one of the strategist hotel location, only 5-10 minutes from the lobby to the beach, 15 minutes to the shopping arcade. It's a plus for a foreigner to choose waikiki resort.The roomWaikiki resort has a good sanitary for the room, there's no smell in the room, and the toilet itself dry and clean. But the balcony feels so small, and not cozy at all for a sunset, since the balcony surrounded by the building around the waikiki resort.The facilityIt'll be great if the wifi can be use in the room, since the lobby was so warm because there's no door to keep the coolnest of the air conditioner.The breakfastOne thing that should be fixed by the management is the breakfast. It's an ordinary american breakfast, but so little choose of menu, such as yogurt, pastry and juice.ConclusionFor an asian tourist like me, waikiki resort got a plus for its location, since Asian love to shop and watch the sunset at the beach. The wifi needs to be improve for a better social facility at the room.Thank you.

We had booked a one bedroom suite in this hotel for our wedding. When checking in our room wasn't ready so we left our bags with the porter who chain them together near his desk. We were advised to come back at 3 pm.The suite was big and spacious, clean and came with a kitchenette.The kitchenette came with a microwave, plates, cups and cutlery as well as washing up items. They provided towels to use at the beach and also had laundry facitlites, which help on holidays.We would like to see WiFi available in the room free of charge rather than having to pay or using the free WiFi in the lobby. During the stay all staff that we encounter were friendly and helpful.

Had never been to Hawaii. Stayed with friends on the 'windward side' then went to Waikiki Resort for the last 5 days. I needed to check in or leave my luggage early and they totally accommodated my request! Got in my room by 11:30am (WOW). Dropped luggage and hit the beach a block away.Every day I was there, my room was cleaned; new supplies as expected-even left extra coffee for me without asking; stellar view of the beach from my room and working a/c!My friends home in Kilauea didn't have a/c-most homes don't there-and I didn't know this. yishhhhThe Concierge, Clinton, absolutely set me up with the right restaurants, best way to see Pearl Harbor and a luau. He saved me alot of $'s and was very helpful about what toursit stores to see/avoid.Restaurants in hotel=look elsewhere

My family and I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel in leu of having our family reunion and my birthday celebration. From the time we checked in until our departure we have recieved remarkable service. One person who truly gave us the Aloha experience of Hawaii was Branden. He truly went out of his way to make our stay comfortable and pleasant and hassle and headache free. He always greeted with kindness and made our stay enjoyable. Talk about 5 star service he is the man. He truly made my husband feel at home and we both agree that upon return to HNL that we would stay at the waikiki resort hotel. Thanks Branden for a Ohana feel.

we are two couples visiting from Australia on a cruise ship, we stopped by the desk and Serena greeted us with warm welcome, since we waited at the front desk for 20min with no one helping us. Serena helped us to our room and suggested activities for us to do. She was warm, sincere, and embodies the Hawaiian aloha spirit. I wish all the people from the front desk had her sunny disposition. She suggested the helicopter, which was amazingggg to say the least and we enjoyed it through and through. She told us that she'd be at the pacific beach hotel the next day so we went and visited her the next day to make restaurant reservations. She helped us with transportation to the ship as well as info regarding pick up times and things to do. She really made our experience so very memorable, and I would definitely come back to see her and recommend all my friends to her. You have really a stellar employee on your team and she's what all the concierge should strive to be. Have a great and blessed day.

I just completed another visit to Waikiki Beach and spent 17 fantastic days at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. I must say that the folks at this hotel will roll out the "RED CARPET" to provide the very best customer service with that world famous "ALOHA" spirit! This hotel is well maintained, quiet, clean with very comfortable beds and the price is unbeatable for this location right near Kuhio Beach! There are two outstanding restaurants right in the hotel that will provide you with an fabulous breakfast, lunch and dinner (The Llima Cafe & Seoul Jung). The Llima Cafe is amazing! Breakfast and lunch Buffets! At the llima cafe, you will meet Erna, Jen, Gil and Mr. Park! I consider them the finest crew anywhere in Waikiki! The Seoul Jung Restaurant is the premier Korean Restaurant in all of Hawaii! Don't miss it! At the Front Desk, you get to meet another outstanding crew that will greet and assist you as you enjoy your visit. You will get the chance to meet Dave, Brandon, June, Susie, Vickie, Denise & Gail. When I say that this is the BEST place for your comfort and enjoyment in Waikiki, it is all made possible by the Hotel General Manager Mr. Glenn P. Vergara. This Manager is always walking around and meeting customers and thanking them for visiting the WRH! What a way to set the example for the entire staff to follow! Even the House Keeping Staff reflects this customer first approach. They go above and beyond to ensure that your rooms are cleaned early or at your convenience to ensure your comfort. Especially the 18th floor staff led by Ms. Shufen! It is indeed my pleasure to highly recommend this hotel for your visit to Hawaii!!

Holy smokes, what a pile! I cannot understand the positive reviews. At $2800 for ten days, I got twin beds and a rollaway piece of crap bed for the mother in law. We had to walk sideways to get to the balcony. Dirty, smelly and small. Looking more like a motel than a wannabe waikiki hotel, and overpriced on top of it. Almost forgot, there is no parking either. We spent half an hour in this room, called hawaii prince hotel and got a decent room. They charge a whole night if you cancel. Good riddance...The photos on websites when you book are very misleading! Beware!
user_name:
Cristian I
Arlington, Washington, United States

review_body: We stayed 11 nights in July. I was after hotel that had good location and reasonable price. We had two interconnecting rooms, they were cleaned daily. Yes, rooms are bit dated, but price and location make up for it! I will stay again and would recommend to all my friends.

I stayed here December 2013. We found hair in the bedding and in the shower. We asked to have it cleaned it took three hours before they sent someone who was unapologetic and didn't clean it all up. Plus our room faced an apartment. Caters to Korean clientele.

Just got back, and we had a great stay at the Waikiki Resort hotel. I wished we had a view of the ocean. Our room was on the 11th floor facing the street. Pro: locationCon:bathroom Only one sink for a family of 4Bad lighting.

Good quality hotel where I stayed 12 days is featured with good location and quality service. Reasonable price for standard equipment. Small swimming pool, good breakfast and interesting Korean cuisine. I truly recommend for all. Mark

Excellent stay for my family!! The staff was very helpfull!! And specially thank you Dave I lot for excellent service!!! The location was the best!! My family was very happy!!!! Recommend for other family's with children!!

We stayed here for two nights in June. The hotel is in a great location, one block back from the beach The room appeared clean, but rather dated. The rates were reasonable. Hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating.

an excellent value at waikiki. just one block off waikiki beach, great location,clean hotel, great service for a reasonable rate. under ground parking was convenient and plentiful. has a gift shop with snacks and food options. great family hotel

My wife and I just had the pleasure of spending a 5 day layover at the Waikiki Resort Hotel at Waikiki Beach Hawaii.We booked this motel because of the great reviews on Trip Adviser and we were not disappointed. We booked an ocean view room and were given a beautiful room on the 18th floor with great views of the ocean. We could lie in bed and watch the surfers riding the waves and the boats cruising past.The position of the Hotel is ideal for a Waikiki visit, it could not be more central to the best area of Waikiki. We were able to walk to the best restaurants and attractions and my wife was able to catch a local bus into the shopping center at Ala Moana for $2.50 return.The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly and our room was maintained very well.Waikiki Resort Hotel will now be our go to accommodation when we visit Hawaii.

Stayed here for two nights with my wife during 2014 Memorial Day weekend. The hotel is at the southern end of the Waikiki area and just minutes away from the beach. The rates are quite affordable and won't break your budget. (There are no resort fees charged on top of Hawaii's taxes, so that's a plus) The room we got was well-maintained and we had no problems with it either. Nothing super fancy, but had all the basics were included. Wifi is only at the lobby, as you have to pay extra to get it in your room. I can see how this might be inconvenient for some, but it didn't bother me. You also need to pay for parking at the hotel (which hotel doesn't in Waikiki?) but you're really close to the Zoo and Aquarium area that you can manage to find free overnight parking there if you are okay with walking 10 minutes or so. It's a nice comfortable walk along the beach in the evening anyways, so why not enjoy it? There are two restaurants at the hotel, which we did not eat at. Given that the hotel is owned by Koreans, it's not surprising that one of the restaurants was a Korean BBQ at a very competitive price. So the bottom line is, if you're looking for a true resort getaway in Waikiki, this might not be your place. For those who want to spend more on the things to do while in Honolulu other than the room you're sleeping in, I'd recommend this place.

My three friends and I spent 6 days at the Waikiki Resort. I am a planner.. so I spent a lot of time reviewing and I must say the pictures had me feeling like ehhhh...not enthused. But once we checked in a was totally removing my foot from my mouth!Like I said, there were three of us in a double room. The hotel put in a cot, right in the middle. The cot was more comfortable than my mattress at home! Sure it made the room a little tighter, but that was the least of our worries! The room was extremely clean and tidy. Standard and clean bathroom. Tight shower. Nothing to complain about! The only thing that I really didnt like about the room was that balcony door that took way too much strength to open, but THE VIEW MADE UP FOR IT!! We were in room 617. Amazing!Lobby was beautiful and open. Free wifi downstairs. Sushi bar isnt really that good but its ok for a late night snack and karaoke.Pool is very nice and usually empty since the beach is less than a block away. Perfect for a little getaway or just a mid day relaxation laying out.Guests were somewhat quiet. Lots of asian tourist moving about in the morning that were kind of noisy but nothing to complain about. Really, I cant think of anything bad about this hotel. Dave at the front desk was really cool! Our trip was 6 days through priceline and our rate was GREAT! I WILL be coming back and staying!!

We have stayed a several other hotels in Waikiki but chose this one for the price and closeness to the beach and shops. Yes we weren't right on the beach but as we were travelling as a family of 5, the options become limited. We booked two rooms with an interconnecting door and we were happy with the beds, space and rooms. The only negative I have would be how to operate the bath and shower. There were no clear instructions so we had to contact the front desk to find out. We didn't use the restaurants so can't comment on them. This hotel has a laundry in the basement which we used almost everyday as we had young kids and never had any problems with it being too busy. We had a car and parked in the basement but if it was too full, parked in the outside lot. I have recommended this hotel to other people as for price, room size and location, I can't fault it.

The biggest plus for this hotel was that it was only one block away from the beach.We stayed for a week and we got a corner room which is supposed to be a deluxe room. Some of the pictures that were shown didn't match what we got at all. Essentially, a corner room gives you a slightly larger mini-refrigerator, microwave and a sink with a few plates and utensils. The room is also slightly larger than a standard room. The hotel is older as is evidenced by the upgrades made when an automatic fire sprinkler system was installed in the building. Also the rest of the construction says 60s at least to me. Fortunately, we did not go to Hawaii to stay in our hotel room.Check-in was fast and the staff was friendly. You have to pay $22 bucks a day for parking. Wifi is free in the lobby but if you want it in your room, you have to pay about $10 a day per device. Come on. This, today, is liking charging extra for sheets on your bed. One of the biggest headaches is that the street outside is so busy and so noisy that using the balcony or leaving the sliding glass door open is next to impossible unless you just want to drown out the noise from your significant other. ... Ouch! She just slapped me... The street is a one way street and there are service vehicles and tour buses using it all day long as well as regular traffic. The street is narrow and it is amazing that they can actually get two buses on the road side by side. One morning, a food truck stopped on the street to deliver to the hotel next door and the noise from his cooler was just unbearable. The next day, someone was jack-hammering on the parking structure next door. The noise was a real downer for me.One other minor irritation was the bathroom layout. It is the type with the tub and toilet in one room while the vanity is in another open to the bedroom. I'm an early riser and I don't like to turn on lights to wake everyone else up. The vanity room needed to be separated from the rest of the room by a door. Oh, and there was only one light switch for both the bathroom and the vanity room. It was all or nothing. speaking of baths, here is a tip when in Hawaii. Open a window in the bathroom and take a bath/shower with just enough hot water to not make it icy. I took a hot shower the first day and just couldn't cool off enough to get the water off of me so getting dressed was no fun with clothes sticking to my wet skin. The rest of the week I was just fine using my own tip.All in all, it was o.k. but next time I'll probably shop around for a different place.

We find it very necessary to include, & Not forget to review the 'Good' places of our travel, Room was very clean, great level of friendliness from the staff, the beach was within 3 minute walk. We're very picky when it comes to serenity, this place offers it! Recommended, we had a Great Get away here!

We recently stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel prior to and after our Cruise on the Pride of America. The hotel room that we stayed in was clean and comfortable. We had breakfast included in our rate. Although the selection was not extensive, it suited our needs. There were eggs, mushrooms, some Asian dishes bacon, baked beans, danishes and a couple of cereals, juices etc. The staff come round continuously offering coffee. I found the reception staff, except for one male member of staff at reception, very helpful and friendly. Two people stood out for their excellent service. Dennis on the concierge desk and June at reception. The Hotel has a laundromat which came in very useful for us. Waikiki Resort is situated one block back from Waikiki beach and the shops. . However, be aware that the check in time for this Hotel is 3pm, so if you arrive in on early flights ie 7am as some flights from Australia do, be aware that a room might not be ready for you as the hotel is very busy and you have a long wait after a 9-10 hour overnight flight, so would suggest when booking ask for an early check in or pay for one night's accommodation, especially if you are of the older generation. If not busy the hotel reception will try and accommodate you, but as previously advised it is a very busy hotel.

Checked in here after spending 8 nights at the Hyatt Regency as it was apart of a package before leaving on a cruise. The reception staff were a little unhelpful at the beginning with organising as we were travelling as a party of 8Checked in smoothly and the rooms were nice and we had a balcony.Wifi isn't included in your room but is free when you are downstairs in the lobby! If you want wifi it will be an extra cost of $10 per day per device!However, special mention to Dave at the front desk who offered us free wifi for our room for me and my friend for our stay!

We recently stayed a week at this hotel. It has clean, comfortable and spacious rooms, which actually look better than they show on their website. The higher rooms are probably quieter, but this would be so everywhere as the traffic is busy in Waikiki. This hotel is not on a busy road though, like many. The beach is only a 30 second walk away and the hotel is in a very central position to walk around Waikiki, with the bus stop into Honolulu only at the next block. Great value, considering it is so close to the beach, has a pool and comfortable rooms. We would definitely stay there again.

When I booked this hotel online I was given a room with two double beds. Since it was just me staying I emailed the hotel and asked for a room with a king bed. When I checked in I was informed I would be staying in a king suite for my stay. This was really great of the hotel to do. I was on the 6th floor and had a partial ocean view. I could also see Diamond Head. The rooms all have nice patios with chairs and a small table. I was worried the noise would be loud from the street but I did not have any issues. The noise in the resort was also minium with people coming and going at different hours. I've read reviews about the showers and tubs being small but I did not notice that, and I am not a small guy. I tried the breakfast buffet at Ilima Cafe and it was pretty good. They have your typical items like bacon, scrammbled eggs, Portuguese sausage, fresh fruit...etc. It was enough to get the day started. For dinner I decided to try Seoul Jung as guests receive a discount. The prices are a little high and I am not exactly sure what everything was. I tried the BulGoGi or marinated beef, and it was outstanding. You also receive 6 little sides and a bowl of soup, so you definately do not go hungry. I would have dined there again, but I had to try other restaurants. The pool was never super busy so it was a nice place to lay and relax in the sun, without the noise of the beach. If you did want to go to the beach it is just a short one block walk. Everything at Waikiki Resort Hotel was great, from the front desk staff, bell desk, housekeeping, and location. If I am ever in Honolulu again I will be staying at Waikiki Resort Hotel in room 613.

My recent trip to Waikiki was in response to a family member and his wife's serious health issue. I needed a place within walking distance to their condo. When I checked in and I told the front desk people I wasn't sure when I would be checking out and the reason that I was there, both Dave and Branden took a personal interest in my situation (my brother spent over 90 days in Queen's Hospital. After that, each night that I returned (usually late) Dave would always greet me by my name and ask me how things were going. I was amazed that with all the guests I would be remembered by sight. Branden always had a warm welcome or a wave if he was busy. During my extended stay, I found the facility to be meticulous the maid service perfect and every member of the staff I came in contact with happy and friendly. The rooms are really nice, well maintained and the room I was in was very quiet. All this in the middle of Waikiki. This place is a real gem. This comment is from a guy who just doesn't make comments, but these guys deserve to be known and if my little comment helps them, then I have paid the fine experience forward.

All parts worked efficiently. Personal service at desk and by bell captain. Great food at all 3 restaurants. Quiet enough to easily recover from jet lag. Internet required payment but worked fast and well. Ocean just a quick block away, so we avoided the crush of people. Partial ocean view was perfect. Watching surfers before dawn and late into evening. Swimming pool opened and closed on time, clean and well maintained. Excellent value for money. Friendly other guests, many from Korea.

I booked this hotel with a booking agent in Honolulu. When I called the hotel to confirm my reservation, I spoke to Nancy at the front desk. My only request was a quiet room preferably on one of the upper floors. I had booked a standard room and when I arrived I found that Nancy had upgraded us to a partial ocean view on the eighteenth floor. It was a rather small but spotless room with a balcony. The housekeeper who just took care of that floor was always there to make sure that we had everything we needed. The entire staff was very gracious and helpful during our four days there. When you leave the front door of the hotel, it is less than two minutes before you have your toes in the sand. There is a very good breakfast buffet at the restaurant in the lobby and many restaurants within a five minute walk. You don't have to hire a tour bus to visit the Honolulu zoo and aquarium . They are within a ten minute walk past shops and restaurants. We loved this hotel and will certainly return on our next visit to Waikiki.

We stayed here for 6 nights in April. This is not a 5 star luxury hotel, but a very decent and comfortable hotel and priced very well and rated 5 out of 5 accordingly. A very short stroll to the beach, as convenient as being beachfront but without the noise and traffic. Staff are nice , and the breakfast buffet is very decent with a good range (fresh pineapples were awesome) and 2 adult brekky coupons are usually included when you book on their website, but if you have 2 kids like we do, dont worry, kids under 12 are half price at $7 each. They also have self service laundry facilities in the basement which is so needed for young families. Pool was good as well, although the beach meant we hardly used it. Given the location, and quality of facilities this hotel has got to be the best value for money hotel in Waikiki, and really conveniently set up for young families where one room can accomodate a family of 2 adults and 2 young kids and with a good breakfast buffet set up with a good range of healthy stuff as well. I would highly recommend this hotel to young families who want a very decent place for a good price (if you want 5 star luxury...look elsewhere) located right next to the beach, and also anyone else for that matter. There is also free wifi in the lobby as well.....very handy for those work emails. We are looking forward to our next visit there. Another tip....check out Ross dress for less store near H&M, great clothes and shoes from last season at incredible prices....stock changes every day.

Just recently spent 3 nights at this hotel and i couldn't fault it at all. Although it's not right on the beach it's only a 5 minute walk to the main Waikiki beach and shops and restaurants. The staff were very helpful and we were able to book tours from the deck. The rooms could do with a bit of an update but are clean and the beds were very comfortable which was great after a long flight. We paid an extra $30 a night for a ocean room view and i think it was worth it. We really enjoyed our stay .

I reserved a city view room through Expedia.com, which explained that I would be housed in a room on the middle to upper floors facing the city. When I arrived at the front desk, they gave me a corner room on the 4th floor with a terrible view facing Koa Ave. The gentlemen at the front desk explained that the room I reserved was a "complementary upgrade" that wasn't available, even though I paid the upcharge for it through a 3rd party booking company. Instead, they gave me a suite on a lower floor with a small kitchenette and much more space, so in a way I got something for the extra money I paid.The A/C was very quiet, but took several hours for my room to reach the desired temperature.The sliding glass doors to the balcony had a quarter inch gap between them when fully closed, so a lot of city street noise was leaking through into my room.Their on-site restaurant that serves breakfast is very tasty, and the waitstaff is very kind.Beware of the "make shift" underground parking garage if you need parking and you're driving a large vehicle. It appears that it was a basement at some point, the ceiling is quite low and the parking spaces are VERY tight.Wi-Fi isn't free, but that's fine. Most Waikiki hotels don't offer it free anyway.The location of this place was the BIGGEST bonus. It's only about 200 feet from the sand of Kuhio Beach, and without the noisy crowds from the street that runs along the beach.If I had more money to spend, I probably wouldn't stay here again. But it's a nice place if you're on a tighter budget.

stayed april 17th - april 24thMe and my boyfriend picked this resort because of its great location, only a 2 second walk to Waikiki beach, 5 minute walk to Honolulu zoo and not to far of a drive to and from the airport.The staff at this hotel are EXTREMELY helpful! When calling to confirm our double bed standard room they upgraded us FOR FREE to a king room with a city view, 15th floor (which actually had a partial ocean view as well BONUS!) Shout out to Joe-Michael, you helped us a lot finding bus routes and times, as well as local directions and always had a smile on our face, thank you for your outstanding customer service!The room was a decent size with a cute little patio big enough for 2 chairs and a little table. The bed was super comfy and there was a nice flatscreen t.v as well.The bathroom was ok however the shower is a little on the small side, not a deal breaker though. The room was adequately equipped with a mini fridge and an in room safe which is always a plus! House keeping was fantastic checking to make sure we had everything we needed and clean towels, always very cheerful and pleasant with guests :-) On the second floor of the hotel there is a nice outdoor pool, a restaurant and spa. The hotel mainly has Korean guests, so there is a variety of Asian cuisine to choose from :-)Overall our stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel actually exceeded our expectations, would we come back to stay again....IN A HEARTBEAT!! Mahalo to the awesome staff again for making our trip one to remember :-)

Looking for the best kept secret in Waikiki? It is on Koa street and one block from the beach. This fine hotel has a management team that is second to none and their staff offer the best that they can which is an expression used in conversation with anyone associated with the hotel. We do our best is exactly what you will hear from staff daily when guests take the time to compliment them on their effort. If you need anything at the Waikiki Resort just ask and they will do what needs to be done to fulfill your wish. We had the good fortune to have an ocean view room and the view early mornings was spectacular as were the sunsets in the early evening. Along with the comfort of the room there was nothing left to ask for. The breakfast buffet daily was most enjoyable and the staff made us feel like family. Mahalo to Mr Vergara and his team at the Waikiki Resort for their warm aloha and kindness.

Thank you Waikiki Resort for a wonderful holiday. This was my 1st time in Hawaii & I just loved it. Stayed for 9 nights in late March in a part ocean view room, weather was perfect. I visited Pearl Harbour, drove right around Oahu taking a swim at all the beautiful beaches, climbed Diamond Head, Surfed Waikiki, ate, ate & ate, & shopped till I dropped.The hotel is in a great location, less than 2 min walk to the Duke Statue on Waikiki Beach. Staff were very friendly, room kept very clean. After very busy days I looked forward to their comfortable bed each night. Staff in the Hotel Restaurant are great & they welcomed us every morning for breakfast, loved their coffee. Also, thank you to Tim who helped us with booking tours & rental car. Tour to Kualoa Ranch was a great day, well worth it. We did the ATV (quad) bikes.A few people on trip advisor seem to comment on the bathroom, shower too small etc, I didn’t have any problems, I actually enjoyed my showers. If you want to spread out & do “laps” go to the pool !! Public transport is very organised & cheap, all just 1 block from hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel. My only complaint is that I didn’t stay longer! Oh well, next time. Mahalo.

We got an ocean view room on the 17th floor and it was stunning. Showers are not great though. Bathroom is poorly lit and shower curtain does little to keep the water in. Every time we showered, there was water all over the floor. Also, I swear that at booking this room was labeled as 2 QUEENS and it was actually 2 doubles so it was a bit of a squeeze. But at the end of each day it was so nice to fall asleep with the balcony door open listening to the ocean.

This was our first time at Waikiki resort and from the minute we walked into the hotel we were greeted by Dave and he went out of his way to accommodate us with our room that we booked through hotels.com. They didn't quite have our reservation correct but Dave rectified the situation. The room was clean we got everything we needed and Branden was also very helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

I staying here at the end of October 2013. We were originally thinking of staying on the beach at an outrigger or the banyan, but I'm really glad that we decided to stay here. We had an ocean view room and it was great to sit on the lanai in the morning with our coffee and look out at the ocean. The money that we saved on our hotel meant that we could rent beach chairs on the beach ($30 to $40 per day for 2 chairs and an umbrella depending on who you rent from)- a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The beach chairs were well worth the cost. The rooms were fine - nothing special, but basic and what I was looking for definitely. The hotel was very clean and we had no complaints there. You get what you pay for in this hotel - and you are for sure paying for location. I would stay here again if I had the same budget that I was travelling with. The location was superb and the staff was great. Get the breakfast at the outdoor restaurant at the hotel across the street - super delicious and very cheap! Also, there was a farmers market just down the block from the hotel at a little outdoor mall that we went to which was a great place to get fresh fruit!Would highly recommend.

I have just returned from a two week stay at this Hotel. I travelled with my husband and six year old daughter. We opted for a corner room to give us slightly more space and also a microwave. Bed was very comfortable and there was a sofa bed for my child. We had a good size bathroom with a bath although on the small side. There is a guest laundry in the basement which was very handy. Staff were friendly, complimentary breakfast was a bonus (although after two weeks it was a bit boring).

Hi we stayed here while we were in Waikiki both before & after our cruise and loved it. Our rooms were big clean & had everything we needed to make our stay comfortable. Only seconds from the beach & main shopping streets we were able to walk to and from everything. The staff were friendly and always smiling, June on the reception counter was so helpful and smiling everytime we had a question. We will be back for sure and will definatly stay here again :) thanks for an amazing holiday stay (Maryanne ) Anna & Scott Duncan

Best hawaii trip ever. My only regret was not being able to spend more time inside the hotel room. Getting such an awesome ocean view is a rare opportunity. The staff were supppper friendly. I never leave comments about a trip but I completely forgot to leave a tip in my room which is why I am leaving a feedback. It's the least I can do. I usually judge a hotel by its bed and bathroom. They were both very clean. The bed was so comfortable. I love the white sheets. They cleaned my room everyday. Hotels usually don't have a window in the bathroom but this hotel did!!! The fresh air flowing through, cleans sheets, the ocean view... I couldn't have asked for more. Oh, and here's a bonus. Location! Shopping and restaurants are right down the block. All walking distance! Even the beach is across the street. Definitely would recommend!!!

We headed to Hawaii from the UK in November 2013. I contacted the hotel before we went and asked if we could be given a cheeky upgrade on a room. When we turned up the had given us one on the Penthouse floor. Made our trip that bit extra special. We booked all of our trips from the Expedia rep down in reception. Im sure we could have got better prices elsewhere however couldn't be bothered with the hassle. We were on holiday. Hotel is a 2 min walk to the beach and the shops and restaurants in the evening. Rooms were decent staff were always friendly. Oahu is an incredible place. Cant wait to return one day.

Came on a staycation in Waikiki . . . played tourist and found this really great deal of a hotel. It's quiet cause its not on one of the main streets, but is soooo close to the beach. I got to walk around a lot and shop and see everything which I don't usually get to do.The staff are really nice and treat you like family. Everyone is soooo helpful! The room cleaners do a really good job and when I asked, they even helped me get a room upgrade!!!!Gotta try their Korean Restaurant, I think its call Seoul Jun. Really good food! I like the spicy pork and squid dishes. They even give you this thing called rice punch which is a sweet cinnamon tasting drink at the end of your meal. I really liked that.The breakfast buffet was really good, I think it was a good price for Waikiki. It was all you can eat and the staff there are really nice and funny!Parking was typical Waikiki, but still way cheaper than any other hotel.The front desk was able to answer all my questions and were really nice.I would totally recommend this hotel!

We spent 6 days at Waikiki Resort however I would not call it a Resort in any way, it's a hotel.Room: Average basic features with limited Service: Average service was received from staff. not very welcoming Internet: only available in the main foyer. don't be fouled by the statement "internet available"Food: poor selection with only on Korean restaurant.Location: Great very central and a easy stroll in to WaikikiOver all we would not stay at this Hotel (sorry Resort) again.

On the whole a great holiday. Except on my arrival my hotel room was not very clean the shower didnt work, and was not clean. The hand basin was dirty and the fridge was leakingwater the carpet wasnt hoovered. I really wasnt happy.The staff at the main desk came up to have a look. He then moved me to another room. Which was much better. I was given a free breakfast vouchure.I enjoyed my stay the food the culture the tours the weather and the people have been great. Although things were quite expensive. I look forward to going again.

Just spent 10 days in what we like to call our second home.From the time we got there we were treated like family. From James at the bell desk who greeted us with welcome back to Branden at the front desk who had a big smile and a warm welcome back. The staff is just fantastic there, Dennis Gary Trent and James at the bell desk who always say good morning or evening, they will ask what we are up to for the day even offering suggestions for something to do or a good place to eat. The front desk staff Nancy and June during the day and Branden and Dave in the evening are super friendly. The staff in the Ilima café are great. Good service, good food and super friendly. A special thanks to Patty who works on Aloha Fridays selling jewelry in the lobby for helping my wife pick out the perfect earrings.I must say the highlight of our stay was when the general manager of the hotel who we had met on previous visits took the time to thank us for staying there, He wished us a safe trip home and said he hoped to see us again next year. We will definitely return next year and we always tell people if you are going to Hawaii you have to stay at the Waikiki Resort.Mahalo, and see you all in 2015.

hello! i usually don't write reviews but i thought this hotel was great! it was very clean and comfortable to stay! it is extremely close to beaches and shops!i also have to comment on one the staff there named Hojin Shin, she was very accommodating and polite! She helped us with every need of ours and even gave us good advice on traveling around Oahu! (she's a local so she knew all the in's and out's of the place!) She also very friendly and personable! after a few minutes of chatting, we almost forgot she was part of the staff and instead one of our family! trust us! ask for her if you should stay at this hotel! Overall, the hotel was pleasant, clean, and beautiful to stay at, but it was the employees there that really made our stay enjoyable and welcoming!

We have just come home to Hilo, from spending a week at the Waikiki Resort Hotel, which is like home, away from home. Very comfortable beds, room and all the hotel is very clean, and they are blessed to have a great General Manager, Glenn Vergara, who walks around asking guests if there stay is going well, and making sure every one is happy! The breakfast there is the best, and the waiters and waitress's, so friendly and efficient too. Also, the Korean Restaurant on the 2nd floor, is very good, and in Hawaii is considered to be the best in town! Even the bell man, wants to be helpful all the time! We have stayed in this hotel many times, and will continue to do so. The rates are good too, and we would recommend this hotel, to any one going to the Island of Oahu!! Much Aloha, Evonne and Paul
