We had a standard 2BR city view room. It was a good size, about 300 SF, including a smallish bathroom, plus a balcony with 2 chairs and a small table.It was clean, of average appearance, with some signs of wear. There was good closet and drawer room. Beds were moderately firm. Noise was minimal.There was free WIFI in the lobby. Location was very good, very near the beach and fancy shopping street. Lobby was OK, and the service people were friendly and helpful.

In late November 2013 my wife and I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel in Honolulu, Hawaii. Because our flight was delayed we had to arrive a day late, so I left them a message that we would be arriving the following day. When we turned up we found that our booking had apparently been cancelled, but they let us have Penthouse Suite A – their best room – because there were no other rooms available, even though we only had to pay the cost of staying in a normal sized room! The penthouse was as dazzling as you would expect with a fabulous view from the balcony at top of the tower. Just remember that they did this as a favour, so other visitors should not automatically expect to get a free upgrade like this.

This hotel is located in an ideal position, only one block back from Waikiki beach & shopping area,The hotel needs urgent renovation as its now looking tired & old fasioned, it is expensive for the basic accommodation & facilities on offer.This is our 3rd visit, the hotel offers guest parking for $22 per night, Free Wifi is only available in the reception area or paid for "in room" wifi for $12 per day, the "in room" wifi is not that fast or good.This year the hotel have also employed heavy handed security guards, don't try and smoke on your room balcony, they have exterior CCTV hotel Surveillance & you will receive a visit from them threatening you with a $100 fine, not good here now....

Just spent 4 nights at the Waikiki Resort Hotel and enjoyed our stay very much. We arrived a couple of hours before check-in time, but they had our room ready and waiting for us. Quick, easy check-in. Very nice people at the check-in counter. Our (city view) room was very nice and the housekeepers did a great job of keeping the room clean. Only thing I would have added to the room would be a microwave, and free wifi in the rooms should be standard, though it seams very common for Waikiki hotels to charge an additional fee for wifi in the room.Our room was on the 17th floor, but the elevators are fast and smooth, and we never had to wait more than a few moments for an elevator to arrive.We ate breakfast at the hotels buffet breakfast, which was better than we had expected. The service was also very good.We always rent a car when staying on Oahu, and were concerned about parking. We have stayed at other Waikiki hotels were the parking was very limited and often full, leaving us to search for parking outside the hotel. The underground parking at the Waikiki Resort was limited, but they also have an additional uncovered parking lot, so parking was not a problem. The hotel location is excellent and about as close to the beach as you can get without being “beach-front”. Restaurants, shopping, surfboard rentals, etc. are all near the hotel. This was our first time at the Waikiki Resort Hotel, and is now at the top of our list when we are back on Oahu.

Loved the convenience of the location. Easy access to shopping, restaurants and of course the beach. The corner deluxe rooms were clean and roomy and having the microwave and the mini fridge was a bonus. Would have been even better if there was a toaster. :) The staff at the resort is great and easy to please. Check in was smooth and friendly and check out was even smoother. We had a late flight home but they provided a key so we were able to use the washrooms as well as the pool throughout the day and kept our luggage secure but accessible by us. One of the best features was that they don't charge a resort fee. I'd highly recommend this resort and look forward to returning!

I really like staying at the Waikiki resort, it is right in the center of everything in Waikiki. Just a short walk to the beach, shopping, restaurants and much more! It is comfortable and feels like a second home. We love eating at the two restaurants on site. Illima has great local favorites and Erna the waitress is the best! Also love Seoul the Korean restaurant - excellent authentic food there.

I would like to commend the work carried out by the front desk staff that I dealt with that included Branden, Kevin, Dave and June who went the extra mile when I required assistance that included access to printing out documents that I required along with room internet access and in providing directions to places in Honolulu and around Oahu.

Hotel is OK, a bit dated, close to everything though. Mainly occupied by Korean tourists. Free internet only available in lobby. Excellent service though, Joe [--] at reception was very helpful! Rooms are clean, balconies good too. Bathroom clean but very small. Excellent rooms if you just need a nice place to sleep. Quite small pool area but not busy.

Overall this is a nice hotel. Location is great, really close to Waikiki Beach, shops and restaurants. Price was good except seems you should be able to have free internet in the rooms. Rooms were clean, housekeeping was great and they were all so friendly. Room was an OK size although the shower is really small. Had a mini fridge, safe, coffee maker only other thing that would have been nice to have would be a microwave. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

The hotel has a wonderful location close to Waikiki beach, rooms in good working order, a maid service that is excellent, and even fast elevators in this 19-story structure. Yet, charging almost $11 per day for terrible internet access in the room is a bid downer. Yes, wireless internet is free in the lobby but that's hardly conducive to serious work. Further, the lobby connection was also flaky. Couple that with a colorless restaurant charging $15 for a buffet breakfast and you have a mix of good and bad.There is one easy alternative to dealing with the hotel's shortcomings: a 24-hr McDonald's that serves fresh food and coffee and offers free wireless.

My visit to Waikiki Resort was more than I expected. The resort is clean, well laid out, and has everything you need to make your stay enjoyable. The front desk staff were very professional and willing to help make my stay an enjoyable experience. They were friendly and courteous to all requests. I would definitely make this my first choice again.

We enjoyed our stay at the Waikiki Resort, booked it at a good price so for us it was good value. I would not spend 200$+ on this hotel however... Room was clean, size was fine, although bathroom was absolutely tiny. But location is great, one block from the beach, and that's why we stay there. Service is good and check in was quick. Pool area is fine as well, they have added some nicer lounge chairs which is nice. Overall a good budget hotel.

The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. They were very patient with our many questions. Location of the hotel is a block from the beach, walking distance to restaurants,shops. Accommodation was clean and cleaning staff were very friendly also. I would definitely stay there again.

We enjoyed our stay at the Waikiki Doubletree hotel. Booked the hotel at a really GREAT price...better than the team group rate. We stayed here mid December 2013, when my daughter's basketball team was invited to play in the Iolani basketball tournament. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel location was very convenient to 2 beaches, lots of shopping and restaurants. We would stay here again. Although we did not enjoy paying the $22 a day parking fee.

I stayed at the Waikiki Resort recently, and I had a spectacular time!~The room was very spacious and comfortable. It had bouncy, comfortable beds and pillows and sturdy tables. Also, in the bathroom there was a 50 inch flat screen TV. There were relaxing massagers and automatic curtains!!! One push of a button, and the drapes go up. Handy bed lights attached to your bed, so you can see things in bed at night. Kind staff members! The bellboy was very obedient (in a good way). The receptionist was very patient, and she always listened to your requirements. Price was not expensive, not too cheap, but in the middle.The resort invites you to a traditional luau, and immersed me into Hawaiian tradition. A wonderful, and interesting show of fire eating, and people playing with fire was presented. Waiters served scrumptious roasted pork, and bbq kebabs! (Best Hawaiian meal ever!) Also, for dessert we had lovely cooked pineapple and apples marinated in some sweet sauce. I loved the fun swimming pool, and had a decorative floor! In addition to that, tanning chairs were placed near the edge of the pool, and towels were in a cabinet next to the chairs, for those who forgot their towels. Very convenient! The resort had a mouth watering scent to it… The scent of fresh muffins in the oven… Heavenly interior for the rooms. I definitely recommend this resort to others!

After reading several of the reviews I was unsure if I had booked the best accomodation for my niece and myself. We arrived early and got our room allocated straight away at no extra cost.Location was excellent and hotel staff where very helpful.I would certainly stay here again and recommend it to friends and family.Keep up the great work !!!!

The hotel is located at a very convinient place, just one blodk from the Waikiki beach. You can walk to DFS. The trolley stations are just near by. i liked my stay at Waikiki resort. However, the hotel was a little old. The bathroom was too small. The air vent was not clean enough. I found it was full of dirty dust. Other than that, every thing was good. Especilly, people were very kind. I thank the concierge for her kindness. One thing I want to say is that I found a group of homeless sleeping in the margin of the hotel lobby in the night. Probably, it was hard for the hotel to treat them properly. But it was unpleasant to see the homeless even at the hotel in addition to the streets.For Koreans, a Korean restaurant named MeBBQ is at 5 min walking distance. Me BBQ offers very good Korean food (to go) at a very good price (just above 10 dollars).Considering the accommodatin price, I would rate this hotel very good. If I emphasize the quality only, I would rate this hotel average.

We had a last minute need for a hotel in Honolulu and used the Hotel Tonight app to pick this place for us. Man, what an awful place. The front desk clerk offered us a room but required that we look at it first because "the elevator made noise". He required that we leave a credit card with him before releasing the key. He looked stoned or high on something. We looked at the room. It wasn't just noisy. It sounded as thought it was directly in the elevator motor room. We traded it for a smaller but quieter room that appears to have been last updated in the 1970s. We should have walked out but after a long flight from Chicago we accepted our fate. Stay away from this place. The bad reviews are accurate.

We were booked for 3 days at the Waikiki Resort Hotel but were sadly disappointed to see that the hotel is very tired looking and the room didn't look like the one advertised. Upon arrival after a very long 11 hour flight from Sydney we had to wait for the Korean air hostesses to be served. In other hotels flight staff are served separately so clients can check in. The room was relatively clean and the bed was comfortable and the linen was good, although I really don't understand why showers are in bathtubs these days...not good for tall westerners.... we didn't eat in the hotel so can make no comment on room service or the small restaurant. This was partially to the fact that this hotel caters mainly to Korean tourists and flight attendants. The good point was that it was a good location to the beach and shopping and restaurants. Would we stay there again? Unfortunately, no.

Upon arrival we were "greeted" by the most rude, unwelcoming, older blonde woman at the front desk, and to add to that less than ideal first impression, the hallway leading to our room reaked of chlorine. However, as we came to find that our room smelled like sewer, the chlorine didn't seem all that bad. Adding to this, the room/decor was very, very run-down and dirty. "Completed an $11-milion dollar renovation in 2008 … " - WHAT!? One may suspect that someone took all that money and fled the premises. We found long black hairs all over the bathroom, and lamp shades and bed covers looked severely tobacco stained, which was pretty nasty. We contacted someone at the front desk and asked for a new room, but seeing as they were all booked, we were told that they couldn't help us. They then provided us with free WI-FI and chocolate. Sweet thought, but that just doesn't help one bit. I am completely puzzled by the positive reviews below, as the only positive thing i can think of is the location, which is pretty great.

I stayed at Waikiki Resort for a week during July 2012. The staff are very friendly and went out of their way to help me. The room was clean and was of excellent standard. The buffet breakfast was also good. Enjoyed my time thoroughly.

Was there November 9th & 10th. One block from the beach, several eating places with in walking distance. Room was clean and in good repair. Elevators were really fast to respond. Really great buffet across the street. Really good breakfast included in the package. Would stay there again. Staff was really good.

Stayed here for 1 week in November and could not fault it. One block from the beach and the shops and restaurants and all the transport services.We had a partial sea view room which was clean and comfortable the staff were also very helpful with anything we asked them. The hotel do not charge the resort fee which can be up to 30 dollars per night per room which most of the other hotels charge in Waikiki.We visited some of the other hotels which are located on the beach and these will cost you nearly double what the Waikiki resort will cost you.We had breakfast a couple of times at the hotel this was a good buffet breakfast and they give you a 20% discount when staying at the hotel.Would stay here again when in Waikiki.

This hotel met or exceeded our expectations. Room was on 15th floor with view of waikiki. Clean, comfortable, friendly staff. A nice bang for our buck and a very short walk (one block) to the beach...can't beat it for the price. Stay if possible 15th floor or higher...can get noisy on the strip.

Very nice room and friendly, helpful employees. The view wasn't very much, but the breakfast buffet that came with the package was great. It is very well situated close to the beach, restaurants and transport.

We stayed on the 18th floor in a 1 bedroom apartment and we were pleasantly surprised at how nice our room was.The cleaners did a wonderful job everyday and the reception staff were very nice and approachable.Before we left I read not so good reviews about this hotel but we felt it was good value for money and in a great location as well.

Stayed here for 5 nights right after a short stay in Vegas. So was quite nice going from a humongous hotel to a little one! As mentioned in previous reviews, the location of hotel is superb. Literally seconds away from the beach and close to many shops, restaurants and a bus stop is right around the corner.We arrived just after 2pm so had to wait till 3pm to check in. The lady who checked us in was very nice, I think her name was Nancy?? Lobby was very nice and open - very welcoming. Wi-Fi worked great. There was a handy little shop with groceries and souvenirs, but we got shouted at by shop assistant for walking in with drinks - so didnt go back in after that!Room and balcony was a decent size. Two double beds and a good sized television with lots of stations. Bathroom was quite small with a low bath. Could not work out how to use shower. Had to go down to reception where the staff member whipped out a dummy tap and showed us how to use. Saw that dummy tap on quite a few occasions when other guests were asking how to use it, so I don't know why they haven't included instructions in the rooms.Rooms also featured a good sized safe (would fit a laptop easily, both our ipads got in there) and a fridge.On one day housekeeping did not make our room up. After two visits to reception it was finally done that evening.They tried to blame the "do not disturb" sign but we had removed this from our door after 10:00amBut again reception staff were very helpful and apologetic and got it all resolved for us.Hope to return to Honolulu at some point and would consider this hotel again.

We have enjoyed our pre cruise stopover at this hotel. We arrived about 10.30am to find our room ready and we appreciated getting in early. It is very well situated close to the beach, restaurants and transport. The staff is courteous and our room 1217 clean and large with partial views. From our balcony we enjoyed watching the surfers day and night. It has an iron and ironing board. Coffee and toiletries were supplied but no milk or creamer. The laundry rates were cheap. The pool could do with a bit more greenery but was clean and never crowded. Of course we would have liked the free wifi in our room but it worked well in the foyer. Like many hotels there were no overhead lights and for two queen size beds only one table lamp. For couples who both like to read in bed this is not satisfactory and probably the only negative comment I can make.

Perfect location a stones throw from the beach and all the action. Nice rooms, nice breakfast and good value. I would recommend to anyone going to waikiki. Why pay heaps to be in a hotel on the beach when you're out of the hotel most of the time anyway.Fab just fab! :D

I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel for 6 nights.Arrived at the Hotel at approx. 10.30am, as expected my room was not available as check-in is 3pm. Arrived back after 3pm to find the room still not available, reception again advised that check-in was 3pm. When I pointed out that it was now after 3 a room became availabe.My room, on the 15th floor was of a reasonable size with two double beds. Decor is a bit dated but not too bad.I had a problem with draining in the bathroom sink. Advised reception, this took several days to be fixed.Overall the hotel is extremely well situated, only one block from the beach as many of the the Waikiki attractions. The receiption area is spacious and comfortable. There is a charge for Wi-fi in your room but free in receiption. It is interested to see everyone in reception tapping way at their computers and tablets.The pool is rather un-inviting with little or no plants and the pool is small. But most go to the beach.The hotel was quite, room comfortable, great location.

That was a relly good hotel, very close to the beach, close to the restaurants and pubs.Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Bathroom was nice and clean. The rooms looks modern and nice. Roomservice was good. Staff was helpful.Internet connection sometimes was working on the 7th floor (it was sait that it is running in patio only). The safe and little fridge was in the room. I really recommend this hotel.

This was our second stay at this hotel. We came back because of the enjoyable and comfortable stay we had on our last visit.The hotel is clean, comfortable and centrally located in Waikiki. The staff are very welcoming and friendly and always keen to help in anyway they can to make your stay more enjoyable. The previous time we asked if we could have a room on the quieter side of the hotel and without hesitation they accommodated our request.The hotel is good value and while not 5 star is more than adequate for a stay in an above average and friendly environment at this price level. We will be back again.

Great location. One block off the main drag and beach. Can walk to everything. Parking available. Staff very nice and helpful. Hotel very clean. Room decor a little tired looking. Over all worth the price.

If you want a basic hotel near the beach then this is fine but with some maintenance and better pillows this place would be much better. Pillows are an essential component if a good night's sleep and our stay last week at the Hilton Back Bay Boston just recently replaced all theirs with great pillows. Here at the Waikiki Resort they still use el cheapo spong pillows. The patio door to he balcony needs new runners. This would be a low cost improvement but I guess management does not care.Staff are very good and helpful and the room is clean.An ice machine on each floor would be a good improvement.Overall this is an OK place to stay but management should get on top of things (I used my travel screwdriver to secure a loose electrical wall socket - another example of a lack of systems to check rooms).

Stayed here on an overnight before boarding NCL's Pride of America. We arrived at 3pm, and our room was ready. the hotel was centrally located, and while not on the beach, it was a short 1/4 mile walk to beachfront Khameamea Park, which was wonderful and busy.PROS - Registration super easy, and hotel staff was friendly and knowlegeable about local eateries.Room was cleanLocation-easy 1 block walk to beach.Free Wi-Fi in lobbyService good at ILIMA buffet.CONS:Decor is tired and run down. Rooms are tiny, Mattresses in beds are AWFUL-soft and lumpy! Thank goodness we had to sleep on them for only one night! Linens are cheap and scratchy.A/C wasn't super effective, and a bit noisy.Overall, not horrible, but for $189 plus taxes and fees per night, we expected more.

My family visited Hawaii for the first time, and we are pleased a lot staying in this hotel. What a great bang for the buck! It's located just one block away from the Duke Statue, where the Waikiki Beach entrance is; and most of transportation services stop for pick-up. Very convenient location for activities and shopping.The front desk service was excellent. I had a problem with some payment issue with my travel agency which I booked this trip with, and HoJin helped me to solve the problem. Thanks to her!

It's located about the one block from Waikiki beach, the hotel staff was very attentive and the rooms clean. We got upgraded to a partial ocean room view, which as a great plus. The guest services helped us pick some great activities.

The hotel has the best location, 30 second walk to the beach. Amazing staff. Every staff member went out of their way to help you. In particular one of the staff members Dave, was very helpful at all times. The only thing was that the pool was nothing to get excited about but you do have the beach at the tip of your toes and the views from the hotel are amazing!

Wasn't sure what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised with the Waikiki Resort Hotel.Our room was a good size, very comfortable bed and most importantly very clean. A microwave oven was a nice addition. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Free wifi was available in the lobby which had plenty of seating and was never too crowded. With the beach and shops only a few minutes walk the location is fantastic. There is a pool area but with the beach so close we never used it. There is a bus stop nearby which was very handy for us as we had friends staying at the opposite end of Waikiki. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

I have stayed at hotels all over the world and this one felt a little 3rd world not going to lie. I guess my secretary booked a good deal but then you pay for parking and internet so that good deal isn't so good. It was right by the beach one block over so the location is great if your going to the beach. I was on business and did some diving so it worked out great. The service was not ideal either. You could tell they mostly catered to Asian tourists. The rooms weren't very nice and they didn't do a good job cleaning them on a daily basis either. I came back and it looked like they half attempted to make my bed and gave up. I will be looking for a different hotel next time I am in town.

The Waikiki Resort Hotel is a very nice hotel in a fabulous location for surfers, shoppers, and diners. I had not intended to stay at the hotel but found it because my surf shop told me I could park in their lot for a fee - the only outdoor lot in the area. I wandered into the hotel to inquire about a room and met with excellent front desk employees who found me a great room for a great price. The room was spacious, quiet and clean. It was a very good experience and I will return to the Waikiki Resort Hotel.

Excellent Hotel, being in the hospitality industry myself, I make my selection very carefully, try to sniff out the what we call "wanna be", but actually not properties. Finally made my selection on the Waikiki Resort. The room is spacious, and most importantly the location. Literately you are right there on the beach and right on the strip for shopping and dinning. But also you have the two restaurants in the hotel that offers good food. The swimming is a bit small, but hey, the ocean is right there so I really don't see that as a problem and since not a lot of people using it. A great hidden gem to get yourself away from the crowd and still enjoy the sun in the water. Super nice front desk staff. Courteous and professional. Full of knowledge of local attractions and foodie goodies. Told us about a 24 hours Japanese super market, Don Quijote close by, driving only 10 minutes. The room itself is nice and spacious, has everything you need and then some. The room we got had an obstructed ocean view. And a mini-fridge and microwave was a nice touch.The management is a true hotelier, value their customer. Already plan our stay for next summer! Strongly recommend for family traveling.

My experience about this hotel was wonderful. Nothing seriously out of place or wrong. Everyone was helpful and very, very nice. Upon check in to check out. Branden and Dave (I think) were the ones I interacted with most, as they were mostly on the late evening shift. Great guys and very nice and helpful. Tyler at the EXPEDIA tour desk was very sweet and helpful as well.They are located about a block (if that much) from the beach. It was just awesome. Upon check out as we had a very early flight, we had to take a cab and not the shuttle and the cab ride was about $45.00Wi-fi was ONLY in the hotels lobby. (a lil slow) Lobby was very spacious and comfy and quiet mostly as everyone seem to be out most times. My room was comfortable, but could have been a little more roomier. They also NEED another mirror, which can be placed in the room. Only 1 mirror and it was in the bathroom. The so called bath tub :-) was like a shower/half tub, it looked like a small child's bath. The beds were to die for. Very very comfy. I stayed in room 1815, a floor below the PH. They have a pool, vending and ice machine on the 2nd floor along with a couple of restaurants.An internet center, breakfast room, gift shop ect on the main lobby floor.McDonald's on the corner. Eggs n Things and then another block and half a lot more food places and stores & International Marketplace where you can get souvenirs to buy.I found that on the last evening before checkout, housekeeping did not wash or give us new drinking glasses, nor did they wash our sink. I thought that was a little tacky and not because it was our last evening that things should not have been prepped. Overall the room was always clean and prepped. The view I asked for was fantastic. Got to see sunsets and the surfers each day on the ocean. 2 birds kept visiting my balcony daily. They were so cute :-) I also had a view of the famous Diamond Head Mtn.My stay was great and I would definitely stay here again and totally recommend it.

Upon arrival and after searching the database, Branden, the front desk clerk, could not find our reservation that we made in March of 2013. After less than 5 minutes, Hojin the reservationist, came to ask some questions and took our confirmation letter. She was gone about 5-10 minutes and the hotel manager came out to speak with us. He apologized and stated that the type of room we booked was sold out and would have the issue resolved to our satisfaction momentarily. To our delight, the manager returned to inform us that we were being upgraded to a penthouse suite. This whole process took less than 20 minutes.The service and attention to customers is excellent in all aspects; professional, kind, and curteous. The hotel iteslf is in a prime location; only a block from the beach and a few blocks from the heart of Waikiki. The ammenities were ample and the hotel resturaunts were very good. This is an older establishment but well kept and clean. A definate return customer.

Nice hotel, not as rushed & busy as some of the big chains. Clean rooms , bathrooms a little tired but quite adequate for our needs. Great location between the 2 bus routes & only a block from the beach. Friendly staff. We would stay again

the hotel location is just perfect, clean rooms, very nice friendly staff and definitely underground parking at a great fare make it the best deal we could get for our vacations, we will repeat it next year for sure.

We stayed at this hotel for a full week. Had stayed here a few years ago for one night and had a good experience at that time too. The property is in a great location - central to most things in Waikiki. The rooms were small, but had enough space. Had a "city view", which faced away from the beach. This was my 5th time to Hawaii, so beach view was not mandatory. The room had a mini-fridge and safe, which we used everyday. The package came with breakfast buffet included. There was a good variety of food each morning. There are many Asian visitors so the breakfast buffet included Asian fare such as miso soup, rice, etc. in addition to pancakes, eggs & bacon. The staff was friendly, from the front desk, housekeeping and restaurant staff. Would stay here again.

I had a standard room with double beds. It was a comfortable room with city view and reasonable price. Staff were very kind. Easy walk to beach, restaurants, the tour bus pickup spots!!! I really enjoyed my stay.
user_name:
Ji Yeon O
Ulsan, Ulsan, South Korea

review_body: We bought a 3 night voucher from Living Social for a corner deluxe suite. We were on the 11th floor and felt that we could almost touch the surfers of Waikiki. The hotel position is excellent as was the front desk service.Our room was quite spacious and we appreciated the microwave and safe.Breakfast was your standard fare nothing special but adequate. Even though our voucher said breakfast was included, apparently that was only for 1 morning.The morning stroll to eat breakfast on the beach was good anyway.

We rented this hotel just for the night , we had a standard room with double beds. Room furnishings were older, But it was a comfortable room more on the smaller side. Room had most amenities, except microwave. We had city view on 18th floor, so our view was just view of otherHotels, no oceanview, or scenery from our room which was 1810. Booked our hotel through Expedia.com, so had option to pay on arrival, without any fee being billed up front, so that was a cool option. This hotel is directly across Pacific Beach hotel which offers great seafood and other types of buffet at their world famous Oceanariums Restaurant.They also had a sushi bar and lounge in the lobby which we didn't get a chance to try. Located just about a block from Waikiki Beach, and nearby to many other restaurants. The Waikiki Zoo is a few blocks away as well. Great location. They offer self parking for $22 a day, with drive in and out options throughout the Day. A the time we stayed payed Kamaaina rate and just room and tax for our one night stay was $181 not including parking, which was charged upon checkout. Room was quiet and near elevator.

Hotel is located a block from Waikiki beach. It was clean and well maintained. We chose it mainly because of the value and nearness to one of the tour bus pickup spots. We were very satisfied on both those counts. Staff was extremely courteous and very friendly.

It was a great hotel in a great location. Very close to the beach, shopping , and great restaurants. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Easy walk to international market place. Realy enjoyed our stay.

I stayed at this hotel for a family. We had two rooms on the 18th floor. The hotel is a little old but the location more than makes up for it!! Our balcony had gorgeous rooms of the beach and the sunset each afternoon was incredible.The hotel is only half a block from the beach. It is in front of the main beach, halfway between diamond head and the international markets.The staff were very friendly and the rooms were always very clean, plus the beds are very comfy. There is free wifi in the lobby and available in room at a cost.The included morning buffett had a selection of hot and cold options plus salad and fruit. The only negative was it did not change for the 7 days.There is no hotel bar but a convenience store in the lobby.Would highly recommend to everyone and very affordable.
user_name:
Jess H
Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia

review_body: Pleasantly surprised with this hotel for our 3 night visit to Oahu - rooms where small but it's honolulu everything is tight. We had parking during our stay for an additional $22/ night. This worked out well for us as we believed we needed a car to travel around the island, this allowed us to come and go as we please and never worried about parking in this very populated area with almost no place to park. Stayed on the 16th floor - had a nice view of city, diamond head and some ocean view, the room was close to the elevator and thought it would be a problem but it wasn't nor did we hear and street level noise some have mentioned. Beds where comfortable, bathroom clean, one block from the beach - very easy walking to many of the area sites. Felt safe at all times, this was never an issue for us - there was a safe in the room for some valuables. Front desk was helpful, pool was clean, refreshing and fun at night, with pool and beach towels easily available. We spent most of our time our and about exploring so this was a perfect pick for us.

Stayed here for a week with my partner. The staff were excellent and very helpful. The location is great and the rooms are comfortable and modern. Would definitely here again. The breakfast downstairs was average but did the trick when rushing out in the mornings. Highly recommend

I Stayed at this hotel with a friend in a City View Room. Our room was pretty much opposite the lifts. I cringed at the time remembering other reviews about the lift noise. However it did not disturb us. Yes you will hear street noise but I don't think it matters what floor you stay on. We stayed on floor 14 and could still hear it. But this shouldn't be an issue as you don't come to Waikiki to sleep all day :).Okay the Room. Its basic and average. It does have an old feel to it and despite the hotel apparently having undergone a renovation the only new thing in the room was the TV. An annoying thing was that there was only one mirror in the bathroom, difficult when your trying to get ready at the same time. However the room was clean and suited us as we weren't looking for anything fancy.The pool was small so I didn't even bother to use it.The location was great. Its a few minutes walk to Kuhio beach. Its situated not far from Kalakaua Ave & Kuhio Ave where the stores/dinning options and nightlife are.The is free WiFi in the lobby which is actually an open air Lobby which I actually loved. It felt welcoming.I would definitely stay here again for the location and price

My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights early August 2013. The location was handy and staff were very courteous and helpful. Sadly, however this hotel needs a good makeover. Everything is old. Our room was reasonably clean but the old fittings and fixtures were a bit off-putting. The power socket in the bathroom was loose and partly detached from the wall.

This is a very standard 3 star hotel with comfy beds and good service. Best point is location--- worst is the pool -it is a good size , but looks onto the back of other building's, so not a great place to sit!

Firstly, the front desk deducted the entire room charge from the credit card I gave on check-in when they were supposedly taking only the $100 holding fee.Then on check-out they proceeded to charge my other credit card with the full amount again, thus paying twice. Fortunately I checked my bank records before I left and queried it with the front desk. Unfortunately they had "no record of the double charge" and refused to refund me. So I am now out of pocket due to their incompetency and forced to reclaim the money through my bank.My advice: check your receipts!

We stayed for 8 nights, and were very happy with our choice of Waikiki hotel. Being our first trip to Hawaii I researched hotels on Trip Advisor and decided upon the Waikiki Resort Hotel.The rooms are a little old, but spotlessly clean and spacious. Free wifi in the lobby and 2 restaurants (although we did not dine at either during our stay). Would definitely consider staying here again if we ever return to Hawaii.

I was a little worried about our accommodations because room ratings in Waikiki can range drastically. The last 3 star hotel I stayed in there was not that great but this was a wonderful surprise. When we arrived late in the evening I was worried that we would be stuck with the worst room being so late but we were so excited to find we had been upgraded to a mini suite!!! The rooms are beautiful and the staff is wonderful. Everyone was so helpful and quick to serve. I needed extra pillows and they were at the door in 5 minutes. I needed my room safe reset and they were at the door in 3 minutes. It was amazing!!! I just can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. If we get the chance to return we will most definitely stay here again. The location is the very best as well.

A fantastic location but a very simple hotel. Everything is in walking distance. There is a great free show on the beach (steps away) on certain nights of the week. The beach is a little crowded and very busy but that is waikiki. We could not find a spot on the beach when we went down at 2pm. Be aware: parking costs $22 daily and the lot is very small and the spots seemed very tight. Also, wifi is not included in the rooms. It is an extra $9.95 daily plus tax for each device. Very surprising and inconvenient. The lobby has wifi free. The rooms are clean but again, very simple.Breakfast buffet had pancakes, eggs, yoghurt, fruit, breads, and some korean ethnic foods as this hotel has korean connections in some way.

We had a good stay in this hotel. It is nicely located, very close to the beach. We had a suite with seaview and really liked that! The rooms are big, have good beds and ours had a small kitchenette with a mw and coffeemaker. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel has a small shop in the lobby, a good Breakfast restaurant and a very nice Korean restaurant. We had a good stay here in Waikiki.
user_name:
GerdaM469
Son en Breugel, The Netherlands

review_body: It is an old hotel. Vent/ air con covers,light covers & power point fixtures need to be replaced. They are so old, looks filthy. Bathrooms need better lighting and they need a full length mirror!Our balcony looked onto the top of the reception building...so no view.Conceirge not that experienced, gave us wrong info & hence we paid more. Hence do your research.Staff extremely friendly even housekeeping. They were good to give us extra towels and drinking cups.Great location...everything is in walking distance. Buses are in easy reach.Try the Crepes on the corner...they are YUM!Even though its an old hotel....the decor grows on you. We pretty much only slept there, so it was great for what we needed.

My wife & I were very impressed with our stay at Waikiki Resort. This trip to Hawaii was our 31st year anniversary and we can honestly say without question, as soon as we return to Hawaii again we will stay at the Waikiki Resort. Very nice friendly staff, nice big clean room with balcony and a view of the ocean we will never forget. There are all kinds of shops and great places to dine all within very close walking distance. The best section of World famous Waikiki Beach is only about a 3 minute walk. Also, Waikiki Resort has a couple of great restaurants, Korean and American food. A great breakfast buffet. No problems at all at this Hotel. Everyone made us feel so welcome when we arrived and all through our stay. VERY HAPPY WITH LOTS OF MEMORIES. ----- Richard & Mary S. ----- Kentucky

My son's and I stayed there over the 4th of July weekend. We usually stay at the Ala Moana Hotel but wanted to try something different. I'm glad we did! The location can not be beat, 1/2 block to the beach and surrounded by numerous shops and restaurants. Nancy at the front desk was a doll and one night when we returned to the hotel the parking garage and outside parking lots were full so the security guard let us park in the employee parking area, talk about service! We will be back!!!

I booked a hotel room here through the Priceline "Name Your Own Price" program. Great location, only one block from the beach, and our room had an ocean view even! Very clean and nice staff. Parking is around $23 a day and there is a lot next door to the hotel for $7 a day, with no overnight privileges if you have guests visiting you. They were also very accommodating to our family of 5, including our 3 small children. Would definitely stay here again.

My sister, niece, husband and I stayed here in 2 separate rooms. The decor of the rooms were a bit outdated, but very comfortable and very clean, they were serviced daily. All the staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. We didn't have any problems with a/c noise or street noise. We had problems with both toilets in both rooms, but these were rectified quickly. We too were offered a free breakfast to show us their new resort, but we were too busy having fun to attend :) I would go back to this Hotel. Mahalo Mrs Barcelo
user_location: Ramsgate Beach, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
Loreley D
Ramsgate Beach, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Everything was first class at the hotel. From the moment we checked in everyone was extremely helpful and attentive. Great restuarant recommendations. Very knowledgeable staff. I will be back very soon. Bill C. Scottsdale AZ

We were quite satisfied with the hotel and the service was very good. I agree with the other reviews, ie the concierge had been put up to promoting the 'free' breakfast in the hope of selling timeshare at a new resort, the birds on the balcony and wanted to come in and visit, that free WiFi the our rooms and not just the foyer would have been handy, and that the tour organisers were very good. What we didn't like was the same breakfast every day, and we were there for a couple of weeks; nothing changed at all in that time! Also, although we had a microwave, there was an incomplete coffee machine and when we asked for a kettle because we like to make tea, we were told sorry but none.

This resort is nice but it is very simple. The rooms do not have mini bar and my safe didn't work. The staff were average at the front desk and the bell desk didn't help me at all while I stayed there.However the trip orangiser was fantastic and the day spa was the best and the cheapest.If you want luxury and dont mind spending more I would suggest the outrigger or surfrider where my family stayed.

Located one block back from the beach, we had good views of the surf and part of the beach – quite adequate for us. We could also see Diamond Head clearly from our balcony. One evening, we heard Hawaiian music wafting up from the beach and so went down while it was still light to enjoy what is a regular traditional performance by a cultural group. Thoroughly enjoyable and we learned a bit as well. It was a good hotel – friendly staff, enjoyable breakfast, comfortable room and white doves that greet you on the balcony. But don’t leave your balcony door open for too long, as the doves will join you in your room! Free WiFi only available in the foyer. It would be nice to have it free in the rooms.

Brilliant hotel located 1 block across the beach, within 5 minutes of the international market and 10 minutes of major shops. Bus stops are also located within a block beach side, 2 blocks mountain side. Major activity pick up point is across the road. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean at all times. All in all, it was a perfect combination and will most definitely stay there again on our next trip back.

We stayed for four nights, before and after our cruise. The rooms were fairly clean and comfortable and as they were on the 12th floor, well away from the noisy street. The bathrooms were a bit dated as was the general décor. The hotel was in a convenient location for shops and the beach. Staff were helpful especially the concierge, Rachelle, who recommended good restaurants, and so was the bell captain who organised our luggage when we were coming and going from the hotel and who helped us to track down our tardy shuttle bus to the cruise port.The expensive breakfast was average, but service was friendly

Other trip-advisors are correct; this is a great value in Honolulu. Not a 5-star hotel, but for around$165 per nite (plus parking/tax) it was a real bargain. The entrance is "open" (as are most Honolulu hotels), rooms clean and very comfortable, a mediocre breakfast restaurant (which is typical) and a Korean BBQ resturant which I would highly recommend (not gourmet food, but we had lots of fun cooking our own food at our table; but this option is only offered for evening dining). Is in a great location; 1-block from Waikiki Beach,, a 2-3 block walk to Hy's Steakhouse (a must!), and shopping all around. The hotel also has a small pool, spa/massage, and a couple of small shops. Would most definately stay here again on next trip to Honolulu. Highly recommended.
user_name:
Gary B
Flat Rock, North Carolina

review_body: My family & friends group stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel before and after our Hawaiian cruise. The first night my husband and I were on the 9th floor and I could hear music and people yelling until around midnight, but after that it was fairly quiet. We could see a small strip of beach from our balcony. After the cruise our room was on the 14th floor and it was much quieter. The balcony was on the city side but we could see the mountains in the distance.We didn't have a car so I'm glad the hotel was within walking distance of food and shopping. The same short walk (about a block or two) gets you to the beach. The staff was friendly and check-in was swift. We left our bags with the bell captain until we left for the ship and the airport, which was convenient. Many thanks to him and his staff. Our room was clean, comfortable, and affordable; great for our pre- and post-cruise needs. I would stay at this hotel again for that purpose. Overall it was a positive experience and I'm glad we chose the Waikiki Resort.

Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and I must say it was a pleasure. Room service was very accommodating, we got upgraded for free to a higher level room upon arrival (reason I do not recall), and our luggage was stored for several hours upon signing out, before our flight. The only drawback was expensive (and lacking) parking space. Overall though, if you factor parking into your costs and get lucky with parking, this hotel is fantastic and well worth the price. You even get to see some of the ocean from your balcony if you're on a high enough floor!

I'm a first timer to Oahu/Waikiki and a first timer to Hawaii in general. This place is located in a great location. It's tucked away from the busy traffic on the main street, very close to the beach (one street up) and central to shops and food. The rooms are clean, and semi modern. It's a great value if you're looking for a clean, quiet, and uncrowded stay in Waikiki. I didn't rent a car in Waikiki as the "TheBus" transportation/tours take me everywhere I need to go, so I can't speak on parking here. But from the looks of it, there is no place to park without paying a hefty fee!My only complaint is the internet. To have it in the room it will cost approx $10 extra/night. I'm too cheap, so I just opt to take my laptop down to the lobby and internet around each night. Other than that, I love this place and I would recommend. If I come to Waikiki again, I'll make my reservation here!

We had a corner room on a high floor (15th) on the beach side of the hotel with a lovely view of the beach to the front. The room itself was quite large and spotlessly clean, in Hawaiian style which I guess could be considered dated. The bed was incredibly comfortable and there was a basic couch. The kitchenette was really handy - mini fridge, plates and cutlery for two, coffee making equipment, but no toaster. The bathroom was nice but we had to get instructions from reception to make the shower work (pull down on the bath tap nozzle even though it looks fixed). The free wi-fi in the foyer only worked intermittently. The street noise from garbage trucks and tourist coaches very early in the mornings (from 5am) got a bit much some days, but then you don't want to miss early morning on Waikiki.

Great location, only one half block from Kuhio Beach where there are free shows most nights. Rooms could use refreshing but comfortable and clean. Staff Is friendly and helpful except for the concierge (male) who seemed more interested in selling timeshares. Big drawback though is the noise from the constant slamming of the steel room doors.This went on all day and night with no consideration for the fact that people were sleeping. Stayed five days and was unable to sleep for two full nights due to noise. Really unfortunate as all other aspects of hotel are great.Be sure to book the breakfast package as the buffet is extensive and can easily make lunch unnecessary. TIP: Go across street to Pacific Beach hotel to see their two story aquarium!

We had a wonderful stay at this resort. Our room had a great beach outlook, even though it is one block back from the beach. The room was clean and spacious. Wifi was fast and free in the foyer, but had to pay in the room. A non smoking property which is definitely a bonus. Breakfast was average, only ate there once. Reception staff were very pleasant and helpful.

We stayed here for a vacation for 10 days. We started out only booked for 7 days but were having so much fun we decided to extend our stay. The hotel staff was very helpful from before we arrived to checkout. They were over booked for the last 3 days but went ahead & allowed us to stay longer PLUS gave us a cheaper rate than we had already been paying!!! If you tried to book 3 additional days last minute anywhere else, they would take advantage of the situation & charge more than usual! As an employee of an airlines, I'm very familiar how hotels operate! We expected to pay more than what we paid for the first days but it was significantly less!! It's true, the rooms could use an update BUT if you go to Hawaii to stay in the room, you might want to reevaluate your life & not the hotel!! It has everything plus more than you will want!! The consier, Tyler, was extremely helpful also!! When we return, we won't even check rates anywhere else!! Mahalo wiakiki resort hotel, mahalo!!!!

The hotel is in a good central location, one block from the main road with many shops and restaurants. There was parking underneath the hotel forUS$20 / day. Our room was clean but dated, it had a US king (UK super king bed) that had a tv. The bathroom was clean and large. Breakfast was not included. There was only free wifi in the lobby, for an additional US$10 / day you could purchase wifi in the room. We would stay here again as the hotel is in a good location to explore the local area and also the rest of the island.

This hotel has a good position, near Waikiki beach. We've been there after being in Aina Nalu (Lahaina, Maui) and, compared to that one, the room seemed to our eyes out-of-date and very small.The bathroom has no privacy. Keep in mind if you are not travelling with your husband.parking is 22 usd per day.The staff, including the guy at the concierge, the housekeeper and the girl at the reception was great: always nice to us and smiling. Everyone except for a man we met at the front desk on our last night. The WI-FI was not working and i ask to him a suggestion on how to connect for having our fligh check-in done. Not jocking: he was like not paying attention to me as i wasn't there, He gave any answer but "is not working". So rude and i still can't get the point!!I know his name, but don't want to make it public.At the end on the day, i think i would search for another place to be the next time.

A hotel that does not deserve the high rating from Trip Advisor mainly due to being way overdue for a total makeover. We had an oceanview room for 4 nights on the 17th floor which was pretty dated and not very clean. The carpet and furnishings are not up to scratch just like in the large entry foyer/ reception area. The small shower over a child size bath with curtain feels closed in and worse than the cruise ship we got off from. Free WiFi is only available in the foyer which is inconvenient at night when you want to relax in the privacy and comfort of your room with a drink while on line. In room our phone not working caused us to miss booking an excursion. When we reported it ,were told that local calls should be made from pay phone in foyer. WHAT ??Double glazing would be good to stop the noise from traffic and building work in the early morning hours when you want to sleep in.On the positive, it is a short stroll to the beach, lots of eateries and public transport, with friendly staff.

I made my cruise and precruise reservations with WMPH and this was one of the 3 hotels they offered me. I chose this one because it is the farthest away from the area of upscale hotels closer to Honolulu and shopping at high end stores. We missed our first night because of United airlines so we only got to spend 2 nights. We had the balcony over looking a small stretch of beach and we could see Diamond Head in the other direction. The room was small but just fine. I wish they had more mirrors. There is only one mirror in the bathroom,and none in the main room. All the employees are friendly and helpful. The bell captain was extremely helpful on the day we checked out but did not leave for the ship until 2 PM. This is a Korean owned and run hotel and the breakfast buffet (included in our package) was great. They had both American and Korean type food. I loved having a salad and beef and radish soup (mostly a tasty broth) for breakfast.

Stayed here for 3 nights with my daughter at this Hotel after visiting the Big Island. We had already stayed here 18 months ago and really loved it. Still the same staff I remembered before, always friendly & helpful. We had a partial ocean view room on the 17th floor with really lovely views. The beach is only one block and takes about 2 minutes to get there. The pool is a good size & clean. It's well priced and close to shops, restaurants & the bus stop. So once again, thank you W.R.H. for a lovely stay & we look forward to seeing you next year at our home away from home.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights before our Hawaiian cruise. The hotel was very well located on the major shopping strip of exclusive stores, restaurants, the international centre and other attractions such as the Honolulu aquarium and picturesque parks. Waikiki Beach was just across the street, so we had a most wonderful time walking along the beach. The hotel had a delicious buffet breakfast as well. The room was very quiet, spacious and clean, with two very comfortable beds. All in all, a perfect hotel experience with very courteous, friendly and helpful staff.

Unsure of where to stay in Hawaii made it difficult to search for a reasonably priced hotel. We found it with this place. Very impressive lobby area, but arn't they all. The thing that struck us first was there are no doors to the lobby. Completely open, sounds weird but actually it is really good.The reception staff were very friendly and we checked in in no time. The room was not to bad, a little shabby and dated, nothing too special really but very clean and very comfortable. A nice two minutes stroll to the main front and beach and all the shops and restaurants, all very expensive and only fair quality.Not a bad place to stay and yes we would stay here again. Bad points. Internet is very expensive in your room. $10 per day and the car parking in very expensive too. If you rent a car the guys are the rental company will give you an idea where to park that is a two minute walk away from the hotel and cost less than half the price. The hotel also charge 75 cents to make a free local call. So be aware of all the extras.Apart from that, not to bad really.

The WRH is a very friendly hotel with a very professional staff. From the lobby check-in, The Bell Desk and the Front Desk Staff to house keeping and the very fine staff @ the Illima Cafe, the folks at the Waikiki Resort Hotel are truely outstanding! They go out of their way to be always smiling, asking if you need anything or can I help you with anything. They just simply make you feel at home. I highly recommend the Waikiki Resort Hotel to all travellers to Waikiki! You cannot do better and the price is just right!

I just came home from a 7 night vacation in Honolulu. I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. It was everything I needed at a low price.The staff was very friendly, The room was nice and very clean.There was a nice L-shaped pool on the second floor.There were 3 restaurants and a bar.I was alone but my room had 2 standard size beds.The one restaurant had a breakfast buffet for a reasonable charge.I would like to mention that the man named Will at the front desk was very nice and friendly.

The hotel is clean and looks updated. Room size is good enough for a family of 4. Can be noisy as there are buses/trucks driving by all the time (can hear the beeping sound as they are backing up at 2 am). Close to the beach and various restaurants. Close to shopping also. Very convenient. Would stay here again.

Pros: Great location, one block from the beach and the Duke Kahanamoku Statue. Clean and spacious room. The breakfast was excellent, both healthy and unhealthy food, and well worth the money.Cons: No smiling staff. No free wifi in rooms.Would stay again: Yes! We had a Ocean View Room, but would also choose this hotel if on a tighter budget.

Beach, Eggs n Things, McDonalds and Haagen Dazs are within a minute's walk; the ABC store is 2 min away; within a 4 minute walk, at the other end of Koa Ave, is King's Village, a quaint shopping/entertainment plaza; the rooms are clean and there's good housekeeping service; my room (18th floor) had a comfortable bed, a small fridge, a table, an office chair, an armchair and sufficient drawer space; excellent tv reception and many channels, including one about scenic Hawaii; the bathroom is a bit small and there's no shelf for toiletries; there's no full length mirror and no closet (just hangers along a wall in the dressing/sink area near the bathroom); the front desk clerks are friendly and helpful; the hotel has 3 fast elevators (other hotels in the area have very poor elevator service); public transit is 2 min from the hotel at Lilioukalani and Kuhio; car rental service (Hertz and Budget) is close by at the Hyatt Regency Hotel (main entrance on Kalakoa Ave with pick up and drop off on the Koa side of the building); for the best car rental quote go to discounthawaiicarrental.com - it's both a search engine and a reservation system with no additional fees; hotel parking is expensive - $22/day; there's free parking along the Ala Wai Canal (except Friday and Monday mornings when the street is being cleaned) - hard to get a spot though; the Aston Waikiki Banyon offers public parking at $12/day.

Stayed for a week in a suite on the seventeen floor. The views were amazing! The room was located next to the elevator but the noise was minimal. Check in was smooth and easy. The location of this hotel is fantastic as it is so close to everything. This was our second stay and there will be a third! The lobby has free wifi.

My mom, dad and I stayed in the hotel from the 9th to the 16th. There are two main reasons why I would say that this hotel is poor the first one is that during the first two nights there was smoke coming out the ventilation system and the second reason was that the cleaning lady was very rude she opened the door at 8am and then second time at 11am.

Went to see pearl harbour and the hotel was very fairly priced and the location was great with alot of eating places in walking distance and the beach was also very close. The buses were close by to the hotel. Rooms were very clean and the staff was very helpful.Scott and Le

Nothing special, horrible views, ice cold pool. Noisy rooms in the AM. Great location, walk to the beach in just a few minutes. Price isn't too bad for Waikiki, expensive to park a car, so we walked to a lot of good places nearby.

We stayed as a family of four for one night before going to our vacation rental. This hotel is old and the attempted updates are poor. The rooms are small, but at least somewhat clean. Beds are small as well, with plastic pillows. Now, all this would be fine if the staff were at least a bit friendly. Both at check in and at check out the staff were very unfriendly. Maybe it was because we only stayed one night, but they certainly made sure we would never stay there another night. In addition, the breakfast buffet was quite poor (there are much better places in the immediate vicinity).

We arrived at our hotel 2 days late as we are on standby for an airline and were not able to travel to Waikiki when we originally had planned. We had family friends who were at the hotel and as the bookings were made together we had arranged for the friend to notify the staff there. As we resulted in paying for another airline to guarantee that we would make the flight, we also specified the new date in which we were to arrive and even offered to pay the days we could not attend.The lady at the desk said that they were unable to keep the booking for us and we would just have to wait and see once we arrived. Upon arrival, after much waiting at the desk they gave us our new rooms and had upgraded one of the rooms to a king suite due to low availability within the hotel.The rooms were not very spacious for what we were paying, but the rooms had a spectacular view and were looking out on to the beach. The hotel was quite nice but there were so many groups of students from Korea and Japan and it felt overrun with teenage school kids and it was annoying when trying to wait for an elevator. The hotel was a block away from the beach and about a 7 mins walk from the main tourist streets within Waikiki.It is an amazing part of the world to travel to, and I feel like for what we paid, we got quite a nice deal as there were many more hotels that looked more outdated and similarly priced. It can be quite difficult to choose hotels within Waikiki because many of the newer, 5 star rated hotels were much more than if it were in another location.
